full_text:
The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Data Analyst
At Fy! we are passionate about using technology and data to help people discover things that they love. Our marketplace platform connects people to the most exciting lifestyle products from brands and designers around the world, through a personalised and serendipitous shopping experience.

The role
We believe in making data-driven decisions and are searching for a talented and curious Data Analyst to help discover and understand hidden patterns in our data which can drive growth, and improve the marketplace experience for shoppers and brands alike.
If real-world problems such as real-time recommendation and personalised shopping, visual search, price forecasting, trend analysis, natural language processing for text search, reinforcement learning, and modern experiment design and statistical analysis sound like your thing, then we'd love to hear from you!
This is a full-time role, located in Berlin, Germany.
Remote work is currently not available for this position, we're sorry!
Responsibilities
Curate terabyte-scale data sets.
Derive insights from deep-dive analyses, bringing analytical modelling to bear on data sets which span sale- and supply-side, marketing, logistics and shopper journeys.
Design and build data visualisations, including reports, dashboards, and analyses to empower multi-team stakeholders at Fy! to make data-influenced decisions.
Collaborate in design and analysis of rigorous statistical tests.
Communicate quantitative findings to teams in actionable ways.
Requirements
Bachelors or Masters in Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or other quantitative discipline field with strong academic record.
Curious, analytical mind with a demonstrated track record of innovative problem solving.
Hands-on experience conducting quantitative analyses on large data sets in an academic or commercial setting.
Coursework or experience with Python, R or other scripting languages, experience with SQL is a plus.
Familiarity with modern software development practices and tools (e.g. Git, unit testing, Docker and cloud platforms).
Participation in MOOC's (e.g. Coursera, Fast.ai (http://fast.ai) and Udacity) or Kaggle competitions are a plus.
Strong written and verbal communication (English).
Flexibility and adaptability to work in a fast-paced startup.
What we offer
Our tech team is composed of experienced generalists and domain experts, and as such we are able to take on complex, interdisciplinary problems. We want you to be part of that, and to be excited by this opportunity!
Mentoring and broad opportunities to expand your role.
Your choice of hardware, screens etc.
Conference and learning budget and support for giving talks and presentations.
Open source ethos.
Free (and plentiful) Five Elephant coffee.
Family-friendly office hours and working culture.
Established business with a clear pathway and resources to grow.
Generous staff discount - fill your home with awesome designer gear!
Absolute bare minimum of meetings. Prepare for a clear calendar.
Want to work in a specific way? We're flexible and want you to be comfortable, happy and productive as part of the team.

As a Marketing Data Analyst you will use your expertise to determine what web and mobile app data needs to be captured and how. You will help to implement what is needed to drive marketing decisions and optimization.

You already have
Experience with Online Marketing and a firm understanding of the underlying concepts
Some knowledge of HTML and JavaScript or other programming languages
The ability to work well in a team and with different client stakeholders
Solid communication skills in English
You want to
Master the tools that drive online marketing
Understand how marketing data is generated, quality tested and analyzed
Develop and expand your technical skill set
Deeply understand how websites and mobile apps work
Learn on from know a variety of interesting client projects and cases
Tasks
Develop Web and Mobile App Tracking strategies and solutions with our clients
Directly work with our clients' developers and marketing stakeholders to implement data solutions
Understand business cases and requirements and translate them into technical solutions
Work with Web and Mobile App Tracking tools like Google Analytics, Firebase, Google Tag Manager, Segment, Adobe Analytics and many more

Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Berlin, Dalia harnesses the app economy and advanced data science to distribute millions of micro-surveys worldwide. we use this real-time data to gather and analyze consumer attitudes, public opinion and market trends. Backed by some of Europe’s leading venture capital firms, Dalia has generated over a billion answers from people spread across +100 countries - with the resulting data cited in over 2,000 news articles globally.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to lead the data generation and delivery process for Dalia’s research projects with global corporations and civil society organizations.

The journey that awaits you:

As a Data Analyst for Process and Automation, you will work cross-functionally supporting the data science, research and project management teams in turning raw data into insights that drive strategic business and product development decisions.
Grow your hard skills in data science, as part of a team that offers teaching & mentoring in multiple programming languages and software kits
Be the guardian of quality and clean data for global research projects in more than 100 countries that explore public opinion of billions of people, and turn the information into insights that generate headlines in 1.000+ news outlets
The opportunity to not only develop your programming skills but to grow as a person. At Dalia, you have a yearly education fund to spend on self-development such as learning German, going to conferences, or on personal coaching.
Your challenge:

Collaborate with the research, project management and data science teams to plan, monitor and tackle all aspects of the data generation and delivery process for Dalia’s research projects with clients.
Take ownership and proactively identify opportunities to automate steps in the data generation and delivery process.
Get your hands dirty with data: transform, clean, and convert raw datasets into public opinion insights for client projects.

Your profile includes:

Data wrangling: experience in data extraction, transformation, and analysis using any statistical software package e.g. Excel, SPSS, Python or R.
Experience in working with relational databases such as MySQL. NoSQL databases such as MongoDB are a plus.
Proven experience in working in a fast-paced project environment with tight deadlines
Strong communicator: you are able to communicate effectively and can adapt your communication style when working cross-functionally.
Focused on optimizing processes; always looking for ways to make our methodology more agile.

Dalia Research is committed to providing a respectful, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone who works here or with us, regardless of their gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, or religion (or lack thereof).

FULL-TIME IN BERLIN, DEENGINEERING & DATA
We are Kolibri Games - mobile games developer from Berlin. Our two games have over 100 million downloads and are on a mission to become the most player-centric games studio out there.

We believe in players, creating values, learning, but, most of all, we believe in people. We strive to offer you a fair recruitment process and a great candidate experience, as well as a friendly environment to work in, with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow. Help us bring joy to people, we promise you will have fun by doing so :)

Junior Data Analyst (f/m/d)

Data is critical in a data-driven company and Kolibri Games is looking for a Junior Game Data Analyst to shape the way we use our data. The ideal candidate is passionate about creating and using accurate data and visualizations to identify trends; and in doing so build trust with game developers, product managers, and marketing alike.

You will work closely with the Data Platform team to help standardize, govern, and truly understand the wide breadth of data that we collect. You will create and analyze down-to-earth in-game metrics, offer insights, and most of all ensure that everything data related makes sense; all in service of making data a key part of our winning formula of becoming the most player-centric games studio out there.

Responsibilities

Work with Data Platform to ensure our data is high-quality and can be used by stakeholders in a logical way.
Provide end-user friendly, visualizations and insights to product managers, game designers, leadership, and marketing.
Synthesize data into new insightful metrics and help us challenge the status quo in pursuit of growth.
Encourage data usage throughout the company by sharing insights, reports, and other data driven facts to help end users make smarter decisions.
Manage and govern the data types, events, and KPI definitions we use as a company

Required Skills

Previous experience using Data Visualisation Tools such as; Looker, Tableau or similar
Expertise with SQL and Familiarity with either Python, R or similar
The ability to understand data and communicate this in a coherent manner to technical as well as non-technical team members
Ability to work within a fast-paced environment

Your Benefits – We’re game to support you

Competitive Salary - We believe that top performers should receive top payment
Training Budget - We believe in learning. A generous personal learning budget to spend on learning and development, including books, workshops and attending conferences. We also offer in-house training such as coding and German classes
Flexible working hours and Home office – We believe in a good work-life balance
Equipment - State-of-the-art technical equipment, including laptops and phones, which may also be used in your free time
Health and Fitness - We pay €50 towards a monthly gym membership or a fitness activity
Relocation - Relocation support to help you move to Berlin
Pension - Opportunity to save for your pension tax-free

Bonus Level – We love to have a good time, too

Food and Drinks - Fresh fruits to keep you healthy and fresh coffee to keep you alert. We also have a fully stocked fridge with Smoothies, Coke, Club Mate, beer etc
Parties and Team Events - Apart from our regular parties, BBQ’s and movie nights we also have a team event budget you can use to buy games or sports equipment to make working here even more fun
Company Holidays - Every year we go on an amazing company holiday to relax and bond as a team. Last summer we went to Greece!
Friday Celebrations - Company-provided dinner and drinks on Friday afternoons

Kolibri Games is an equal opportunity employer. We come from 25 different countries and many different backgrounds. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of their age, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, physical appearance or disability.

We are an international studio, so don’t forget to send in your application in English. Although it is not mandatory, we always appreciate a cover letter stating your motivation to join us.

We look forward to hearing from you!
Perks
Training Budget
Flexible Working Hours
Home Office
Travel and relocation

The Intelligence Analyst provides input and expertise on all intelligence matters including processes, support requirements, technical aspects, and operational methods.
DETAILS
Essential Functions

The functions listed describe the business purpose of this job. Specific duties or tasks may vary and be documented separately. The employee might not be required to perform all functions listed. Additional duties may be assigned, and functions may be modified, according to business necessity.
All assigned duties or tasks are deemed to be part of the essential functions, unless such duties or tasks are unrelated to the functions listed, in which case they are deemed to be other (non-essential) functions.
Employees are held accountable for successful job performance. Job performance standards may be documented separately, and may include functions, objectives, duties or tasks not specifically listed herein.
In performing functions, duties or tasks, employees are required to know and follow safe work practices, and to be aware of company policies and procedures related to job safety, including safety rules and regulations. Employees are required to notify superiors upon becoming aware of unsafe working conditions.
All functions, duties or tasks are to be carried out in an honest, ethical and professional manner, and to be performed in conformance with applicable company policies and procedures. In the event of uncertainty or lack of knowledge of company policies and procedures, employees are required to request clarification or explanations from superiors or authorized company representatives.
The Essential Functions Include:
Represent Pinkerton's core values of integrity, vigilance, and excellence.
Respond in a timely manner to requests for intelligence information; correlate intelligence and contextual data of cases with data used in preparing briefing materials, presentation briefings, and drafting information papers/articles on intelligence issues.
Review and verify information and Intelligence Reports, Alert Notices, Crime Prevention Surveys, and other reports as required; disseminate data via reports or other analytical products, to appropriate client staff members.
Provide advice, counsel, and provide recommendations with appropriate responses based upon a thorough and accurate analysis to supervisors and assigned Intelligence Coordinators.
Assess and maintain a variety of situational awareness tools to quickly and accurately advise decision-makers on possible courses of action.
Review and utilize diagnostic tools and technology to develop complex data compilations.
Research, evaluate, integrate, and analyze all-source data in the preparation and presentation of clear, concise, in-depth intelligence analytical products; focus on threats to operations (research and development, production, delivery systems, doctrine, and capabilities) prepared in response to collection tasking and other requirements.
Perform research, analysis, and reporting on threat environments, as directed.
May represent the organization in the preparation and presentation of security related information and intelligence briefings at conferences, working groups, and planning sessions.
Directly support travel protection initiatives through preparation of location threat briefs.
Serve as a professional representative of the company while protecting client interests.
All other duties, as assigned.
Minimum Hiring Standards

Additional qualifications may be specified and receive preference, depending upon the nature of the position.
Must have Reifezeugnis/Abitur or equivalent.
Must be willing to participate in the Company's pre-employment screening process including drug testing and/or background investigation.
Must meet the country's age requirement.
Must have a reliable means of communication (i.e., email, cell phone).
Must have a reliable means of transportation (public or private).
Must have the legal right to work in the Germany.
Must have the ability to speak, read, and write English.
Education/Experience

Bachelor's degree with three to five years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company.
Competencies

Additional language skills, preferred; Russian, Arabic.
Experience in Geopolitics, International Affairs, Political Science, Philosophy, Security, Intelligence, Strategic Analysis, etc.
Able to develop and recommend policy and initiatives appropriate to client needs.
Able to organize and implement various client specific programs in an efficient and effective manner, meeting all deliverables and deadlines.
Able to evaluate and recommend changes in intelligence operations methods.
Demonstrated analytical expertise; accurately draw conclusions by synthesizing raw data and information from multiple unrelated sources into a finished comprehensive product.
Able to identify and solve complex problems.
Exceptional time/stress management skills.
Able to carry out responsibilities with little or no supervision and, at times, under adverse situations.
Able to present and defend intelligence positions to a variety of audiences including staff, representatives, and members of the Board.
Interact effectively at all levels of an organization and across diverse cultural and language barriers.
Computer skills; Microsoft Office.
Working Conditions

With or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to perform effectively all essential functions. In addition to other demands, the demands of the job include:
Must undergo and meet company standards for background and reference checks, drug testing, and/or behavioral selection survey.
Maintain composure in dealing with authorities, executives, clients, staff, and the public occasionally under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
Exposure to sensitive and confidential information.
Regular computer usage.
Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently.
Must be able to see, hear, speak, and write clearly in order to communicate with employees and/or customers.
Manual dexterity required for occasional reaching and lifting of small objects and operating office equipment.
Close and distance vision and ability to adjust focus.
Frequent sitting.
Travel, as required.
Pinkerton is an equal opportunity employer and provides equal opportunity to all applicants for all positions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, marital/prenatal status, pregnancy/childbirth or related conditions, religion, creed, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status or any protected status by local, state, federal or country-specific law.

(Junior) Data Analyst *
in Berlin
Alle Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter in jeder der 123 Einzelgesellschaften der Otto Group tragen täglich mit innovativen Ideen dazu bei, uns unserem gemeinsamen Ziel näher zu bringen: in allen Bereichen Best in Class zu werden.
Als (Junior) Data Analyst * unterstützt Du durch folgendes Aufgabenprofil unsere Marketingteams dabei im Rahmen eines datengetriebenen Marketings optimierte und personalisierte Maßnahmen zu entwickeln:
Analysen zum Kaufverhalten der Kunden und zu Kohortenentwicklungen
Entwicklung von Scoring-Modellen
Definieren und Dokumentieren von relevanten Kennzahlen und Erstellung von Regelreports (z.B. CRM Dashboards)
Weiterentwicklung von Kundensegmentierungen und -selektionen für Marketingmaßnahmen
Entdecken von Trends und Mustern in den Kundendaten zur Entwicklung eines tieferen Verständnisses über die Kundenmotive und -bedürfnisse
Interpretieren der Analyseergebnisse und Ableiten von Handlungsempfehlungen für das Marketing

Unsere Anforderungen:
Abgeschlossenes Studium mit analytischem Schwerpunkt (BWL, VWL, Mathematik, Statistik, Sozialwissenschaften, Psychologie, Wirtschaftsinformatik o.ä.)
Gerne Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse (Warenkorb- und Kundenwertanalyse, Kundenselektionen)
SQL-Kenntnisse (Datenmodellierung, Datenqualitätsprozesse) und Kenntnisse mit Tools zur statistischen Datenanalyse (z. B. R, SPSS, Python) und Datenvisualisierung (z.B. Tableau)
Erfahrungen mit Datenbanken (z. B. Oracle), heterogenen Datenlandschaften und großen Datenmengen wünschenswert
Verständnis für marketingstrategische Fragestellungen
Innovationsgeist und Eigeninitiative für Deine Projekte
Kommunikationsstärke und Durchsetzungsfähigkeit
Belastbarkeit und Teamfähigkeit in einem dynamischen Umfeld
Lösungsorientierte, strukturierte und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise

Was wir dir bieten:
Einen attraktiven, zentral gelegenen Arbeitsplatz in Berlin-Schöneberg
Flexible Arbeitszeiten für eine optimale Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf
Spannende, fordernde und facettenreiche Aufgaben mit viel Eigenverantwortung sowie individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Motivierte, humorvolle und fachstarke Kollegen
Flache Hierarchien sowie eine sympathische Duz-Kultur
Eine moderne offene Feedback-Kultur mit regelmäßigen Jour Fixen / Teamevents
Mitarbeiterrabatte, Getränke-Flatrate sowie zahlreiche weitere Vergünstigungen

Wir erklären ausdrücklich, dass bei uns jede Person, unabhängig des Geschlechts, der Nationalität oder der ethnischen Herkunft, der Religion oder der Weltanschauung, einer Behinderung, des Alters sowie der sexuellen Identität, willkommen ist.
Auf Grund der aktuellen Ereignisse möchten wir Euch versichern, dass wir weiterhin Kaltwasserspringer und Teamplayer suchen, die mit viel Eigenverantwortung die MYTOYS GROUP voranbringen. Wir arbeiten auf vielen Kanälen, um Interviews, Challanges und Teamkennenlernen zu ermöglichen und um Euch einen guten Einblick in unsere Unternehmenskultur zu liefern. Ihr dürft Euch also wie gewohnt auf einen zügigen und transparenten Prozess verlassen. Lasst uns diese unwägbaren Zeiten gemeinsam bewältigen und unser Ziel, Familien gemeinsam glücklich zu machen, weiterverfolgen.

MYTOYS GROUP
Isabelle Hoffmann
Potsdamer Straße 192
10783 Berlin

Begeistert? Dann erlebe myToys.de und bewirb Dich jetzt bevorzugt online mit Deinen vollständigen Unterlagen inkl. Angabe Deines Gehaltswunsches.

Data Analyst (m/w/d)

The Cortado corporate group, headquartered in Berlin, is looking for a data analyst to evaluate marketing and sales data from our software solutions.
Your Tasks Include:
Independently develop ideas on how to create added value from existing or new data sources, and actively seek direct exchange the requirements of individual departments.
Create new KPIs and implement analysis and dashboards that will enable us to make faster and better decisions.
Develop dashboards that deliver not only relevant information, but actionable insights.
Create ad hoc reports and dashboards and derive action-oriented insights.
What You Offer:
Experience with Google Analytics.
Power BI is a nice-to-have.
Work experience in statistics, business intelligence or data warehouse.
A can-do attitude, from receiving a task to its implementation.
An analytical mind combined with the ability to clearly express recommendations for practical implementation.
Professional working proficiency in both German and English.
What We Offer:
Flexible, family-friendly working hours with childcare subsidies.
Smartphone sponsorship, employee stock purchase plan, team events, company pension scheme, Cortado BikePass, company e-bike use.
A dynamic and open working atmosphere, flat hierarchies and short decision paths.
Large, bright offices directly on the Spree river in Berlin’s Tiergarten district, easily accessible by bicycle, bus and rail.
A large cafeteria and free organic-quality drinks.
A games console lounge for breaks and for sporty employees, we even have showers.
We look forward to receiving your application!
If you have any questions, simply contact Jeannette Boidol by phone at: +49 (0)30 408 198 700.
For further information on careers at the Cortado Holding group of companies, as well as all current vacancies, make sure to visit our career page .

About Penta

At Penta we're on a mission to simplify business banking, allowing business owners to focus on the things they really love. They can open a bank account online in minutes, get debit cards for employees, send affordable foreign transfers and easily integrate their accounting solution into Penta. More than 17.000 businesses use Penta today and we are growing quickly.

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst (f/m/div) for our HQ in Berlin. The role is set to enhance, extend and expand the knowledge of product performance and heighten our understanding of the end customers through data. Delivering powerful insights across the company through dashboards, reports and analyses.

Be part of our journey to become Europe's most wanted business bank account!


Job Description

We are looking for an experienced data analyst who is proficient with SQL, developing intuitive dashboards in Tableau or similar, wrangling data and data driven.

You have a passion for both data and business and have a nose for details. Your primary focus will be on developing dashboards that provide insights to key stakeholders across the company, create ad-hoc analysis and reports, optimize data related processes. You will be part of the Data Analytics House and be an active participant and an integral piece in shaping the Data Culture within Penta. You will be reporting to the Data House Lead.

You are committed to collaboration within the team and across departments, are a problem solver, like challenges but love finding solutions even more.

Minimum 3 years working as a Data Analyst, Business Intelligence analyst or similar role
Strong proficiency in SQL, preferably PostgreSQL
Expertise building dashboards and running analyses with – Tableau, Power BI or similar
Bachelors or Masters, preferably in Computer Science, Business Intelligence, Analytics or Business or Finance related discipline
High analytical skills; ability to clean, scrutinize and investigate data and translate it into meaningful reports, insights and high-level information
Strong communication skills in English – both written and verbal, including the ability to clearly articulate messages
Self-starter and team player able to work under high levels of pressure through challenging deadlines

Nice to have
Experience working in Fintech, Payments or similar
Coding experience with Python, R and data wrangling packages
Experience with Github/Gitlab

What can you expect from us?
Work within a growing team, where there is a level of autonomy paired with a flat hierarchy and room to develop.
Great office atmosphere and the ability to change the way banking works for SMEs.
Working with a great team with amazing employer benefits
Fully reimbursed BVG public transport card
Company-wide events - we believe hard work and success deserve to be celebrated both in and out of our office.
Strong network of companies and experts as part of the Finleap family, Europe's No.1 fintech ecosystem.
Choice of computer
Personal learning budget

Support stakeholders' decision-making with crucial analyses and data-insights
Provide input and ideas to continuously advance Business Intelligence at sennder
Help with the creation of descriptive and predictive analytics
Identify and collect new data to drive novel insights into sennder's operations
Work closely with management, engineering and operations to develop and improve our analytics

To get there you will need:

Substantial experience with Power BI and SQL
Passion for data
Strong analytical and result-oriented mindset
Proven experience with Python or further programming languages
Excellent English skills

A part of an international company with office locations in 5 different countries
Be a part of an international team from 40+ nationalities at HQ Berlin office
Structured promotion process in order to give everyone the same chance to grow
Structured regular feedback process enabling personal development
Employee's well-being: in-house gym, unlimited snacks, drinks and fruits
Countless opportunities to connect within and outside of work with regular team events and trips, partnership events with other companies and local organizers

At sennder we value commitment, team spirit, and your personal and professional development. Our mission is to offer our teams a diverse work environment by fostering a very friendly atmosphere and an energetic company culture. We enjoy to build and nourish long-lasting friendships across teams and often come together to plan fun events and activities.

You will join a company where you will take ownership of your role and contribute actively with new ideas of new projects in a stimulating working environment. You will be part of a small and high performing team, and you will work together in goodwill to achieve best results.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

idealo has direct business relationships with the entire e-commerce retailer market, from Amazon and eBay to the small specialist everything is represented. For our business partners we are one of the most important sources for online traffic, customer contacts and online sales. We are looking for your support in sales development, because with your analyses you can make a significant contribution to taking the right measures at an early stage as well as ideally developing recommendations for action and strategies for the future.

As a Senior Data Analyst you will have the opportunity to open new perspectives with your creativity and generate meaningful data driven insights for our platform business.

As an Inventory Data analyst, you combine multiple data sources (Data Warehouse, MySQL databases) to create analysis, reporting, and relevant dashboards in order to enable automated data driven decision making

Within the scope of your work you derive the needs of our partners from large amounts of data and validate findings using qualitative methods. Based on your analysis, you will be able to derive and represent recommendations for action and develop self-explanatory, thus meaningful dashboards

This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

job_title: Business Analyst, Finance, Procure to Pay (PtP)
full_text:
About OLX:
We’re a global product and tech group. 20 brands. 30 countries. 5000 people. One mindset.
Our mission is to make it easier for people to buy and sell almost anything, promoting prosperity in local communities.
We are proud to be different, and we work differently too. We combine the spirit and agility of a start-up with the maturity that comes from being part of a 100 year-old company.
We are curious, ambitious and allergic to corporate interference. We improvise, experiment and push each other further, embracing uncertainty and inspiring change.

About our team:
We are looking for a motivated and enthusiastic Business Analyst! As a great teammate who is also able to work independently with light oversight you will work with the Finance Systems Team in the area of end to end Procure to Pay to analyze, design and execute OLX's needs into standardized, global and the technical requirements on PtP processes.
Your outstanding experience and problem-solving approach will help to build in our engaged and hardworking team to support implementation of global finance scope in procurement, accounting and payments. The goal is to design coordinated, integrated, compliant and automated processes across all of the OLX Group Entities.
We offer a great opportunity to join our global team and chip in to the OLX success. Being based in Berlin! - one of the most vibrant European capitals, you will impact Finance Systems and proficient existing cloud tools and technologies. Your excellent communication and presentation skills will engage a broad network of decision makers to align, and we count on your ability to challenge status-quo and influence key partners.

When on board, how to contribute?
Help and execute in business processes and data
Conduct gap analysis of the existing process and finance related systems
Researching processes across countries and report findings back (i.e. due diligence status quo of existing PtP process)
Collect business requirements, analyse and consolidate themes, report
Proactively drive project support/administrative functions and tasks
Prepare root cause analysis and recommend an operational improvement, redesign and automation
Determine effective use of the ERP and related tools, compile a consolidated view of requirements and propose an expert solution
Provide with daily operational support to the local finance teams
Compile training materials, train and educate users on the new process
Initiate constant process streamline and improvements by executing test plans and retests as necessary

Who we are looking for:
University degree in Economics, Business, Finance, IT or related field
Min. 3-4 years of experience in finance process support and/or projects
Good knowledge of PtP components (Procurement, Accounting, Expenses, Payments, Reconciliations) and general accounting processes is desirable
Experience in SAP, Oracle, NetSuite, Expensify, Coupa applications is advantage
Good experience in working in project teams and project management skills
Excellent in effective time management and superb organizational and interpersonal skills
Hands-on attitude, customer oriented approach, open for creative solutions
Excellent analytical skills and orientation to details; Proficient in Excel and analysis methods
Ability to design financial reports to facilitate analysis and gap analysis process
Keen in translating business and finance requirements into functional design, energised to be part of change process
Proficient in PowerPoint presentation methods and synthesizing data
Fluent English

What you get from us:
Competitive compensation and benefits
Work with an international team learning from one another
Competitive salary and great benefits
Company Mobile phone
Any tool you might need MacBook Pro, Notebook, PC
Great office location around the corner from Berlin Alexander Platz
INSPIRED AND INTERESTED IN THE JOB? BE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY!
If you see yourself in this role, it only takes a few minutes to apply using our simple application template. Once submitted online our talent scouts promise to give it serious consideration. We will try to get back to you as soon as possible, and we will respond to every application no matter what.
If you’d like to learn more about us take a look at the other parts of our website or check our blog. And remember, we are an equal opportunities employer.

Guten Tag! We are OYO. Nice meeting you!

We are OYO, the fastest-growing hospitality chain globally and our mission is very simple: creating quality living spaces to help people find an affordable place to stay everywhere they go. OYO is standardizing the experience both for guests and hotels by introducing technology to the currently broken affordable hotel industry.

Originally founded in India in 2013, we are already Asia’s largest and 3rd largest hotel chain worldwide and on track to become the world’s biggest hotel brand by 2023. By partnering with asset and home-owners we are providing travelers 23k+ exclusive OYO hotels across 800+ cities in 80+ countries at an affordable price.

At present we are valued over $10 Billion, backed by some of the world’s best investors such as SoftBank, Sequoia Capital, and Lightspeed Venture Partners and have been recognized as #1 LinkedIn Top Startups in Asia.

OYO is now looking to expand its business into Europe, launching in Germany. It is a lifetime opportunity to join a truly global trend and be part of zero-to-one early team that is building the biggest hospitality chain in Europe. We push ourselves to innovation edge and optimize for your growth and learning. We prefer speed and hustle as it is always Day 0 here. We build meritocratic culture where best ideas win and diversity is an essential part of the setup. Competitive compensation and fun-loving environment is waiting for you if you have that fire in the belly.

The Position

In this position you will get to work with extensive hotel datasets to empower our management to take the right strategic decisions and guide our Sales and Ops teams to the perfect opportunity.

You must bring a hacker mindset, be adept at data analysis and have some programming experience to help us automate our processes and set up a robust analysis framework that supports our growth at scale.

At this phase we need your creativity and problem-solving attitude to integrate a multitude of data sources, then come up with meaningful indicators that help us focus on the right market and the right lead and also implement and validate these. As we are growing fast, you must be ready to take some responsibility, however, you'll always have the support of our world class engineers and industry experts

Responsibilities:

Support Sales Team with digital infrastructure, hot Leads and spot-on data driven pitch documents:

Help us plug in new Lead sources, set up a system to spot duplicates and ensure high quality
Contribute to a robust system to score and prioritize Leads
Be part of setting up processes and data flows in our CRM system, powering up Sales, Management and our own next analysis
 Work with Management to plan market entrance strategy:
Evaluate and prioritize markets based on industry data and your insights
Identify relevant indicators and coordinate with external information providers to get a full market overview
Support Operations by providing insights into day to day business

Spot anomalies in daily operations and propose solutions how to address identified root causes
The must have‘s:
Candidate should have more than 4 years of experience in similar capacity
Programming and data wrangling experience, preferably in R or python
In addition to stellar technical skills, candidate should bring strong analytical thinking and be able to think along and see the big picture
This role will require certain creativity and hacker attitude
Good communication skills, verbal and written English
We are looking for candidates that live in Germany and are eligible to work in Germany. We don't provide visa sponsorship.
Read more about OYO Rooms:

We are expanding in Europe and recently launched in the UK market.

OYO is disrupting the global Hotel market with our design, transformation, operational and technology capabilities and our growth rate is pretty exceptional!

The company just raised a $Billion from investors, led by Softbank Vision Fund the $100 Billion Tech fund and we are having strong momentum.. proven by this recent investment from AirBnb

The conclusion is simple.


We are an equal opportunity employer and all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any characteristic protected by law.

As a leading mobile games developer, Jam City is looking to “level up” our talent. We’re on the hunt for innovators who consider themselves dynamic, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Are you interested in using data to help drive product decisions and directly influence the experience of millions of people playing our games?

We are looking for passionate & proactive Data Analyst to join our team in Berlin! You will have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the gaming industry's top professionals, touching on large amounts of data, and helping our teams make quick & impactful changes to our games.

The game data analyst works with product managers inside the studio team to analyze player behavior and overall performance in our games. You will collaborate with data scientists and analysts across the company to support live operations that continuously improve engagement and monetization. We are looking for a creative analytical mind that combines quantitative rigor with and deep understanding of what makes mobile games great.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for transforming raw data into digestible reports and actionable insights
Work closely with product management team to monitor product health, prioritize features, measure event performance, and optimize merchandising
Setup and maintain live dashboards (i.e. Tableau) and write SQL queries to support rapid decision making
Validate data sets and BI calls in live games to ensure accuracy of event logging and reporting
Conduct deeper inquiries into player behavior by coordinating with central data science team
Provide ad hoc analysis and insights to help interpret player reception of new features or events
Help design controlled experiments to test hypotheses about new features
Present reports on KPIs, event engagement, game economy, and more
Build models to run sensitivities and forecast outcomes
Develop reporting strategies for games in development to ensure event schema and data architecture are set up for efficient, comprehensive analysis
Think creatively about how to use data to answer question or confirm/reject hypotheses
QUALIFICATIONS
B.A. or B.S. a quantitative field (Math/Statistics, CS, Engineering, Business, Economics, experimental science, or similar), graduate degree a plus
3+ years experience in an analyst role at a mobile gaming company, or similar experience
Ability to think strategically (big picture perspective, consider both the player experience and the business needs) combined with hands-on, execution-oriented attitude
Experience in analytics requirements gathering, solution design and implementation; solid experience in the area of user intelligence / behavior, event tagging / tracking
Knowledge of statistics and statistical models, such as linear / logistic regression, clustering and factor analyses
Expert knowledge of SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Tableau
Detail-oriented, leaves no stone unturned, never lets anything slip through the cracks
Communication skills to articulate complex quantitative analyses in a way that a broad game team can understand
Any experience using Python, R, Scala, BigQuery, Databricks, Bayesian Statistics, Machine Learning a plus.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently
Work closely with a cross-functional team, including remote team members and collegues in North and South America.
ABOUT JAM CITY
Jam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment studio providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience.

Led by CEO Chris DeWolfe, former MySpace co-founder and CEO, and COO Josh Yguado, former 20th Century Fox executive, Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing and most enduring mobile games. Jam City’s global franchise Cookie Jam has generated more than half a billion dollars, and Panda Pop has more than 120 million downloads to date.

The company also is the go-to studio for Hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands. The company’s popular RPG game Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery was the #1 game in more than 40 countries at its launch in April 2018.

Jam City has nine studios located in Los Angeles (HQ), Berlin, Buenos Aires, Bogotá, Burbank, Cedar Falls, San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto.

Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Berlin, Dalia harnesses the app economy and advanced data science to distribute millions of micro-surveys worldwide. we use this real-time data to gather and analyze consumer attitudes, public opinion and market trends. Backed by some of Europe's leading venture capital firms, Dalia has generated over a billion answers from people spread across +100 countries - with the resulting data cited in over 2,000 news articles globally.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to lead the data generation and delivery process for Dalia's research projects with global corporations and civil society organizations.

The journey that awaits you:

As a Data Analyst for Process and Automation, you will work cross-functionally supporting the data science, research and project management teams in turning raw data into insights that drive strategic business and product development decisions.
Grow your hard skills in data science, as part of a team that offers teaching & mentoring in multiple programming languages and software kits
Be the guardian of quality and clean data for global research projects in more than 100 countries that explore public opinion of billions of people, and turn the information into insights that generate headlines in 1.000+ news outlets
The opportunity to not only develop your programming skills but to grow as a person. At Dalia, you have a yearly education fund to spend on self-development such as learning German, going to conferences, or on personal coaching.

Your challenge:

Collaborate with the research, project management and data science teams to plan, monitor and tackle all aspects of the data generation and delivery process for Dalia's research projects with clients.
Take ownership and proactively identify opportunities to automate steps in the data generation and delivery process.
Get your hands dirty with data: transform, clean, and convert raw datasets into public opinion insights for client projects.

Your profile includes:

Data wrangling: experience in data extraction, transformation, and analysis using any statistical software package e.g. Excel, SPSS, Python or R.
Experience in working with relational databases such as MySQL. NoSQL databases such as MongoDB are a plus.
Proven experience in working in a fast-paced project environment with tight deadlines
Strong communicator: you are able to communicate effectively and can adapt your communication style when working cross-functionally.
Focused on optimizing processes; always looking for ways to make our methodology more agile.

Dalia Research is committed to providing a respectful, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone who works here or with us, regardless of their gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, or religion (or lack thereof).

We are looking for a Data Analyst with focus on Products to join our Berlin-based team. The ideal candidate has previous experience working in the tech industry, and combines a solid foundation of statistics and SQL with great analytical and communication skills.

You will work in a cross-functional team using agile methodologies providing insights to empower our product teams to improve and expand our portfolio of products and services for musicians, music producers and DJs.

Based in Berlin, Kreuzberg, you will join an international, multicultural, and creative environment that supports individual growth and knowledge sharing.

**************
What You'll Do
**************


Active involvement in building up a contemporary, data-driven culture in the company.
Creating and maintaining reports, dashboards and KPIs for monitoring product performance.
Training and educating stakeholders on how to work in a data informed culture.
Analyze user behaviour and journeys, and provide insights to the Products organization.
Turn business questions into clear analytical problems and search for answers by analyzing historical data, collecting new data and conducting experiments.

*****************
What You'll Bring
*****************


A strong analytical mindset and the ability to translate stakeholder requirements into questions for analysis.
Profound knowledge of SQL, knowledge of Python or R is a plus.
Solid understanding of statistics (e.g. hypothesis testing, regressions, time series and association rules).
An academic degree in computer science, statistics, economics or equivalent training & experience
Experience with modern data analytics tools and platforms, such as GCP, Cloud SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery, Metabase, Data Studio (or equivalent).
Excellent communication skills: you are able to clearly demonstrate and present your findings.
You are highly motivated, proactive, and have a strong sense of ownership.
You enjoy the challenge of having a wide range of tasks depending on the dynamics of the business.

Native Instruments embraces diversity. As an equal opportunities employer, we believe the foundation of our dynamic and pioneering spirit starts with a fair and inclusive culture. Our company culture focuses on bringing unique ideas together to fuel innovation.

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment at Native Instruments and we encourage everyone to apply – regardless of gender identity, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Help us reach our goal in making the future of music diverse, inclusive, and exciting.

Factorymarket ist ein schnellwachsendes, international tätiges Tech Unternehmen mit Hauptsitz in Berlin.

Unser Fokus liegt auf der Vernetzung von Online Marktplätzen und stationärem Handel im Zuge unserer Omnichannel Strategie (einschließlich entsprechender Software Entwicklung).

Für unser Data Team suchen wir am Standort Berlin HQ ab sofort DICH als Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d).

Aufgaben


Erstellung und Pflege von Live-Geschäftsberichten
Unterstützung bei Ad-hoc-Datenanfragen und -analysen
Regelmäßige Datenintegritäts- und Qualitätsüberprüfungen von internen Datenbanken
Verwaltung von ETL-Pipelines und kleineren Skripten

Erste Praktika im Bereich Datenanalyse/Business Intelligence absolviert
Du beherrschst etwas mehr als die Grundlagen von SQL und Python
Strukturierte und analytische Arbeitsweise
Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch und Englisch

Benefits


Ein lichtdurchflutetes Büro über den Dächern Berlins mit direktem Blick auf den Potsdamer und Leipziger Platz
Kostenloses Obst, Müsli, Getränke und Sandwiches
Regelmäßige Teamevents als wichtiger Bestandteil unserer Unternehmenskultur
Optimale Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten - Weiterbildung wird gefördert
Ein motiviertes, internationales und dynamisches Team mit flachen Hierarchien

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

MIT MIR
GEHT KI

Torsten, 42 Jahre, Data Science
Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Standort: Berlin

Wir von der DKB sind immer in Bewegung und stets auf der Suche nach der besten Lösung – für unsere Kunden wie für unsere eigenen Leute. In Deutschland überzeugen wir mit smarten Lösungen bereits über 4,1 Millionen Privat- sowie Geschäftskunden und zählen 3.700 kluge Köpfe zu unserem Team. Unser Denken ist digital geprägt. Unsere Philosophie nachhaltig: Wir sind #geldverbesserer. Als größter Geldgeber der Energiewende oder mit Förderdarlehen für die heimische Landwirtschaft. Durch Investitionen in alles, was der Mensch zum Leben braucht – z.B. in Kindertagesstätten, Pflegeheime oder Krankenhäuser.

Wir haben sportliche Ziele: die Zukunft der Bank gestalten. Deshalb suchen wir Leute mit Ambitionen, die Verantwortung übernehmen wollen und den Mut haben, Altbekanntes zu überdenken.

auch in Teilzeit

DAS HAST DU

Ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit quantitativer Ausrichtung?
Hast du in der Tasche.
Du hast bereits in größeren datengetriebenen Projekten mitgearbeitet?
Dein umfangreiches Wissen setzt du seit mehreren Jahren erfolgreich in der Praxis ein.
Die Fähigkeit, die Zusammenhänge hinter den Daten zu sehen?
Du siehst den Wald und die Bäume.
Die richtige Software für den richtigen Zweck?
Von Pivottabellen über SQL zu R oder Stata - du beherrschst Analytics-Tools und setzt sie zielgerichtet ein.
Dashboards und Visualisierungen erstellen?
Mit Tools wie Tableau, Looker oder MicroStrategy schaffst du Durchblick und machst KPIs greifbar.
Arbeitserfahrung in einem dynamischen Umfeld – z. B. Fintech-Startup?
Check!
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse?
Would be nice.

DAS KANNST DU

In God we trust, all others bring data?
Klar, für dich sind Daten Grundlage allen Handelns.
Neue Ideen eigenverantwortlich umsetzen?
Immer, aber nie ohne dein Team.
Veränderungen positiv und chancenorientiert begegnen?
Du packst an und reißt andere mit.
Zusammenhänge verständlich und prägnant darstellen?
Ein Bild sagt mehr als Tausend Worte.
Gestaltungsspielräume nutzen?
Klar, du holst das Beste aus jeder Situation raus.
Über Teamgrenzen hinweg effektiv mit anderen zusammenarbeiten?
Einer für alle, alle für einen.

DAS MACHST DU

Aus großen Datenmengen Zusammenhänge und Erkenntnisse schaffen, mit denen wir unsere Produkte und Prozesse entscheidend verbessern.
Neue Technologien zur Datenanalyse und Visualisierung erproben und zum Einsatz bringen.
Auf unserem cloudbasierten Data Lake und DWH Reportings konzipieren und zentrale Steuerungsgrößen in Dashboards fassen.
Auswertungen und Analysen durchführen und zentrale Ergebnisse präzise und visuell klar kommunizieren.
In einem schnell wachsenden Team deine Skills und Karriere rasch voranbringen.

Dein Kontakt

Torsten Nahm
Head of Data Science
Tel.: 030 12030-6752
Deutsche Kreditbank AG

We at HelloFresh are hungry for more. Because: "We want to change the way people eat. Forever." Our cooking boxes already make the everyday lives of our customers easier in 12 countries on 3 continents. Every week anew. Our recipe for success? A team full of smart team players, entrepreneurial courage and of course... good taste. We are one of the top 10 employers in the Glassdoor ranking and we are continuing to grow. And to do this, our HelloFresh DACH team needs top talents like you, who love progress and good food just as much as we do.

As a Data & Automation Analyst Intern for HelloFresh DACH, we want you to support us in our efforts to automate data processes throughout all departments and to help make better informed decisions based on clean and insightful data. If you're interested in working in one of Europe's fastest-growing companies with a great (and delicious) product, plenty of opportunities and challenging tasks, this is your chance!

---------------------------
Your area of responsibility
---------------------------


You will help the entire DACH organisation identify, automate and consolidate data-driven processes to improve productivity and decrease error potential
You will enable teams of the HelloFresh DACH market to translate data into actionable insights by creating data processing tools, pipelines and dashboards. We also need your support in constantly adjusting them to the fast-changing business environment of HelloFresh
You will accompany Marketing and Operations departments in data sourcing as well as exploration processes
You will provide accurate and insightful data analyses for different teams, explain and interpret your findings to them
You will have the opportunity to use state-of-the-art Analysis Tools to generate insights for our teams

------------
Your Profile
------------


You can prove that you are a quick learner, especially when it comes to new analytical methods, software applications and tools
Excellent analytical and critical thinking
Very good SQL skills
Solid skills in visualization Tools such as Tableau or QlikView
First experience in solving problems programmatically with Python
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office products
You're interested in a longterm internship (at least 4 months)
A basic level of German is a plus
Eligibility to work in Germany full-time (40h/Week) is a must

----------------------
What else we offer you
----------------------


The opportunity to get into one of the most intellectually demanding roles at one of the largest technology companies in Europe
Cutting edge technology, allowing you to work with state-of-the-art tools and software solutions
A well-balanced mix between hands-on, operational tasks and strategic projects
Competitive compensation and plenty of room for personal growth
Great international exposure and team atmosphere
A feel-good workplace in Berlin-Mitte with great colleagues
Greatly discounted HelloFresh cooking box and HelloFreshGO products plus free food
Fitness programs such as office yoga and discounted Urban Sports Club membership
Regular team events, company parties and Friday beers
Windows or Apple equipment (depending on preference)

-----------------------
You're hungry for more?
-----------------------

Apply now with your complete application documents, including your visa, availability and earliest possible starting date.

We look forward to hearing from you!

HelloFresh lives diversity. We are proud of the different backgrounds, skills and perspectives of each individual team member and support their personal development at the workplace. All personnel decisions are based on equal opportunities and are made on the basis of the qualifications, performance and the company's requirements.

ABOUT US

Contentful ( https://www.contentful.com/ ) provides content infrastructure for digital teams to power websites, apps, and devices. Unlike a CMS, Contentful was built to integrate with the modern software stack. It offers a central hub for structured content, powerful management and delivery APIs, and a customizable web app that enables developers and content creators to ship their products faster. Companies including Spotify, Red Bull, WeWork, Lyft, and Urban Outfitters rely on Contentful to manage content as part of their modern web stack.

Contentful is growing rapidly, backed by $80 million in funding from VC firms including Benchmark and General Catalyst, and strategic investors including Sapphire Ventures (SAP) and Salesforce Ventures.

We're a fun team of more than 300 people from 44 nations, with offices in Berlin and San Francisco. Join us!

ABOUT THE ROLE

Contentful is looking for a data analysis working student to promote data-driven decision making in the marketing department. As part of the marketing data team, you will be working with stakeholders from across the company on projects that impact the entire business.

RESPONSIBILITIES


Create reports and dashboards for the marketing department
Analyze data from diverse sources for diverse purposes
Use the latest visualization tools to turn data into insight

YOUR PROFILE


Currently enrolled in a university or technical college
A great communicator
Independently motivated
Interested to learn about data analysis or technical marketing
Ideally some experience with SQL (have written a query) or Python (have wrestled with a dataframe)
Comfortable with Microsoft Office and G-suite (Google Sheets, Google Slides and Google Docs)

BENEFITS


Join an innovative tech company as we help drive the evolution of digital experiences to become ever-more ubiquitous and interactive. Be a part of helping companies build modern architectures for mission-critical applications
Shape the future of Contentful: help us establish, scale, and improve our team's processes
Be set up for success, equipped with the latest and greatest hardware
Hang-out in one of our many shared spaces, playing games with colleagues or enjoying a full range of events, including workshops, on-site meetups, guest speakers, and fun events for the company and each team.
Sharpen your PlayStation, ping pong, and kicker/fußball skills during breaks in the day
As much artisan coffee as you can handle
Take a break and pat a pup, we are a dog-friendly office
Plus, Contentful socks ( https://twitter.com/hashtag/contentsocks ), oh yeah!

"Variety is the spice of life" — and a celebrated component of our culture. At Contentful, we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer: all qualified applicants are considered for positions regardless of race, ethnic origin, gender, age, religion or belief, marital status, gender identification, sexual orientation, or disability. We look forward to your application!

Gemeinsam in einem Team von 5 Kollegen sammelst du Insights über die Produktpalette im Netz und analysierst die Daten, wertest Erkenntnisse aus und gibst gezielt Handlungsempfehlungen an Entscheidungsträger ab, um letztendlich eine Steigerung von Brand Awareness & Customer Journey der User auf den Social diveresen Kanälen zu erzielen.

Mitarbeit in der Ausarbeitung von Web Tracking Strategien und Konzepten

Operative Maßnahmen zur Optimierung und Steigerung der Conversion Rate, sowie der Usability anhand von A/B und Multivariant Tests für mehrere Klienten

KPI Workshops für Produkt Manager

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined


PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
