We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können

Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

This includes applications for core processes as well as third party connections. Our partners profit from the combination of leading technology and the optimal regulatory setup as we hold all necessary BaFin licenses. As a Data Analyst - Business Intelligence (m/f/div) at Elinvar, you will be working as the part of our Data & Analytics team and provide data driven insights into our customers, products and processes. You will be collaborating closely with Engineers, Product Managers and Relationship Managers to add business value through the definition, ownership and delivery of end to end analytics projects.

What will keep you challenged?

Translating business questions into analytical questions where data can provide meaningful answer
Building sophisticated dashboards and reports for internal and external use
Understanding and validating business logic implemented in the decision engine of the product
Effectively using data to uncover product issues and solve problems as they arise
Presenting findings to business teams and non-technical stakeholders
Researching analytics techniques and present back to the team
Working closely with Product Managers to define and evaluate product requirements
Working directly with Engineers to validate and test the implementation of features

Why Elinvar?

Outstanding, highly motivated and international team who values a positive and open working environment
Tech-driven and focused on excellence in reshaping the wealth management industry by replacing legacy IT with a modern, sustainable IT platform
Backed by some of the world’s most recognized investors and benefit from the expertise of a strong leadership team
Everything you need to excel in your profession – including beverages, (mostly) healthy snacks and barista-style coffee
Beautiful loft-style office, just a few minutes from Alexanderplatz and surrounded by restaurants, cafés, and bars
28 vacation days and flexible working hours with the option to work remotely


At least Masters' degree in a quantitative filed (Mathematics, Statistics, Physics), PhD. preferred
Programming experience with a data manipulation language (SQL, R, Python)
Experience in solving real business problems with data preferable in the finance space
Demonstrated understanding of different statistical and analytical techniques
Experience working with relational databases
Strong interest in latest developments regarding data analytics (i.e. analytical techniques, technologies, etc.)
Strong communication skills and ability to present complex technical concepts to diverse audiences
Willingness and ability to learn quickly and be challenged in an agile environment

Data Analyst

Careem is the internet platform for the greater Middle East region. A pioneer of the region's ride-hailing economy, Careem is expanding services across its platform to become the region's everyday Super App. Careem's mission is to simplify and improve the lives of people and build an awesome organisation that inspires. Established in July 2012, Careem operates in over 100 cities across 13 countries and has created more than one million employment opportunities in the region. Careem became a wholly owned subsidiary of Uber Technologies, Inc. in January 2020. www.careem.com

ABOUT THE ROLE


You will work closely with product and engineering teams to define and tackle focused as well as open-ended problems. In the process, you will:

Embark on exploratory data analysis projects to achieve a better understanding of phenomena as well as to discover untapped areas of growth and optimization.
Help define and track the appropriate key metrics for specific projects.
Design and run randomized controlled experiments, analyze the resulting data and communicate results with other teams
Help design A/B and Multivariate tests and their reporting tools for product teams
Collaborate with engineers to build prototype predictive models into production and re-iterate as needed.

REQUIREMENTS

The ideal candidate is innovative, detail-oriented, result-focused, has a solid quantitative background, business savvy, and takes full ownership of their work from the inception of the idea to the implementation of the final product. In particular, the requirements are

3+ years experience in A/B testing analysis, data mining, time series analysis, transformation and cleaning of both structured and unstructured data.
Fluency in English along with excellent oral and written communication skills.
Proficiency and demonstrated experience in at least two of the following: SQL, R, Python, Spark, Hive, RapidMiner.
Demonstrated experience with database technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Amazon EMR, Hive, Oracle, SAP, DB2, Teradata, MS SQL Server, MySQL)
Demonstrated experience with business intelligence and visualization tools such as Tableau, MicroStrategy, ChartIO, Qlik, along with geospatial data processing skills
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or Computer Science.
Understanding of business and ability to drive decisions that affect the bottom line
Knowledge of Agile methodologies

BENEFITS

Unlimited holidays
Flexible hours
Mentorship and career growth
Diversity: we have 70+ nationalities on board!

What do we offer you?

Working in an international environment with colleagues from 70+ nationalities, ownership culture, flexible working hours, unlimited (paid!) holidays and the latest technologies.

Careem gives equal opportunities. All aspects of ownership including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone.

Data Analyst (m/w/d) im Autismus-Spektrum

Voll-/Teilzeit
Berlin, Hamburg, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt, Stuttgart und München
Besonders bei auticon:

Möchten Sie für ein erfolgreiches und wachsendes IT-Dienstleistungsunternehmen in den Themenbereichen Softwareentwicklung & Migration, Analytik, Qualitätsmanagement & Testing und Compliance & Reporting arbeiten?

Wir sind anders als klassische Beratungsunternehmen. Wir sind das erste IT-Dienstleistungsunternehmen in Deutschland, das ausschließlich Autisten als IT-Mitarbeiter einsetzt. Wir vertrauen den logischen und analytischen Stärken von unseren autistischen Mitarbeitern und suchen weitere leidenschaftliche, qualitätsorientierte und IT-affine Mitarbeiter.


Wir suchen:

Datenanalyst (m/w/d)

Warum es sich lohnt zu auticon zu wechseln – Unser Angebot:

Wir bieten eine autismusfreundliche Arbeitskultur, ein wertschätzendes Umfeld mit flachen Hierarchien und flexible Arbeitszeitenmodelle nach Absprache
Sie arbeiten an vielfältigen IT-Projekten bei unseren namhaften Kunden
Ein Job Coach bietet Ihnen Unterstützung in Fragen der Kommunikation, im Umgang mit Behörden und arbeitsalltagspraktischen Fragen, damit Sie sich voll auf Ihre Kernaufgaben konzentrieren können
Ein Projektmanager bietet Ihnen Unterstützung in der fachlichen Kommunikation mit dem Kunden und bei der organisatorischen und zeitlichen Strukturierung Ihrer Projekte und Aufgaben
Wir ermöglichen Ihnen fachliche Weiterentwicklung durch die mit Ihnen abgesprochene Durchführung von individuell geeigneten Maßnahmen


Sie übernehmen folgende Tätigkeiten:

auticon bietet seinen Kunden für die Lösung individueller IT Fragestellungen kompetente Unterstützung an.
Wir bekommen Anfragen zu Projekten aus verschiedensten Branchen (Automotive, Banken und Versicherungen, FinTech, etc.) mit unterschiedlichen fachlichen Anforderungen. Aufgaben umfassen zum Beispiel:

Identifikation von Abweichungen, Erkennen von Mustern in großen strukturierten und unstrukturierten Datenmengen
Optimierung bereits bestehender und Schaffung neuer Auswertungen und Reports in Tabellen-, Text- und Grafikform
Analyse von Bilddaten, Zeitreihen, Controllingdaten etc.
Zusammenführung und Auswertung von Daten aus unterschiedlichen Quellen unter Einsatz von Techniken wie Excel, Access, SQL, TensorFlow, PowerBI, QlikView, Tableau


Sie übernehmen Aufgaben und Teilbereiche innerhalb eines Projekts entsprechend ihrer fachlichen Voraussetzungen und Kenntnisse in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Projektmanagern und Teamleitern. Die angeleitete projektspezifische Einarbeitung in neue Tools und Fachgebiete ist Teil Ihres Aufgabenspektrums.


Ihr Profil:

Sie sind leidenschaftlicher Datenanalyst und haben schon persönliche oder fachliche Erfahrung erworben
Die Qualität Ihrer Arbeit hat für Sie eine hohe Priorität und Sie suchen ein berufliches Umfeld, in dem diese Qualitäten große Wertschätzung erfahren
Sie bringen tiefergehende Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrungen in der Anwendungsentwicklung mit verschiedenen Programmiersprachen, Entwicklungsumgebungen, Frameworks und Datenbanken mit
Der Umgang mit Tools zur Versionsverwaltung und Ticketsystemen ist Ihnen vertraut
Erfahrung in der Zusammenarbeit mit Teams sind vorhanden


So kommen Sie mit uns in Kontakt:

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Unterlagen, entweder per E-Mail an: oder bewerben Sie sich über unser Online Formular. Wir benötigen lediglich Ihren tabellarischen Lebenslauf und die Angabe der Refernznummer HP_2019DA10. Wir werden dann Kontakt zu Ihnen aufnehmen und Ihnen einen Fragebogen zusenden, in dem Sie uns einen kurzen Überblick über Ihre Kenntnisse und Interessen geben können.

auticon verbindet unternehmerische und soziale Ambitionen und ist damit ein einzigartiges Beratungsunternehmen. Nach einem erfolgreichen Start in Deutschland ist auticon nun auch in England, Frankreich, Italien, Schweiz, USA und Kanada aktiv und baut weitere Standorte weltweit auf. Wir sind stolz auf unser Team mit über 200 Mitarbeitern und gespannt auf neue Kollegen, die bereit sind, unsere besondere Reise zu begleiten.
Oder bewerben Sie sich über unser Online Formular

job_title: Game Data Analyst - Hidden Object Game
full_text:
At Wooga, data is a key driver in making strategic decisions in Live Games. As Game Data Analyst you will analyze large-scale data across customer touch points in order to generate insightful metrics, custom dashboards and deep dive analyses to measure performance.

Our game teams are aiming for best-in-class services to our players with frequent, meaningful game and content updates as well as driving innovation around personalized game experiences. Our culture is about open feedback and debate along the way; we believe analytics is a team sport. The product team you will join collaborates across design, engineering, art, and central service teams: our mission is to drive innovation at Wooga through deep qualitative & quantitative research.

We're looking for a passionate and results-oriented analyst to join our product team and develop new insights to shape data driven decisions, continuously improve our player's experience and thereby help us to generate business growth for years to come. Some of your other responsibilities will include:


Dive deep into the large-scale data to identify key insights that will inform product improvements and business strategy.
Help define how best to measure and monitor our product and its features.
Develop an analysis strategy and perform analysis of complex scenarios and AB-tests, both systematically and on a one-off basis.
Engage with the product, engineering and service team members as a thought partner and provide an analytics perspective to discussions.
Build and maintain strong partnerships with key stakeholders across the company in order to successfully deliver actionable insights.
Partner with Data Science and Data Engineering on data gathering, data governance, democratizing data with reporting tools and evangelizing KPIs.
Carefully check, debug, and problem solve issues to ensure you deliver accurate and clear analysis and reports.
Translate business needs to technical requirements and AB-tests, then work with development teams to ensure correct implementation and tracking.
Communicate actionable results and findings derived from data throughout the organization in a clear, concise way.
Be the pro-active owner of the entire data chain for your product.

About you


You have a Bachelor's degree in Economics, Computer Science, CIS/MIS, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or relevant field.
1-2 years of recent experience in a business analyst role. Preferably experience in the app industry or related field.
You can use SQL effectively and you have a good understanding of commonly applied statistical techniques.
You have good problem solving skills and can look for logical connections between consumer behavior and data.
You have a good sense for the market, you are in tune with player patterns and understand customers.
You have strong monetization design understanding and you analytically understand what makes a game great!
You know your way around designing, communicating, visualizing or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous.
You have excellent written and verbal skills in English. All of our internal communication at Wooga is in English. German skills are not required.

Nice to have


Experience in the games industry
Understanding of behavioral psychology
Robust understanding of more advanced statistical techniques suitable for analysis of highly skewed populations
Experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas
Skills with reporting tools such as Periscope, Tableau, Mode

Our promise


Shape the future! Challenge the status quo and team up with a diverse group of experts working on crafting the world's best games!
Excite millions of players around the world every day through our games!
Work just minutes from the center of Europe's most vibrant city, Socialize in our hang-out spaces, and enjoy many fun events and parties! Enjoy our unique office space!
A relocation support which matches your needs to make your and your loved ones' move to Berlin smooth! Did we mention that we also cooperate with Kindergartens?
Make use of an education budget and extra days off for self-development. Join our meetups, talks, brown bag lunches, world cafe's, internal trainings, workshops and many others!
We offer German language classes for you and your significant other!
Choose your own equipment and be set up for success! We got your back!

At Wooga we are committed to providing a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for everyone who works here or with us, regardless to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, religion (or lack thereof) and game preferences..

Support the finance team to prepare monthly and annual reporting
Controlling tasks
Participate as key member of the finance team
Develop an internal reporting towards management
Improve financial processes in our product
Job requirements
You have a degree in Computer Science, Finance, Economics or similar field
You are fluent in English, German is a plus
Build and maintain reports for internal and external stakeholders

Strong ability to Understand business model and define meaningful metrics and KPIs
Fluency in SQL & Power BI (must-have)
Understanding of data warehouse. Structures and concepts is nice to have
Skills in Python is a big plus
You are extremely precise and detail-oriented
You are very communicative and you are able to provide reports very quickly
You are performance driven and you are an Excel wizard


Nice-to-have qualifications:


You are experienced with consolidated financial statements

Company Description

datapine ist ein dynamisches und innovatives Start-up mit Sitz in Berlin und seit 2019 Teil der RIB Software SE. Wir entwickeln und vertreiben eine leistungsstarke BI Software und bieten unseren Kunden ein breites Portfolio an maßgeschneiderten Dienstleistungen und digitalen Lösungen rund um das Thema Datenanalyse und -visualisierung.
Für die Unterstützung unseres Data Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen Data Analyst (m/w/d).

Job Description

Deine Aufgaben:
Du unterstützt unsere Kunden bei der Implementierung unserer BI Software und bist Ansprechpartner für alle Fragestellungen rund um die Themen Datenintegration, -analyse und -visualisierung
Du bist für die Ausarbeitung von Projektvorschlägen und anschließend auch für deren Implementierung direkt in datapine verantwortlich
Du analysierst und visualisierst Unternehmenskennzahlen für unsere internationalen Kunden aus den verschiedensten Branchen und erstellst Berichte und Dashboards in datapine
Du entwickelst eigenständig Konzepte für die Integration und Aufarbeitung von Daten, inkl. Aufbau eines Data Warehouses und Gestaltung der Workflows und Update-Prozesse
Du führst eigenständig Kundenschulungen und Beratungsgespräche durch und bist regelmäßig in direktem Kontakt mit unseren Kunden und Partnern

Qualifications

Was du mitbringen solltest:
Abgeschlossenes Studium mit analytischem Schwerpunkt (BWL, VWL, Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik o.ä.)
Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse/Business Intelligence
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS Excel
Sichere Kenntnisse im Bereich Datenbanken und SQL sind ein Muss (Datenmodellierung, Datenbankprozesse)
Arbeitserfahrung mit Tools zur statistischen Datenanalyse (z. B. R Studio)
Verhandlungssicherheit in Englisch und Deutsch
Flexible Arbeitsweise, gute Teamfähigkeit sowie ein aufgeschlossenes und sicheres Auftreten
Additional Information

Was wir dir bieten:
Spannende Projekte und Aufgaben mit viel Eigenverantwortung
Du bist Teil eines internationalen und hochmotivierten Teams
Du kannst Dich in flexiblen Strukturen und flachen Hierarchien verwirklichen
Du erhältst ein Maximum an Eigenverantwortung und kannst deine Projekte von Anfang an mitgestalten
Wir bieten Dir eine attraktive Vergütung und ein angenehmes Arbeitsumfeld in einem modernen Büro in Berlin

Interessiert an dieser Herausforderung?
Dann sende uns deine Bewerbung mit Lebenslauf und relevanten Zeugnissen per E‐Mail an jobs(at)datapine.com. Bitte teile uns in deinem Anschreiben auch deinen gewünschten Starttermin mit.
Wir freuen uns auf dich!

Ihre Aufgaben:
Sie erstellen komplexe Abfragen und Analysen, um bei unseren Kunden datenbasierte Entscheidungen insbesondere im Marketing, Vertrieb und Service durchzuführen
Dabei gewährleisten Sie die Datenkonsistenz und sorgen für eine gleichbleibend hohe Datenqualität
Sie entwickeln operative Controlling-Systeme, inkl. Reporting und KPI‘s zur Sicherstellung der Umsetzung der Servicequalität und Kundenzufriedenheit
Sie definieren neue fachliche Anforderungen mit Anwendern/Nutzern aus den Fachabteilungen beim Kunden
Sie erstellen automatisierte ad hoc Reports und Dashboards zur Visualisierung
Sie überprüfen kontinuierlich die Daten in Bezug auf Qualität, Plausibilität und Profitabilität
Dabei arbeiten Sie eng mit anderen Kollegen in der Analyse der Daten zusammen und gewährleisten einen effizienten Kommunikationsfluss
Ihr Profil:
Für diese anspruchsvollen Aufgaben suchen wir erfahrene Spezialisten mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung (3-5 Jahre) im Bereich Datenanalyse/analytisches CRM.
Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung zum Fachinformatiker oder haben Ihr Studium mit analytischem Schwerpunkt der (z.B. Statistik, VWL/BWL, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftsmathematik) Wirtschaftswissenschaften absolviert oder besitzen eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.
Idealerweise können Sie Berufserfahrung für Kommunikationslösungen, speziell mit den Technologien eines der Hersteller AVAYA, Genesys, Aspect oder anderen ACD- bzw. Contact Center Lösungen vorweisen und/oder im Bereich von CRM-Systemen wie Salesforce o.ä..
Sie verfügen über:
Sehr gutes analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen
Sehr gute Datenbankkenntnisse
Erfahrung im Einsatz von gängigen Analyse- und Statistik-Tools insbesondere auf großen Datenmengen (z.B. Umgang mit Tools wie Power BI oder Clickview)
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und mindestens einer Programmiersprache
Sehr gute MS-Office Kenntnisse insbesondere in Access und Excel inkl. VBA Programmierung
Erfahrung in der Erstellung, Aufbereitung und der Pflege von Reports und größeren Datenmengen
Idealerweise Erfahrung im Umgang mit komplexen CRM- und/oder Telefonsystemen
Verständnis für Kundenbedürfnisse und schnelle Auffassungsgabe auch bei komplexen Sachverhalten
Kommunikationsstärke und sicheres Auftreten sowie ein hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative
Selbständige, lösungsorientierte und strukturierte Arbeitsweise
Reisebereitschaft von 4 Tagen die Woche.
Sichere deutsche und englische Sprachkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Customer Experience und Kundenservice ist Ihre Leidenschaft und Sie sehen die Steigerung der Kundenzufriedenheit mit Hilfe von analytischer Unterstützung als spannenden Auftrag an. Sie sind in der Lage, konzeptionelle Stärken mit operativer Erfahrung zu kombinieren, um für unsere Kunden tragfähige und realistische datenbasierte Lösungen zu erarbeiten.
Wir bieten:
Einen attraktiven Arbeitsplatz mit abwechslungsreichen Aufgaben und Projekten
Eine Unternehmenskultur, in der es Spaß macht, Ideen und Initiativen einzubringen
Projekte, an denen Sie wachsen, in denen Sie dazulernen und etwas bewegen können
Eine hohe Eigenverantwortung und Freiheiten in der Arbeitsgestaltung beim Kunden, im Büro oder im Homeoffice, wobei der Wohnort für uns keine Rolle spielt
Eine faire Vergütung und sehr interessante berufliche Perspektiven

Wir von der DKB sind immer in Bewegung und stets auf der Suche nach der besten Lösung – für unsere Kunden wie für unsere eigenen Leute. In Deutschland überzeugen wir mit smarten Lösungen bereits über 4,1 Millionen Kunden und zählen 3.990 kluge Köpfe zu unserem Team. Unser Denken ist digital geprägt. Unsere Philosophie nachhaltig: Wir sind #geldverbesserer. Als größter Geldgeber der Energiewende oder mit Förderdarlehen für die heimische Landwirtschaft. Durch Investitionen in alles, was der Mensch zum Leben braucht – z.B. bezahlbaren Wohnraum, Kindertagesstätten, Pflegeheime oder Krankenhäuser.

Wir haben sportliche Ziele: die Zukunft der Bank gestalten. Deshalb suchen wir Leute mit Ambitionen, die Verantwortung übernehmen wollen und den Mut haben, Altbekanntes zu überdenken.

In unserem Traineeprogramm Business Analyst zeigst du, was du kannst und lernst, was du noch nicht kannst. Dein Programm wird genau auf dich zugeschnitten und holt das Beste aus dir raus: Du übernimmst von Anfang an Verantwortung und baust dir Schritt für Schritt (d)ein Karrierenetzwerk auf. Am Ende entscheiden wir gemeinsam aus der Vielzahl an Stationen, wohin die Reise innerhalb der DKB geht.


DAS HAST DU

Bachelor oder Masterabschluss?
Hast du bereits in der Tasche. Oder zumindest bald.
Wirtschaftsmathematik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Datenanalyse/-Management, BWL, VWL oder vergleichbare Studiengänge mit digitalem Bezug?

Einer davon reicht uns.
Erste praktische Erfahrungen im Bereich Business Analytics, Data Science oder Controlling?
Ein Plus, aber kein Muss.
Auswertungs- und Analysemethoden in petto?

Aber logisch.
Anwenderkenntnisse in SQL?
Wäre echt schön, kannst du dir aber auch von uns beibringen lassen.


DAS KANNST DU

Strukturiert und selbständig arbeiten?
Sowieso.
Fragen genau auf den Grund gehen und betriebswirtschaftlich sinnvolle Lösungen finden?

Auf jeden Fall.
Freude und Geschick bei Datenanalyse und -verarbeitung?
Na klar!
Eine offene Persönlichkeit und Eigeninitiative?
Und zusätzlich sicher auftreten.
Spaß daran, Herausforderungen fachlich und technisch zu lösen?
So kennt man dich!


DAS MACHST DU

Mit IT-Entwickler*innen, Datenmodellierer*innen und verschiedenen Fachabteilungen an der Optimierung und Automatisierung unserer Prozesse arbeiten.
Scoring-Modelle, Kundensegmentierungen und Reportingsysteme weiterentwickeln und am DWH schrauben.
Spannende Unternehmensbereiche kennenlernen: Business Intelligence, Risiko Controlling, Finanzen oder IT.
Bankenweite Innovationsprojekte, z. B. in den Bereichen CRM und KI, begleiten und vorantreiben.
Verantwortung für Projekte übernehmen.

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined

ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle , connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).

Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. As a Product Analyst in the content composition team, you will work with data scientists and engineers, draw insights from the complex interaction of content, customers, and Zalando’s business and help to understand why which content is successful in front of the customer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle , connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

A Pricing Data Analyst in our Pricing & Forecasting team is passionate about creating accurate data solutions and have a proven record of developing trusting relationships with product and commercial leads who will turn your insights into actions.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Build and improve upon the system which measures sales forecasting, price optimisation and customer lifetime value
Act as the point of contact between Analytics and external product, engineering and ops teams to ensure key projects are successful
Build and own periodic reporting - Take advantage of the ever-growing amount of data we have at our fingertips to help stakeholders build best in class forecasting tools
Managing and leading key initiatives in the Analytics team and Pricing & Forecasting
Mentor and guide junior members of the Analytics team
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
3+ years of experience using data to build analytical solutions at industry leading companies in Technology, Retail or e-commerce.
Ability to turn complex findings and results into a compelling narrative and a set of actions
Familiarity with SQL and an objection-oriented programing language (Python, R,Java)
Undergraduate degree in a technical field (Science, Economics, Physics, Maths, Engineering)
Led or contributing to a complex technical project related to analytics, testing or data modeling/Warehousing
Experience mentoring or leading
Passion for analytics as a craft
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
The Pricing & Forecasting Department plays a pivotal role in the organisation by producing algorithmic-based price recommendations, forecasting sales, defining and implementing pricing strategies across 16 countries and 500k articles . The Department is a self-sufficient team of product, engineering, Analytics and operations. As a member of the Pricing Analytics team, you’ll build tools and data products that impacts millions of Zalando shoppers, the top and bottom line of our company and the many internal teams that rely on your analytics solutions.
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form – we do not accept applications via e-mail.

Who we are

Blinkist offers the best selection of nonfiction knowledge, all in an app that makes it easy to fit learning into your life. Through audio and text explainers called Blinks, original podcasts and author-driven content, Blinkist is on a mission to help people turn ordinary moments into extraordinary learning opportunities—anytime, anywhere.

Blinkist was created in 2012 right in the heart of Berlin. We’ve been selected as one of the Top 25 Startups in Germany by LinkedIn, and are amongst Berlin’s top 3 employers based on Glassdoor and Kununu ratings.

Why we need you

At Blinkist, data has always been in focus when it comes to optimizing our operations in the areas of marketing and finance. Over the past years, we have carefully tailored an analytical framework that helps us understand our current state and estimate future performance through clear metrics, complex transformations, and intuitive dashboards.

Now, we’d like to move it to the next level! With your help, we’d like to extend our framework to further areas of our marketing stack (e.g. brand and organic marketing) and advance our coverage in web and conversion funnel analytics. We would also like to improve our revenue and financial reporting to support our expanding product offering with the necessary insights.
Responsibilities
Build transformations using statistical and data warehousing tools (Matillion, AWS) to convert raw platform and performance datasets into marketing reports and dashboards
Make sure the marketing data from various channels and campaigns are up-to-date (including paid social, paid search, native ads, and offline marketing), the transformations are running as scheduled and data consistency is maintained
Analyze the conversion funnel on mobile and web. Perform in-depth analysis for large scale campaign/product/pricing strategies
Define key metrics, identify trends and opportunities across channels, campaigns and consumer segments and use them to generate actionable insights for the marketing team
Join key marketing decision meetings as an advocate of the BI team to uphold data-driven thinking
Requirements
2+ years of experience working with marketing or financial data
A deep understanding of key metrics and analysis used in marketing
A strong analytical foundation with advanced knowledge of SQL, or an intermediate knowledge of SQL and one other data-related language (Python, R, etc.)
Proven experience in a fast-paced business environment and an understanding of how analytics contributes to business success
Experience with drawing in raw data from various third-party data sources (e.g marketing platforms, payment platforms, mobile marketing attribution and analytics solutions) and transforming it into effective data sets for analysis
Accountable when it comes to data domain and have a strong relationship with your stakeholders
Excellent command of English: you know how to present numbers in a convincing way and establish trust with your stakeholders
A pragmatic approach to solving problems
A conceptual thinker and a problem solver to respond to changing situations quickly
Experience with developing and drawing insights from experiments will be considered a plus
Experience developing a model (attribution, forecast, revenue expectation etc.) in production will be considered a plus
What’s in it for you

At Blinkist, we’ve flipped the script and moved beyond rigid classic management hierarchies. Instead, we value distributed authority amongst our team. We created our own Blinkist Operating System that grows along with us and fosters a unique company culture valuing self-empowerment, personal development, direct communication, transparency, and mutual support.

We offer a comfortable office in the heart of Berlin-Neukölln with perks like a yearly €1,600 personal development budget, free plant-based lunch, a gym membership, public transportation pass, and 30 days of vacation.

Does Blinkist sound like somewhere where you can make a lasting, positive impact? Apply now and let us know why you’re someone we need on our team.

What you can expect

Please send an application that speaks directly to this position. If you’re unsure where to start, you can take a look at this article.

At Blinkist, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it and support it. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

we are unu

We believe in cities in which all people are able to embrace the full potential of urban life. This is why we are committed to creating the mobility solution, that fully connects people to their city.

unu is an urban mobility brand based in Berlin. Our first product was the unu Scooter Classic, an electric scooter with portable batteries and was launched in 2014. Our products are sold both directly to consumers and business customers, making them accessible to everyone and resulting in fair prices by eluding dealership costs. In 2019, we launched the second generation of our scooter: The unu Scooter was designed inhouse and completely re-developed with our partners in Germany. The new scooter offers space for two people, as well as the largest storage space and one of the fastest acceleration values in the electric scooter segment. With its own app and integrated display, it also offers innovative smart features such as navigation, theft protection, and digital key sharing.

With already more than 110 creative challengers striving for simply perfect solutions, we are now looking for a strong Business Analyst to join the product team in unu’s HQ in Berlin.

THE ROLE
As part of a product-driven organization, you identify, assess, and prioritize high-value opportunities. You align the product team but work cross-functional to ensure that business and customer values are at the center of the decision-making process. You collect and analyze data that justify new features or product development and iteration. You understand which products are important to focus on. Plus, you support product development from a business perspective and ensure the company delivers products our customers want.
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
Support the product team (hardware, software, app, website) in evaluating, validating and prioritizing the product development roadmap
Participate in or lead decisions regarding growth-related (up/cross-sell) topics
Contribute to the development of new business models and market expansion
Responsible for the pricing and packaging of new products and features
Ensure consistent and continuous documentation of all available products and services
Direct contact with business customers and partners and seek new business opportunities
Support the design of the product strategy
WHAT YOU BRING
First of all, you should be passionate about our values - connection, creative challenger, simple perfection, authenticity, we are David - and our vision to create a mobility solution that fully connects people to their city.
We’d really like if you bring us the following:
3 years of business development experience with skills in project management, user research, business & scenario planning
Ability to learn fast and quickly on different topics
Capacity to negotiate contracts and partnerships
Strong communication skills as you work and align with a lot of stakeholders
Basic understanding of agile methodologies & product management
Fluency in English mandatory, German/French/Dutch is a plus
Previous experience with a hardware & software company is a plus
YOUR PERKS
Direct influence and impact on the future of one of the most sought after startup in Germany
A highly diverse and vibrant group of people with a strong cultural bond, flat hierarchy, with space for your own ideas in a dynamic, dedicated and motivating environment
Competitive salary and attractive stock options
You will get your own company unu Scooter to unlock Berlin’s potential or discount on the BVG monthly ticket
A creative workspace in Kreuzberg
Healthy snacks, drinks, and meals, e.g. daily lunch vouchers
Discounted Urban Sports Club Membership or 10€ contribution to your sports club
Are you ready to join our team? Would you like to learn more about unu’s vision, then please send us:
A short motivational letter, highlighting your relevant portfolioYour CV, or a link to your updated profile on Linkedin, Xing, etc.Reference letters

Job Description
Alexion Talent has opportunities across Europe and MENA for Professionals, who have an exceptional track record of driving impact for clients in various industries and various countries. As a candidate, you would be selected through professional, progressive stages, to be a best fit for the client and find a promising career for yourself. If you are in search for a new opportunity to bring out your experience and potential, we would like to meet you immediately .




Responsibilities



Implementing and maintaining human resource information management systems and guiding management regarding system requirements based on company requirements and needs.


Implement and provide IT support for human resource software such as payroll software, timekeeping software, employee records,

Responsible for overall system performance and maintenance,

Monitor system performance and identify processes that need improvement, outline appropriate solutions and present to department manager,

Provide project management to implement system changes,

Perform regular system testing for updates,
Create appropriate user guidelines and procedures for new and/or HRIS solutions,

Assist with system maintenance during system upgrades and patches

Process and maintain periodic reports of employee record data, develop reports.



Requirements
Bachelor's degree in computer science, human resources or a relevant field,

Strong knowledge of human resource management systems,

3+ years of human resources experience,

2+ years of experience in an IT support role,

Analytical mind, attention to detail,

Dependable with confidential information,

Good communicator, both verbal and written.

job_title: Data Analyst / Data Manager (m/w/d) - Data Integrity
full_text:
Unbefristet, Vollzeit



ISS gehört heute mit rund 480.000 Mitarbeitern zu den größten privaten Arbeitgebern der Welt und gestaltet durch Sensorik und IoT-Lösungen die digitale Zukunft rund um das Gebäude. Unser Ziel ist es, die beste Serviceorganisation der Welt zu werden.

Sind Sie bereit mit uns den nächsten Schritt zu gehen?

Durch die intelligente Vernetzung von Menschen und Systemen schaffen wir täglich gemeinsam den Arbeitsplatz der Zukunft. Bei uns erwartet Sie ein Arbeitsumfeld, das Ihnen die Möglichkeit bietet, sich frei zu entfalten und Verantwortung zu übernehmen.



Für unsere Tochtergesellschaft, die ISS Communication Services GmbH, suchen wir Sie als "Data Analyst / Data Manager (m/w/d) - Data Integrity ".


Ihre Aufgaben
Verantwortung über die Datenintegration zwischen dem Kunden und ISS
Überwachung der Integrität der Datenströme
Einführung von Maßnahmen zur Erhaltung der Integrität über mehrere Level
Definition und Einführung von Qualitätsmaßnamen
Troubbleshooting und Fehleranalyse
Entwickelung von Verfahren zur sicheren Massenänderung von Stamm- und ggf. Bewegungsdaten
Bereitstellung von Reports zu Integrität, Qualität und Incidents
Ihr Profil

Studienabschluss in Informatik oder vergleichbar (Schwerpunkt Facility Management wünschenswert)
Kenntnisse im Facility Management wünschenswert
Erfahrung in Stammdaten und Datenmanagement
Erfahrung in Design und Betrieb von IT Schnittstellen zwischen heterogenen Systemen
Sicheres Auftreten vor externen und internen Kunden
Analytische Vorgehensweise

Wir bieten
Eine Unternehmenskultur mit kurzen Kommunikationswegen, die es jedem Einzelnen ermöglicht, sein Potential bestmöglich zu entfalten und mit uns zu wachsen, z.B. durch Weiterbildungen im ISS College
Den "German Award", der jährlich unsere Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter auszeichnet, die außergewöhnliche Leistungen erbracht haben
Mitarbeiterkonditionen mit vergünstigten Preisen bei Shopping-, Reise- und Mietwagenportalen
Den Rückhalt eines internationalen Unternehmens in einer wachsenden Branche




Sie haben Lust auf eine Veränderung und wir haben Sie überzeugt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!

We look for the risk-takers , the collaborators , the inspired and the inspirational . We want the people who are brave enough to work at the cutting edge and create solutions that will enrich and improve the lives of people across the globe. So, if you want to make the world say wow, let's talk.
The conversation starts here. If this role matches your ambitions and skillset, let's get started with your application . Take a look at our other open positions too. Our many opportunities can lead to infinite possibilities .

Please submit applications in English!!!
Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir eine analytische Persönlichkeit mit Erfahrung im Bereich Verkaufsplanung und Report- Erstellung mit starker Kundenorientierung und Freude an analytischen Aufgaben.
Hauptverantwortlichkeiten:
Projekt- sowie Prozessverantwortung und –koordinierung
Prozesssteuerung für den monatlichen Forecast Prozess
Schnittstelle zur europäischen Sony Support Plattform
Analyse und Konsolidierung von Verkaufsdaten
Unterstützung von regionalen/nationalen Business Review Meetings
Unterstützung der Geschäftsplanung nach Verkaufsstellen
 (Budget, Messe-Business-Pläne und neue Modelleinführungen)
Unterstützende Projektarbeit zur Verbesserung der Verkaufssteuerungstools
Zusätzliche Aufgaben:
Unterstützung des Sales Director bei der Umsetzung der Vertriebsstrategie
Schnittstelle zwischen den Abteilungen Marketing, Strategy und Sales
Planung, Aufbereitung und Präsentation
Direkter Draht zum Vertrieb
Ihr Profil:
Bachelor oder Master of Science in Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder Betriebswirtschaftslehre
Fähigkeit, starke Beziehungen zum Top Management aufzubauen
Ein erfahrener Berichts- oder Vertriebsplaner mit mindestens 3-5 Jahren Berufserfahrung
Sehr analytisch, kundenorientiert, strategisch orientiert und ergebnisorientiert
Fortgeschrittene MS Excel und MS Powerpoint Kenntnisse
Zahlenaffinität
Deutsch und Englisch auf einem verhandlungssicheren Niveau
Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung inklusive Ihres möglichen Starttermins.

job_title: Data Scientist* / Data Analyst* – Big Data
full_text:
Diese Herausforderung erwartet Sie:

Durch zum Teil hochautomatisierte Automobile werden immer mehr Fahrzeug- und Umfelddaten gewonnen, analysiert und verwertet. Auf Grundlage des fundierten Wissens von IAV im Gesamtfahrzeug und in der Fahrzeugvernetzung können wir in diesen Daten Auffälligkeiten und Fehlverhalten erkennen. Wir können unseren Kunden Dienste zur Verfügung stellen, um Entwicklungszyklen maßgeblich zu reduzieren und auch Endkunden große Mehrwerte in der Nutzung der Fahrzeuge zu bieten.
Um die gesamte Leistungskette von der Erfassung, über die Übertragung und Verwaltung, bis hin zur Analyse der Messdaten effizient zu bearbeiten, wurde von IAV ein eigenes Messdatenmanagement- und Analysesystem entwickelt, das im Bereich der Flottenerprobung und der Data Analytics eingesetzt wird.
Aufbereitung und Analyse strukturierter und unstrukturierter Daten wie z.B. Mustererkennung mittels Verfahren aus dem Bereich Data Mining, Predictive Analytics und Machine Learning
Entwicklung prognostischer Modelle oder Durchführung von Analysen auf Basis von Methoden aus der deskriptiven Statistik
Aufbau von Data-Mining- und Machine-Learning-Techniken, mit dem Ziel, Modelle und geschäftsrelevante Erkenntnisse aus großen Mengen strukturierter und unstrukturierter Daten abzuleiten und systematisch aufzusetzen
Enge Vernetzung zum Fachbereich, um Analyseergebnisse zu visualisieren und Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten
Identifikation neuer Technologien, die zur Lösung bestehender und zukünftiger Anforderungen beitragen

Das spricht für Sie:
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Informatik, Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Ingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung, gerne auch als Quereinstieg aus den Bereichen der Physik, Mathematik o. Ä.
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Science / Big Data
Wünschenswerterweise sicherer Umgang mit R, Python, SAS oder SPSS, Spark und Hadoop
Kenntnisse der Fahrzeugvernetzung und in der Programmierung in Java von Vorteil
Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und sicheres Auftreten
Hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative und Kreativität sowie die Fähigkeit, über den eigenen Tellerrand hinausschauen zu können

Bitte geben Sie uns im Anschreiben Ihren bevorzugten IAV-Standort an.

Das spricht für uns:

Verantwortung übernehmen statt Rädchen im Getriebe sein. Bei IAV vertrauen wir Ihnen step by step immer wichtigere Aufgaben an. Dank Fach-Mentoren sind Sie nicht allein und können so mit den Projekten wachsen. Sie arbeiten mit den großen Namen der Automobil- und Forschungswelt zusammen. Und qualifizieren sich gezielt weiter, z.B. durch in-house Seminare oder auf Kongressen.
Wir freuen uns über Menschen jeden Geschlechts.

The Berlin-based vertical commerce company Berlin Brands Group, founded as Chal-Tec GmbH in 2005 by Peter Chaljawski, has been successfully producing and selling products for consumers in the area of home & living, consumer electronics, sound & light and sports since 2005 and is one of Germany's top-selling digital companies. The largest and best-known brands are Klarstein for household appliances, auna for audio equipment and Capital Sports for home fitness.

The Berlin Brands Group combines the entire value chain: from product development, conception and design to production, marketing and customer service. From its headquarters in Berlin, the vertical commerce company manages the brand development and multi-channel distribution of more than 2,500 products for consumers in 24 countries worldwide. More than 700 employees currently work at the six locations in Berlin (headquarters), Kamp-Lintfort (logistics centre), Bratislava, Istanbul, Hong Kong and San Francisco.

In order to continue to grow so successfully and dynamically, we are always looking for motivated colleagues like you to join us in shaping the DNA of the Berlin Brands Group.
Your responsibilities:
You will work on ad-hoc data and deep dive analysis in order to support decision-making processes
You will design and implement new dashboards using Power BI
You will perform data analysis using a variety of tools such as R, Python, Power BI, Excel, etc.
You will develop and manage ETL pipelines using Python and/or R
You are responsible for the continuous validation of data in our data warehouse
You will actively support the expansion of a data driven and KPI oriented company culture
Your profile:
You have at least 3 years of experience in in data analysis using Python or R (Matlab, Tableau and others are a plus), ideally in e-commerce
You have a minimum of 1-2 years of experience in working with Power BI
You have already gained solid experience writing SQL queries (SQL Server, PostgreSQL or any other variant)
You have a degree in Computer Science or similar field; background in STEM is a plus
You have have experience in building KPI dashboards and reports
You are highly self-driven and have a strong hands-on mindset
You are innovative, adaptable and a great multitasker
We offer:
Challenging projects with plenty of entrepreneurial freedom in one of Europe's leading e-commerce companies
Flexible working hours and a modern office in the heart of Berlin (Spittelmarkt)
Company benefits such as public transport ticket grant, 30% discount on products from our own shop and employer's contribution to the company pension plan
Daily fresh fruits and vegetables as well as drinks and various health offers (physiotherapy, yoga and back training courses)
Opportunities for professional development, language courses as well as team training and coaching
An international and dynamic working environment; We celebrate success together at numerous company events
JOIN THE GANG

Become a member of one of Europe's leading ecommerce companies. Click the following button to fill out our online application. We are looking forward to your application!

Berlin Brands Group
Wallstr. 16
10179 Berlin
www.berlin-brands-group.com

Klarna makes shopping smoooth. And we do it with flair because shopping is fun. Every day, we help customers, businesses, and partners explore just how smoooth the modern shopping experience can be.

It means we’re constantly changing the game. Always trying out new things. And we encourage our people to do the same. To grow. To develop. Because we don’t believe roles have to stay fixed. Instead we inspire our people to take an irregular career path. As a company of 350 dynamic start-ups, our whole business is built for it. So once you’re in, there’s no telling what will happen next.

Klarna strives to become the world’s favourite way to buy, and you can contribute to reaching this goal! We are looking to hire great people, who are passionate about using their talents to generate success. Analytics is no exception! We are currently looking to grow our Analytics teams to satisfy the company’s ever increasing need for complex problem solving and data driven decision making.

What you will do

Analytics at Klarna is divided into several teams with their unique responsibilities. One of these teams is our Fraud Analytics Team, which focuses on the continuous improvement of our fraud real-time decisioning for every transaction processed by Klarna. E-Commerce is changing quickly and so do the patterns of fraud. Our Analysts aim to identify these patterns with the help of manual and automated tools to protect our business, merchants and consumers from any fraud related losses and risks.
Use statistical analysis tools and techniques to develop automated fraud detection and real-time decisioning strategies.
Collaborate with Data Scientists to build and implement fraud pattern models.
Work with other teams across the business (particularly Engineering, Product and Commercial) to devise robust fraud strategies for new products and markets.
Create, test and monitor new fraud tools and strategies from scratch.
Work on proof of concepts involving new technologies and proactively seek out vendor and internal solutions to fraud problems.
Ensure metrics and strategies are fit for purpose in terms of the current fraud environment and emerging threats.
Work closely with the investigations team to understand threats and develop mitigations.
Communicate and involve stakeholders to respond to any fraud related incidents as the first touchpoint for Legal, Finance, Engineering, Data Science and other partners
Act as a trainer and consultant for our internal and external stakeholders.
Who you are
Klarna is looking for ambitious people with significant drive! You should be passionate about your job and enjoy a fast paced international working environment. You will play an important role in taking Klarna to the next level thus, you should desire to go above and beyond to produce best work results! At Klarna we embrace change, you should dare to challenge the status quo and be persistent.
We have roles fit for either someone starting their career or ready to lead teams as a senior manager.
You should have
A degree from a university in a numerate subject (e.g. Economics, Science, Engineering, Mathematics)
Exceptional analytical thinking abilities, decision making and problem solving skills.
Strong proficiency in SQL with the ability to analyse large quantities of data using statistical analysis tools such as Python or R.
Experience in the entire Analytics lifecycle, from requirements gathering, data extraction, manipulation and analysis to sharing insights and advising on decision making
Excellent track record in optimizing business performance and identifying gaps in business strategy, with a focus on financial services, ideally fraud.
Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English
Fantastic stakeholder management skills.
Passion for learning about Fraud
You might also have
Experience of decision systems, including rule/strategy implementation and testing is preferred
Fraud experience - knowledge of external fraud data sources and use cases to prevent fraud
Preferably an understanding for how to perform data extraction and manipulation in multiple programming languages is a plus (MatLab, Java, C# etc…)
How to apply

Send over a CV in English.

About Klarna

Klarna was founded in Stockholm, Sweden in 2005. Since then, we’ve changed the banking industry forever. And now we’re creating the world’s smooothest shopping experience. We serve 80 million consumers worldwide, and partner with 190,000 merchants – with a new merchant joining us every 8 minutes. Including some of the world’s leading brands, such as H&M, ASOS, IKEA, Adidas, Samsung and Lufthansa. Our offices are spread over 17 different markets, hosted by +2,500 people from 90 nationalities.

company_name: Bund für Umwelt und Naturschutz Deutschland e. V.
full_text: Der Bund für Umwelt und Naturschutz Deutschland e.V. ist mit rund 620.000 Unterstützerinnen und Unterstützern der größte Natur- und Umweltschutzverband Deutschlands. Der BUND engagiert sich für die Erhaltung der Biodiversität, den Schutz des Klimas und die Rechte der Verbraucherinnen und Verbraucher. Get to know AAX
AAX, which stands for Acceptable Ads Exchange, is a leading ad blocking monetization platform. AAX is working with premium publishers to revitalize the ad ecosystem by establishing a sustainable balance between publisher monetization and user experience. This won’t just reward all three participants in the value exchange—users, publishers, and advertisers—but will also strengthen the free web.
By heading the vanguard of the Acceptable Ads marketplace, AAX signals its commitment to building a bridge between the needs of publishers and the wishes of users.

Where you fit in:
We’re committed to making AAX a game-changer, so we’re looking for someone who wants to change the rules of the game.
As AAX’s Berlin-based Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst, you’ll be helping us make the most out of our data as well as guiding our understanding of how to make better, data-supported business decisions. You’ll also be engaging and collaborating with the AAX team across multiple functional units and conferring with your colleagues and other stakeholders to gather requirements and analyze information. In addition, you’ll be responsible for heading the mission of measuring the impact of business strategies in order to support tactical operations.

After your morning coffee, you’ll be
working with the management team and preparing reports for all business requirements.
assisting with the design and creation of data structures to produce actionable reports and facilitate decision making.
analyzing business processes and developing ways to reduce the cost of operation and increase efficiency.
developing and maintaining various business process documents.
assisting in the design, architecture, and implementation of data sources.
evaluating trend data, developing metric reports, and recommending improvements as required.
interacting with internal and occasionally external stakeholders in order to understand business and data requirements
iteratively designing report prototypes and templates.
working with the team to identify (and subsequently build) the best means of displaying data.
managing and/or coordinating 3rd party resources in the development of reporting and business insights solutions.
developing your understanding of ad tech terminology to include relevant quality measures and metrics in reports, dashboards and data structures.


Our vision of a successful Business and Reporting Analyst? Someone who has

two- to four years of experience in a similar role, ideally in a digital tech company.
a university degree, preferably in information management, computer science, economics, business administration, or a related field.
fluency in English (command of a second language a plus).
direct experience working with stakeholders at all levels, across multiple functions.
excellent analytical skills.
the ability to work both on a team and independently.
cross-functional communication skills with technical, legal, and marketing stakeholders.
comfort/experience working with a distributed team.
direct experience designing, developing, and implementing reporting solutions.
excellent verbal, written, and organizational skills.
the ability to proactively research solutions and best practices.
comfort and enthusiasm performing in a dynamic environment.
the ability to debug and solve problems.
availability to travel (up to 10%) both domestically and internationally.
direct experience using Salesforce.com reports and reports visualization (dashboards) is highly preferred.


Some of the benefits associated with this role are

a competitive salary and an annual bonus plan.
generous vacation time.
flexibility in work hours and schedule.
a yearly stipend for personal development courses.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.

You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.

BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Google Analytics Certification/experience

ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
