Your profile:
You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!

Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.

Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined

Apply here, or send your profile to pietro(at)upvest.co

Upvest builds the financial infrastructure of tomorrow, powered by blockchain. We make it incredibly simple for every company to use the benefits of the blockchain via our APIs. Our solution is globally used in more than 80 countries. Our team of around 20 talented people comes from 10 different countries, and we are based in Berlin, Germany.

Tasks


Working closely with Upvest’s senior managers to deliver tasks that address specific client and investors’ needs (tech-reports, business presentations and other VC-related due diligence)
Conducting independent tech-research to identify, collect, manage and analyse relevant business data
Draw conclusions from the blockchain-industry trends and support go to market initiatives for Upvest
Support business development, sales and tech-recruiting activities
Be ready to support our marketing team with pro-active ideation and execution (e.g. tech content creation, blogs, strategy on which blockchain events to attend)
Performing detailed market analysis and research on potential clients

Requirements


Currently enrolled or just graduated from Uni degree, ideally studying a Business/Management related subject
Have the authorization to work in Europe
Solid understanding of the basics of blockchain (protocols, applications, leading corporations in the ecosystem)
Prior experience in unstructured startup dynamics, which rewards proactive and leadership attitude
Verbal and written fluency in English, other languages a plus
Ability to take direction and absorb information quickly

We’re an English-speaking team, so no German knowledge will be required

Benefits


Our salary package is typically above average
You will receive personal coaching sessions
We have flat hierarchies, you can grow into any role

Our cultural values:

Think big: Know your north star. Be hungry. Never give up.
Dig deep: Find the root cause of things. Be obsessed with it.
Play fair: Build powerful partnerships, lasting relationships and long term value.
Resourcefulness: Understand the concept of time. Find a solution.
Own it: Be proactive. Lead by example.
Unity: Supporting each other and working together with transparency in good and bad times.

Data Analyst (w/m/d), Vollzeit

Deine Aufgaben
Du findest in der Fülle der Rohdaten die relevanten Zahlen und übernimmst die Organisation, Zusammenstellung und Aufbereitung von komplexen Daten und Informationen für Analysen, Berichte und Dashboards.Du visualisierst und interpretierst die Analyseergebnisse und leitest Handlungsempfehlungen abDu entwirfst und implementierst neue Reporting-Strategien.Du erkennst, innerhalb welcher Prozesse Optimierungsbedarf besteht und arbeitest aktiv und selbständig an deren Verbesserung.Du bist ein vertrauensvoller Ansprechpartner bei Fragen rund um das Thema Datenaufbereitung und -analyse.

Dein Profil
Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Betriebswirtschaft, (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder Statistik.Du hast mindestens drei Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung.Du hast Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierungssoftware und eine Leidenschaft für neue Technologien und digitale Trends im Bereich Big Data & Advanced AnalyticsProgrammierkenntnisse in Python sind ein Vorteil.Du bist ein Zahlenexperte mit ausgeprägten analytischen und konzeptionellen Fähigkeiten.Du bist durchsetzungsstark, arbeitest strukturiert und zeigst ein hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative sowie unternehmerisches, strategisches Denken.Du bist teamfähig, flexibel und gut organisiert.Du bist motiviert und freust dich über herausfordernde Aufgaben.Du beherrschst Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift (fließend).

job_title: Pricing & Business Analyst (f/m/div) at solarisBank AG
full_text:
solarisBank is the world's first banking platform. Our goal is to empower finance pioneers - anyone who wants to build something new with banking services. The core of the company is fast, modern technology that makes our banking services quick to setup and simple to build with. We see ourselves as a tech company with a full banking license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Our international team of 300+ colleagues combines digital focus, tech expertise and banking experience. Whether you're a full-stack developer, banker or astronaut, if you're ready to change banking, reach out to us. We love what we do and love our team.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Your Role & Responsibilities

You are responsible for establishing and maintaining solarisBank's pricing strategy, focusing on deal and product pricing. You will also support our commercial teams with business analytics, using SQL and Tableau to visualize results.

Your main responsibility is to establish a value-based pricing approach which is highly standardized and scalable across our B2B product portfolio.

Detailed content will include but not limit to:

Define pricing strategy and standard pricing guidelines
Create pricing processes to ensure
Documentation
Pricing integrity
Value based pricing
Monitoring
Deal support, consult and guide partner facing teams
Build and align business cases and pricing calculators, enable management to drive decisions based on deal economics and profitability
Train team members and socialize solarisBank's pricing philosophy, guidelines and processes

Our Perfect Match

The person we are looking for has at least 3 years of work experience as Business Analyst or Pricing Manager, ideally in payments, payment processing or banking.

You should be a team player with strong communication skills, fluent in English as well as being able to have business conversations in German.

You have dealt with pricing in your previous role(s) and you are familiar with value-based pricing strategies and automated pricing implementations.

You don't shy away from pushing the sales organization to deliver clean and professional pricing proposals out to the market.

You can expect to become part of a young & highly motivated team, shaping solarisBank's pricing strategy & business analytics. If you are looking for a dynamic work environment and you enjoy changing things fast: Please send us your application!

Our Organization:

We are a tech company with a banking license and we change banking forever. We combine the best from the digital world with our unique tech-enabled platform banking approach.
Take a deep breath – and get ready to grow at the speed of light: We're a young company and you can shape our destiny from day one.
You'll join a team of experts from tech, entrepreneurship and banking. It's an exclusive combination you'll find in few places other than solarisBank.
We're growing rapidly – and you will grow with us. We have a true hands-on mentality which creates lots of opportunities for individual growth.

At solarisBank, we are committed to nurture an inclusive environment, where all solarians feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to build a diverse workforce that reflects the diversity of our communicates. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of color, race, religion, sex, origin, disability, marital status, citizenship, or gender identity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.

To all recruitment agencies: solarisBank does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, solarisBanks' employees or any other venture in our ecosystem. solarisBank is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Information on data processing:
DE: https://www.solarisbank.com/gdpr_notice_de

EN: https://www.solarisbank.com/gdpr_notice_en

We're looking for a security-obsessed IT Risk and Control Analyst who loves to jump into processes, auditing and risk management. Building integrations and participating in control reviews while analyzing data to provide action plans. You'll also recommend the training to the various teams in order to implement solutions that come from these findings!
Who you are
Having a knack for research is your thing, critical view of a project and understanding where the problem might be. Focusing on developing yourself in both processes, risk, and auditing is meaningful but being able to communicate and be in touch with various teams to help them out is a must!
Technically, working in the IT area focusing on information security and had to deal with the compliance aspect. It is highly relevant that you have the awareness in risk management techniques and strategies that can be applied.
Having experience in the field, we expect that you would know the principles of IT Audit and IT Security but also an understanding of IT controls and Systems development lifecycle.
You'll need to be able to travel internationally to help the teams in other parts of the globe so your English level needs to a high level.
What you’ll bring
Experience in development using Python and working with SQL databases but also experience in reporting tools like PowerBI, Tableau or similar.
Bringing experience in handling and understanding monitoring and logging tools like Splunk or similar.
Pursuing and solving global process projects having PCI and ISO27001 in mind. The will come in audit, risk management, processes and improving them with that in mind.
Good experience in Lean and Agile methodologies. This includes in dealing with multiple projects at the same time.
What can you expect from us?
Outstanding opportunity to become a part of international teams, learning from one another and contributing to the global OLX Group success.
An excellent place to learn and develop within a fast-growing, global classifieds leader which opens further career opportunities in a diverse world of OLX and Prosus.
Work in a multicultural and international environment.
Competitive salary and excellent benefits
Company Mobile phone and any tool you might need a MacBook Pro/ Notebook/ PC
About us
The OLX Group is a network of leading classifieds platforms in 45 markets, including brands like OLX, Avito, Letgo, Dubizzle, among others. We connect local people to buy, sell or exchange used goods and services by making it fast and easy. Hundreds of millions of people in local markets all around the globe generate more than 1.9 billion monthly visits, 37 billion monthly page views and 54 million listings every month on the OLX Group’s online marketplaces.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. To learn more about us please visit www.olxgroup.com

Responsibilities
Engage with business stakeholders and partner with Realtimo Solution Architects to gather requirements and map them to solutions that leverage salesforce functionality

Review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs. Document requirements, define scope and objectives and formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies. May require an associate’s degree in a related area and 2-4 years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiar with relational database concepts and client-server concepts. Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.

Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats

Construct workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications

Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications

Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures

Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget

Monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions

Maintain user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential

Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends

Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed

Validate resource requirements and develop cost estimate models

Conduct and coordinate financial, product, market, operational and related research to support strategic and business planning within the various departments and programs of the client group

Interpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making

Plan and coordinate the development of primary and secondary market research studies in support of strategic planning and specific marketing initiatives, as required and presents findings of studies to client committees

Perform daily, weekly and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reports

Review a variety of areas including operations, purchasing, inventory, distribution and facilities

Understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes

Suggest changes to senior management using analytics to support your recommendations. Actively participate in the implementation of approved changes

Create informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement

Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience

Microsoft Access and/or SQL experience strongly preferred

Ability to impact operations and effect change without being confrontational

Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive

Ability to work independently and with others

Extremely organized with strong time-management skills

.

Job Type: Full-time

Location: Berlin, Germany

Experience:

Software Design; Analysis; Teamwork; Software Maintenance; Process Improvement; Microsoft Access and/or SQL experience; Big Picture Thinking; Work Well Under Pressure; Communication; Problem Solving; Critical Thinking; Relationship Building

Product Management, People Management, Understanding the Customer, Product Development, Requirements Analysis, Pricing, Planning, Competitive Analysis, Sales Planning, Inventory Control, Financial Planning and Strategy

Product Management: 2+ years
Cloud Application: 2+ year
Come Join us as we grow. Please email us at sales@realtimo.com with a copy of your updated Resume and a cover letter to apply.

wefox Group is Europe’s leading insurtech that is reinventing insurance at scale, with a total of $235 million raised in 2019, making it the largest funding round by a European insurtech.

wefox Group is revolutionising insurance by empowering the customer and delivering solutions for secured data-driven experiences.

The wefox platform is a fully digital marketplace that connects insurance companies with brokers to give customers a simplified and easier customer experience. wefox has 2085 sales agents managing more than 500,000 customers with a premia under management of more than USD$300 million.

ONE is Europe’s first fully digital insurance company. ONE Insurance was launched in 2017 and has already exceeded 130,000 contracts making it Germany’s leading provider for household and second place for liability insurance

The role:
Support the project lead in delivering transformation cross-functional strategic initiatives to drive people, process, data, and platform impact for large, complex projects
Utilise own skills, business & technical experience to facilitate outcomes on your project
Ability to handle data (Excel must have, SQL strong plus)
Ability to transfer business requirements to specs
Occasionally prepare Excel dashboards and business decks
Work with our Operations, Product, and Tech teams to ensure multi-department coordination on backlog planning and refinement and help maintain our project board in Jira
Strong communication skills

What you bring:
You have a profound academic record in the area of Business and or IT/ Information Management
You bring at least 1- 2 years of work experience within insurance, consulting, a financial services company or in a fast-paced startup environment
You have a strong affinity towards digital business models, innovation and transformation
As a strong problem solver, you are thrilled to take on challenging new tasks, always working ‘hands-on’ towards a tangible outcome.
You have great interpersonal communication skills
Entrepreneurial drive and the ability to stay focused and achieve goals in a fast-paced environment complete your profile.
Experience working with at least one Agile framework (e.g. SCRUM, Kanban, Kanplan, etc.) is a big advantage.

What we offer:
Now, we’ve gotten to the fun part, the part where you get to brag about your company, those perks your friends are so jealous of!

Here are some of them:
Flexible working hours including some days remote option
26 working days of vacation, with an additional day for each year of service - up to 30 days + 24th and 31st December
Discounted fitness memberships
Up to 50% of your public transport costs reimbursed
A stack of the latest technologies and working gadgets
Free coffee, fruit and snacks, because we need fuel!
Grants for training and coaching

If you love a less-formal work environment, flexible paid time off, a great compensation package and benefits offering - and most of all, being the authentic you, get in touch, we want to meet you!

To all the misunderstood geniuses, rebels and mavericks looking to change the world for the better. Come work with us!

We are an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

The Company:
Our client are Global Leaders in online food ordering. They are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who is enthusiastic, talented and passionate to join their team. They offer a challenging and dynamic working environment where you can grow and develop your career with the right support. You will be working on a cross functional team in a modern office in the heart of Berlin, with flexible working hours in a multicultural work space.
Your Responsibilities:
Create engaging data visualization to facilitate insight
Analyse data trends to provide actionable insights
Engage with Stakeholders to understand the business vision
Collaborate on a cross functional team

Experience Required:
2 years’ experience minimum
Experience working e-commerce OR internet companies.
Experience with SQL
Experience with Tableau, Looker or other visualization tools
Experience with big data tools (e.g Redshift or BigQuery) is a plus

To apply send your CV directly to Graham@alldus.com

As the Data Management area at idealo, we are building a cutting-edge, cloud-based data platform suitable for self-service analytics as well as for machine learning, data products, and our enterprise reporting. We believe that a data-driven approach is a key success factor for our business. Therefore we aim to enable our technical and non-technical internal customers to base their everyday business decisions on hypotheses that are proved by data.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst highly passionate about product performance and customer-centric analytics. You will be placed as an internal consultant in a product area which focuses on supporting users in their product discovery. There you enable product owners and developers in generating and validating product ideas and features based on data and tests. You will be supported by a broader team of product analysts, who are like you embedded in the Data Management area as well as in dedicated product areas.

Tasks


Be the analytical expert in the product area
Enable and support hypothesis-driven product development
Work closely with product owners, software engineers, and UX experts
Provide profound expertise around A/B testing; support test setups and the analysis of the results
Support the definition and reporting on product-specific KPIs
Create dashboards and reports in Google Analytics and Tableau
Teach stakeholders in interpreting dashboards and reports
Teach stakeholders in creating own dashboards and reports
Actively, drive data awareness and data literacy in your product area

Requirements


You have a passion for customer-centric analytics and increasing user and business value from an analytical point of view
You have a strong hands-on background in data analysis, web analytics, business intelligence or similar
You have proven experience with Google Analytics and at least one data visualization tool (e.g. Tableau)
You deliver point-on data visualization, to ensure early on decision making
You have great communication skills and can deliver a story with data
Work closely with the Product Discovery teams to provide meaningful insights and accurate data analysis on their projects, interpret the findings and recommend solid actions
Ideally you have experience with SQL and are curious to analyze data with programmatic approaches (e.g. Python, R)
You have hands on experience with designing and interpreting A/B testing
You are able to translate complex analytics into business implications and discuss your findings with non-experts
You can explain the power of self-service analytics
You are a strong team player and still can work autonomously

Benefits


Upon starting at idealo you will get all the equipment you need to perform at your best and are invited to our welcome days for OnBoarding
We offer a large degree of responsibility and freedom in an international and inspirational environment
We provide training opportunities for your individual management or specialist career
We share knowledge and learnings through tech talks, tech communities, and product demos
We value our culture of trust, freedom, and responsibility. Employees are self-reliant and free to schedule their own work day
800 motivated colleagues, 37 childcare spots at our company Kita, and a cool office loft in the trendy district of Kreuzberg in Berlin!

idealo is a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Today, with 1.5 million visits per day, 50,000 shops and more than 330 million product offers, we are one of the most popular German e-commerce websites and one of the leading European shopping and comparison platforms. We are active as a price comparison platform in six countries (Austria, France, Germany, Great Britain, Italy and Spain).

As a member of our team, you can look forward to working with a large degree of freedom in an international and inspirational environment. We are located in the heart of Berlin and offer a unique idealo spirit. Your ideas are the driving force that moves our business forward. Not only our product portfolio is diverse, but also the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation or a degree of disability are irrelevant.

If you are passionate about improving the world of online shopping alongside 800 idealos from 40 nations, apply with us today.

Factorymarket ist ein schnellwachsendes, international tätiges Tech Unternehmen mit Hauptsitz in Berlin.

Unser Fokus liegt auf der Vernetzung von Online Marktplätzen und stationärem Handel im Zuge unserer Omnichannel Strategie (einschließlich entsprechender Software Entwicklung).

Für unser Data Team suchen wir am Standort Berlin HQ ab sofort DICH als Data Analyst (m/w/d).

Aufgaben


Erstellung und Pflege von Live-Geschäftsberichten
Beantwortung von Ad-hoc-Datenanfragen und -analysen des Senior Managements
Kontinuierliches Data Mining, um neue Daten-getriebene Projekte zu identifizieren mit hohem Umsatz- und Effizienzsteigerungspotenzial
Regelmäßige Datenintegritäts- und Qualitätsüberprüfungen von internen Datenbanken
Aufbau und Pflege von ETL-Pipelines
Agiles Projektmanagement eines Datenteams

Qualifikation


Du bist der "Zahlen"-Typ und hast ein gutes Gespür für große Datenmengen und Automatisierung
Abgeschlossenes Studium im MINT-Bereich (oder vergleichbare Ausbildung) mit betriebswirtschaftlichem Verständnis
Mindestens zweijährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse/Business Intelligence
Du "atmest" SQL, Python und verstehst den Umgang mit gängigen BI-Tools
Idealerweise Erfahrungen mit Airflow, Docker, Git, Cloud-Technologien und Konzepten des Maschinellen Lernens
Strukturierte und analytische Arbeitsweise
Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch und Englisch

Benefits


Ein lichtdurchflutetes Büro über den Dächern Berlins mit direktem Blick auf den Potsdamer und Leipziger Platz
Kostenloses Obst, Müsli, Getränke und Sandwiches
Regelmäßige Teamevents als wichtiger Bestandteil unserer Unternehmenskultur
Optimale Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten - Weiterbildung wird gefördert
Ein motiviertes, internationales und dynamisches Team mit flachen Hierarchien

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Unternehmensbeschreibung
heycater! ist die erste Online-Plattform für Catering und Events in Deutschland und hilft Unternehmen, den perfekten Caterer für jeden Anlass zu finden. Wir sind ein Startup, das mit der Vision gegründet wurde, hochwertiges und abwechslungsreiches Essen in die Büros und Eventlocations zu bringen!
Das erwartet Dich!
Ein engagiertes, erfahrenes Team mit großem Zusammenhalt
Regelmäßige Team-Events
Ein enger Support und Coaching von erfahrenen Kollegen
Flache Hierarchien und eine offene, direkte Feedback-Kultur
Zentral gelegenes Office am Alexanderplatz
Tolles Essen von unseren Caterern, frisches Obst, Snacks und Team-Frühstück
Stellenbeschreibung
Als Senior Data Analyst (w/m/d) bist Du verantwortlich, mit Hilfe statistischer Methoden unsere Daten zu analysieren und Insights für verschiedene Stakeholder zu generieren.
Deine Aufgaben
Du bereitest die Ergebnisse Deiner Auswertung leicht verständlich auf und präsentierst sie dem Team
Du erstellst und pflegst Dashboards für verschiedene Gruppen mit Hilfe eines BI-Tools
Du hast Freude an der Arbeit mit Daten und entwickelst die BI-Prozesse weiter
Du führst Tests und Dokumentationen durch zur Umsetzung einem Reporting-Systems durch
Qualifikationen
Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich der Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik, Naturwissenschaften oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Du beherrschst mindestens eine Programmiersprachen für statistische Analysen (vorzugsweise R oder Python) und bist in der Lage, Reports damit zu erstellen
Du hast Erfahrungen mit SQLund kannst dir Daten für deine Analysen beschaffen
Du hast fundierte Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von statistischen Methoden (u.a. Zeitreihenananlyse, Regressionsanalyse, Statistische Hypothesentests)
Mit einem BI-Tool (z.B. Tableau, PowerBI, etc.) hast du idealerweise schon mal gearbeitet
Sehr gute analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten sowie starke Präsentationsfähigkeiten runden Dein Profil ab
Du sprichst und schreibst fließend Deutsch und Englisch
Zusätzliche Informationen
Deine Werte
Unsere Werte sind unsere DNA. Unser Zusammenhalt und Teamspirit lässt uns jede Herausforderung bewältigen. Uns ist es wichtig, dass Du Dich mit unseren Werten wohlfühlst und diese auch leben kannst:
Think twice, then go all in
Be thankful for where you are
Keep growing, you can do better
Love the people around you
Create value and build to last
Du hast Fragen und Gedanken zu unseren Werten? Wir freuen uns darauf und werden uns im gemeinsamen Kennenlernen dazu austauschen.
Deine Bewerbung
Wenn Du ein junges, dynamisches Team suchst, in dem Du die Möglichkeit hast, Deine Ideen und Eigenverantwortung einzubringen und aktiv die Zukunft von heycater! mitgestalten kannst, freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung inkl. Zeugnissen und Lebenslauf mit Angabe Deines Gehaltswunsches!

Your tasksYou will support Risk Management department with various tasks related to underwriting, scoring, risk reporting, fraud prevention, risk-adjusted pricing, etc.Perform ad-hoc analysis/reporting for top managementMonitor various risk KPIs on segment levelBuild and update scorecard models using statistical toolsMonitor scorecard performance and variable stability, define new segments, monitor cut-offs, strategies for credit decisionTake active role in integrating external risk management and fraud prevention toolsImprove our current reporting process and develop reports from scratchSupport impact analysis of various changes to product and pricingPerform testing and validation of risk measures in internal systemsWork closely with customer support, collection and IT on risk and underwriting topicsGain valuable experience in credit risk management and become knowledgeable with risk management tools and KPIsRequired skills and experienceBachelor or Master's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, IT, Finance or similar areaAt least three years of relevant experience in risk management and data analysisRelevant experience in financial sectorProficient knowledge of MS Office, especially ExcelStrong SQL/MySQL Python, or R user. Knowledge of VBA, SAS, Tableau will be considered an advantageStrong communication and analytical skills, specialist in data analysisCapacity to work independently and reliably with attention to detailsFluenty in English, German is a plusResponsible and willing to learn and go the extra mileWe offerPermanent employment contractFair remuneration28 holidays / yearInternational environment with a dynamic, dedicated and collegial teamOffice in the heart of Berlin near Checkpoint CharliePersonal and professional developmentModern working conditions and processes that we constantly improveA secure job in a company that prepares for the future like no otherTeam Events - e.g. Summer festival, Halloween Party, X-mas eventWeekly fresh fruit basketsZusätzliche Leistungen:Flexible ArbeitszeitenKostenlose GetränkeHome OfficeErfolgsbeteiligungZusätzliche UrlaubstageJob Types: Full-time, Permanent

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined


PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.

Since 2011, General Assembly has transformed tens of thousands of careers through pioneering, experiential education in today's most in-demand skills. As featured in The Economist, Wired, and The New York Times, GA offers training in web development, data, design, business, and more, both online and at campuses around the world. Our global professional community boasts 40,000 full- and part-time alumni — and counting.

In addition to fostering career growth for individuals, GA helps employers cultivate top tech talent and spur innovation by transforming their teams through strategic learning. More than 21,000 employees at elite companies worldwide have honed their digital fluency with our corporate training programs. GA has also been recognized as one of Deloitte's Technology Fast 500, and Fast Company has dubbed us leaders in World-Changing Ideas as well as the #1 Most Innovative Company in Education.

Teach Data Science in Riyadh, Jeddah, and Al Khobar
---------------------------------------------------

General Assembly is partnering with the MiSK Foundation to train the next generation of tech leaders in Saudi Arabia. Together, GA and MiSK are launching data, web development, UX, and other tech courses at the MiSK Academy. By 2020, this will be one of the largest tech student communities in the Kingdom, with partnerships across most major Saudi and international companies.

Our Data Science Immersive course is a life-changing educational experience where students leave with the skills and mindset to take on new careers in a wide variety of Data Science roles.

Join our team for 6 months or 1 year and earn more by teaching your craft.

Why Be a Part of the Data Science Immersive?

If you are looking to make a life-changing impact by doing what you know and love, this is the position for you. Through this unparalleled opportunity, you will:


Deepen your own skills by guiding students through a rigorous journey where they begin as driven novices and leave as empowered data analysts and scientists
Contribute your own expertise to a deep and broad global curriculum maintained by a team of talented data science instructors across multiple industries
Facilitate a supportive and energetic community that lasts well beyond the course
Hone your own leadership skills by working with an instructional team and classroom community

As a member of the instructional team, you will not only impact the careers of your own students, but you'll also have a unique opportunity to shape the potential of students on a global scale through contributions to our global curriculum.

Skills and Qualifications


Must Haves:
You have at least 6 months of professional data science experience.
You are an expert in SQL, Python, and related Python libraries (pandas, numpy).
You have domain expertise in statistics, mathematics, and probability.
You can build and apply statistical models in python using machine learning libraries, such as scikit-learn and statsmodels.
You have a deep understanding of statistical hypothesis testing and experimental design, data visualization techniques and tools (i.e. matplotlib, bokeh, etc), and manipulation of large data sets.
You can demonstrate and explain the function of machine learning algorithms such as regularized regression, naive bayes, decision trees, ensemble methods, KNN, K-means clustering, and neural networks.
You are the person your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are trying to figure something out.
You are eager to shape the skills, minds, and trajectories of the newest generation of data scientists.
You are fluent in the English language
Nice to haves:
You have proficiency with NLP python libraries such as NLTK; Hadoop or Apache Spark; D3.js or R.
You are on top of industry trends in big data, machine learning, deep learning, and AI.
You have previous data science or engineering teaching experience, through a course, workshop, team training, etc.

Responsibilities and Duties


Plan and implement a 12-week curriculum in conjunction with baseline materials and your local instructional team.
Deliver instruction 5 days a week, including teaching, advising, and content development.
Work closely with your instructional team to provide students with meaningful and prompt feedback on their progress.
Collaborate alongside GA staff in order to best meet the needs and learning styles of your students.
Guide students through the development of real world projects that will showcase their abilities to hiring managers.
Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community.
Inspire students to persevere through the challenges of learning complex subjects.
Contribute to the material and direction of an expanding global curriculum, ensuring the course remains cutting-edge and effective for students worldwide.

FULL-TIME IN BERLIN, DEENGINEERING & DATA
We are Kolibri Games - mobile games developer from Berlin. Our two games have over 100 million downloads and are on a mission to become the most player-centric games studio out there.

We believe in players, creating values, learning, but, most of all, we believe in people. We strive to offer you a fair recruitment process and a great candidate experience, as well as a friendly environment to work in, with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow. Help us bring joy to people, we promise you will have fun by doing so :)

Product Analyst (f/m/d)

We are on a mission to create the greatest Idle games in the world and you are here to help us do it. Without great players a gaming company can’t exist and if you are the type of person who wants to use data to give a voice to the silent majority of gamers then you are the ideal candidate for Product Analyst at Kolibri Games.

A Game Product Analyst is embedded within our Game Development Teams and works along each developer to identify goals, measure them, and in doing so ensure each feature we ship in the game is a resounding success. In this role, you will plunge head first into our data and empower our developers to get their data questions fast. You will also proactively create visualizations and dashboards to increase data awareness alongside building ad-hoc analyses to demonstrate your expertise in F2P Games by sharing trends and risks that can be actioned upon by the developers to help us become the world's most player-centric games studio.

Responsibilities

Help Product Managers, Game Designers, and other Stakeholders answer their data questions by prototyping metrics and visualizations.
Partner with Product Managers and Game Designers to identify measurable goals for each initiative and to verify that each goal is met and why.
Analyze retention trends to ensure our games are fun and engaging.
Analyze monetisation trends to ensure our players are happy with each purchase and remain loyal customers.

Required Skills

Building analysis in Excel or Google Sheets, and familiarity with SQL
The ability to identify growing or dropping trends and dive deep into data to understand what may cause them.
A detail oriented and highly organized mindset to work closely with Product Management to draw trends between releases, sales, community events and other product activity.
Confidence presenting to multiple people with the ability to clearly and concisely explain key findings
Ability to work within a fast-paced environment

Desirable Skills

Previous experience using Data Visualisation Tools such as; Looker, Tableau or similar
Professional Experience with SQL, Python, R or Similar
An interest in the Free-to-Play Mobile Business, Monetisation, Player Behavior, and Game Design

Your Benefits – We’re game to support you

Competitive Salary - We believe that top performers should receive top payment
Training Budget - We believe in learning. A generous personal learning budget to spend on learning and development, including books, workshops and attending conferences. We also offer in-house training such as coding and German classes
Flexible working hours and Home office – We believe in a good work-life balance
Equipment - State-of-the-art technical equipment, including laptops and phones, which may also be used in your free time
Health and Fitness - We pay €50 towards a monthly gym membership or a fitness activity
Relocation - Relocation support to help you move to Berlin
Pension - Opportunity to save for your pension tax-free

Bonus Level – We love to have a good time, too

Food and Drinks - Fresh fruits to keep you healthy and fresh coffee to keep you alert. We also have a fully stocked fridge with Smoothies, Coke, Club Mate, beer etc
Parties and Team Events - Apart from our regular parties, BBQ’s and movie nights we also have a team event budget you can use to buy games or sports equipment to make working here even more fun
Company Holidays - Every year we go on an amazing company holiday to relax and bond as a team. Last summer we went to Greece!
Friday Celebrations - Company-provided dinner and drinks on Friday afternoons

Das sind wir
Wir sind eine Beratung für datenbasiertes Marketing und Sales. Das klingt vielleicht
langweilig, ist es aber bei uns überhaupt nicht. Wir arbeiten an einigen der
aktuellsten und spannendsten Themen unserer Zeit. Data Driven Marketing ist für
uns kein Buzz-Word, sondern Philosophie, Ziel und ein wenig auch ein Traum. Was
uns ausmacht ist analytische Kompetenz, gute Laune und Spaß bei der Arbeit.
Was Du mitbringst

Du denkst analytisch und bist kreativ.
Du hast keine Lust auf Hierarchien oder Großagentur/Konzern, sondern auf

ein freundschaftliches Arbeitsumfeld.

Du hast ein gutes Verständnis für Business-Analytics-Techniken und magst

es, Dich in Themen und Projekte einzuarbeiten.

Du hast keine Lust, Dich zu verstellen oder Dich zu verkleiden.
Du kannst aussagekräftige Präsentationen erstellen und gibst unseren

Kunden Empfehlungen, die über Zahlen und Bekanntes hinausgehen.

Du hast Lust auf New-Work und flexibles, eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten.
Du hast Lust, den Umgang mit unserer Data-as-a-Service Software „Genius“

zu erlernen und mit uns weiter zu entwickeln, spannende Insights zu finden
und coole Dashboards zu bauen.

Du sprichst fließend Englisch und Deutsch, bist ein aufgeschlossener,

inspirierender Mensch und Teamplayer.
Wie wir arbeiten
Wir sind in unserem dritten Jahr und wachsen stetig. Jede(r) von uns bringt sich ein
und prägt unsere Unternehmenskultur. Bei uns hast du die Möglichkeit das
Wachstum unserer Firma mit zu gestalten. Dabei sind uns drei Dinge besonders
wichtig: Spaß bei der Arbeit, erfolgreiche Projekte für unsere Kunden und genügend
Freiraum für das eigene Leben außerhalb des Büros.
Klingt gut?
Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!
