Unser Auftraggeber bietet Strategie-, Organisations-, Technik- und Prozessberatung in den Bereichen Customer Experience und Kundenservice. Die Optimierung der Customer Experience namhafter Kunden des Auftraggebers steht bei allen Aufgaben im Zentrum der Beratungstätigkeit. Mit den praxiserfahrenen Beratern für die Unternehmensbereiche Marketing, Vertrieb und Kundenservice kann unserer Auftraggeber so seine Leistungen zum Einsatz bringen: von der Analyse bis zur Implementierung.

Die Klienten unseres Auftraggebers kommen vor allem aus der Telekommunikation, der Energieversorgung, dem Banken- und Versicherungssektor, dem E-Commerce, sind BPO-Anbieter und Beteiligungsgesellschaften. Die übertragenen Aufgabenstellungen umfassen u.a. Digitalisierung im Kundenkontaktmanagement, technische Ausschreibungsprozesse und Implementierungen, Due Diligences von Customer Care Bereichen bei Unternehmenskäufen, Strategieberatungen zum Thema Outsourcing und Kundenserviceausrichtung, die Leitung diverser Projekte in Inhouse- und externen Contact Centern, sowohl in Deutschland als auch im Ausland. Dazu gehören Prozessoptimierungen, die Begleitung von Dienstleisterwechseln, Beratungsbausteine wie z.B. „Mystery Agent“ und „Gesundheitschecks“ in verschiedenen Servicebereichen u.v.a.m..


Ihre Aufgaben:

Sie erstellen komplexe Abfragen und Analysen, um bei Unternehmenskunden datenbasierte Entscheidungen insbesondere im Marketing, Vertrieb und Service durchzuführen
Dabei gewährleisten Sie die Datenkonsistenz und sorgen für eine gleichbleibend hohe Datenqualität
Sie entwickeln operative Controllingsysteme, inkl. Reporting und KPIs zur Sicherstellung der Umsetzung der Servicequalität und Kundenzufriedenheit
Sie definieren neue fachliche Anforderungen mit Anwendern/Nutzern aus den Fachabteilungen beim Kunden
Sie erstellen automatisierte ad hoc Reports und Dashboards zur Visualisierung
Sie überprüfen kontinuierlich die Daten in Bezug auf Qualität, Plausibilität und Profitabilität
Dabei arbeiten Sie eng mit anderen Kollegen in der Analyse der Daten zusammen und gewährleisten einen effizienten Kommunikationsfluss


Ihr Profil:

Für diese anspruchsvollen Aufgaben sucht unser Auftraggeber erfahrene Spezialisten (m/w/d) mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung (3-5 Jahre) in den Bereichen Datenanalyse oder analytisches CRM.

Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung zum Fachinformatiker (m/w) oder haben Ihr Studium mit analytischem Schwerpunkt der (z.B. Statistik, VWL/BWL, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftsmathematik) Wirtschaftswissenschaften absolviert oder besitzen eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.

Idealerweise können Sie Berufserfahrung für Kommunikationslösungen, speziell mit den Technologien eines der Hersteller AVAYA, Genesys, Aspect oder anderen ACD- bzw. Contact Center Lösungen vorweisen und/oder im Bereich von CRM-Systemen wie Salesforce o.ä..


Sie verfügen über:

Sehr gutes analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen
Sehr gute Datenbankkenntnisse
Erfahrung im Einsatz von gängigen Analyse- und Statistik-Tools insbesondere auf großen Datenmengen (z.B. Umgang mit Tools wie Power BI oder Clickview)
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und mindestens einer Programmiersprache
Sehr gute MS-Office Kenntnisse insbesondere in Access und Excel inkl. VBA Programmierung
Erfahrung in der Erstellung, Aufbereitung und der Pflege von Reports und größeren Datenmengen
Idealerweise Erfahrung im Umgang mit komplexen CRM- und/oder Telefonsystemen
Verständnis für Kundenbedürfnisse und schnelle Auffassungsgabe auch bei komplexen Sachverhalten
Kommunikationsstärke und sicheres Auftreten sowie ein hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative
Selbständige, lösungsorientierte und strukturierte Arbeitsweise
Sichere deutsche und englische Sprachkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Customer Experience und Kundenservice ist Ihre Leidenschaft und Sie sehen die Steigerung der Kundenzufriedenheit mit Hilfe von analytischer Unterstützung als spannenden Auftrag an. Sie sind in der Lage, konzeptionelle Stärken mit operativer Erfahrung zu kombinieren, um für unsere Kunden tragfähige und realistische datenbasierte Lösungen zu erarbeiten. Sie haben Spaß an Reisetätigkeiten auch im europäischen Ausland und der Arbeit in einem Team von motivierten Kollegen/innen.


Das können Sie erwarten:

Einen attraktiven Arbeitsplatz mit abwechslungsreichen Aufgaben und Projekten
Eine Unternehmenskultur, in der es Spaß macht, Ideen und Initiativen einzubringen
Projekte, an denen Sie wachsen, in denen Sie dazulernen und etwas bewegen können
Eine hohe Eigenverantwortung und Freiheiten in der Arbeitsgestaltung beim Kunden, im Büro oder im Homeoffice, wobei der Wohnort für unseren Auftraggeber keine Rolle spielt (Ihr Wohnort muss nicht Berlin sein)
Eine faire Vergütung und sehr interessante berufliche Perspektiven
ZUSÄTZLICHE INFORMATIONEN
Stadt Berlin
Art der Stelle Vollzeit
Eintrittsdatum Ab sofort
JOB-ID 2019-0008
VERANTWORTLICH
Jens Mühlberg

job_title: Mathematiker / Data Analyst in der Spielebranche (w/m/d)
full_text:
Mathematiker / Data Analyst in der Spielebranche (w/m/d)
Das machst Du bei uns:
Du analysierst den Markt und identifizierst neue Spiele-Trends.
Du lieferst datengetriebene Entscheidungsgrundlagen für unsere Produktentwicklung.
Du entwickelst unsere standardisierten Reports weiter.
Du arbeitest gemeinsam mit dem Team an innovativen Spielideen für unsere Zielmärkte.
Du führst statistische Tests durch und sorgst für ein einwandfreies Spielvergnügen.
Du bist Ansprechpartner für alle mathematischen und statistischen Fragen in unserem Entwicklungsteam sowie für unsere internationalen Partner.
Das bist Du:
Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Mathematik, Physik oder Informatik.
Du verfügst über sehr gute Statistikkenntnisse und über erste Erfahrungen in der Datenanalyse.
Du hast fundierte Programmierkenntnisse in Python und C#.
Idealerweise konntest Du bereits erste Erfahrungen mit Datenbankensystemen (SQL) sammeln.
Kommunikationsstärke im Kontakt mit unterschiedlichsten Menschen und eine hohe Qualitätsorientierung zählen zu Deinen größten Stärken.
Du bist lösungsorientiert und analysestark und hast eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise.
Du schreibst und sprichst sehr gutes Deutsch (C1) und Englisch.
Das gefällt Dir:
Bodenständige, mittelständische Unternehmenswerte gepaart mit coolen Produkten.
Nachhaltiges Unternehmenswachstum, das die Organisation fordert, aber nicht überfordert.
Viel Gestaltungsspielraum durch flache Strukturen und kollaborative Kultur.
Intensive Einarbeitung und maßgeschneiderte Personalentwicklung.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten - nicht damit Du um Mitternacht Pizza in die Firma bestellst, sondern damit Du Deinen Beruf und Dein Privatleben in Einklang bringen kannst.
Einen Wohlfühl-Arbeitsplatz mit lockerer Atmosphäre in Berlin-Mitte.

What you'll be doing
Promote data driven decision making throughout the company by creating reporting, establishing processes and on boarding teammates
Work on strategic long-term goals as well as ad-hoc analytics requests
Develop high-impact data project opportunities in close collaboration with the marketing and operations teams
Translate business requirements into technical specifications for data engineering and product teams and ensure their correct implementation
Conceptualize advanced prediction models in collaboration with our data scientists
Conduct and evaluate A/B tests
What we look for
Minimum 2 years of experience in a data-related analytics role
You are passionate about building a modern financial system that redefines how people invest their money in today’s markets
Background in a highly quantitative field and solid knowledge of statistics and data modelling
Experience working with large data sets and self-service BI-tools (e.g. Tableau or Looker)
Ability to work highly independent and deliver projects on time
Strong SQL skills
Basic knowledge in Python (pandas, numpy, scikit)
Stronger exposure to Python and experience with more complex machine learning methods is a plus
Fluent English skills, German is a plus

Über uns
Wir sind Joblift – die Jobplattform für eine intuitive und mühelose Stellensuche. Wir führen alle Angebote auf einer einzigen Plattform zusammen und machen so das Durchsuchen unzähliger Karrierewebseiten überflüssig. Die Anwendung neuester Machine Learning- und Big Data-Technologien sorgt für eine konsequente Verbesserung unseres Suchalgorithmus. So gelingt es uns, möglichst passende Bewerber und Arbeitgeber zusammen zu bringen.

Wir wollen die erste Anlaufstelle für Jobsuchende weltweit werden. In unseren Märkten USA, Deutschland, dem Vereinigten Königreich, Frankreich und Holland arbeiten wir bereits mit über 4.000 Partnern zusammen und bündeln auf unserer Plattform somit rund 10 Millionen Ausschreibungen.

Unsere erfahrenen Gründer Lukas Erlebach (CEO), Alexander Rausch (COO) und Denis Bauer (CTO) – zuletzt in C-Level Positionen bei Zalando, Amorelie, audibene und Microsoft tätig – haben ein internationales Team voller Unternehmergeist um sich versammelt. Darüber hinaus sind namhafte Investoren wie DN Capital (z.B. Endeca, Shazam, Quandoo), Picus Capital (z.B. Getsurance, Nested), Cherry Ventures (z.B. Zalando, Auto1) und b-to-v (z.B. Facebook, Xing) sowie einige branchenführende Business Angels an Joblift beteiligt.

Weitere Fragen? Wende dich gerne an Julia Marie unter join@joblift.de
Zu deinen spannenden Verantwortungsbereichen zählen:
Building and designing insightful data visualizations to support the management in long-term decisions regarding marketing and customer performance
Working in cross-functional teams to define requirements for future data-related projects and work with the data team to get these up and running
Translating strategic questions and problems into data-related tasks to support your squad in their decision-making process
Meeting ad-hoc requests for deep-dives into specific topics that produce actionable results
Idealerweise bringst du folgende Punkte mit:
1+ year of work in experience in Business Intelligence/ Analytics, preferably in a start-up environment or an online company
Strong knowledge in SQL and relational databases
BA/BSc in Economics, Business, Business Informatics or similar
Expertise in programming languages (Python, R) and scientific libraries (Pandas, Numpy etc)
Knowledge of Tableau, PowerBI, Datastudio or similar
Experience with tools like Google Analytics, Google BigQuery and Google Cloud
A critical mindset and outstanding analytical skills as well as great communicational skills
English skills on a fluent level
Das bieten wir:
An impactful position since you will be responsible for our data related strategies
Direct exposure to product development, business management and strategy
Cutting-edge technology stack
Regular coaching and feedback sessions to help you grow and develop in your role
An international and fast-paced working environment based on our core values; ownership & accountability, eagerness & curiosity, as well as entrepreneurship
A very transparent information policy with flat hierarchies that value the individual
An energetic team of passionate and skilled people with fast decision-making procedures
Weitere Hinweise:
Start: asap
Location: Berlin, Mitte
If you want to support our team and be part of one of the fastest growing Tech startups, apply now!

Your tasksYou will support Risk Management department with various tasks related to underwriting, scoring, risk reporting, fraud prevention, risk-adjusted pricing, etc.Perform ad-hoc analysis/reporting for top managementMonitor various risk KPIs on segment levelBuild and update scorecard models using statistical toolsMonitor scorecard performance and variable stability, define new segments, monitor cut-offs, strategies for credit decisionTake active role in integrating external risk management and fraud prevention toolsImprove our current reporting process and develop reports from scratchSupport impact analysis of various changes to product and pricingPerform testing and validation of risk measures in internal systemsWork closely with customer support, collection and IT on risk and underwriting topicsGain valuable experience in credit risk management and become knowledgeable with risk management tools and KPIsRequired skills and experienceBachelor or Master's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, IT, Finance or similar areaAt least three years of relevant experience in risk management and data analysisRelevant experience in financial sectorProficient knowledge of MS Office, especially ExcelStrong SQL/MySQL Python, or R user. Knowledge of VBA, SAS, Tableau will be considered an advantageStrong communication and analytical skills, specialist in data analysisCapacity to work independently and reliably with attention to detailsFluenty in English, German is a plusResponsible and willing to learn and go the extra mileWe offerPermanent employment contractFair remuneration28 holidays / yearInternational environment with a dynamic, dedicated and collegial teamOffice in the heart of Berlin near Checkpoint CharliePersonal and professional developmentModern working conditions and processes that we constantly improveA secure job in a company that prepares for the future like no otherTeam Events - e.g. Summer festival, Halloween Party, X-mas eventWeekly fresh fruit basketsZusätzliche Leistungen:Flexible ArbeitszeitenKostenlose GetränkeHome OfficeErfolgsbeteiligungZusätzliche UrlaubstageJob Types: Full-time, Permanent

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


WHICH PRODUCT TEAMS


Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. As a Product Analyst in the content composition team, you will work with data scientists and engineers, draw insights from the complex interaction of content, customers, and Zalando’s business and help to understand why which content is successful in front of the customer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle , connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Your profile:
You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

ABOUT ZALANDO
The Pricing & Forecasting Department plays a pivotal role in the organisation by producing algorithmic-based price recommendations, forecasting sales, defining and implementing pricing strategies across 16 countries and 500k articles . The Department is a self-sufficient team of product, engineering, Analytics and operations. As a member of the Pricing Analytics team, you’ll build tools and data products that impacts millions of Zalando shoppers, the top and bottom line of our company and the many internal teams that rely on your analytics solutions.
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form – we do not accept applications via e-mail.

Company Description

Bonial is part of Axel Springer SE and is the leading "Drive to Store" marketing partner in Germany and France. Every day we inspire millions of users by connecting them to their favourite shops via our apps "kaufDA" and "MeinProspekt" in Germany, and “Bonial” in France
The biggest brands and retailers rely on our data-based advertising solutions to market their offerings digitally and to efficiently increase their customer reach.

Job Description

Our Head of Data says: “Data is one of the hubs between Online Marketing, Product, IT and Sales here at Bonial.com. New questions are raised every day that cover all facets of business intelligence, such as developing a prediction model for user retention, defining KPIs and events for an A/B test, integrating a new data source in our enterprise data architecture or supporting critical business decisions by translating business problems into quantitative terms.”
Our mission is to transform data into knowledge to enable people to make smart decisions. As a data team, we want Bonial to be more data-driven. Therefore, our role is to transform the decision-making process from gut feeling to a scientific approach. We support all departments to help them deliver the most values. As part of the data team, you can influence projects with the results of your analysis. We offer you a strong learning curve, responsibility for projects and room for your own ideas to bring the data team to the next level.
As our (Senior) Data Analyst, you will join our data team and report to the team lead. You will work on end-to-end aspect of data analysis: from gathering, cleaning and aggregating data up to creating, evaluating, visualizing and automating reports. You will also maintain and modify them based on changing business requirements. Your stakeholders are Online Marketing, Sales and Product, and many more.
You will also...
Perform deep-dives on data, give meaning to data, investigate business questions with timely and insightful analysis, identify opportunities and issues, draw actionable insights from raw data and present findings to stakeholders.
Develop metrics/KPIs, reports, dashboards to enable departments to make business-critical decisions based on data.
Filter, organize and clean large datasets prior to analysis.
Gather know-how on tools and best practices on data world.

Qualifications

You hold a degree in business, economics, mathematics, statistics or equivalent (technical) field and you are a data enthusiast, you have a ‘can-do’ attitude with a passion for analytics and data and bring with you years of hands-on experience.
What you’ll bring to the table...
A strong ability to understand and incorporate the big picture into the details of the analysis.
Well structured, analytical thinking and ability to explain and visualize complex analysis in a clear understandable manner to a non-technical audience.
Having an entrepreneurial mindset: clear understanding of the key business process, reporting and analytics so you are keen on making recommendations that will positively impact Bonial.
At least 5+ years of experience in the data field.
The ability to understand & write complex SQL statements and preferably a programming language, e.g. Python, R, etc.
Experience with data visualization tools, e.g. Excel, Power BI, Tableau, etc., is a plus
Having experience with big data tools is a plus.
Experience with online advertising and/or digital analytics is a plus.
You can communicate fluently in English with all other languages being very much a bonus.
Additional Information

Once you are part of Bonial, we offer you great opportunities to grow. We have a clear career path, depending on your personal goals. In order to reach these goals, you have feedback talks with your team lead on a regular basis. Additionally, you can enjoy the view of on our roof terrace during our monthly meetups and regular team- and company events.

More (fun)facts:
An international, diverse and dynamic team where you can grow personally and professionally
A company that focuses on sustainability and the impact that we make on the environment
Budget for your personal development from seminars to workshops and more...
A modern, spacious and full of light office with rooftop terrace, barbecue, relaxing areas, ping pong table, kicker table and more…
A fully equipped gym directly in the office and a subsidy for your Urban Sports membership
A room for children in case you need to bring your kids to work
Free drinks and daily fruit & vegetables; fresh croissants every Monday morning; organic bread at lunchtime on Wednesdays & Thursdays
Weekly social events

WE ARE LENDICO

The team at Lendico stands for combining sophisticated technology, in-depth finance understanding, and years of experience with streamlined processes and the courage to explore new things. We’re better – and that is not only valued by our customers but also recognized with multiple awards by the finance industry.

ING & Lendico

With ING on our side, we focus on what we do best: offer financing solutions for small and medium sized companies – fast, straightforward, inexpensive.

For the past 50 years, ING has proved in Germany that they are different. We’re doing the same – just not quite as long. That’s why we are convinced that ING’s corporate strategy in Germany and Lendico’s digital, very efficient business model complement each other well and that together we can grow faster.

Tasks


You develop autonomous analyses on customer behavior and product usage which drive growth and inform product development.
With your passion for number crunching, testing and science you help foster a data-driven mindset across the organization, ensuring that data is at the heart of every decision we make.
Together with your fellow stakeholders you design data marts enabling self-service analytics
On a daily basis you collaborate with different teams (e. g. Risk, Marketing, Product Development/Management) to deliver data and reports.
You develop dashboards for our stakeholders and visualize the most important KPIs (not vanity metrics)
You develop meaningful KPIs to track the performance of our products and to derive strategic actions
You perform insightful data analysis and make suggestions to Management
You will foster and support your fellow team members and mentor junior staff
You will be part of a self-organized cross-functional agile team
You will challenge the status quo and propose changes to bring us to the next level

Requirements


At least 3 years of professional experience in Business Intelligence or Data Science
At least 3 years of professional experience with data modelling and SQL
Experience with conducting analyses using Python or R is a strong plus
A solid grasp of Excel to combine data sources, analyze data and visualize insights
Experience working with relational databases as PostgreSQL
Ability to draw actionable insights from data and to clearly communicate with our stakeholders
Knowledge on statistical analysis (e. g., correlations, cohort analysis, long- term trends, hypothesis-testing, A/B-Testing)
Fluent in English
Working Experience in FinTech or a strong interest in FinTech
You work independently and welcome not only challenges but the feeling of overcoming an obstacle
You are passionate about creating something from scratch and building up your department in a team effort
You are fun to work with and you actively contribute to our company culture
You are a team player who proactively shares her/his knowledge
Keen on learning, cooperation and personal growth

Benefits


An unlimited contract
A steep learning curve in an innovative industry; including plenty of responsibility and conceptual freedom
An international team of experts who inspire and support you
An easily accessible and modern workplace
Regular get-togethers, team-building events, barbecues, and parties
Typical start-up perks: soft drinks and snacks for free, language classes for German and English, company pension scheme, etc.

Über uns
Wir sind Joblift – die Jobplattform für eine intuitive und mühelose Stellensuche. Wir führen alle Angebote auf einer einzigen Plattform zusammen und machen so das Durchsuchen unzähliger Karrierewebseiten überflüssig. Die Anwendung neuester Machine Learning- und Big Data-Technologien sorgt für eine konsequente Verbesserung unseres Suchalgorithmus. So gelingt es uns, möglichst passende Bewerber und Arbeitgeber zusammen zu bringen.

Wir wollen die erste Anlaufstelle für Jobsuchende weltweit werden. In unseren Märkten USA, Deutschland, dem Vereinigten Königreich, Frankreich und Holland arbeiten wir bereits mit über 4.000 Partnern zusammen und bündeln auf unserer Plattform somit rund 10 Millionen Ausschreibungen.

Unsere erfahrenen Gründer Lukas Erlebach (CEO), Alexander Rausch (COO) und Denis Bauer (CTO) – zuletzt in C-Level Positionen bei Zalando, Amorelie, audibene und Microsoft tätig – haben ein internationales Team voller Unternehmergeist um sich versammelt. Darüber hinaus sind namhafte Investoren wie DN Capital (z.B. Endeca, Shazam, Quandoo), Picus Capital (z.B. Getsurance, Nested), Cherry Ventures (z.B. Zalando, Auto1) und b-to-v (z.B. Facebook, Xing) sowie einige branchenführende Business Angels an Joblift beteiligt.

Google Tag Manager, Firebase and Google Analytics is a plus

We have loved SEO since our inception in 2000 and analyzing SEO data is at the heart of what we do.

If you love pulling data from all kinds of sources to make better decisions, and like to be part of the movement to make SEO more data driven, predictable and testable, come join the idealo SEO team at idealo!


Your Tasks
You are in charge of combining data from multiple data sources (Data Lake, MySQL databases) for analysis and reporting to enable data driven decision making
As SEO Analyst you are responsible for creating and maintaining a library of dashboards with Tableau, Google Analytics & Data Studio to monitor important KPIs for the SEO team
You play a key role in supporting the SEO team with A/B testing to ensure meaningful insights
As a part of the marketing team at idealo, you also collaborate with data analysts across the Marketing department and channels to align on marketing-wide targets and data management topics
Based on your analysis, you will be able to derive and represent recommendations for action and develop self-explanatory, thus meaningful dashboards




Your Profile
You feel comfortable working with data analytics and tracking tools (i.e. Google Analytics, Data Studio, Tableau)
You have professional experience using SQL and are not intimidated working with programming languages (i.e. Python)
You possess a strong analytical mindset, a passion for working with data and statistics
You are interested in online marketing + e-commerce trends; a background in SEO would be ideal
You are a passionate team player and enjoy supporting other team members with your data driven approach
Excellent communication skills in English, both oral and written; German is nice to have
Your benefits at idealo

No room for stagnancy! Whether tech talks, conferences or individual training, there are countless opportunities for constructive discussion and input
Influence in creating and deciding individual tasks as well as direct
contact with idealo partner
Various idealo benefits to satisfy every heart's desire, ranging from organic breakfasts to bikes that
can be rented during the lunch break
With countless opportunities for team building such as team events and parties at Christmas and in
summer, you'll be able to strengthen team spirit as well as the professional development of your department
About idealo

idealo is a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Right in the heart of Berlin, over 800 employees from 40 nations are working on the future of online shopping. We focussing on agile and self-reliant work, sustainability and a healthy relationship between work and private life. These values are firmly anchored in our corporate culture and an integral part of our corporate philosophy.

As part of our team, you can look forward to freedom, an international and inspiring working environment. Your ideas are particularly important to us. Not only our product portfolio is diverse, but also the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation or a severely handicapped degree do not play a role.

Klarna makes shopping smoooth. And we do it with flair because shopping is fun. Every day, we help customers, businesses, and partners explore just how smoooth the modern shopping experience can be.

It means we’re constantly changing the game. Always trying out new things. And we encourage our people to do the same. To grow. To develop. Because we don’t believe roles have to stay fixed. Instead we inspire our people to take an irregular career path. As a company of 350 dynamic start-ups, our whole business is built for it. So once you’re in, there’s no telling what will happen next.

We at Klarna are looking for driven and energetic Data Engineers who also happen to like Python in order to join our engineering hub in Berlin.

Our mission is to make payments as smooth as possible, reducing the friction you are facing when you purchase goods online. Our secret sauce to achieve this, is our ability to provide credit in real-time. If you want to learn more on how it is done, there is a great opportunity to join us, aim for awesomeness and write history.

We are currently serving 80 million customers and we are growing with a rate more than 40% annually, so there are very big opportunities having a massive impact in one of the very few profitable unicorns out there.
Who you are
Klarna is looking for ambitious people with significant drive! You should be passionate about your job and enjoy a fast paced international working environment.
You will play an important role in taking Klarna to the next level thus, you should desire to go above and beyond to produce best work results!
At Klarna we embrace change, you should dare to challenge the status quo and be persistent.
What we expect from you
Drive, this is an essential attribute if you want to thrive in Klarna’s fast moving environment
Optimism, being a source of can-do optimism will be crucial for the whole undertaking and the teams you will be collaborating
Passion about building data platforms and pipelines
Develop and optimize a unified data landscape from architecture to development and Optimization in an distributed infrastructure
Build, maintain and improve the availability of historical, real time and third parties data pipelines
Continuously improve our ELT and ETL processes for the data lakes and data warehouses behind
Provide Analysts, Product Managers and BI with complex, large scaled data storage from various data resources

Klarna is an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

If it sounds good, go ahead and contact us! We are looking forward to hear from you!

About Klarna

Klarna was founded in Stockholm, Sweden in 2005. Since then, we’ve changed the banking industry forever. And now we’re creating the world’s smooothest shopping experience. We serve 80 million consumers worldwide, and partner with 190,000 merchants – with a new merchant joining us every 8 minutes. Including some of the world’s leading brands, such as H&M, ASOS, IKEA, Adidas, Samsung and Lufthansa. Our offices are spread over 17 different markets, hosted by +2,500 people from 90 nationalities.

We are the world’s #1 bike share company with 8 million bicycles in circulation in over 200 cities on 5 continents. Together, our users make up to 30 million rides per day. Mobike is also the world’s largest IoT (Internet of Things) network, connecting every bike in our fleet.

In 2017, Mobike was named as one of the Champions of the Earth by the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), in recognition of its transformative contribution to the advancement of low carbon public transport.

We are also the largest bike sharing operator in Europe, available in France, Italy, Spain, UK, Germany and the Netherlands.

As we grow internationally, we're always on the lookout for talented and brilliant future Mobikers - so if you are looking for an internship opportunity with a bold, innovative and fast-driven workplace, then Mobike is definitely the place you want to be!

Tasks

To support our business in Berlin, we are looking for an Operations Intern, for a period of 3 months, starting as soon as possible.

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Reporting to the Berlin Operations Manager, you will work on the forefront of the exciting micromobility industry, mastering your analytics skillset in an international growth-focused technology start-up venture. Your main tasks include but are not limited to the below:

\-Create dashboards and reports to monitor key metrics on a regular basis, taking a leading role in City Operations supervision.

\-Build and analyze data related to every area of our product, including but not limited to supply optimization and user behavior;

\-Work closely with the rest of the local and international operations team to collaboratively design tailored solutions to increase our efficiency and streamline our business;

\-Support logistics planning activities, including purchase, inventory tracking and planning, re-stocking, delivery check and follow up.

We will expose you to all operational aspects of our business, and allow you to play a critical part in delivering a fantastic user experience to our users as well as driving cost efficiency in our operations.

You’ll be involved in the deployment, redistribution and maintenance of our bicycle fleet, and support the operations leadership team in evaluating, and improving our existing operating procedures.

Requirements

\-This internship is ideally suited to someone who wants to develop an operational skill set in a fast-paced tech start-up.

\-Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience in Operations, Logistics, Management Consulting or similar field.

\-Strong analytical skills, ability to process vast amounts of data and draw actionable conclusions from them

\-Native German speaker with a strong command of English

\-Excellent people and communication skills, ability to work various stakeholders at all levels

\-Proactive and self-driven - able to provide results with minimal direction

\-Both creative and well-organized

\-Flexibility to adapt to tasks outside the scope

We're looking forward to hearing from you!

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.

BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined

An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective

Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

Each day, hundreds of thousands of developers make billions of transactions worldwide on our cloud. They are harnessing the power of Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enable innovative applications, websites, and businesses. However, there are always a few people that try to take unfair advantage of a good thing...

Are you interested in taking your skills and career to the next level, while having fun and fighting bad guys? Join a growing world class team to conduct investigations in order to prevent malicious and fraudulent usage on AWS. You will be an integral member of a team of investigators, analysts and specialists conducting complex investigations of fraud activity. You will help drive related intelligence initiatives targeting new and emerging fraud threats to AWS.

You will leverage your analytical and data skills to deep dive on a myriad of fraud activity to help drive complex investigations and investigative strategies. You will be at the forefront of keeping abreast of trends and fraud issues impacting the Cloud industry to ensure AWS is leading the curve in identifying, migrating and preventing fraud attacks.

Responsibilities Include:
Provide wing-to-wing project life-cycle execution (project planning, execution, risk assessment and system availability)Identify new and emerging patterns of fraud and proactively take action to improve efficiency and reduce time to identify new fraud techniques, tactics and proceduresUse statistical analysis to segment customer behavior and develop targeted solutions to prevent sophisticated fraud activityWork with cross-functional teams across Amazon/AWS for collaboration on fraud risks and investigationsTake on ad-hoc projects/assignments related fraud investigations/prosecutions as necessaryDesign and influence operational best practices within the Fraud Response teamAnalyze emerging MOs and communicate trends to larger fraud community. Partner with data scientists and research scientists to build long-term counter protectionsAnalyze rule performance trendsReport on daily fraud trends and cluster characteristicsAbility to perform deep dives and write summaries of complex and sensitive escalations to Legal and Fraud LeadershipWork with internal teams to build corrective and preventative measures to mitigate fraud riskWork with stakeholders to drive process improvements that will impact internal and external customersContribute and/or lead special projects which reduce fraud related losses, while maintaining focus on a positive customer experienceLead deep dive efforts and prepare executive escalation summaries

Experience in e-commerce/on-line companies in fraud / risk control functionsExperience working with Federal/State/foreign law enforcement or national security agenciesExperience in leading strategic and analytical projects related to; Fraud or Cyber Crime or Financial Crimes or White Collar Crimes or Financial Risk ManagementCloud computing experience/knowledgeExposure to Software Development Life cycle (SDLC)Experience working with teams across regions (U.S.; EMEA; APAC)

talendo AG is looking for a Junior Business Intelligence Analyst to play a pivotal role in the upscaling of a product that has already gained traction with thousands of clients worldwide.

As the Junior Business Intelligence Analyst you will constantly challenge the status quo and relentlessly focus on improving performance based on data-driven decisions.

Tasks


Gradually take over and start to own our business intelligence suit and KPI frameworks to enable data-driven decision making.
Improve and adjust the BI-infrastructure, consisting of ETL pipelines, databases and SQL-modelling steps.
Deriving insights for key stakeholder teams such as marketing, sales, product management and customer support and enabling them to act upon those.
Conception and development of standards for analyses, reports, and dashboards to enable data-driven decision making.
Effectively using data to uncover product issues and solve problems as they arise
Own and share your expert knowledge across departments and enable your colleagues to interpret data and use digital analytics tools.

University degree in Business, Economics, IT or in a related field with an inclination towards numbers.
First working experience in the fields of data and analytics in fast-paced, high-performance environments.
Besides being an expert in Excel, you are proficient in SQL and know Python, R or another language for data analysis – experience in machine learning is a plus.
Analytical and quantitative approach to problems, familiar with statistical measures.
You have excellent language skills (written and spoken) in English, German is a plus.
You have a strong hands-on mentality and are a team player by heart.

Benefits


A high flyer international BI team, providing a wide range of expert knowledge.
Training programs, skills enhancement and the opportunity to grow and to fully develop your potential.
Start-up feeling, flat hierarchies, short decision-making paths and an inspiring international working atmosphere.
You’ll be joining an innovative team headquartered in their brand new office at the Berlin Startup Hub "Kulturbrauerei".
All the additional fuzz you need (Urban Sports Club cooperation, world's best coffee & tea, fruits&veg, company & team events in exciting European cities, N64, ping pong & kicker).

FULL-TIME IN BERLIN, DESENIORENGINEERING & DATA
We are Kolibri Games - mobile games developer from Berlin. Our two games have over 100 million downloads and are on a mission to become the most player-centric games studio out there.

We believe in players, creating values, learning, but, most of all, we believe in people. We strive to offer you a fair recruitment process and a great candidate experience, as well as a friendly environment to work in, with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow. Help us bring joy to people, we promise you will have fun by doing so :)


(Senior) Game Data Analyst (f/m/d)

Are you the kind of person who wonders what kind of people play idle games? Are you the kind of person who - through an unbiased lens - wants to figure out not only what people do but try to understand why they do it? And can you take that knowledge and transform it into action points that are easy to understand and make the game more fun, rewarding, and engaging to play?

This is the kind of curiosity, initiative, and knowledge we expect from the ideal candidate for Game Data Analyst here at Kolibri Games. You will work alongside our Product Director, analyzing in-game metrics and offering insights, evaluations, and direct recommendations that will change how our games evolve for the better.

In this role, you will dive deep into the data by building visualizations and down-to-earth reports - applying a mixture of psychology or economics - to understand how the game works and what players do. You will demonstrate your expertise by actively sharing that knowledge and insight in an easy to understand way - and in doing so become a pivotal contributor to the success of our games.

Responsibilities

Partner with Product Managers and Marketing Managers to identify key strategic questions, metrics, and actionable tests.
Provide end-user friendly, recommendations and insights to product managers, game designers, leadership, and marketing.
Research and develop cutting edge data-mining, data collection, and statistical techniques and apply them to game design, monetization, and other key business behaviors.
Build and educate a world-class team of analysts to bring agile data-driven decision making throughout the company.

Required skills

3+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst
Previous experience using Data Visualization Tools such as; Looker, Tableau or similar
Professional experience with at least Python, R or similar
The ability to understand data and communicate this in a coherent manner to technical as well as non-technical team members
Confidence presenting to multiple people with the ability to clearly and concisely explain key findings
Ability to work within a fast-paced environment
Desirable skills

Previous experience within a Free to Play games studio
Strong SQL skills in an enterprise data environment
An interest in machine learning, data science, business intelligence, and data technologies
Your Benefits – We’re game to support you
Competitive Salary - We believe that top performers should receive top payment

Training Budget - We believe in learning. A generous personal learning budget to spend on learning and development, including books, workshops and attending conferences. We also offer in-house training such as coding and German classes

Flexible working hours and Home office – We believe in a good work-life balance

Equipment - State-of-the-art technical equipment, including laptops and phones, which may also be used in your free time
Health and Fitness - We pay €50 towards a monthly gym membership or a fitness activity

Relocation - Relocation support to help you move to Berlin

Pension - Opportunity to save for your pension tax-free

Bonus Level – We love to have a good time, too

Food and Drinks - Fresh fruits to keep you healthy and fresh coffee to keep you alert. We also have a fully stocked fridge with Smoothies, Coke, Club Mate, beer etc

Parties and Team Events - Apart from our regular parties, BBQ’s and movie nights we also have a team event budget you can use to buy games or sports equipment to make working here even more fun
Company Holidays - Every year we go on an amazing company holiday to relax and bond as a team. Last summer we went to Greece!

Friday Celebrations - Company-provided dinner and drinks on Friday afternoons

Data in FCG

Deine Motivation ist aus Daten Nutzen zu generieren? Europace sucht dich als Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Engineer, Cloud Engineer oder Machine Learning Engineer (w/m/d)

Du hast Spaß an, ...

a) Daten und was man damit machen kann (Machine Learning, Data Engineering, Data Analytics, Datenmodellierung)
b) Business Intelligence und die damit verbundene Implementierung von Tools, Ansätzen und Methoden, um eine datengetriebene Kultur im Unternehmen zu etablieren. (KPI Dashboards, Steuerungsinstrumente, Prognose- und Szenarien-Entwicklung)
c) Cloud-basierten, serverlosen Daten-Architekturen und deren automatisiertem Betrieb
d) Feature-Erstellung von datenbasierten Services
sowie der Mitarbeit in einem selbstorganisierten Team um die Vision eines datengetriebenen Unternehmens zu realisieren und Themen des FinTech Umfelds.
Wobei kannst Du uns aktuell unterstützen,...

Aufbau von Business Intelligence Instrumenten
Weiterentwicklung von Reports & Dashboards zu smarten Entscheidungshilfen
Klassifizierung von Text- und Bilddokumenten durch Kombination verschiedener Modelle
Datenmodellierung

Was bringst du mit?

a) Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung von Modellen zur Analyse und Vorhersage auf Basis von Datenauswertungen: Statistische Analyse, Predictive Analytics und/oder Information Retrieval
b) Erfahrungen im Ausbau von Business Intelligence Instrumenten
c) Erfahrung in der Visualisierung von Datenanalysen
d) Programmieren mit analysebezogenen Sprachen
e) Ein ausgeprägtes mathematisch-statistisches Verständnis
f) Geschäftsverständnis und Erkennen von Wertschöpfungspotenzialen der Datenanalyse
Was dich bei uns erwartet?

Freiraum: Raum zum Gestalten und Wirken. Technisch, fachlich oder auch organisatorisch *Cross-Funktionale Teamarbeit*
Flexibilität: Arbeitszeit, Ort, Urlaub sind im Team flexibel. Selbstorganisation: Wir organisieren uns holakratisch und bringen Denken und Handeln zusammen.
Agile: Viele reden von Agile, doch es zu leben schaffen wenige.
Persönliche Entwicklung: Ist in unserem Umfeld eine Voraussetzung die wir entsprechend unterstützen und kein Benefit.
Respekt: Gegenseitiger Respekt und Wertschätzung und ein hohes Maß an sozialer Kompetenz
Familienfreundlichkeit: Ist die Betreuung deines Kindes nicht möglich, kannst du neben Home Office gerne auch unser Kids-Office nutzen.
20 % Zeit: für fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung
Unterstützung: durch einen Mentor
So lernen wir uns kennen

c) bewirb Dich klassisch mit Anschreiben, CV und Zeugnissen über unser Bewerbungsportal.

Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig

Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops

Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.

This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
