Company Intro & Mission
---------------------------

As one of the most successful and fast-growing FinTech startup companies in Europe, we are currently experiencing exciting growth and development. We are revolutionizing the way people file their taxes; helping them to save money, time and stress by putting a personalized digital tax consultant into the palm of their hands. Our user-friendly Taxfix App enables people to file their tax declaration within 22 minutes on average, without any prior tax knowledge or the complicated forms associated with it.

Our offices in Berlin and Madrid are home to a diverse team of 200+ people who come from more than 40 nations around the world!

Senior Product Data Analyst (m/f/d), this is your challenge
-----------------------------------------------------------

As a Senior Product Data Analyst, you will be working in one of our cross-functional teams with a clear mission and goal. You will support your team by providing actionable insights based on data.

Your responsibilities
---------------------


Help Taxfix understand the customer journey phases and main KPIs.
Build segmentation and provide insights regarding users behaviour.
Define ways of evaluating and measuring potential gains by adding new features.
Enable colleagues' access to data by providing dashboards and analysis as well as deep insights and recommendations.
Drive A/B testing of the product by defining objectives, experiments, tracking, analyses and clear conclusions
Dive deep into data and provide patterns and insights that are actionable

We're a fit if you bring these qualities with you
-------------------------------------------------------


3-5 years of experience working as a Product Data Analyst in a B2C environment.
3-5 years of experience using analytics tools, with at least 1 year of experience in digital user analytics.
Very good knowledge of different analytical methods, performance measurement, business reporting, forecasting and A/B testing know-how.
Proficiency in programming/scripting, knowledge of SQL and/or statistical packages like R or Python is a plus.
Good communication skills to share complex insights in a clear and simple language.
You are collaborative, open and have a flexible mindset with critical thinking.

What's in it for you?
---------------------------

Of course, we offer you all the perks you would expect from a tech startup that you can check out here ( https://taxfix.de/en/careers/ ). Additionally this role also offers:


Work together with a cross functional and highly talented team.
Opportunity to have a huge impact on the future of Taxfix.
Opportunity to take leadership from day one.
Get relocation and visa support.
A beautiful office located near to Alexanderplatz.

At Taxfix, we don't just accept diversity, we celebrate it! We're proudly committed to equal employment opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability or place of origin. We care about one another at Taxfix and are grateful for each person's individual contribution to our overall identity, purpose, and goals.

Join us to build a better future together!

Berlin
OUTFITTERY is the biggest personal shopping service for men in Europe. We’re for those who want a little more substance from style, more guidance and expertise - fewer rules and less routine because we believe that style is an unfolding story. We aim to inspire and empower - not dictate what to wear. We understand that style is a journey, and we’re here to guide the way. Every customer gets a personal selection of clothes, which our stylists create out of more than 100 brands - always considering his wishes and budget. He only pays for what he keeps. Our mission is to empower anyone to unlock their true style.

Would you like to be responsible for leading and driving mission critical projects which elevate our business and product offering while working in an international and diverse environment? You could be part of it as a Senior Data Insight Analyst (m/f/x).

Your Tasks

You will identify and lead high value projects, such as customer modelling, business forecasting or marketing acquisition to name just a few from inception to completion.
You will be responsible for mentoring and supporting the professional growth of your team members.
You create data pipelines and data marts. You use BI reporting tools such as Tableau and Re-dash to visualize your work.
You work closely with business and product stakeholders to evolve and understand our product offering to our customers.
You ensure that self-service dashboards are in place to enable key stakeholders to answer many of their data-based questions themselves without sending ad hoc requests.

Your Profile

Ideally, a graduate or postgraduate Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics or a similar quantitative field.
You have experience synthesizing, visualizing and communicating data narratives in verbal and written format to others reflecting an understanding of diverse audiences.
You have experience working with structured and unstructured data-sets.
You are comfortable using SQL and Scripting languages such as Python to perform data analysis, and apply machine learning or statistical techniques to large data-sets.
Previous experience in mentoring or leading small teams would be advantageous but not essential.
You are a great team player who is experienced with Scrum/Agile methodology.
You feel comfortable working in an English speaking work environment.

We Offer

An international and smart team which is eager to revolutionize shopping for men.
A transparent company culture with highly motivated colleagues, which work on our ambitious goals - we love to celebrate them as well! Join us for our exciting team events.
An exciting and responsible role with great impact.
An honest and open feedback culture - 360°-degree feedback from your peers and your manager (vice versa).
Individual development opportunities - want to attend a conference, take upon a course or go to a workshop? Do it, we support you financially.
A newly refurbished, bright, open office space in Berlin - Kreuzberg - we have air-conditioning, too.
We love dog owners - you are welcome to bring your four-legged friend.
We subsidize your retirement plan & offer fresh fruits, mate, fritz-spritz and beers after work.


Intrigued? Then send us your application with your salary expectations and possible starting date. Your contact person is Joanna Eva Brinkmann.

Wargaming Berlin is an exciting office within Wargaming that acts as a proving ground for innovative and outstanding projects. We drive results through teamwork, passion and smart data-driven decisions.

With the continuous growth of our product portfolio and emphasis on delivering the legendary games, we are currently on the lookout for an experienced Consumer Insights Analyst to join our team in Berlin. In this role you will be driving market and consumer insights research using a number of different tools and methodologies, with the opportunity to work closely with our development teams and having a direct impact on the content that goes into our games.

An ideal candidate for this position would have a few years of previous experience within the gaming industry as a Consumer Insights specialist, utilizing analytics software such as Excel.

Reports To
----------

Consumer Insights Director

What will you do?
-----------------------


Plan and conduct user research activities for multiple Wargaming products
Support the Consumer Insights team with running complete research and usability projects using online tools such as Playtestcloud
Support the games teams with monthly in game surveys and analysis of results
Work closely with the BI terms to see that findings are supported with game data where applicable
Effectively communicate research results to game teams (verbal and written reports), provide recommendations and ongoing feedback to design
Identify research opportunities that will impact users understanding, product design and quality
Collaborate with cross functional teams to support broader analytics and insights work that drive business impact

What are we looking for?
------------------------------


2+ years of relevant job experience working in areas of consumer research
Experience in the interactive entertainment industry (e.g. video/mobile gaming, video/entertainment platforms), streaming industry (e.g. video, music)

Job Description
Als Senior Data Analyst (w/m/d) bist Du verantwortlich, mit Hilfe statistischer Methoden unsere Daten zu analysieren und Insights für verschiedene Stakeholder zu generieren.
Deine Aufgaben
Du bereitest die Ergebnisse Deiner Auswertung leicht verständlich auf und präsentierst sie dem Team
Du erstellst und pflegst Dashboards für verschiedene Gruppen mit Hilfe eines BI-Tools
Du hast Freude an der Arbeit mit Daten und entwickelst die BI-Prozesse weiter
Du führst Tests und Dokumentationen durch zur Umsetzung einem Reporting-Systems durch

Qualifications

Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich der Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik, Naturwissenschaften oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Du beherrschst mindestens eine Programmiersprachen für statistische Analysen (vorzugsweise R oder Python) und bist in der Lage, Reports damit zu erstellen
Du hast Erfahrungen mit SQLund kannst dir Daten für deine Analysen beschaffen
Du hast fundierte Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von statistischen Methoden (u.a. Zeitreihenananlyse, Regressionsanalyse, Statistische Hypothesentests)
Mit einem BI-Tool (z.B. Tableau, PowerBI, etc.) hast du idealerweise schon mal gearbeitet
Sehr gute analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten sowie starke Präsentationsfähigkeiten runden Dein Profil ab
Du sprichst und schreibst fließend Deutsch und Englisch
Additional Information
Deine Werte
Unsere Werte sind unsere DNA. Unser Zusammenhalt und Teamspirit lässt uns jede Herausforderung bewältigen. Uns ist es wichtig, dass Du Dich mit unseren Werten wohlfühlst und diese auch leben kannst:
Think twice, then go all in
Be thankful for where you are
Keep growing, you can do better
Love the people around you
Create value and build to last
Du hast Fragen und Gedanken zu unseren Werten? Wir freuen uns darauf und werden uns im gemeinsamen Kennenlernen dazu austauschen.
Deine Bewerbung
Wenn Du ein junges, dynamisches Team suchst, in dem Du die Möglichkeit hast, Deine Ideen und Eigenverantwortung einzubringen und aktiv die Zukunft von heycater! mitgestalten kannst, freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung inkl. Zeugnissen und Lebenslauf mit Angabe Deines Gehaltswunsches!

Grover is the new alternative to buying or financing tech products
Grover offers a simple, monthly subscription model for the tech you love. We are the first financing company for the Circular Economy, breaking the link between ownership and usage. For a low monthly fee, private customers, as well as businesses, get access to a wide assortment of tech products at a fraction of the purchase price. We're on a mission to re-invent consumption and to make innovative technology accessible to everyone. As a member of the CE100 group of leading companies in the Circular Economy worldwide, we are at the forefront of reducing waste and establishing a more sustainable way of using products for both consumers and the environment.
To date, we have raised more than €100 million in equity and debt from investors including Samsung, Commerzbank, and Global Founders Capital. LinkedIn ranks Grover as one of the Top 10 hottest startups to work for in Germany in 2019.
We are now looking for a Credit Risk Analyst to support our Business Intelligence, Risk & Finance teams.

Your Role:
Review and monitor portfolios developments and provide commentary on key features for internal and external reporting
Maintain all dashboards and ensure they are implemented correctly
Work intimately with both Risk, Business Intelligence, and Finance to establish a consistently high quality standard
Strengthen existing complex problem solving and data-driven decision making

Excellent analytical skills & problem solving abilities

Flexibility to work in a fast-paced, high-growth and KPI-driven environment that is scaling fast
Adept at describing technical and financial topics to non-technical audiences

2+ years previous experience at a bank or financial institution
Business case modelling / advanced Excel / financial modelling skills
Excellent knowledge of financial instruments
Familiarity with SQL

Knowledge of Python or R is a plus

Ownership of your work

Open minded variety of nationalities
German Classes in the office
A fun workplace
Smunch

About us
Grover is the European market leader in technology rentals, bringing the access economy to the consumer electronics market. If you want to work with a dedicated team at a purpose-driven, fast-growing company, increasing consumer welfare around the world, join us now. At Grover, we value entrepreneurship, intelligence, and speed in everything we do. We're a team of over 90 creative and motivated minds, from more than 31 countries – which means our aims, beliefs, and ways of working are influenced by many different perspectives. We care for individuality and for team spirit, act courageously and communicate openly. In our HQ, in Berlin Mitte, there is plenty of space for fun, collaboration, and rethinking the way the world does, uses and values things.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich

Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!

Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.

Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.

Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


WHICH PRODUCT TEAMS


Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. As a Product Analyst in the content composition team, you will work with data scientists and engineers, draw insights from the complex interaction of content, customers, and Zalando’s business and help to understand why which content is successful in front of the customer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle , connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

A Pricing Data Analyst in our Pricing & Forecasting team is passionate about creating accurate data solutions and have a proven record of developing trusting relationships with product and commercial leads who will turn your insights into actions.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Build and improve upon the system which measures sales forecasting, price optimisation and customer lifetime value
Act as the point of contact between Analytics and external product, engineering and ops teams to ensure key projects are successful
Build and own periodic reporting - Take advantage of the ever-growing amount of data we have at our fingertips to help stakeholders build best in class forecasting tools
Managing and leading key initiatives in the Analytics team and Pricing & Forecasting
Mentor and guide junior members of the Analytics team
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
3+ years of experience using data to build analytical solutions at industry leading companies in Technology, Retail or e-commerce.
Ability to turn complex findings and results into a compelling narrative and a set of actions
Familiarity with SQL and an objection-oriented programing language (Python, R,Java)
Undergraduate degree in a technical field (Science, Economics, Physics, Maths, Engineering)

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
The Pricing & Forecasting Department plays a pivotal role in the organisation by producing algorithmic-based price recommendations, forecasting sales, defining and implementing pricing strategies across 16 countries and 500k articles . The Department is a self-sufficient team of product, engineering, Analytics and operations. As a member of the Pricing Analytics team, you’ll build tools and data products that impacts millions of Zalando shoppers, the top and bottom line of our company and the many internal teams that rely on your analytics solutions.
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

At Infarm we want to help solve one of the toughest sustainability challenges today: feeding the cities of tomorrow.

In 2050 more than 7 billion people will be living in cities. We're recreating urban farming for a more sustainable future.

Be part of the infarm (r)evolution and help people to take back ownership of their food.

We are currently building out both our data team and data warehouse infrastructure. As part of this process we are integrating many data sources into our Business Intelligence reporting and supporting our stakeholders in using our analytics visualization tools. Additionally, we are working on applying machine learning to offer our customers a better, personalized service. As an Analytics Engineer, you will be a key person in enabling our different business sectors to gain insights into their data. You will have input in developing and maintaining our data infrastructure and ETL pipelines, you will write SQL code and create dashboards using Tableau and other BI tools, while also taking part in a fun and rapidly growing company.

Who You Are
-----------


You're excited about our vision to reshape the food industry.
You believe diversity, collaboration and teamwork are key drivers for success.
You thrive in an environment where you can take ownership and solve hard problems.
You love a challenge and want to do well while doing good.
You want to expand your horizons and grow with us as we grow.

Responsibilities
----------------


Work closely with business units on how to define and implement advanced BI reports
Write code (mostly SQL and/or python) to support extraction of data
Develop creative and engaging data visualizations which allow stakeholders to make data-driven decisions
Help identify, define and specify future insight and data needs to support the different business departments
Maintain existing business intelligence reporting and provide support to users

Requirements
------------


Have 3 years of experience designing & building BI reports
Experience working with databases (Postgres / BigQuery / etc).
Experienced in using Tableau (Other visual analytics tools also a bonus)
Proficient in SQL
Strong communication skills
Eager to learn and act as a team member
Like to ''get things done'' but still keep your work organised
Have experience working in a fast-growing organisation i.e startups

What We Offer
-------------


The opportunity to join infarm as we expand across the globe and help change the future of farming
A friendly work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues
30 days of vacation plus an extra day off on your birthday
Monthly BVG ticket
Fresh herbs to take home
Lunch provided 3 days a week
Coffee, tea, fresh and healthy snacks and Friday drinks!

wefox Group is Europe’s leading insurtech that is reinventing insurance at scale, with a total of $235 million raised in 2019, making it the largest funding round by a European insurtech.

wefox Group is revolutionising insurance by empowering the customer and delivering solutions for secured data-driven experiences.

The wefox platform is a fully digital marketplace that connects insurance companies with brokers to give customers a simplified and easier customer experience. wefox has 2085 sales agents managing more than 500,000 customers with a premia under management of more than USD$300 million.

ONE is Europe’s first fully digital insurance company. ONE Insurance was launched in 2017 and has already exceeded 130,000 contracts making it Germany’s leading provider for household and second place for liability insurance

The role:
Support the project lead in delivering transformation cross-functional strategic initiatives to drive people, process, data, and platform impact for large, complex projects
Utilise own skills, business & technical experience to facilitate outcomes on your project
Document workshop outcomes and business requirements in Confluence
Work closely with our Data & Analytics team and independently write SQL queries to pull data from our DWH, analyze it, and present it to other stakeholders
Occasionally prepare Excel dashboards and business decks
Maintain regular reporting to C-level and the company on project success and the development of various metrics and KPIs
Work with our Operations, Product, and Tech teams to ensure multi-department coordination on backlog planning and refinement and help maintain our project board in Jira

What you bring:
You have a profound academic record in the area of Business and or IT/ Information Management
You bring at least 2 years of work experience within insurance, consulting, a financial services company or in a fast-paced startup environment
You have a strong affinity towards digital business models, innovation and transformation
As a strong problem solver, you are thrilled to take on challenging new tasks, always working ‘hands-on’ towards a tangible outcome.
You have great interpersonal communication skills
Entrepreneurial drive and the ability to stay focused and achieve goals in a fast-paced environment complete your profile.
Experience working with at least one Agile framework (e.g. SCRUM, Kanban, Kanplan, etc.).

What we offer:
Now, we’ve gotten to the fun part, the part where you get to brag about your company, those perks your friends are so jealous of!

Here are some of them:
Flexible working hours including some days remote option
26 working days of vacation, with an additional day for each year of service - up to 30 days + 24th and 31st December
Discounted fitness memberships
Up to 50% of your public transport costs reimbursed
A stack of the latest technologies and working gadgets
Free coffee, fruit and snacks, because we need fuel!
Grants for training and coaching

If you love a less-formal work environment, flexible paid time off, a great compensation package and benefits offering - and most of all, being the authentic you, get in touch, we want to meet you!

To all the misunderstood geniuses, rebels and mavericks looking to change the world for the better. Come work with us!

Amazon Web Services (AWS) enables customers of all sizes to run their applications on Amazon’s industry-leading cloud computing infrastructure. AWS is growing very rapidly with hundreds of thousands of companies in over 190 countries on the platform.
We're looking for a detailed, motivated, and structured Sales Operations and Strategy Analyst to partner with the DACH sales teams to define, land and execute against our strategic priorities for the business. This role will partner with the EMEA central operations team in the strategic planning process, the annual and monthly rhythm of business and the annual Territory Planning process. The preferred location for this posiiton is Berlin, the alternative can be Munich.
The successful candidate (m/f) will need to collaborate effectively with internal end-users and cross-functional data teams to solve problems, implement new reporting solutions, and deliver successfully against high standards.
This position will be responsible for supporting the rhythm of the business activities such as Monthly Business Reviews, Pipeline Reviews, and other cadenced reporting and metrics. The position will assist Sales Managers in evaluating and forecasting attainment against quotas, utilizing various CRM tools to derive well-vetted analysis, and other ad-hoc requests and analysis as needed. This individual will support the day-to-day execution of the business including commission and quota plans, managing the territory definitions and account movements, and providing reporting and insights to sales leaders.
The successful candidate must be able to roll-up their sleeves and dive deep into unclearly defined spaces and instill proper levels of structure and control. They will be passionate about their work, detail-oriented, analytical, and have excellent problem-solving abilities. The individual must have the ability to communicate effectively across multiple technical and non-technical business units, as well as across other geographies.

Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Develop key sales support systems/processes required to meet the rapid growth of the business and achieve revenue attainment and market development objectives
Analyze data and trends and make informed recommendations to the sales teams and managersManage continuously-evolving forecast models and methodologies, owning the quantitative analysis of the performance of our sales teamDevelop relationships and work with sales, partner, sales operations, and other stakeholders to create and refine the tools and processes needed to drive productivity increases.Assist Sales Managers in all aspects of evaluating their teams’ performanceEnsure accurate and timely sales commission calculationsIdentify reporting issues, gaps in processes, and drive timely resolutionPrepare ad hoc analysis & participate on projects as needed
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize Amazon to transmit and store your information in the Amazon group of companies' world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.

Ability to learn new tools quickly
Hands-on experience of Salesforce and compensation tools e.g. Varicent
Ability to build reports in web based tools e.g. OBIEE
Handles multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

job_title: Praktikant (m/w/d) Data Analyst | Intern Data Analyst (f/m/d)
full_text:
Factorymarket is a fast-growing, globally operating tech company in the retail sector, with a headquartered in Berlin. Our main focus is on the operation and omnichannel marketing of online marketplaces (including appropriate software development) and retail stores. With our highly developed, highly scalable technology platform, very good financing as well as experienced founders & business leaders, we are pioneers in the New Retail industry and strive to revolutionise the retail business of the day after tomorrow! Our international team is based both in our headquarters in Berlin and our branch in Moscow.

For our Data-Team located in our Berlin Head-Quarter we are looking for an Intern (f/m/d) Data Analyst available to start immediately.

Aufgaben


Creating top-level and ad-hoc reports & dashboards based on cross-functional business demands
Continuous data integrity and quality checks, and data cleansing of internal databases
Support of analytics team (and other departments) with business-centerd and actionable insights
Support of creating and maintaining of ETL pipelines

Qualifikation


Currently enrolled in a quantitive degree in Business Informatics,Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Mathematics (or self-taught)
Basic experience with statistics, data analysis & data visualization (fundamental knowledge of database query languages and programming languages)
Very structured and analytical approach with the ability to zoom in and out and aim for practical solutions
Fluent in spoken German and English

Benefits


A light-filled and representative office above the rooftops of Berlin, with a direct view of Potsdamer Platz
A south-facing terrace for chilling and barbecuing
Free fruit, cereals, drinks and sandwiches
Regular team events as an important part of our corporate culture
Optimum development opportunities - Further education is encouraged
A motivated, international and dynamic team with flat hierarchies

We´re looking forward to receive your application!

Bewerbungsfrist 31. März 2020
Arbeitszeit Vollzeit

Laufbahn höherer Dienst

Arbeitsort Berlin
Kennzahl AS-2019-148

Anforderungsprofil
Sie besitzen die deutsche Staatsangehörigkeit und verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Master/Diplom [Univ.]) in einem der folgenden oder vergleichbaren Studiengänge bzw. schließen dieses in den nächsten 12 Monaten ab:
Elektro- oder Informationstechnik
Informatik
Mathematik
Statistiker und Data Scientist
Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen/ Wirtschaftsinformatik mit ingenieurswissenschaftlichem Schwerpunkt
Technische und angewandte Physik
Physikalische Technik
Ein Diplom-FH-Studium erfüllt nicht die Voraussetzung für die Laufbahn des höheren Dienstes.
Ebenfalls erwarten wir:
Vertiefte Kenntnisse der Informationstechnik (z.B. Netzwerkprotokolle) und der Cyber-Sicherheit)
Grundkenntnisse im lösungsorientierten Einsatz von Programmier- oder Skriptsprachen (z.B. C++, Java, Perl, Phyton)
sehr gute mündliche und schriftliche Ausdrucksweise in deutscher und englischer Sprache
Bereitschaft zu stetiger Fort- und Weiterbildung
Bereitschaft zu Dienstreisen im In- und Ausland
Arbeitgeber-Leistungen
Die Einstellung erfolgt nach dem Tarifvertrag für den öffentlichen Dienst (TVöD Bund) in der Entgeltgruppe E13 oder E14 in einem unbefristeten Beschäftigungsverhältnis. Zusätzlich hierzu kann eine tarifliche Sonderzulage in Höhe von bis zu 1.000 € monatlich gewährt werden. Die Übernahme von Beamten (m/w/d) bis zur Besoldungsgruppe A14 ist bei Vorliegen der laufbahnrechtlichen Voraussetzungen möglich.
Die Stelle ist grundsätzlich für eine Teilzeitbeschäftigung geeignet.
Die Möglichkeit einer späteren Verbeamtung ist gegeben.
Daneben erhalten die Mitarbeiter (m/w/d) des BND eine behördenspezifische Zulage.
Tätigkeitsprofil
Als einziger Auslandsnachrichtendienst der Bundesrepublik Deutschland leistet der Bundesnachrichtendienst (BND) einen wesentlichen Beitrag zur Sicherheit der Bürgerinnen und Bürger.
Im Bereich Cyber-Sicherheit werden Cyber-Angriffe ausländischer Akteure und die Cyber-Strukturen anderer Staaten analysiert und bewertet. Aufgaben sind je nach Einsatzgebiet unter anderem die netzwerkforensische Analyse von digitalen Spuren und der Schadsoftware der Täter, Konzeption und Entwicklung eigener Analysewerkzeuge oder die cyberforensische Analyse der eingesetzten Techniken (ausgenutzte Schwachstellen, eingesetzte Schadsoftware). Weitere Aufgaben sind je nach Tätigkeitsprofil die Teilnahme oder Leitung von Fachgesprächen in Ihrem jeweiligen Einsatzgebiet, die Erstellung von Fachbeiträgen zu Cyber-Angriffen und Cyber-Strukturen oder die Zusammenarbeit mit externen Fachbereichen auf nationaler und internationaler Ebene. Je nach Einsatzgebiet können Sie mit Führungsaufgaben betraut werden.
Wir setzen grundsätzlich die Bereitschaft voraus, sich schnell in neue Fachbereiche und Aufgabenstellungen einzuarbeiten.
Bewerbungsverfahren
Sollten wir Ihr Interesse geweckt haben, freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung unter folgendem Link.
Besondere Hinweise
Im Interesse der beruflichen Gleichstellung sind Bewerbungen von Frauen in Bereichen mit Unterrepräsentanz besonders erwünscht und werden bei gleicher Eignung, Befähigung und fachlicher Leistung nach Maßgabe des BGleiG bevorzugt berücksichtigt.
Schwerbehinderte Menschen werden bei gleicher Eignung, Befähigung und fachlicher Leistung nach Maßgabe des SGB IX und der für den Geschäftsbereich des BND geschlossenen Integrationsvereinbarung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.
Sofern Sie im Ausland einen Hochschulabschluss erlangt haben, können Sie die Gleichwertigkeit über die Zentralstelle für ausländisches Bildungswesen (ZAB) betriebene Datenbank ANABIN feststellen. Die Datenbank ist im Internet unter www.anabin.de zugänglich. Bitte fügen Sie Ihren Bewerbungsunterlagen einen Nachweis über die Gleichwertigkeit des Abschlusses bei.
Bitte behandeln Sie Ihre Bewerbung beim BND und die Ihnen zugesandten Unterlagen besonders vertraulich. Eine Weitergabe der Unterlagen an Dritte ist nicht statthaft. Dies umfasst auch Informationen in sozialen Netzwerken.

MADE FOR\_ is a tech company in the online nutrition industry aiming to simplify the customer health journey by providing users with tailored monthly nutrition packs (mineral, vitamins, herbs and specialties). Join a well-funded and already established solid team of entrepreneurs and specialists.

Our data science team is in a special position to tackle problems across digital product (web, recommendations), operations research (inventory), and general behavioral prediction (probabilistic models, time series analysis). The data around our e-commerce products will interact richly with granular measures of users' health and wellness, a domain where machine learning is only recently starting to gain traction.

We are interested in hiring highly technical analysts who are comfortable with modern tools of data analysis and the scale of data at a tech company.

Our business analysts are proficient with SQL, as it is essential to data self-service, business intelligence functions, and the scaling of analysis beyond spreadsheets. Business analysts transform the rich information in our data warehouse into product improvements, business optimizations, and valuable insights about our customer base.

Tasks


Create reports and dashboards using our SQL-based BI tools and Tableau
Develop a clear idea about our diversified data sources in order
Clean and wrangle data from a heterogeneous mix of sources
Partner with marketing, product, and ops to support their goals with data analysis
Proactively identify opportunities where data analysis can enhance our understanding of our business
Write ad hoc SQL to answer day-to-day inquiries as they arise
Clearly convey findings through visualization, written communication, presentations, and/or internal tools

Requirements


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (math, statistics, computer science, economics, physics)
Knowledge of SQL
A good foundation in statistics and undergraduate math
Some experience with Python / R a plus

We are looking for:
A new team member for one of our portfolio companies.

Tasks

What will keep you challenged?


Specification and implementation of requirements for the Data & Analytics system and application landscape (DWH, BI Reporting, BI SelfService, Digital Analytics, Data Products, etc.)
Development of standards for data acquisition, data processing, analyses, reports, and dashboards
Conception and further development of data acquisition with Digital Analytics Tools (Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager)
Processing ad hoc requests for data and reports
Support and training other business units in the use of BI reporting, BI self-service, and digital analytics tools

Requirements

Which traits contribute to your success?


A completed degree with a focus on economics or natural sciences
At least 2 years of professional experience in the area of Data & Analytics/Business Analytics, ideally with a focus on Business Intelligence
Good SQL knowledge and experience in dealing with databases
Sufficient domain knowledge in the areas of marketing, sales, and operations
Experience with data visualization applications such as Tableau, QlikView, Power BI, Mode Analytics, Looker
Ideally experience with Digital Analytics tools, e.g. Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager
Interest and willingness to work agilely
Ability to work in a team, strong communication skills and a pronounced hands-on mentality
Very Good knowledge of German and English

Benefits

What to expect working with our portfolio company:

Make a true impact in the Digital Health industry where you have the opportunity to help change people’s lives
Well equipped and modern office in the heart of Berlin
Transparent culture with flat hierarchies where every person is highly valued
A true “no politics, no bullshit” mentality with fast decision-making processes and fast outcomes
Thrive from an inspiring, creative, and diverse environment with amazing and smart colleagues from all over the world
Having fun together as a company with regular team events, off-sites, and weekly after-work drinks at the office
Getting challenged and developing your professional skills by taking over responsibilities, and a guaranteed steep learning curve from day one
Choose from a variety of drinks and healthy snacks available to keep you energized throughout the day
Being part of an instant network within the Project A family with access to regular events, knowledge sharing, and meetups

Do you want to be part of the success story of our portfolio company?

We are looking forward to your online application.

That’s us

TD Reply is an innovation and marketing consultancy and part of the Reply Group. We take a data driven and execution oriented approach to drive organizational change through meaningful insights. In our Berlin and Beijing offices we are around 90 thinkers, developers, analysts, designers, consultants, visualizers, futurologists and organizers. We have productized our insights solution as “Pulse” for various of our clients, including Miele, FrieslandCampina, BMW, Volkswagen, Lufthansa, Postbank, Deutsche Bahn, L’Oreal, and Telefónica.

That’s you

We drive innovation in marketing and data science and believe that magic happens when data science meets imagination. Great brands, however, will to also create great business value by supporting a company’s actions. Together with our consultants, developers, and designers we help to build those products and drive the digital transformation of our clients. Therefore, we create data science solutions to predict the future of consumer behavior, to find the best media budget allocation, to guide brand management operations and to provide insights and management solutions on how to drive business. If you are also keen to shape the future of data driven management solutions and break down boundaries in marketing and data science, you are welcome in our data science team.

Your tasks will include

Implementing and maintaining production-level, robust data analytics scripts in R or Python
Shape the technical infrastructure, testing, and monitoring
Define and put into action development, quality assurance, and support processes
Keep code quality high through pair programming, code reviews, code analytics
Crunching and describing data sets containing important consumer/customer insights on structured and unstructured data
Integrate against external API, databases, and our reporting platform
Optimize performance of algorithms and script execution
Promote the spirit of Data Science development


There is a match if…

… your profile is completed by demonstrated skills in a relevant programming language, e.g. R or Python, for a minimum of 1-2 years

… you have a solid understanding of coding techniques, robust code, and error handling

… you have worked with DBMS like MongoDB or Elasticsearch

… you have experience in connecting with external RESTful APIs

…. you possess a deep understanding of statistical modelling (particularly regression analysis and probability theory), practical machine learning and data mining

…. you hold a Master’s Degree in Econometrics/Mathematics/Statistics/Engineering with at least 1-2 years’ working experience

… you like working in an agile environment and being responsible for the technical design, implementation, maintenance, monitoring and automated testing of software

… you are a team player who likes to share, discuss and work on ideas / tasks with your colleagues


That’s in it for you

A startup atmosphere within an economically solid company right in the center of Berlin – with rooftop access and a stunning view
Flexible, family-friendly working hours
Work with a like-minded team
Get an opportunity to try out new technologies
Projects & clients that will make you feel proud to work for


Application
We want to hire you!

OK, to be totally honest, we should qualify that statement: If you’re talented, hard working, smart, brave, innovative, humble, confident, nice and love working in a data driven industry, then we want to hire you.

Interested?

Please submit your resume to our REPLY Recruiter here.

The wefox platform is a fully digital marketplace that connects insurance companies with brokers to give customers a simplified and easier customer experience. wefox has 2085 sales agents managing more than 500,000 customers with a premia under management of more than USD$300 million.

ONE is Europe’s first fully digital insurance company. ONE Insurance was launched in 2017 and has already exceeded 130,000 contracts making it Germany’s leading provider for household and second place for liability insurance

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


WHICH PRODUCT TEAMS


Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. As a Product Analyst in the content composition team, you will work with data scientists and engineers, draw insights from the complex interaction of content, customers, and Zalando’s business and help to understand why which content is successful in front of the customer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle , connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

job_title: Data Scientist / Analyst IT (w/m/d) Audit Center of Competence
full_text:
Begleite KPMG bei den zukünftigen Herausforderungen unserer Kunden. Begeistere auch Du Dich für die Vielfalt unserer Fragestellungen - und mach gemeinsam mit uns den Unterschied. Prüfe gemeinsam mit Deinem Team Konzern- und Jahresabschlüsse von Handels- und Industrieunternehmen und analysiere und bewerte IT-gestützte Geschäftsprozesse.
Datenextraktion und Datenaggregation sowie Aufbereitung interner und externer Unternehmensdaten
Qualitative und quantitative Analyse von Daten zur Identifikation von versteckten Fehlern und Risiken
Visualisierung von Analyseergebnissen
Datenmodellierung, Design, Implementierung und Test von Extraktions-, Lade- und Transformationsprogrammen (ETL) auf Basis von Microsoft SQL Server
Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, (Wirtschafts-)Mathematik oder eines vergleichbaren Studiengangs
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Data Analyst oder Data Scientist von Vorteil
Betriebswirtschaftliche Kenntnisse im Bereich Rechnungswesen & Controlling
Kenntnisse über Datenbanksysteme vorzugsweise MS SQL Server, ETL Ansätze und Systeme, SQL Programmierung
Erste Erfahrungen mit den SAP Modulen FI, SD, MM wünschenswert
Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Die abgebildeten Leistungen können je nach Position und Standort leicht variieren.
Als Wirtschaftsprüfungs- und Beratungsgesellschaft arbeiten wir mit rund 11.700 Mitarbeiterinnen
 und
 Mitarbeitern an mehr als 20 Standorten in Deutschland an einer bedeutsamen Schnittstelle von
 Wirtschaft, Öffentlichkeit und Gesellschaft. Was die Wirtschaftswelt von morgen bewegt, bewegt
 auch
 uns. Wir begleiten unsere Mandanten in den Bereichen Wirtschaftsprüfung (Audit), Steuer- (Tax)
 und
 betriebswirtschaftliche Beratung (Consulting, Deal Advisory oder Financial Services). Vom
 mittelständischen Unternehmen bis hin zum internationalen Großkonzern – wir entwickeln gemeinsam
 Lösungen für die Themen der Zukunft und haben so einen direkten Impact auf die Businesswelt. Wir
 suchen Talente, die gemeinsam mit uns die Herausforderungen von morgen angehen wollen, um mit
 uns
 den Unterschied zu machen.
Deine Bewerbung enthält idealerweise Deinen vollständigen Lebenslauf, Deine Abschluss-
 und Arbeitszeugnisse und Deinen möglichen Eintrittstermin.


 Weitere Informationen zum Bewerbungsprozess findest Du hier.

We are looking for reinforcement for our extraordinary team at "The unbelievable Machine Company". We are an independent full-service provider of big data, cloud services, and managed hosting solutions. We are pioneers in holistic consultancy, planning, and realization in digitalization projects fit for the 21st century, covering a full spectrum of services – from the idea to the cable.

We’re different, cheeky, creative and bold. Professional but not restrictive. We’re genuine and passionate about what we do. If you share our values and have that "certain something", apply now at *um!


Your Mission:

Provide reliable financial information to our business and identify corrective actions
Act as a trusted financial SPOC to the project management and service delivery organization

Supervise the customer and project profitability working closely with project managers and operational team leaders

Provide inputs for production planning by team and projects. Identify areas of improvement
Participate in bid preparation to sign off on budgeted margins together with the solution architects, project managers and sales team

Prepare monthly reporting packs (actuals, forecasts, budgets, deviation reports)

Support improvement of controlling tools
Further development of the BI-Tool (Qlik Sense)

Holistic understanding of complex business relationships
Experience in working with top management

Conceptual, analytical and independent work

Your Work Environment

Cool projects with well-known national and international customers
Steep learning curve through participation in various projects and further training measures
Flat hierarchies and clear, direct communication

Good work equipment with Lenovo
