Datenexperte (m/w/d) im Fachbereich Regulatory Reporting werden.
Eigenverantwortlich die Standard- und ad-hoc-Reports zukunftsfähig gestalten.
Mit dem Aufbau des Data Warehouses und der Anbindung der Software ABACUS das Reporting revolutionieren.
Den Wissensdurst von Aufsicht, Vorstand und weiteren Stakeholdern mit deinen Erkenntnissen aus den Daten stillen.
Dich wahlweise zum Spezialisten (m/w/d) oder zum Generalisten (m/w/d) entwickeln, indem du jeden Tag neue Herausforderungen meisterst.
Dein Kontakt

Nadja Wick
Leiterin Regulatory Reporting
Tel.: 030 12030-3272
Deutsche Kreditbank AG

Grade: TG9
Description of field of activity
The Risk division has the fundamental responsibility to protect the Bank. With group-wide responsibility for the management and control of credit, market, operational and reputational risks, we have a unique vantage point, which allows us a holistic view of our businesses and our clients. Nearly 4,000 employees work together to achieve our ambition to be an industry-leading risk management organisation.
In an increasingly complex environment, risk management is fast becoming the most sought after place to build a career within the banking world. Risk at Deutsche Bank is relied upon to help shape the strategy of the organisation and the wider industry agenda.
The Risk Methodology (RM) division is instrumental in developing and managing Deutsche Bank’s risk valuation methodologies, thereby providing risk managers with fit-for-purpose tools when it comes to allocating resources, managing risk appetite and making well-judged credit decisions. In addition, Risk Methodology ensures that all models developed within the division fulfill requirements relating to regulatory and economic capital calculations. RM is part of the Group Strategic Analytics division which combines single, group-wide quantitative analytics and modelling capabilities of DB.
Within RM, LGD Methodology is primarily responsible for the calibration of Loss-Given-Default parameter across all credit portfolios of Deutsche Bank Group but also for other related topics such as collateral distribution and calculations of transfer risk.
You will work in an environment that encourages an open communication, provides a mature feedback culture and offers employees a wide range of options to balance the requirements of the workplace with their personal and family needs.
Responsibilities:
Task: Complex analysis, evaluation & decision-making
Development/ calibration and maintenance of rating methodologies for the credit risk parameters for both retail and wholesale portfolios of the Deutsche Bank.
Implementation of EBA requirements and other existing and upcoming regulations to modelling of IRB-A credit risk parameters (CRR, EBA GL to PD/LGD, ECB guide to internal models, Basel III/IV, etc.).
Assurance of readiness of developed models including responsibility for related processes (e.g. active support and participation in regulatory audits or studies).
Resolution of regulatory and internal findings related to the methodology of credit risk parameters or related models.
Analytical support of other involved stakeholders within the bank in the risk assessment and statistical ad-hoc analyses.
Data processing: Collecting complex information and processing it ready for decision-making
Efficient processing of large datasets for the purpose of model development or related statistical analyses.
In-depth analysis of the underlying data, identification of data deficiencies and addressing them.
Extensive data and statistical analyses for quantifying credit risk and decision-making.
Presentation of data and statistical analyses in a comprehensive form for internal review, reporting and decision-making of senior management.
Relationship management: Integration into banks' and team's processes and on-the-job learning
Establishment of a network of contacts within Risk Methodology as well as outside department and across different locations.
Onboarding and supervision of new joiners and interns.
Coordination and organization of internal projects.
Participation in relevant trainings and development programs.
Requirements
Education and Experience:
Relevant university degree (Master) in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematical Finance/ Statistics/ Econometrics) with focus on applications and relevant professional experience necessary or
Relevant university degree (PhD) in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematical Finance/ Statistics/ Econometrics) necessary
Competencies and Practical Skills:
Practical knowledge of the modeling of credit risk parameters (PD, LGD, CCF).
Strong IT / data management skills and advanced experience with relevant statistical and other software packages (e.g. SAS, R, Matlab, Excel VBA).
Strong analytical skills and ability to solve problems efficiently while acting independently and proactively.
Personal Characteristics and Social Skills:
Ability to work efficiently and professionally under tight timelines, provide structured results on a short notice or/and under stressful circumstances.
Ability to work in a self-reliant independent manner as well as a part of a large team.
Ability to learn on the job, proactively acquire new skills or improve the existing ones.
Ability to process and structure large amount of information and prioritize tasks in line with set objectives.
Excellent written and verbal skills in English.
Start Date: 09.01.2020
End Date: 23.01.2020
Unsere Werte bestimmen das Arbeitsumfeld, welches wir schaffen möchten – vielfältig, wertschätzend und offen für verschiedene Meinungen. Nur eine Unternehmenskultur, die eine Vielzahl von Perspektiven, sowie kulturellen und gesellschaftlichen Hintergründen vereint, fördert Innovation. Wir setzten auf vielfältige Teams, in welchen die Menschen ihr volles Potential entfalten können – denn das Zusammenführen verschiedener Talente und Ideen spielt eine entscheidende Rolle für den geschäftlichen Erfolg der Deutschen Bank.


Unsere Unternehmenskultur setzt hohe ethische Standards und fördert ein gutes Miteinander. Unabhängig von kulturellem Hintergrund, Nationalität, ethnischer Zugehörigkeit, geschlechtlicher und sexueller Identität, körperlichen Fähigkeiten, Religion und Generation freuen wir uns über Bewerbungen talentierter Menschen.

Sprechen Sie uns an: Wir bieten flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und weitere Zusatzleistungen, um Sie in Ihrem Berufsleben zu unterstützen.


Klicken Sie hier für weitere Informationen zu Vielfalt und Teilhabe in der Deutschen Bank.

Berlin, Germany A/B-Testing Analysis Business Intelligence Data metrics SQL Tableau
Would you like to use your skills to help non-academic talent to have the same career opportunities you have? Join the Heyvolution!


We use a rich data set we collect along the hiring processes of many companies & machine-learning based matching technology to connect people to their next job. Our vision is to become the trustworthy career advisor for talent – making exhausting and intransparent application processes a thing of the past.

By the end of 2020, we want to help 1 million people to find the right job to live a fulfilling life.

Our 3 main offers to you:

An impactful role: You are the first touchpoint between BI and our Sales and Account Management teams. You will work closely with them to understand their needs and deliver all data needed to help them make the right decisions.

Follow your own path: We have a 7-step career plan with equal paths for managers and individual contributors. You have the opportunity to develop yourself in any direction with a wide array of technologies and the support of senior engineers & data scientists that love to learn from each other.

A welcoming company culture: Our values – Teamwork, Entrepreneurship, Drive – are integrated in all areas of our organization and build the core for a respectful and people-focused culture.

What you can contribute:

Your responsibility is to analyse and interpret results as well as turn complex data into simple understandable information.
You derive key messages and conclusions of the analysis and enable actionable measures.
You will be the owner of our B2B analytics by supporting our Marketing and Business Development teams.
You support our Marketing Engineering team in optimising the performance of our marketing campaigns by analysing the performance of our marketing channels, building dashboards, supporting in setting up A/B tests, diving into the data for analyses, and being proactive in making recommendations.
Together with our Business Development Team, you will improve our B2B user acquisition and retention with tasks like identifying and setting up customer segmentation, identifying business growth potentials, and running cohort analyses
You will make sure KPI definitions are aligned and ensure everyone understands and knows how to use reports and data tools available.
You will need to proactively identify data needs and quality issues, define data quality improvement and coordinate their implementation with our Data Warehouse Engineers.

What you need to bring:

Completed studies – preferably with a focus on business, economics, statistics, mathematics, engineering or a related field.
+2 years of experience in Data Analysis and Reporting, knowhow in visualising data and building dashboards.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
Clear and structured communication of ideas.
Ability to work in a fast and practically oriented environment.
Fluency in English
Experience with SQL, Tableau, and marketing analytics is required.
Experience with Salesforce is a plus.

What our employees also like about us:

Diverse Team: 29 different nationalities, 43% females (34% female leaders), 45% of employees working in tech, LGBT+ champion
Secure Job: Over 1’000 large clients, proven business model & over 15M€ financing
Work-Life Balance: Flexible working mode
Perks & Benefits: weekly team lunch, annual company retreat, urban sports membership, employee stock options, a 1-month paid sabbatical (after 3 years) and much more
Great Office: Kreuzberg, Paul-Lincke Ufer – great lunch options and food markets close by
High-quality equipment: Standing desk, MacBook of choice, etc.

Join us in building the leading healthcare company in Europe! KRY is a digital healthcare service enabling patients to meet and seek advice from healthcare professionals digitally. Backed by some of the most renowned investors, we’re on a mission to build better and more accessible healthcare - regardless of location. Our headquarters are located in Stockholm, and we’re rapidly growing internationally with offices in the UK, Norway, France, and Germany.
Are you ready to disrupt healthcare? Healthcare needs data, so we are expanding our committed Analytics team. If you are passionate about analytics, focused on growth opportunities and have strong skills in SQL, this is the role for you! As a member of the Growth Analyst team, you will be part of building the future of healthcare powered by smart data products and deep insights, and bringing better care to patients around Europe.
What you’ll do;
Working in close collaboration with the Germany Growth team, you will be handling and influencing a wide range of high-level stakeholders with your strong analytical and storytelling abilities. At KRY your daily life will be filled with exciting missions mainly focusing on the following responsibilities;

Guiding the German Growth Team to become data-driven and achieve their targets
Collaborating with Product, Marketing and Operations teams to uncover insights
Supporting the team with product strategy and growth opportunities
Analyzing product performance from both the patient and clinician point of view
Experimenting and A/B-testing new product features
Building new product datasets and use SQL on a daily basis

Who you are;
We are looking for an entrepreneurial, innovative and committed Growth Analyst who wants to make an impact by bringing a hands-on mindset and a curious approach to the organization while staying focused on the priorities. Some of the abilities and skills which will greatly help you with this role are;

Experience working with large datasets using SQL
The ability to formalize problems and turn data into actionable recommendations
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Proficiency with a visualization tool is a strong plus - Mode, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Funnel, Domo, Datorama, etc.
2+ years of experience in a similar role

What we offer;

Amazing, friendly, smart colleagues from all over the world
The opportunity to grow and learn from knowledgeable co-workers and cross-collaboration across departments
Ability to have a big impact on what we build and how we build it, as each team is in control of their own environment
As a team, committing to goals, sharing both success and failures
The chance to be a part of the journey of building the future of healthcare
Discounted Urban Sports Club membership

This is your chance to work for a meaningful company that encourages personal development and celebrates diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, or marital status.

We offer a unique opportunity to gain a broad and deep understanding of the inner working at Europe’s leading digital healthcare provider. We value grit and a can-do attitude; there is a long and challenging journey ahead of us. You are brave enough to set high goals and then work passionately to achieve them. Last, but not least, we think you believe in that by working together we will achieve greater things than by working alone. At KRY we care about each other and the world around us. Expect to have fun and learn new things every day!
If you have any questions regarding jobs or our recruitment process, please read our FAQ or contact us on jobs@kry.se. Please note that we do not accept any email applications due to GDPR.

Each day, hundreds of thousands of customers make billions of transactions worldwide on our cloud. They are harnessing the power of Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enable innovative applications, websites, and businesses. However, there are always a few people that try to take unfair advantage of a good thing...

Are you interested in taking your skills and career to the next level, while having fun and fighting bad guys? Join a growing world class team to conduct investigations in order to prevent malicious and fraudulent usage on AWS.

You will be an integral member of a team of analysts, investigators, and specialists conducting complex investigations of fraud activity.

You will aid in identifying new and emerging fraud threats through data extraction and analysis, as well as consumption of 3P cybercrime threat intelligence reports.

You will leverage your analytical and data skills to deep dive on a myriad of fraud activity to help drive complex investigations and investigative strategies.

You will be at the forefront of keeping abreast of trends and fraud issues impacting the cloud industry to ensure AWS is leading the curve in identifying, migrating and preventing fraud attacks.

Responsibilities Include:
Assist in building the analytical component of a world class team conducting complex and deep dive investigations of sophisticated criminals and criminal enterprisesUnderstand the requirements of stakeholders and map them with the data sources/data warehouseAssist in the design and development of highly available dashboards and metrics using appropriate software and programming solutionsProvide wing-to-wing project lifecycle execution (project planning, execution, risk assessment and system availability)Execute analytical projects and understanding of analytical methods particularly as it relates investigating transnational organized crime enterprisesIdentify new and emerging patterns of fraud and make recommendations for new controls and improved monitoringUse statistical analysis to segment customer behavior and develop targeted solutions to prevent sophisticated fraud activityWork with cross-functional teams across Amazon/AWS for collaboration on fraud risks and investigationsLiaise with private industry groups involved in fraud prevention and mitigationTake on ad-hoc projects/assignments related fraud investigations/prosecutions as necessary

Each day, hundreds of thousands of customers make billions of transactions worldwide on our cloud. They are harnessing the power of Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enable innovative applications, websites, and businesses. However, there are always a few people that try to take unfair advantage of a good thing... Are you interested in taking your skills and career to the next level, while having fun and fighting bad guys? Join a growing world class team to conduct investigations in order to prevent malicious and fraudulent usage on AWS. You will be an integral member of a team of investigators, analysts and specialists conducting complex investigations of fraud activity. You will help drive related intelligence initiatives targeting new and emerging fraud threats to AWS. You will leverage your analytical and data skills to deep dive on a myriad of fraud activity to help drive complex investigations and investigative strategies. You will be at the forefront of keeping abreast of trends and fraud issues impacting the Cloud industry to ensure AWS is leading the curve in identifying, mitigating and preventing fraud attacks.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization

You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

Die 2007 gegründete Peak Ace AG ist eine international tätige Performance Marketing Agentur mit Sitz in Berlin. Mit mehr als 120 Mitarbeitern realisieren wir Kampagnen in mehr als 20 Sprachen auf muttersprachlichem Niveau. Mit unserem technologiegetriebenen Ansatz bieten wir unseren Kunden in den Bereichen Paid Advertising (PPC), Organic Search (SEO) und Content Marketing sowie Conversion Rate Optimierung und Digital Analytics datengetriebene Lösungen aus einer Hand.

Aufgaben


Als Teil unseres Marketing Technology Teams arbeitest du an der Planung und Umsetzung von erfolgreichen Digital Analytics Konzepten für unsere verschiedenen Kunden von SMB bis Enterprise
Dabei wendest du dein spezialisiertes Know-how in den Bereichen Tracking (Google Tag Manager), Datenanalyse (Google Analytics & weitere Tools), Reporting und Automatisierung (Google Data Studio) an und vertiefst dieses stetig
Die Durchführung von Kundenterminen und -korrespondenz ist ein wichtiger Teil deiner Aufgaben
Du ermittelst und analysierst relevante KPIs, erstellst automatisierte Reports und leitest daraus konkrete Handlungsempfehlungen für unsere Kunden ab
Du arbeitest dich im Rahmen der strategischen Kundenarbeit in neue MarTech- und Google Cloud Tools ein
Du unterstützt in der Beratung unserer Fachbereiche SEO, SEA, Social Advertising & Content Marketing und baust dort grundlegendes Know-how auf
Du informierst dich über aktuelle Trends und Entwicklungen im eigenen Fachbereich und bringst eigene Ideen in tägliche Arbeitsabläufe und Projekte ein
Du kümmerst dich als Mentor um die fachliche Weiterentwicklung von MarTech Trainees & Junior Manager
Die Durchführung von internen und externen Workshops sowie Präsentationen gehört ebenfalls zu deinem Aufgabengebiet

Qualifikation


Idealerweise besitzt du mindestens 2 Jahre praktische Erfahrung in der digitalen Analyse und interessierst dich für die Welt des Online Marketings
Du hast dein Studium, z.B. mit Schwerpunkt (Online) Marketing, Datenanalyse oder verwandten Fächern, bzw. gleichwertige Qualifikation bereits erfolgreich abgeschlossen
Du besitzt ein gutes Zahlenverständnis und analytisches Denken sowie Interesse an technischen Implementierungen
Du überzeugst durch sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Du verfügst über sehr gute Kenntnisse des Google Tag Managers sowie Google Analytics
Erste Erfahrungen mit Google BigQuery sind wünschenswert
Ein hohes Maß an Kommunikationsstärke, Eigeninitiative und Teamfähigkeit, sowie Spaß daran, dich in neue Themengebiete einzuarbeiten, rundet dein Profil ab
Gute Kenntnisse der Programmiersprachen SQL & JavaScript ein Plus

Benefits


Eine Unternehmenskultur, in der Mitgestaltung erwünscht ist und Zusammenarbeit wirklich Spaß macht
Mitarbeit in einem kreativen Umfeld und eine steile Lernkurve
Flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege
Arbeit in einem internationalen und kollegialen Team
Company Lunch von montags bis donnerstags (kostenfrei)
Moderner Arbeitsplatz im Herzen Kreuzbergs
Direkte Zusammenarbeit mit großen Marken aus allen denkbaren Branchen
Home Office Option (nach der Probezeit)
Pool Office auf Zypern – Eine Woche im Jahr im sonnigen Pool House arbeiten
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Regelmäßige Agentur- und Teamevents

Dann freuen wir uns über die Zusendung deiner aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf, relevante Zeugnisse, Gehaltswunsch, nächstmöglicher Eintrittstermin; formatiert im PDF Format) über unser Online-Bewerbungsformular.

job_title: Oliver Wyman - Senior Analyst - FSQA - Berlin
full_text:
WHO WE ARE
Oliver Wyman is a global leader in management consulting. With offices in 60 cities across 29 countries, Oliver Wyman combines deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise in strategy, operations, risk management, and organization transformation. The firm has more than 5,000 professionals around the world who work with clients to optimize their business, improve their operations and risk profile, and accelerate their organizational performance to seize the most attractive opportunities. Oliver Wyman is a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies [NYSE: MMC]. For more information, visitwww.oliverwyman.com. Follow Oliver Wyman on Twitter @OliverWyman.
Financial Services Quantitative Analytics is a specialist business unit within Oliver Wyman, set up in Newcastle-upon-Tyne in 2017 and has since expanded to Milan and Berlin. The business unit has a fast-paced start-up culture and provides high quality quantitative analytics for Oliver Wyman's global client base with a primary focus on the financial services sector.
We are looking for highly talented quantitative analysts who are excited to work in an entrepreneurial environment to continue the success and development of FSQA in Berlin.
THE ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Working with us offers excellent career and growth opportunities for highly motivated professionals with relevant prior experience in specialised consulting firms, top tier banking or financial institutions, focused in quantitatively intense areas of financial services. We are passionate about developing our people and support your progression to partner.
YOUR ATTRIBUTES AND EXPERIENCE
Clients hire Oliver Wyman for specialized expertise, the ideal candidate will have most of the following:
Required Skills & Experience:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline. Ideally Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science or EngineeringStrong analysis, documentation, and communication skillsExperience in using advanced analytics and data manipulation software - SAS, R, SQL, SPSS, or PythonWork effectively and collaboratively in a teamPresent effectively results, potential issues and implications.Excellent command of German and English language (verbal and written)Ability to manage a demanding work volume and meet deadlines in an extremely fast paced environmentAbility to maintain and respect confidentiality
Preferred Skills:
Previous experience in banking and financial institutions, with content in one or more of the following areas: credit risk measurement (e.g. Probability of Default, Loss Given Default, Exposure at Default), stress testing, financial modelling, RWA calculations, credit portfolio modelling, derivative pricing, fair value calculations, Asset Quality reviews, model validation, VaR, CVA or IRC modelling
OUR VALUES & CULTURE
We’re serious about making OW a rewarding, progressive, enjoyable and balanced place to work.
Self starters and free thinkers who work well in a team
We are individuals who are self starting, motivated, energetic, entrepreneurial about what we do

Common aspiration, collective endeavour, shared success
We have the common aspiration to have an impact, leave a legacy and change the world. We have no interest in running a steady-state business. We want to build, grow and shape the environment around us
Straightforward, open, respectful interaction
We value an environment where every member of Oliver Wyman is encouraged and expected to voice his or her opinion
Opportunity without artificial barriers
We value merit and believe that to create a true meritocracy we need to remove artificial barriers to opportunity
Balanced lives
We value people whose lives balance work and non-work activities because we believe they are both more interesting colleagues and are able to make better contributions to the Firm. We push ourselves hard to deliver excellence, but we also work to extract the maximum benefit from the flexibility of a project-based business. We provide the ability to take career breaks for personal or family reasons. We fundamentally value each other’s time, and are sensitive to how it is used. We are an output not input-based culture, have respect for people’s personal decisions, and believe that one's workload must be sustainable. We seek balance for ourselves and our colleagues.

HOW TO APPLY
If you like what you’ve read, we’d love to hear from you.
If you’d like to learn more about the firm during your application process, please visit www.oliverwyman.com/careers,
Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer.
Our commitment to diversity is genuine, deep and growing. We’re not perfect yet, but we’re working hard right now to make our teams balanced, representative and diverse.

OLX Group, a leading online classifieds company, is looking for a passionate UiPath RPA developer to join our Finance in Transformation team in Berlin, Germany. You will work in a growing agile, cross-functional team of 30+ people with a global scope.
As a RPA Developer, you will be responsible for development of automated process solutions with the use of UiPath software, taking care of service requests and changes, and spreading the use of UiPath software within the organization.
As part of this vision, you will cooperate closely with FiT Team BAs, Finance systems users, Enterprise Architecture and Business IT teams.
 What you will be doing:
Design, create, code, develop and implement robot-automated process solutions based on finance users requirements and in accordance with standard automation design principles and conventions (incl. UiPath ReFrameWork)
Analyze business scenarios and recommend standard methodologies for automation
Collaborate with Business Analysts for solution design and feasibility check
Design process workflow using UiPath, build, test and implement quality RPA solutions
Help in preparation and documentation of software requirements and specifications
Analyze test results and assist in delivery of solutions to problem areas
Assist in the development and maintenance of user manuals and guidelines
Educate end users on the specifics of working with the robotic solutions
Contribute to spreading the use of RPA by participation in building up RPA Training Program and educating advanced users on attended and unattended automation
Research and investigate the next automation technologies as provided by UiPath and other vendors (Chatbot, OCR/ICR, AI/ML)
 Who we're looking for:
Ability to design, develop and communicate along the RPA automation life cycle
Data-driven mindset with focus on metrics, with visualization and dashboards being good friends.
Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with good communication skills and a sense of ownership and drive.
Knowledge of UiPath Robotic Process Automation development software (Studio)
UiPath Foundation training finished.
UiPath Orchestrator operation experience
MS Windows experience is nice to have
Knowledge of .Net and VB is a plus
Experience with other RPA Tools is beneficial
Experience of automation within financial processes (P2P, R2R, O2C) is an asset
Interaction / automation experience with at least one current tool used in Finance Systems is an advantage (Netsuite, SAP, Coupa, Expensify)
Interest in learning interactions with new tools in the pipeline (Anaplan, OneStream)
Ability to invent ideas on how to streamline/ further improve processes and motivated by process optimization
Critical thinker, unafraid to challenge the status quo with a constant lens of “what good looks like”
Ability to think outside of the box and find creative solutions, while adhering to Team FIT’s motto of simple, streamlined and scalable
Phenomenal attention to details and organisational skills
Great teammate who is also able to work independently with light oversight
Fluent in both written and spoken English.
 What we’ll give you:
Contribute to enabling local sellers and buyers to connect - keep the Earth green
International career and travel opportunities
Work with an international team of top talent, learning from one another
Conferences, training and career development
Competitive salary and fantastic benefits
Flexible office culture and the possibility to work from home
Company mobile phone, laptop (MacBook Pro / PC), and other tools you might need
Great central office location
 What you need to know about us:
OLX is the world’s leading classifieds platform in high-growth markets. It’s available in more than 35 countries and in over 50 languages. The platform makes it so easy to connect people to buy, sell or exchange used goods and services.
OLX is part of the OLX Group, a global product and tech company with 17 brands, +40 countries, +5000 people and one mindset.
Our mission is to make it super easy for people to buy and sell almost anything, boosting the local economy
We are proud to be different, and we work differently too. We combine the spirit and agility of a start-up with the maturity that comes from being part of a 100-year-old company.
We are curious, ambitious and allergic to corporate interference. We improvise, experiment and push each other further, embracing uncertainty and driving change.
If you’d like to learn more about the OLX Group take a look at the other parts of our website . And remember, we are an equal opportunities employer.

Senior Data Analyst
We’re looking for an experienced data expert who can transform facts and figures into valuable insights across our international markets. Sound like you? Then keep reading…
Our story (the bitesize version):

With customers in around 100 cities across 11 countries (and counting!), we’ve come a long way since our start-up days. In a few quick clicks, our food-loving customers can get everything from fries in Frankfurt to pierogi in Poznan – ensuring their day has the perfect ingredients.
But the truth is that business insight is what really drives us. In an ever-changing, competitive industry, smart strategies and expert analysis help us bring in millions of orders every month.
What you will do:

In a sentence: we’re counting on you to analyse our data and transform it into valuable insights, supporting the IT systems for our driver operations and logistics.
But that’s just a flavour of the role. As Senior Data Analyst, you’re leading the way with a pioneering data-driven strategy to take our Analytics team to the next level. As a hands-on individual, you’ll also design new metrics to analyse our business activities and help make key decisions.
Know how to evaluate and monitor system performance? That’s a major plus. We’re counting on you to develop a strong information system, ensuring efficiency in our operational processes. In dealing with our data infrastructure, you’ll also be working with Amazon Web Services (AWS).
This role is tailor-made for a strong communicator. You’ll be analysing key information and working with a range of colleagues, which means:
Delivering insights and data to help our Product and Development teams achieve continuous improvement
Supporting management with risk assessments and mitigation activities
Working with the central BI team to define goals, analyse current projects and ensure future ones are thoroughly planned – boosting our business KPIs
Can you deliver...

Ready to serve up the analytics expertise we need? That’s great. But it’s even better if you can bring us the following:
4+ years’ experience working with Data Analytics
University Degree (preferably MsC) in Economics, Mathematics, Data Analytics or another relevant field
Experience with AWS and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Natural problem-solving skills and an ability to present your findings well
Confident working autonomously and making key decisions
Fluent language skills in English (written & spoken). German is a plus
Mastery of SQL and experience with BI reporting tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlikview, Looker) and modern databases
Here is our offer:
So, that’s what we need from you. Here’s what you’ll get as part of our community:
Competitive salary
Opportunities for personal and professional growth
Fantastic company-wide events like our summer party and snow event
A dynamic, welcoming workplace in Berlin (you’ll be right near Potsdamer Platz)
The chance to work in a team with a flat hierarchy and agile scrum environment
Contribution towards travel costs and ordering lunches
A pension plan in which we pay 20%
Fresh fruit and delicious tea & coffee in the office
Are you the analytics ace we’re looking for? Click the button below to send us your CV and motivational letter.

SOFTGAMES is currently looking for a talented and passionate Senior Game Data Analyst (f/m/x) to strengthen our BI team. You interact with your peers from the BI team, multiple game teams and key players across the company to provide a broad and detailed understanding of our user base. Our goal is to create the best experience for our players.

The ideal candidate will be a data-driven advisor who enjoys deep diveing into our games, has the ability to do independent research and generate insights from large data sets as well as a hands-on attitude of servicing daily data requests and analyses.

This role requires excellent understanding of SQL and other query languages, and enjoys combining analytic skills with business acumen to provide our game teams with the data and insights that will drive the continued success of our games.

Your role:
Extend our Game Analytics systems
Work with teams and individuals across the company
Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis of key performance indicators
Communicate, define and create clear and unambiguous visualizations of your results/analysis
Identify and report actionable insights and make recommendations
Other areas of data-driven reporting, analysis and investigations as they are required
Your profile:

University degree in the fields of Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or comparable qualification
Passionate and knowledgeable about F2P mobile games and big data
4+ years of professional experience in the field of data science or similar work environment
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Working knowledge in some data analysis and reporting tools (Eg. Tableau, or similar business intelligence tools)
Experience with data discovery, visualization and dashboards
People-oriented, a team player with excellent communication skills
Fluent in written and spoken English
Good knowledge of DeltaDNA is a plus

We offer:

A spirited, inspiring, international and enthusiastic team
The best and brightest company in producing and distributing HTML5 Messenger Games
The chance to produce Messenger games for millions of gamers globally
Valuable insights into global expansion, start-up scene and entrepreneurship
Flexible working-hours and flat company hierarchy
Inspiring company breakfasts, team events
Perks: fresh fruits, cold drinks, tee, coffee, discounted local transport ticket, health package etc.


With offices in Berlin, Germany and Toronto, ON, Canada, SOFTGAMES is a leading developer of the most popular Messenger Games with tens of million users every month. Further SOFTGAMES is operating the world’s largest platform for HTML5 games distribution and monetization outside the Messengers. Our vision is to help users to instantly play great games with their friends, while helping brands to reach their target audiences. To-date, more than 100 MM people have played our games on Facebook Messenger, including Cookie Crush, Solitaire Story, Mahjong Story, Space Invaders, Fish Story, Bubble Shooter or Candy Rain.

Have we caught your interest? Then we look forward to your detailed application together with your salary expectations and earliest possible start date.

Who We Are:

DuckerFrontier is a market intelligence and consulting firm that provides tailored solutions to drive growth for clients across the B2B, healthcare, consumer, and technology sectors. Our dedicated teams serve as advisers to clients, delivering the market and industry knowledge they need to succeed at all points in the business cycle. Continuous research & insights, custom solutions, and transaction support services provide clients with timely, actionable insights to adapt and win in changing markets. The company is headquartered in Washington, DC, with offices in Troy, Mich., New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Singapore, Shanghai, and Bangalore. For more information, please visit https://www.duckerfrontier.com.

As we plan for continued growth, DuckerFrontier is seeking an experienced Consulting Market Analyst to join our team in the Berlin office.


The Market Analyst is responsible for the day-to-day organization and execution of client projects through high-quality information gathering, analysis and business/report writing.


Job Responsibilities:

Fieldwork / Insight Generation
Understand client's business challenges and market questions

Develop interview/discussion guidelines, and translate if needed

Conduct secondary research about technologies, markets and key market players, and consolidate collected data
Identify, qualify, contact and interview key market participants across the value chain

Summarize and report insights won through the investigative interviews
Aggregate interview feedback and cross-check consistency/reliability of information
Proactively communicate project process as well as potential timing barriers/challenges to team members and project leaders
Submit suggestions to improve fieldwork tools and enhance efficiency of information gathering process
Incorporate feedback from project manager/director, other team members or client, adjustments and changes into the process
Help coordinate fieldwork and oversee quality of information collected by other team members or potential external resources involved in the project
Work independently on multiple projects at one time, with minimal guidance from the project manger
Manage timelines and effectively work to meet established project milestones
Prioritize tasks
Handle peaks in workflow cycle

Analysis, Report Writing and Client Presentations

Understand and analyze multiple fieldwork inputs (interview insights, secondary findings, and data provided by the client) - both qualitative and quantitative - and apply findings to study objectives

Organize information to generate deliverables relevant to client objectives:

Build market models to size, segment and forecast market
Map drivers and barriers
Assess technologies
Capture customer needs and satisfaction level
Analyze pricing
Map competitive landscape
Profile companies
Write a complete report (client-ready PowerPoint slides) including story lines around deliverables and insightful conclusions that tie back to program objectives
Leverage strong business acumen and client -orientation to develop targeted and actionable recommendations
Be creative in information visualization
Interact directly with the client, attend client meetings and presentations (kick-off meeting, progress updates and final presentation) - including presentation of report sections and active participation in discussions/sharing insights

Qualifications and Profile:
College degree required in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics or Engineering (master degree a plus)

Minimum of three years' experience in market research/consulting
German native-speaker, with fluency in the English language in writing and speaking (both languages will be required for the role)
Excellent communication skills and comfort in approaching industry members
Agility to adapt to various interview partners and topics
Distinct intellectual curiosity and ability/willingness to deal with both business and technical subjects (automotive experience/interest a plus)

Proven analytical and report writing skills
Openness to receive feedback and improvement suggestions
Strong time management
Good command of Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
Familiarity with Excel databases and development of basic formulas and market models
Ability to travel for business (less than 10 percent)
Eligible to work in Europe

Application Process:
This position will be located in our Berlin office and ideal candidates will be located in or around the area. To be considered, interested candidates must submit a resume and cover letter, including salary requirements.

company_name: Project A Services GmbH & Co. KG
full_text:

Die adviqo GmbH in Berlin ist international Marktführer im Segment Life Coaching. Das Portfolio der Medien-Gruppe umfasst digitale Beratungsplattformen, Content und E-Commerce Dienstleistungen, Websites und Apps sowie einen eigenen TV-Sender. Mit rund 250 Mitarbeitern in diversen Business Units in Europa, UK, Asien und Lateinamerika bietet die adviqo weltweit Coaching-Lösungen rund um die Themen Lebensberatung, Spiritualität, Astrologie und Esoterik.KurzdarstellungAls BI Data Analyst/Scientist erwartet Dich ein aufgeschlossenes Business Intelligence Team, die leidenschaftlich mit Daten und Zahlen hantieren sowie die modernsten AI, Big Data und Machine Learning Technologien nicht nur theoretisch verstehen, sondern auch praktisch anwenden. Wir leben, kommunizieren und fördern einen Data Driven Ansatz bei adviqo.Was Du machst Als Experte im Umgang mit großen Datenmengen erstellst Du Business Intelligence Analysen (Predictive Analytics, Machine Learning, Deep Learning) für die verschiedenen Businessprozesse der adviqoIn enger Zusammenarbeit mit den unterschiedlichsten Unternehmensbereichen bist Du für die Visualisierung der Daten verantwortlichDie gewonnenen Ergebnisse interpretierst Du zielsicher und leitest konkrete Handlungsempfehlungen für die Business Einheiten und das Management abDu leitest und steuerst Data Science ProjekteWas Du mitbringst Du hast einen (Fach-)Hochschulabschluss der Wirtschafts-/Mathematik, Physik, Wirtschafts-/Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation mit statistischem Bezug bzw. mit dem Schwerpunkt BIDu besitzt fundierte Kenntnisse über AI und Data Mining-Methoden und angewendeter Statistik (inkl. multivariate Analysemethoden, Regressionsanalysen bzw. Machine Learning)Idealerweise bringst Du erste praktische Erfahrungen im Bereich BI Reporting, BI Analytics und in den jeweiligen Softwareprodukten mitDiese Erfahrungen ergänzt Du durch fundiertes Wissen in Datenmodellierung, Data Management (inkl. ETL-Kenntnissen), Datenbanktechnologien und Big DataDu besitzt eine ausgeprägte Begeisterung für Daten, Analysen und VisualisierungenDich zeichnet ein hervorragendes Kommunikationsgeschick, eine zielorientierte Arbeitsweise sowie eine ausgeprägte Analyse- und Konzeptfähigkeit ausDein Profil wird durch sehr gute Englischkenntnisse abgerundetWas wir Dir bietenErfolg und SicherheitStarte bei einem erfahrenen Unternehmen mit einem seit fast zwei Jahrzehnten erfolgreichem Geschäftsmodell; genieße die Möglichkeit einer langfristigen Perspektive durch einen unbefristeten ArbeitsvertragWeiterentwicklungsmöglichkeitenFortschritt treibt Menschen an - wir sind auf der Suche nach kontinuierlicher Weiterentwicklung und bieten unseren Mitarbeitern maßgeschneiderte Trainings und Karrierewege anEin gesunder Geist in einem gesunden KörperArbeite ausgeglichen, dann arbeitest du gesund - Yoga & Rückentraining, Sponsoring von Sportveranstaltungen, täglich frisches Obst, Work-Life Balance (familienfreundliche und flexible Arbeitszeiten); wir sorgen dafür, dass wir dir das beste Arbeitsumfeld bietenSpaß bei der ArbeitGenieße das einzigartige Flair einer Startup Mentalität in einem etablierten Unternehmen, ein dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld mit flachen Hierarchien und ausgeglichenen After-Work-Kultur mit vielen FirmenveranstaltungenZusätzliche Leistungen:Flexible ArbeitszeitenHome OfficeKostenlose GetränkeBetriebliche AltersvorsorgeWeiterbildungKostenloses oder vergünstigtes EssenJob Types: Full-time, PermanentExperience:Data Scientist: 3 years (Required)

What you will do:
Consolidate and review existing reports to lift our reporting to an higher-level of information density
Develop new reports while working on the interface between BI and our key departments
Provide accurate reports and insightful data analysis to our key departments and explain your findings when needed
Define and implement proof of concepts for data driven, self-service solutions and processes to enhance the performance of our key departments

What you should bring:
Bachelor/Master’s degree in a related field (e.g. business administration, economics, statistics, mathematics)
2+ years of relevant experience, preferably in an e-commerce/ internet-based company
Excellent knowledge of MS Excel and good knowledge of Tableau Software
Solid experience writing SQL queries and with relational DBMS’s like MySQL
High affinity for numbers, unwavering attention to detail and a strong analytical mind
Being a great team player comes naturally to you and you communicate fluently in English
What you will get:
Colleagues striving for excellence while using the latest technologies. You can see what we do in our Tech-Blog: https://auto1.tech/.
Relocation support to Germany which includes assistance with visa, apartment search and refund of moving costs.
A beautiful and modern office in the heart of Berlin (Kreuzberg, Bergmannkiez) with free drinks & fruits.
Team and company events like Hackathons, International Nights, Annual Company Parties, Football, Team Nights and more.
Attractive discounts on different services like gym, public transport, car purchases and others.
Flexible working hours.
Annual salary reviews weaved into our feedback cycle.
Access to German Courses online.
Sounds interesting? Upload your CV with a note of your salary expectations. We are looking forward to your application.
Contact:
Kasia Karwacka

Die FUNKE Digital ist seit März 2014 der digitale Motor der FUNKE MEDIENGRUPPE, einem der größten Medienkonzerne Deutschlands. Ausgestattet mit modernsten Technologien treiben wir die Weiterentwicklung der Verlagsbranche voran. Geboren als Digital Natives,sind wir der zentrale Ansprechpartner für die verschiedenen Standorte der FUNKE MEDIENGRUPPE im Bereich Digitalisierung, Produktkonzeptionierung, Agenturgeschäft, Data & Analytics, Sales und Softwareentwicklung.

Als Teil des Data Teams analysierst du auf unserem Data Warehouse große Mengen an Daten und unterstützt mit deinen analytischen Fähigkeiten die Web-, Mobile- und App-Plattformen der Funke Mediengruppe, wobei du direkten Einfluss auf wichtige strategische Entscheidungen hast.

Wir suchen dich ab sofort in Teil- oder Vollzeit als
Digital Analyst
DEINE AUFGABEN
Analyse der Performance unserer unterschiedlichen Web-, Mobile- und App-Plattformen z. B. Berliner Morgenpost, etc.
Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen aus den Analysen
Erstellung von umfangreichen Datenanalysen
Konzeption von Dashboards für die internen Stakeholder
Nutzerverhaltenanalyse im Bezug auf den Content und die dahinterstehenden Erlösmodelle
Direkte/r Ansprechpartner/in für verschiedene Abteilungen z. B. Redaktion, Sales und Produkmanagement
DEIN PROFIL
Erste Berufserfahrungen z. B. als Analyst
Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten und Spaß an der Arbeit mit Daten
Gängiger Umgang mit Analyse- & Daten-Tools, wie Google BigQuery, G. Analytics, G. Tag Manager sowie G. Data Studio
Erste Kenntnisse in R, Python, SQL oder JavaScript wünschenswert
Fähigkeit Kennzahlen richtig einzuschätzen, diese verständlich aufzubereiten sowie zu kommunizieren
Interdisziplinäre/r Teamplayer/in mit Leidenschaft für neue Themen

DEINE BENEFITS
Mitgestaltung der digitalen Transformation eines der größten Medienhäuser Deutschlands
30 Urlaubstage, unbefristete Anstellung, flexible Arbeitszeiten sowie betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Agile Teams, innovative Projekte, flache Strukturen und direkte Kommunikation
Neue Technologien und Tools in Vollversion, wie z.B. Google 360°
Einzigartige Location in Berlin Mitte mit eigenem Office-Bulli und regelmäßige kulinarische Reisen mit unserem “Funky Lunch”
Individuelle Entwicklungsperspektiven durch Seminare, Workshops, Kongresse und E-Learnings sowie ein umfassendes Qualifizierungsangebot im Rahmen der gruppenweiten FUNKE Akademie
Kooperationen mit verschiedensten Fitnessstudios und spannende Gesundheitsaktionen
Mitarbeiter-Abos und Vergünstigungen über Corporate Benefits

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience

Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events

ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Your profile:
You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.

Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined

WHICH PRODUCT TEAMS


Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. As a Product Analyst in the content composition team, you will work with data scientists and engineers, draw insights from the complex interaction of content, customers, and Zalando’s business and help to understand why which content is successful in front of the customer. job_title: Data Manager | Data Analyst (m/w/d) für B2B-Online-Marketing
full_text:
Für unseren Standort in Berlin oder Nürnberg suchen wir ab sofort einen leidenschaftlichen Data Manager | Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Vollzeit (40 h).
Die LUMITOS AG führt B2B-Unternehmen und ihre Mitarbeiter mit Online-Marketing zum Erfolg. Mit unseren sieben marktführenden B2B-Portalen und Newslettern sorgen wir dafür, dass fünf Millionen Anwender aus aller Welt über das aktuelle Branchengeschehen bestens informiert sind. Und so die richtigen Entscheidungen treffen.
Seit 2000 gibt LUMITOS Orientierung in den B2B-Märkten Chemie, Life Sciences, Labor, Pharma, Analytik und Food & Beverage. 23 Mitarbeiter in Berlin und Nürnberg engagieren sich mit viel Leidenschaft für den Erfolg von Industrie und Wissenschaft, von Mittelstand und Großindustrie.
Unsere Online-Medien liefern uns Daten und Fakten darüber, was B2B-Anwender suchen, was sie interessiert und was sie begeistert. Dieses Insiderwissen verknüpfen wir mit Branchen-Know-how und Online-Marketing-Wissen zu einer heute schon einzigartigen Wissenswelt. Der nächste Schritt: Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen analysieren und verknüpfen zu einem völlig neuen Ansatz im B2B-Online-Marketing.
Deine Aufgaben:
Du bist der zentrale Ansprechpartner für alle Fragen zum Thema Data-Management und Data-Analytics bei LUMITOS und trägst die Verantwortung für die Entwicklung und Umsetzung unserer Datenstrategie.
Die Visualisierung von Daten und die Darstellung in Dashboards gehört zu Deinem Daily Business
Unterstützung und Zusammenarbeit mit den verschiedenen Fachabteilungen bei der Definition der Anforderungen sowie der Erstellung von Visual Mockups für Dashboards
Aufbereitung, Bereinigung und Standardisierung von Daten aus unterschiedlichsten Quellen im Rahmen von Data-Preparation und Data-Cleansing
Bereitstellung von Kennzahlen und Unternehmensdaten sowie Reportings zur Kontrolle, Überwachung und Steuerung unseres Unternehmens
Verbesserung operativer Prozesse durch Data Mining zusammen mit IT, Vertrieb, Content Management und Marketing
Deine Ideen zur Optimierung und ständigen Weiterentwicklung von vorhandenen Datenprozessen, Data-Tools und Datenstrukturen bringst du aktiv mit ein
Ausbau unserer Infrastruktur zur Überwachung der Datenqualität
Dein Profil:
Mit großer Begeisterung erweckst Du unsere Daten zum Leben und sorgst im LUMITOS-Team dafür, dass Zusammenhänge und Trends besser verstanden werden und ganz neue Ideen entstehen.
Du verfügst über mindestens fünf Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data-Management, Datenanalyse und Datenvisualisierung.
Dank Deiner umfangreichen Kenntnisse in Statistik, Datenanalyse und verwandten Themen erstellst Du zuverlässig Analysen, Reports und Dashboards und leitest daraus Trends und Strategien ab.
Die Nutzung von Daten aus verschiedensten Datenquellen und die damit verbundenen Verfahren der Datenaufbereitung sind Dir bestens bekannt. Hierbei setzt Du Deine fundierte Anwendungserfahrung mit gängigen Datenbanken und MS-Excel ein.
Du verfügst über Erfahrung mit Tools wie Sisense, Tableau oder Qlik
Idealerweise bringst Du Wissen im Bereich Datawarehousing, hadoop/hive und Datapreparation-Tools wie Talend, OpenRefine oder Trifacta mit
Deine ausgeprägte Zahlenaffinität und Dein analytisches und konzeptionelles Denken machen Dich zum verlässlichen Ansprechpartner für die Geschäftsführung und Deine Kollegen
Du besitzt die Fähigkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen klar und verständlich zu visualisieren und zu kommunizieren
Du bist neugierig und hast großen Spaß daran, neue Technologien und Anwendungen im Bereich Data-Management auszuprobieren und proaktiv einzubringen.
Du pflegst einen selbstständigen, eigenverantwortlichen und zielorientierten Arbeitsstil und hast einen hohen Qualitätsanspruch an Deine Arbeit
Du verfügst über gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Du bist vertraut mit agilen Arbeitsweisen und Tools wie z.B. JIRA, Confluence, OKR
Wir bieten
LUMITOS ist anders, als alles was Du bisher erlebt hast: Wir haben ambitionierte Wachstumsziele, verlieren dabei aber den Menschen, ob als Mitarbeiter, Kunde oder Nutzer, nicht aus dem Auge.
Bei uns genießt Du flexible und individuelle Arbeitszeiten auf der Basis von Vertrauensarbeitszeit. Auch die Arbeit vom Home-Office oder temporär reduzierte Arbeitszeiten in besonderen Situationen werden bei LUMITOS seit Jahren aktiv gelebt und sind für uns eine Selbstverständlichkeit.
Flache Hierarchien sorgen für schnelle Entscheidungen und wenig Abstimmungsbedarf. Unsere Arbeitsweise ist geprägt von Transparenz und offenem Austausch.
Wöchentlich trifft sich das gesamte LUMITOS-Team zum Erfahrungsaustausch. Da kannst Du Ideen einbringen, Dein Wissen teilen oder Dein Wissen erweitern.
Unsere beiden Standorte in Berlin und Nürnberg bieten top moderne Arbeitswelten auf Basis des Activity-Based-Workings. Glaswände und hochwertige Akustiksysteme sorgen für eine angenehme Arbeitsatmosphäre. Für jede Aufgabe bieten wir das passende Raumkonzept. Ob Einzelbüro, Teamraum, Kreativraum oder verschiedene Meetingräume mit modernster Video- und Audiotechnik.
Beide Standorte sind bequem zu erreichen. Egal ob mit der S-Bahn, dem Fahrrad oder dem Auto.
Dein Arbeitsplatz ist mit leistungsstarkem PC, zwei großen Monitoren, Softphone und Headset ausgestattet. Wir arbeiten mit Office365, JIRA, Confluence und vielen weiteren cloudbasierten Softwaretools.
Höhenverstellbare Schreibtische fördern Deine Gesundheit
Unsere gemütlichen Loungebereiche mit gut ausgestatteten Küchen laden zu Pausen und lockeren Meetings ein. Sie bieten ausreichend Platz für entspannte Mittagspausen.

idealo has direct business relationships with the entire e-commerce retailer market, from Amazon and eBay to the small specialist everything is represented.
