In a two-sided platform business, inventory is essential to generate growth.

We are looking for your support in sales development, because with your analyses you can make a significant contribution to taking the right measures at an early stage as well as ideally developing recommendations for action and strategies for the future.

As a Senior Data Analyst you will have the opportunity to open new perspectives with your creativity and generate meaningful data driven insights for our platform business.

About your new role
As an Inventory Data analyst, you combine multiple data sources (Data Warehouse, MySQL databases) to create analysis, reporting, and relevant dashboards in order to enable automated data driven decision making
You will help to identify, shape and implement data-driven product features across our B2B Unit and create new use cases within various data sources
Within the scope of your work you derive the needs of our partners from large amounts of data and validate findings using qualitative methods. You will work closely with the Data Science, Business Intelligence and Product Area Inventory departments to create new data and/or aggregation structures to drive inventory analytics across the company
Based on your analysis, you will be able to derive and represent recommendations for action and develop self-explanatory, thus meaningful dashboards

Skills & Requirements
You possess a strong analytical mindset, a passion for working with data and statistics and a minimum of five years working experience in a similar position
You have several years of experience in using R, Python, Tableau and /or other statistical, reporting tools would be an advantage
You are experienced in data modeling using AWS infrastructure
In preference a background in computer science or a scientific education in mathematics, statistics,economics, Data Science or similar
Excellent communication skills in English, both oral and written; German is nice to have

Influence in creating and deciding individual tasks as well as direct
contact with idealo partner

Aktuelle Jobs bei magaloop - Business Analyst
Der Zahlenjongleur schafft aus unseren Daten echte Mehrwerte für Einzelhändler und Hersteller
Warum suchen wir einen Business Analyst?

Jeden Tag werden in Kiosken, Spätis und Büdchen Millionen von Artikeln umgesetzt. Magaloop liefert Echtzeit-Informationen und bietet Herstellern die Möglichkeit, diesen Markt zielgerichtet und ohne Streuverluste über unsere Plattform zu entwickeln.

Das basiert auf Analytik und Business Intelligenz, die echten, direkt messbaren Business-Mehrwert für unsere Kunden liefert.
Was macht ein Business Analyst / Data Scientist bei magaloop

Stell dir vor, du bist Vertriebschef einer Brauerei die 15% ihres Umsatzes über einen Kanal verkauft, auf den sie keinen direkten Zugriff hast. Und dann bietet dir jemand die Möglichkeit, genau dort zielgerichtet und basierend auf Fakten Marktanteile zu gewinnen. Dieser jemand könntest du sein, Du bist der Herr der Datenauswertungen bei magaloop.

Du hilfst Konsumgüterunternehmen zu verstehen, wie Produkte im Markt funktionieren und entwickelst Ansätze zur zielgerichteten Ansprache von Einzelhändlern über die magaloop App
Du lieferst Insights in einen bislang intransparenten Markt, erstellst Snapshots oder arbeitest mit Echtzeit-Daten
Du hilfst unseren Spätis, das richtige Sortiment für ihren Laden einzukaufen und trägst dazu bei, dass sie von Herstellerseite mit besseren Preisen und Konditionen versorgt werden
Dazu definierst du gemeinsam mit Vertrieb und Operations die Spezifikationen sowie die analytischen Fragestellungen zu echten Business-Problemen
Du identifizierst die benötigten Daten, erstellst die notwendigen Analysen, kommunizierst diese und lieferst Handlungsempfehlungen
Du nutzt Data Mining-, statistischen Modellierungs- und Machine Learning-Ansätze, testest und bewertest neuen Methoden, Technologien und Best Practices für die Verwendung im Unternehmen

Das erwartet dich
Spannende Aufgaben und Themen mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum und Eigenverantwortung innerhalb einer flachen Hierarchie und offener Kommunikationskultur
Ein Datenpool, den es in dieser Form noch nie in Deutschland gab
Die Chance bei unseren Partnern auf Hersteller- und Lieferantenseite “erstmalig Licht ins Dunkel” eines bislang komplett intransparenten Marktes zu bringen
Herausragende Lern- und Entwicklungschancen in einem Markt voller Individuen, die sich über ihr enormes Geschäftspotenzial noch gar nicht im Klaren sind
Freie Gestaltung deines Arbeitsumfeldes von der eingesetzten Technologie über deine Arbeitszeiten bis hin zum Arbeitsort
Ein freundschaftliches Team, mit Menschen, die überzeugt sind von dem, was sie tun
Das bringst du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Mathematik oder Physik mit relevantem Schwerpunkt oder vergleichbaren Abschluss
Tieferes Verständnis für Datenbankstrukturen und Datenaufbereitung
Fähigkeit komplexe Zusammenhänge zwischen unseren Geschäftsprozessen und verschiedensten Daten herzustellen und zu erkennen
Du besitzt ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten und kannst deine Auswertungen transparent für verschiedene Anspruchsgruppen darstellen
Spaß an der Arbeit in einem motivierten Team
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Wer wir sind

Wir sind ein kleines Team von Experten mit großer Leidenschaft für den Handel und unsere Kunden. Wir agieren konsequent auf Basis unserer Philosophie, den unabhängigen Einzelhandel zu stärken. Und uns ist eine besondere Arbeitsatmosphäre und persönliches Weiterkommen sehr wichtig: wir möchten uns gut fühlen bei dem, was wir tun und mit Schlauen, guten Leuten gemeinsam wachsen. Finde heraus was wir machen und wer wir sind.

ABOUT ZALANDO

Zalando is Europe's leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests andlanguages ( https://opensource.zalando.com/tech-radar/ ) our teams choose to use.

Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined


PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!

Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.

An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective

Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization

Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events

ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.

Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

That’s us

td is an innovation and marketing consultancy and part of the Reply Group. We take a data driven and execution oriented approach to drive organizational change through meaningful insights. In our Berlin, Munich and Beijing offices we are around 90 thinkers, developers, analysts, designers, consultants, visualizers, futurologists, data scientists and organizers. We are working on international data science projects for our clients such as Audi, Adidas, Coca-Cola, Miele, Telefonica and Volkswagen. For our team in Berlin and Munich we are looking for support across multiple projects.

Please indicate your preferred location.

That’s you

In the midst of endless flows of data and information lies hidden value. And you are keen to find it. The tools for handling big data are probably advancing faster than any other technology. And you master them one by one. Data enable us to make smarter, more informed decisions and develop better products. And you want to be part of this. As a member of our Smart Data team you work closely with our Smart Data and Strategy teams. You ask and answer shrewd questions, face critical analysis with strategic foresight, and turn data into insights. You support our clients to transform their brands – based on smart data.

Your tasks will include
Apply your skills in data mining, quantitative analysis, and the presentation of data, integrating and unifying data from various sources
Consult on the selection of data sources and their usage, identify key performance indicators and give recommendations in meaningful presentations beyond numbers
Collaborate closely with a wide range of international clients, understanding their business needs and challenges
Model and visualize great amounts of commercial data and build tracking solutions to create statistical models of future behavior, market drivers, trends and growth potential
Create insightful reports and interactive dashboards based on digital data sources (including web analytics, Buzz Tracking, CRM, Search)
Work closely with our technical team to define functional specifications, create lively user stories, and to access and understand the tools and data sets for ongoing improvements of our software
There’s a match if…

… you hold an advanced degree in statistics, informatics, economics, behavioral or social science, psychology, mathematics or a related field
… this is not your first assignment. You have at least 1-2 years of relevant experience (data mining and analytics, data and insights digital agency, or a consultancy)
… you have strong data mining skills. Statistical analysis understanding is a plus
… you have a good understanding of business analysis techniques, a keen perception and a strong sense of responsibility
… you bring along a passion for all things digital

... ideally you have a strong understanding of Automotive industry

… you are fully fluent in English and German
…. you have some experience in working in an agile environment (we use Scrum)
… you are both an open minded and inspired individual and a team player

That’s in it for you

You will collaborate with experienced and enthusiastic team of experts with a lot of ideas, great and challenging clients and projects – and an awesome work environment in a great time with all imaginable digital nerd expertise. Berlin Mitte and Hackescher Markt are at your feet. We will tailor a package that’s just right for you.

Application

We want to hire you!

OK, to be totally honest, we should qualify that statement: If you’re talented, hard working, smart, brave, innovative, humble, confident, nice and love working in a data driven industry, then we want to hire you.

To learn more about our approach to smart Data, read our blog post on From Big to smart Data – a rough guide to data-driven marketing.

Interested?

Please submit your resume to our REPLY Recruiter here.

job_title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/div) at solarisBank AG
full_text:
solarisBank is the world's first banking platform enabling businesses to create custom solutions for their financial needs. The core of the company is a fast and modern technology which makes our banking services quick to setup and simple to build. With a full EU banking license, we combine agile engineering with the regulatory expertise of a fully licensed bank.

By combining digital focus, tech expertise, and banking experience we enable our partners to offer various digital financial services to their end-consumer. Our Banking Platform is built in a modular way allowing partners to easily integrate through APIs and access a range of solutions, including BKYC, Digital Banking, Cards, Payments, and Lending. We also partner with trusted third parties to offer additional services e.g. FX, KYC.

solarisBank was founded in March 2016 in Berlin receiving full EU Banking License within 9 months of operating. We are now active in 7+ EU countries via passporting of the banking license and reaching over 2 million end-customers via 50+ partners. Following two successful funding rounds, solarisBank received approx. 95m EUR of funding from strategic investors such as Arvato, BBVA, Lakestar, Visa, SBI Group, ABN AMRO and FinLeap.

In Data team, experts from Data Engineering, Business Intelligence and Data Analytics are working closely together. Our main goal is to ensure the data availability for internal and external processes and to deliver exceptional analyses to ensure excellent business decision-making. We work closely together with our five cross-functional business units as well as our internal functional teams. Your main contributions would be to deliver exceptional insights and data to diverse stakeholders.

Your Role & Responsibilities


You will be part of our growing team of Data Engineers and Data Analysts
Your main responsibility is to ensure that key stakeholder receive information that enables them to take great data-informed business decisions This involves you being responsible for:
Gather and understand requirements of business owners
Create dashboards and reports that support business decision-making
Gather and migrate data to feed the dashboards and reports
Analyse information and give recommendations
You ensure that Self-Service Dashboards are in place to enable key stakeholders to answer many of their data-based questions themselves - without sending ad hoc requests
You will provide accurate and reliable insights for various stakeholders within our company
You will be main contact point and responsible for at least one of our Business Units or Functional Team
Senior members of the solarisBank Data Team feel responsible not only for their personal growth but also for that of their team members and provide technical guidance in their respective fields of expertise.

Our Perfect Match


Minimum 5 years of experience in Data Analytics/Data Science/BI
Confident in both, Python and SQL
Experience in Data Modeling and Data Warehouse setup
Experience with aws services is a plus
You are thinking analytical - but act hands-on.
You are a problem-solver and are able to find solutions in any situation.
You understand what kind of information is driving business - and know how to "tell a story" around it to gain stakeholder's attention
You have sufficient soft skills to setup and manage a good working relationship with your team members and key stakeholders internally
Excellent communication skills in English

Background

Studied Computer Science, Business Information Systems, Business or similar

Our Organization:

We are a tech company with a banking license and we change banking forever. We combine the best from the digital world with our unique tech-enabled platform banking approach.
Take a deep breath – and get ready to grow at the speed of light: We're a young company and you can shape our destiny from day one.

Within AKQA, Data & Analytics is one of the fastest growing disciplines that is integral to delivering value for our clients and positive impact for their customers. As part of a multi-disciplinary approach to problem solving our team provide a wide range of capabilities including user experience (UX) analytics, consumer research, and applied data science. Our clients are building the future of their business and, more than ever, data is at the heart of making this future a reality.

As a Senior Analyst at AKQA, you should be passionate about using data to derive insights and provide optimization recommendations that create better connections with consumers. You will be responsible for defining measurement and testing frameworks to business results for our clients.

For the right person this role offers the chance to shine on top tier clients, impact experiences that touch millions, scope and build out a team to deliver on our vision. This role will work directly with department and account leads in Berlin, as well as the Executive Director of Data & Analytics in Europe.

ROLE REQUIREMENTS


Experience in digital analytics, UX/funnel optimisation, and A/B testing.
Knowledge and mastery of relevant analytics systems and data sources such as: web analytics (Google Analytics), funnel / flow analysis (Content Square), CRM, Survey (Usabilia), BI tools (Tableau, PowerBI), other 3rdparty sources, etc.
Ability to connect a client's business goals to a complete measurement plan that defines the metrics, systems, and methodologies needed to meet those objectives.
Strong background in data analysis and insight generation, using statistically sound analytical techniques to provide robust descriptive data sets that inform, shape, and defend a business/brand/experience strategy.
Highly developed communication and story-telling skills, to be able to connect those insights in a way that tells a clear story and leads to clear action – across a variety of formats (reports, presentations, interactive dashboards).
Experience in designing a detailed tracking strategy and ensuring rich data capture, as part of tag management (GTM), QA, and implementation guidance to dev team/partners.
Familiarity with creating strategic testing frameworks, learning agendas and associated tools and methodologies, like using Google Optimise and analysing statistical significance.

QUALITIES AND CHARACTERISTICS


Proactive mindset, able to execute a hypothesis-driven, data-first approach with light guidance from an Analytics Manager
Skilled storyteller, able to effectively communicate analysis, identify key takeaways, and quantify opportunities.
Team player, able to integrate into a project and team environment as a thought leader, seamlessly connecting analytics to actionable strategic goals.
3 – 5 years of experience, web and digital product analytics experience preferred.

AKQA is an Equal Opportunities Employer, we believe that diversity is vital to AKQA's ability to provide our clients with the best recommendations and are committed to fostering a varied and inclusive work environment. Your race, colour, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or veteran status have no bearing on our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

The Group Audit Model Risk, Market Risk & Counterparty Credit Risk team are responsible for assessing the control environment around related Group-wide activities and identifying weaknesses and potential improvements which can be made to underlying processes and controls. The team includes specialist model risk (quant) auditors, which this role relates to. The team also includes specialists regarding market risk and counterparty credit risk management.
The team is based in London, New York and Berlin.
The successful candidate will be responsible for the following:
Review model documentation, and discuss with model developers and validators, to understand the model, its risks, and assess adequacy of model development and validation.
Assess appropriateness of data inputs and related processes around the model by reviewing related documentation, systems, and discussing with model owners.
Confirm adherence to Group policies and procedures relating to Model Risk Management and regulatory requirements.
Document testing to support the assessment of the above.
Raise written findings on deficiencies noted during testing and discuss and agree with prospective remediation owners.
The successful candidate will should have the following knowledge and skills:
Quantitative finance skillset gained either via academic background, research or previous work experience.
Critical mind able to identify weaknesses or areas for improvement in models and related processes.
Ability to constructively challenge existing processes, influence stakeholders, while considering other points of view.
Preferred to have some audit or model validation experience but not necessary.
The role with provide the following opportunities:
Gain exposure to all types of models used across the Group for different purposes and in different regions.
Partner with other members of the team covering market and counterparty credit risk, as well as other teams in Group Audit, to gain insight on how the models are used in practice.
Training will be provided on audit policies, methodology and testing approach; as well as opportunities for external qualifications and courses relating to quantitative finance.
Requirements or opportunities to travel to London and Frankfurt may exist.
To get more information please contact Elizabeta Bilokapa ( elizabeta.bilokapa@db.com ).
Unsere Werte bestimmen das Arbeitsumfeld, welches wir schaffen möchten – vielfältig, wertschätzend und offen für verschiedene Meinungen. Nur eine Unternehmenskultur, die eine Vielzahl von Perspektiven, sowie kulturellen und gesellschaftlichen Hintergründen vereint, fördert Innovation. Wir setzten auf vielfältige Teams, in welchen die Menschen ihr volles Potential entfalten können – denn das Zusammenführen verschiedener Talente und Ideen spielt eine entscheidende Rolle für den geschäftlichen Erfolg der Deutschen Bank.


Unsere Unternehmenskultur setzt hohe ethische Standards und fördert ein gutes Miteinander. Unabhängig von kulturellem Hintergrund, Nationalität, ethnischer Zugehörigkeit, geschlechtlicher und sexueller Identität, körperlichen Fähigkeiten, Religion und Generation freuen wir uns über Bewerbungen talentierter Menschen.

Sprechen Sie uns an: Wir bieten flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und weitere Zusatzleistungen, um Sie in Ihrem Berufsleben zu unterstützen.

Job Description
Alexion Talent has opportunities across Europe and MENA for Professionals, who have an exceptional track record of driving impact for clients in various industries and various countries. As a candidate, you would be selected through professional, progressive stages, to be a best fit for the client and find a promising career for yourself. If you are in search for a new opportunity to bring out your experience and potential, we would like to meet you immediately.


Responsibilities


Planning and carrying out security measures to protect a company's computer networks and systems, keeping constant tabs on threats and monitoring the organization's networks for any breaches in security.



Conduct platform or operating system vulnerability scans to assess exposure of system to attacks or hacking,

Respond to questions regarding viral activity, concerns about spam/phishing etc.,

Serve as the organization's POC for the third-party certification of security procedures and use of cyber security protections,

Validation and analysis of investigations escalated by internal teams,

Analyse medium to high complexity technical and system problems related to security events,

Design, plan and implement test strategies to support the core infrastructure in the contingency environment for all critical business applications to ensure business continuity in the event of a major business interruption or disaster,

Proactively look for suspicious abnormal activity based on data alerts or data outputs.

Provide Incident Response (IR) support when analysis confirms the actionable incident.


Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Cyber Security, Computer Science or related fields,

Demonstrated understanding of principles, theories, standards, practices, protocols, and procedures used in Cyber Security,

Ability to understand policies, procedures, laws, regulations, and other directives, maintain strict confidentiality,

Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills,

Customer service and quality focused with proven process improvement skills,

Ability to multitask and prioritize work effectively

Strong understanding of data security, data classification, and data loss prevention.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran

Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können

Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig

Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined


PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

Your profile:
You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


WHICH PRODUCT TEAMS


Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. As a Product Analyst in the content composition team, you will work with data scientists and engineers, draw insights from the complex interaction of content, customers, and Zalando’s business and help to understand why which content is successful in front of the customer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle , connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

About Kontist:
Have you ever tried to open a business bank account as a freelancer? Did it suck? And did you ever wonder how much tax you need to put aside and why nobody can tell you? Imagine a smart mobile bank account with superpowers that helps with finances, taxes and savings and makes it as easy to run your own business as being self-employed. If you are as passionate about helping small business owners as we are, then join us to build the next generation bank account!

Your Mission at Kontist:
As experienced BI analyst you have to ensure that various teams are making the best possible data-driven decisions. You're acting as an internal consultant but you really love to get your hands in the data.

Tasks


Collaborate with product and engineering to evolve our BI into a system that allows all internal teams to access relevant analytics data and allow for data-driven decisions.
Produce, share and ultimately automate core business reports.
Collaborate with internal teams to define, structure and report on metrics relevant to their projects and team and manage organization dashboards.
Work with product and marketing to build models and analyze data to identify interesting business opportunities.
Work with operations to identify where the organization is inefficient and help to define solutions.

Requirements


Strong background in economics, statistics, computer science, math or a related field.
3+ years of experience in a similar role.
Superior knowledge and understanding of BI methods and topics such that you can hold your own in discussions with technical teams and also make complex concepts understandable to anyone in the organization.
Excellent English communication skills (written/spoken), as well as comfort with making presentations to both internal and external teams.
Proficiency with the tools of the trade: PSQL, Mixpanel, Google Analytics, etc.; Experience with scripting or programing is a plus.
Self-motivated, analytical, helpful, driven person who enjoys collaboration and creative problem solving and is willing to learn new things and step in to help out where the company needs it most.
Interest in FinTech and the challenges of freelancing.

Benefits

How we show you our love:

Highly diverse and motivated team
Lovely & green office in Prenzlauer Berg with an office dog
Great working conditions with one home office day per week
Flexible trust-based working hours
Personal coaching once per week
Regular team events and offsites
Weekly German classes
Perks such as office fruits, team lunch x 5/week

We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Florian

Als Consultant leisten Sie technische und fachliche Beratung im Bereich Datenanalyse und Business Intelligence in Kundenprojekten. Sie wirken aktiv bei der Implementierung von BI und Analyse Anwendungen vom Frontend (Reporting, Data Mining, etc.) bis zum Backend (Data Warehouse, ETL) mit.

momox is Germany’s leading online buying-and-selling service, where everyone can turn their books, films, CDs, games and clothes into money. Via www.momox.de and the momox app (iOS and Android) we buy used products at fixed prices. We offer the purchased items for sale in our online shops www.medimops.de (media) and www.ubup.com (fashion) and other marketplaces such as Amazon and eBay, faithful to the slogan “We give products a second life”. Since starting, we have grown to become a company of 1,800 dedicated people at four locations in Berlin, Leipzig, Neuenhagen and Stettin. We are active in Germany, Austria, France and Great Britain. In 2018 our employees generated a revenue of 200 million euros. Since our launch, we have bought to sell more than 190 million items.
The people working for us are as diverse as our products. Logistics experts, team players, communication geniuses, creative minds, IT specialists and many more give their best at our four locations. We are still looking for new enthusiastic colleagues.
If you want to be part of this success story, work in an ambitious and loyal team and are seeking a performance challenge as Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d), please continue reading.

YOUR MISSION
You will be part of a team of skilled analysts and data engineers and interact with various stakeholders to put the vast amount of data we own to successful use for our business and our customers. You should be able to understand business driven data problems as well as tech infrastructure and data pipelines.
Collaboration on the strategic orientation of Business Intelligence at momox
Execution of analytics and data science projects from concept to collection of requirements to writing development tickets
Strategic development and automation of our reporting structure (Dashboards and KPIs) in close coordination with stakeholders
Collaborate closely with our data engineers to ensure quality and usability of data
Support the development of our self-service BI platform
Help consolidate a data-driven culture throughout momox
YOUR PROFILE
Successfully completed studies with a degree in economics, computer science, business informatics or a related field
Several years of professional experience in the field of Business Intelligence (e.g. analyst or consultant), preferably in an e-commerce company
Experience with BI reporting tools (Looker, Tableau or similar) and SQL
Excellent communication skills - able to talk to developers and business managers
Hands-on mentality, solution-oriented and structured thinking, very analytical problem solver, high attention to detail
Fluent in English, German is an advantage
Bonus: Practical knowledge of Data Warehousing, ETL processes or Python
Bonus: Experience with statistical methods
YOU CAN LOOK FORWARD TO
Exciting tasks and challenges in the center of Berlin
Agile work environment with flat hierarchies
Motivated, open-minded teams with openness for new impulses
Work-life balance with flexible working hours
Lounge with table football and PlayStation
Fit on the job through running groups, cooperation with Gympass and healthy lunch from smunch
Employee benefits such as discounted public transport ticket, shopping vouchers for our medimops shop, free drinks, fruits and much more
 Individual work environment
Design your ergonomic workspace with height-adjustable desks and the laptop of your choice (MacBook or ThinkPad). We use the latest technology and you even get your own Bose noise cancelling headphones.
Sustainability
We love second hand and integrate our sustainable business idea with simple methods into everyday office life through sustainable consumables, double-sided printing, energy-saving mode on equipment, waste separation, etc.
Training
momox is only as good as you. That's why you will find room and budget for your individual professional development with language classes, internal training, conferences, (online) courses and more.
Open work environment
A bright office with flat hierarchies and open doors. We are a motivated team that is open to new impulses. Bring in your ideas and put them into practice! In our break rooms you will not only find peace and quiet, but also action with kicker, PS4 and Xbox.
1/2 day off on your birthday
On your birthday you get half a day off. Come later, leave earlier or just take another half day of your vacation budget to have the whole day off. Additionally you get half a day off on 24.12. and 31.12.
Team events
We celebrate with the whole team: summer, Christmas, Halloween, monthly breakfasts and movie nights, successes, etc.
Flexible working hours
Whether you are an early bird or a night owl, you decide when you want to start work. The only thing that is important is that you are here at 10 am for the daily standup to exchange and coordinate with the team.
Sport and fitness offers
A personal trainer comes every week to keep us fit or you can join our running group. A shower is provided for cooling down afterwards. Otherwise you can find your favourite sport with Gympass. The mobile massage visits us every 2 weeks.
If you have any further questions, feel free to call: Tina Schimek (Recruiting), Tel: +49 (0)30 610 8007 516
You can find more information about us here: momox.biz/en/career/
This is the right challenge for you? Apply now!

momox GmbH | Schreiberhauer Str. 30 | 10317 Berlin

You will join our successful journey in disrupting the luggage and tech market. Regressionsmodelle) zur Beurteilung der Schuldnerbonität und entsprechenden RealisationswahrscheinlichkeitDu bist in ständigem Austausch zum Data Science, Operations und Legal Team, um externe Effekte in deiner Entscheidungsfindung sofort zu berücksichtigenWas wir von dir erwarten: Du verfügst über mindestens 4 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Risikomanagement oder Risikoanalyse und Portfoliobewertung, idealerweise bei einer Unternehmensberatung oder im Finanzsektor (z.B. Inkassounternehmen, Banken, Ratingagenturen)Du besitzt ein sehr gut abgeschlossenes wirtschafts- oder naturwissenschaftliches Studium mit quantitativem FokusDu hast ein sehr gutes finanzmathematisches Verständnis und hast Erfahrung im Aufbau von Finanzmodellen und PortfolioanalysenDu besitzt sehr gute Excel Kenntnisse (u.a. VBA)Du verfügst über einen hohen Grad an Eigeninitiative, Teamspirit sowie Kommunikationsstärke und hast Spaß daran, proaktiv Lösungen zu findenDu besitzt sehr gute Deutsch- und EnglischkenntnisseWas wir dir bieten: Herausfordernde, abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben für Deine steile Lernkurve.Individuelle Entwicklungsangebote sowie eine transparente, wertschätzende Feedbackkultur für Deine persönliche Weiterentwicklung.Ein internationales Team mit professionellen Kollegen und starken Experten für ein inspirierendes Netzwerk.Team Events für ein erfolgreiches Team.Gutes Gehalt für Deine starken Leistungen.Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung und 28 Urlaubstage für Deine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance.Betriebliche Altersvorsorge und weitere Vergünstigungen für Dein volles Wohlfühlpaket.Modernes Office mit frischen Früchten, Müsli und Getränken für ein angenehmes Arbeitsumfeld.Über PAIR Finance: Digital, effizient und kundenorientiert - unter diesen Leitlinien hat PAIR Finance einen revolutionären Ansatz für das Forderungsmanagement entwickelt, um den Inkassomarkt nachhaltig zu verändern. job_title: Risk Appetite Analyst (m/f/x) Enterprise Risk Management - Risk Strategy
full_text:
Responsibilities:
Task: Complex analysis, evaluation & decision-making
Manage complex data to support risk appetite, strategic risk, and recovery planning
Perform complex analysis across a wide range of data to support the development, embedding and monitoring of risk appetite framework across all dimensions of its implementation
Own the analytical tools and processes around risk appetite and strategic risk and contribute to a wide range of deliveries including the strategic plan, strategic risk (RCP delivery), risk appetite and ad-hoc management requests
Further develop recovery planning tools, such as scenario analysis and QA of countermeasures
Management of large-scale (partial) projects in line with the assigned tasks
Data processing: Collecting complex information and processing it ready for decision-making
Manage finance data relevant for the team and run varied analytics to support appetite statements for businesses and legal entities
Be the point of contact for complex data queries to support strategic risk and risk appetite
Communication of data and high-level analysis to risk-type and business aligned risk management
Support creation of presentation material for working groups and senior management meetings, incorporating complex data and analytics
Improvement: Support development of complex methods, processes or analyses as well as improvements
Drive the improvement of data management and analytics
Maintain complex databases, and build robust and flexible tools to manage, update and present key information for the broader team
Develop processes to ensure robust and reliable retrieval of data for any regulatory/management/audit request and ensure the highest level of quality control
Relationship management
Contribute to preparation of management presentation with a focus on presenting complex data in user friendly ways
Support preparation of training and communication materials to drive organisational implementation and embedding of risk appetite concepts
Prepare responses to ad hoc queries from senior risk management, regulators and audit
Requirements:
Education and Experience:
University degree - quantitative discipline preferred (e.g. mathematics, statistics, economics)
Two+ years of relevant working experience
Competencies:
Good knowledge of regulations related to risk management and minimum standards (e.g. Basel, CRD regulations, CRR etc.)
Theoretical and practical knowledge of quantitative and qualitative risk management techniques; risk or finance qualifications supporting this knowledge desirable but not essential
Very strong analytical skills, specifically ability to analyse and order large amounts of data from a number of inhomogeneous data sources
Precise working style and strong attention to detail
Strong Microsoft Office skills: Excel, Word and PowerPoint; VBA and SAS experience a plus
Personal characteristics:
Capable of working autonomously in a structured and well-organized manner, given geographically dispersed nature of the team
Very strong analytical mind-set, with high attention to detail
Within Deutsche Bank’s Risk division, Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) 's mission is to shape Bank strategy and risk management at enterprise level, unconstrained by risk types and geographies, together with ERM's partners across Risk and the Bank.
ERM manages the enterprise-level risk management framework so that all risks are identified, owned and controlled Bank-wide, within the agreed risk appetite and aligned to the bank’s stated culture. ERM will:
Manage enterprise risk appetite and application across businesses and legal entities
Integrate and aggregate risks to provide greater enterprise risk transparency to support decision making
Govern and improve the effectiveness of risk management framework
Commission forward looking stress tests, and manage group recovery and resolution plans
The ERM Risk Appetite/ Strategic risk/ recovery planning team performs a number of key tasks: (i) monitors and coordinates the implementation of the Group Risk Appetite framework across the group, divisions, businesses and all relevant Legal Entities, (ii) challenges DB’s strategic plan (iii) is responsible for DB’s recovery plan and (iv) drives consistent risk management standards across the Bank. The team is heavily integrated within the various activities carried out by ERM as a whole (for example, risk identification) works with all global business divisions and Risk functions as well as some of the key strategic functions performed by Finance (for example, Planning and Performance Management).
Within ERM you will be able to work in a creative and diverse working environment, giving you the opportunity to become familiar with various topics and divisions within the Bank and to broaden your technical and personal skills.
Marlene Müller da Silva

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
