SUMMER & WINTER PARTY
RELOCATION
Send us your CV and become a part of Huuuge Games!
(Remember about including your consent to the processing of your personal data for the recruitment process. Please note that we will contact only selected candidates.)

By applying to Huuuge for this job, you agree to the Huuuge privacy policy available here. The controller of your data is the employer within the Huuuge group who is responsible for hiring the person according to the job post. Your data is being processed to review your application and to start and conclude the recruitment process, and we will continue to process your data in case of a potential legal claim related to the recruitment for the purpose of meeting such claim. Upon your consent, we will save your personal data in order to contact you regarding other job openings or opportunities after the position has been filled. Learn more about our Privacy Policy for job applicants.

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


WHICH PRODUCT TEAMS


Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization

At HelloFresh, our mission is to change the way people eat - forever. From our 2011 founding in Europe's vibrant tech hub Berlin, we've become the global market leader in the meal kit sector and inspire millions of energised home cooks across the globe every week.

We offer our meal kit boxes full of exciting recipes and thoughtfully sourced, fresh ingredients in more than 12 countries, operating from offices in Berlin, New York City, Sydney, Toronto, London, Amsterdam and Copenhagen and shipped out more than 250 Million meals in 2019.

Our more than 5,000 employees are the heart and soul of our highly international, fast-paced, and dynamic environment where innovation and smart, fast action is encouraged.

We want you to join us and help take HelloFresh to the next level - as a company in its growth phase this is a great time to join. Career and development opportunities are endless.

We will encourage you to make an immediate impact in your area of work as well as empower you to grow your career with us.

-------------
About the job
-------------


As part of our Berlin-based Marketing Business Intelligence team, you will be providing detailed insights into our customer behaviour and business performance to enable data-driven strategic decision making across 10+ countries world-wide
You will work closely with a wide range of stakeholders and translate their business questions into meaningful analytics - combining commercial and technical understanding
Your work will span across creating ad-hoc insights, AB testing, streamlining analysis processes and setting up and maintaining the reporting landscape for Marketing teams
You will be utilising various databases and querying/programming languages to access and manipulate the data needed
You will present and discuss the results of your work to stakeholders of all seniority
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other collleagues

----------------------
Who we're looking for?
----------------------


3+ years of experience in Business Intelligence/ Analytics/ Data Science. Experience in e-commerce and consulting background would be a plus
A degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Business Analytics, or similar quantitative discipline
A passion for numbers, an analytical mind and curiosity to proactively dig deeper into business-critical topics
You are advanced with SQL, have some experience with Python and are always keen on learning more on the technical side
Experience with AB Testing and good statistical knowledge would be a big plus
You shine while interacting with your stakeholders, you like an international atmosphere and are business fluent in English
You enjoy searching for the best ways the visualize data and have first-hand experience with tools like Tableau
Experience in the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) area would be a big plus

-------------
What we offer
-------------


The chance to have a serious impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase
A guaranteed steep learning curve & a boost for your career
Competitive compensation with annual budget for training and development
A vibrant international environment
Work in our office located in the heart of Berlin
Windows or Apple equipment (depending on preference)
Sabbatical policy
A range of additional perks (significant reduction on your HelloFresh boxes, weekly allowance for HelloFresh GO vending machines, budget for German classes, discounts for our neighboring Fitness Studio & Urban Sports Club, weekly Yoga Classes, Friday Beers, Summer & Winter parties, daily fruits in the office)

Closely monitor customers' on-site activities and find areas for on-site improvement

Be the analytics's point person who supports marketing stakeholders in their day-to-day work

Yes, we're friendly. Here's our story!

Casper (casper.com) is a global sleep company that launched in 2014 with an obsessively engineered, outrageously comfortable mattress sold directly to consumers. Its critically acclaimed sleep surface was developed in-house, has a sleek design, and is delivered in a small, "how did they do that?"-sized box. The company is one of the fastest-growing consumer brands of all time, and its product line has expanded to include sheets, pillows and a dog mattress. Casper was named one of Fast Company's 50 Most Innovative Companies in 2017, and its eponymous mattress was crowned one of TIME Magazine's Best Inventions.

Free snacks and coffee
A full gifted bed set when you join (mattress, sheets, pillows, the works)!

If you dream about this stuff this job is probably right for you. We look forward to learning more about you, but if you're feeling sleepy, take a nap before applying!

PRICING DATA ANALYST
BERLIN
SALARY 60.000- 80.000
THE COMPANY
My client is Europe's leading online platform, connecting customers, brands and partners across several markets. They drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing products to many customers every day.
THE ROLE
A Pricing Data Analyst in the Pricing & Forecasting team is passionate about creating accurate data solutions and have a proven record of developing trusting relationships with product and commercial leads who will turn your insights into actions.
Build and improve upon the system which measures sales forecasting, price optimisation and customer lifetime value
Act as the point of contact between Analytics and external product, engineering and ops teams to ensure key projects are successful
Build and own periodic reporting - Take advantage of the ever-growing amount of data we have at the fingertips to help stakeholders build best in class forecasting tools
Managing and leading key initiatives in the Analytics team and Pricing & Forecasting
Mentor and guide junior members of the Analytics team
YOUR SKILLSET
3+ years of experience using data to build analytical solutions at industry leading companies in Technology, Retail or e-commerce.
Ability to turn complex findings and results into a compelling narrative and a set of actions

Undergraduate degree in a technical field (Science, Economics, Physics, Maths, Engineering)
Led or contributing to a complex technical project related to analytics, testing or data modelling/Warehousing
Experience mentoring or leading
Great communication skills
Passion for analytics as a craft
THE BENEFITS
Flexible working hours with the option of working from home
Develop your skills with your personal educational budget for conferences and external training
Learn German with free classes, access our e-learning platform and participate in our in-house training

We’re looking for an analytics expert who can decipher data and help optimise our online presence. Ready to make an international impact with your skills? Then keep reading…
Our story (the bitesize version):

Need gyoza for your guests or craving a post-work pizza? That’s what we’re here for. Whether they know us as Lieferando.de, Takeaway.com or even just ‘that food app’, we’re connecting food fans with the dishes they love, in cities across 11 countries – from Berlin to Bucharest!
But at our heart, we’re a tech company. While our partner restaurants cook up the food, we’re focused on everything from app development to analytics. That’s where you come in.
All about the role:
In a sentence: you’ll be leading data quality. That means being able to identify, track and use data to help optimise the user experience. You’ll be spotting improvement points and troubleshooting tracking implementations, as well as acting as our Google Analytics expert.
You’re also the first point of contact for colleagues, offering behavioural analytics and website optimisation in a range of areas – including Product and various IT-related matters. And we’re also counting on you to:
Understand what stakeholders need, communicating clearly and delivering the solution
Assist with insights from the digital analytics platform, helping various departments optimise internal and external, web and mobile app products
Understand how data is gathered and processed by a range of different analysing tools
Regularly use Tag Management systems like Tealium and Google Tag Manager to boost our functionality
Can you deliver…

Think you’re our next Web Analyst? That’s great. Even better if you can say ‘yes’ to the following:
3+ years’ experience as a Web/ Product Analyst, Conversion Optimisation Specialist or similar
Significant working knowledge of A/B Testing, SQL and Tag Management System/Tracking debugging
Nice to have: Experience with dashboarding software like Tableau
Fluent in English
Experience with with user facing application optimisation and tracking for desktop and/or mobile apps
Strong background in using and managing Google Analytics and/ or Firebase, Optimizely and similar tools
Enjoy helping and sharing knowledge with colleagues in various departments

Here’s our offer:
It’s not all about what we need from you. Here’s a taste of what makes working here extra special:
Competitive salary
27 days of annual leave
Amazing workplace events like our summer party and snow event
Opportunities to develop and progress in a scalable international company
A dynamic, welcoming workplace at the heart of Berlin
A contribution to your pension plan
Office amenities: Great coffee, ping pong and our popular Friday drinks (to name a few!)
Ready to take our analytics to the next level? Click the button below to send us your motivational letter and CV.

Company Description

reBuy reCommerce GmbH
reBuy is the simple buying and selling Internet Shop. Users can buy and sell refurbished media and electronic items. Compared to online auction houses and marketplaces reBuy is particularly simple, fast and secure in its user interface and implementation. All in all, users can buy refurbished qualitative products up to 50% cheaper. All items are sold with an 36-months functional warranty.

Job Description

What’s the opportunity?
As the Head of CRM, you will be responsible for defining and delivering our CRM strategy. reBuy is the largest re-commerce platform for electronics and media in Europe. Success in this role will lead to significantly higher customer loyalty and growth, and offers real potential for personal development.

What will I be doing?
Supporting and developing the existing CRM team, you'll step by step create a more personalised future where reBuy builds an authentic emotional bond to customers. You'll work with customer service, product, data, engineering, content marketing, and category managers to ensure consistency and real customer value is at the heart of all communication. To be successful, you'll balance the big picture with minute detail, and provide an outstanding atmosphere for your team and colleagues to prosper.
Example work in this role:
Create and own the CRM strategy. You will design a crm strategy that supports our company strategy, stays relevant as the business evolves, and delivers tangible value covering all relevant communication platforms.
Drive evolution to personalised messaging to build emotional connection with customers, bringing it to life in a clear and consistent way that resonates with and motivates our target audiences. You’ll choose and lead our mix of internal and external tooling to deliver this.
Evidenced based experiments are meticulously designed and run on a weekly and monthly basis to gain insights to customer behaviour and the value of our program.
Collaborate and lead across the organization. You will directly lead and mentor a growing team of experts across CRM, engineers, analysts, and designers. You will represent the voice of the CRM, and the customer within the organization, bringing your insights, and ensuring a consistent message across Content, Marketing, Onsite Merchandising, Product, Customer Service, and Logistics.
Make a lasting impact on society and the environment working with a purpose driven company with sustainability at its core.

Qualifications

What skills do I need?
An experienced leader of CRM teams, ideally with an ecommerce or other high volume business. Able to define a strategy, KPIs, forecast, and steps to deliver.
Deep user and customer empathy with dedication to offering authentic value while growing the business.
A true servant leader capable of supporting an ambitious team
Fluent user of data, from tracking technology, storage, streaming, analysis, and are able to alter both tactics and strategy as needed.
Demonstrate experience and ability with CRM delivery technology, personalisation, and predictive analytics.
Exceptional communication and organisation skills allow you to operate effectively with all levels of the organisation, across multiple verticals.
A passion for setting CRM up right, in a sustainable business that matters.
Additional Information

We are offering an exciting job in an innovation-friendly company within an inspiring and flourishing environment. We are the Grown-Up Start-Up: with several years of experience and nevertheless with the young spirit of continuous innovation. We will provide you state of the art hardware in a modern office in the heart of Berlin-Schöneberg. Fresh fruits, free drinks and many company events are awaiting you at reBuy! Our hierarchy is and will always be flat. Our atmosphere is open-minded: Something you want to change? Or something to introduce? Let us talk about it. Our goals are ambitious and they will lead us to exciting paths.

TD Reply, ein Unternehmen der Reply AG, ist eine Innovations- und Marketing-Beratung. idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).

Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization

Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. CENTOGENE AG is a global leader in the field of genetic diagnostics for hereditary diseases. The international certified (CAP/CLIA/ISO) company is a globally operating biotechnology company with headquarters in Rostock and Berlin and international offices (Dubai, Delhi, Vienna, Boston, etc.).
CENTOGENE is supported by the application of cutting-edge technologies (whole exome/genome sequencing, large organ-specific panels, innovative biomarkers based on high-end mass-spectrometry) and is constantly developing new innovative products in the field of genetics. The analysis of samples from more than 115 countries as well as our it-based (big data, artificial intelligence), molecular knowledge is the basis for the constantly development of the largest mutation database for hereditary diseases(CentoMD®). CENTOGENE is also an strong international partner for multiple renowned pharmaceutical companies in the orphan drug market.

Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Berlin, Dalia develops B2B/SaaS solutions to facilitate market and opinion research in >100 countries. We harness the app economy and advanced data science to distribute millions of micro-surveys worldwide to gather and analyze real-time data on consumer attitudes, public opinion, and market trends. Backed by some of Europe's leading venture capital firms, Dalia is one of Germany's fastest-growing tech startups with a team from 29 different countries driven by one mission: to generate information that helps us better understand the world around us.

We are looking for a Senior Python Developer to work in close collaboration with Data Science, Business Intelligence, Engineering, and others to steer innovation in Dalia's data analytics capacities.

The journey that awaits you:

You will be a key catalyst for enabling our data scientists to conceptualize and implement algorithmic solutions to challenging problems. This can include machine learning techniques, but also definition and analysis of product use cases.
You will work on MRP (Multi-level Regression and Poststratification) and machine learning algorithms, both of which are revolutionising the way we extract insights from the tremendous amount of survey data we collect from tens of millions of people in over 150 countries.
Ultimately, you will have a one of a kind opportunity to work on the tools and technologies which enable organisations around the world to make better data-driven decisions.

Your challenge:

Take full ownership of the Python-based codebase for all machine learning models and analytics-driven solutions.
Become the internal expert on all things Python, working shoulder to shoulder with our Data Scientists and Data Analysts, plus our Business Intelligence, Engineering, DevOps, Researchers and Analysts when needed.
Deliver clean, maintainable and error-proof code with good test coverage. Write test automation, conduct code reviews, and take end-to-end ownership, from development to production.
Design the architecture with the goal of making our codebase better, faster, and scalable.

Your profile includes:

Over 5 years of software development experience within a professional setting.
Proven expertise with Python.
Any experience with scikit-learn, pymc3, theano, pandas, numpy, jupyter, falcon and django is a plus.
Strong computer science fundamentals: data structures and algorithms.
In-depth understanding of software architecture.
Strong experience in DB Design, SQL queries and optimisation.
Great Object Oriented coding practices, including strong design pattern knowledge, Refactoring, Clean Code, Domain Driven Design and Encapsulation.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines.
Proven experience with AWS Services.
Experience with Docker/Containers.
Excellent command of written and spoken English.
Strong inner drive to get things done: you are able to work autonomously without micro-management and possess the self-motivation and inner drive to set and deliver against tight deadlines.

Dalia Research is committed to providing a respectful, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone who works here or with us, regardless of their gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, or religion (or lack thereof).

Strategic Business Analyst - Geo Scaling (m/f/d)
Location: Berlin, Germany
Salary: EUR 70-85k
THE COMPANY
Leading Berlin start-up in the digital advertising and programmatic field with the mission to disrupt the digital display Out-Of-Home market in a never before seen fashion are looking to bring in a passionate, open and analytically minded individual for the role Strategic Business Analyst - Geo Scaling.
Having grown from a few visionary early employees to a thriving post-Series A company in a short period of time, the company is determined to provide best in-class service to anyone looking to advertise. Berlin is in focus right now with other metropolitan areas and territories to follow. The goal is to completely digitize and open up an old economy vertical with an innovative platform backed by a highly recognized and very well-funded management team. In addition, the scaling of this platform will enable advertisers to move their message away from personal devices into a public yet highly personalized space with unmatched programmatic potential.
THE ROLE
The Strategic Business Analyst aims at leveraging their personality, analytical and data skills to enable the creation, alignment and execution of an all-encompassing go to market strategy as a vital part of the strategic business development team. The role provides excellent opportunities to apply your experience and creativity in leading the effort to identify potential national as well as international growth opportunities, conduct due diligence, competitive analysis and financial modelling on potential targets and facilitate the positioning and communication of the brand in the digital Out-Of-Home market space.
The company is scaling globally - you will point them in the right direction with data!
Identify, analyse and present go to market routes as well as scenario models in close collaboration with the leads for sales, marketing, tech and the CEO and founders
Conduct due diligence and financial analysis on revenue, pricing, growth and scaling opportunities including on site market research in the territories
Leverage existing market and user understanding and make the right choices to build on it further and shed light on previously opaque market structures
Manage the growth and scaling operation by providing strategic as well as ad-hoc analysis for operational personnel, leadership and investors
Critical assessment of the viability of the business model in various territories
Challenge leadership/founders to bulletproof and develop their business model
Define the market potential and anticipate market developments and act as an inhouse consultant by constantly thinking ahead
REQUIREMENTS
Proven experience in valuations, financial projections, assessment, screening, initial due diligence and preparation of CIM modelling
Experience in preparing presentation and other materials showcasing analysis results
Initial experience in scenario building, geo scaling analysis and on-site research
Assist leadership in monitoring performance by providing valuations, financial forecasts, operating models, markets and stage analysis in an anticipatory fashion
Experience in high-growth digital/tech environment or related on the VC/PE beneficial
Fluent English, both verbally and in writing, German is a plus
Entrepreneurial, proactive and results-driven personality that is not only highly analytical but also creative and hands-on in nature
Collaborative team player with sophisticated influencing skills and alignment oriented
HOW TO APPLY
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Peter Schroeter via the Apply link on this page.

As Principal Incident Response Analyst (m/f/d) at our location in Berlin or Gütersloh you are responsible for verification, assessment and classification of reported Cyber Security incidents. You communicate incident remediation status and escalates to relevant parties, lead incident response projects and countermeasure coordination with affected parties and review incidents after closure for potential defense and process improvements. Finally, you develop substantial improvements in process and tooling.

Tasks and Responsibilities

Lead incident response analyst teams including incident detection, analysis, containment, eradication, recovery and chain of evidence/ forensic artifacts required for additional investigations
Review and analyze incidents escalated from Monitoring Analyst Team and validate incident risk and priority scoring
Utilize advanced network and host forensic tools in order to triage and scope an incident.
Perform investigation and analytics of network and host-based payloads and artifacts in relation to the incident
Correlate additional context from Threat Intelligence team for incident during investigation and analysis
Participate vulnerability management processes
Lead project teams to ensure that corporate data and technology platform components are safeguarded from known threats
Create recommendations and requirements for content detection and response, enhancements to response process & procedures and systems
Provide technical support for forensics services to include evidence seizure, computer forensic analysis and data recovery, in support of computer crime investigation

Qualifications

Basic understanding of Operating Systems, Virtualization technologies, Network Devices, Cloud computing concepts, Web Proxies, Firewalls, Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems, Antivirus Systems, Data Loss Prevention, Vulnerability Assessment tools
Strong understanding of security incident management, malware management and vulnerability management processes
Ability to follow through on all phases of the incident response and identify attacks, determine initial vectors, and complete scope of incidents
Good understanding of basic security principles with an understanding of malware, cryptography, threats and vulnerabilities, access control as well as application, data, and host security
Knowledge of TCP/IP Protocols, network analysis, and network/security applications and common Internet protocols and applications
Experience in troubleshooting in a technical environment as well as basic forensics tools and web history tools
Excellent English and German written and verbal skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, case management and ticketing system

Personal Qualities

Innovative and eager to learn in a rapidly evolving field
Personality traits, work habits, communication, and social skills necessary to work effectively within a dynamic and highly operational environment
Exemplary personal and professional integrity and demonstrate strong interpersonal skills
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail
Ability to manage multiple tasks, priorities, and operational assignments in a high-pressure environment
Must have good time management skills with a demonstrated ability to complete assignments in a timely, high quality manner

Working Conditions & Compensation

Shift work required
On-call/stand-by availability required
Salary: Based on experience, education and certification
Travel: on occasion
Security Operation Center positions require employees to obtain and maintain a security clearance

Pool Office auf Zypern – Eine Woche im Jahr im sonnigen Pool House arbeiten
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Regelmäßige Agentur- und Teamevents

Dann freuen wir uns über die Zusendung deiner aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf, relevante Zeugnisse, Gehaltswunsch, nächstmöglicher Eintrittstermin; formatiert im PDF Format) über unser Online-Bewerbungsformular.

As the Data Management area at idealo, we are building a cutting-edge, cloud-based data platform suitable for self-service analytics as well as for machine learning, data products, and our enterprise reporting. We believe that a data-driven approach is a key success factor for our business. Therefore we aim to enable our technical and non-technical internal customers to base their everyday business decisions on the hypothesis that are proved by data.

We are looking for a Product Owner highly passionate about self-service analytics, data processing as code and as a service and data related engineering. Together with a team of engineers, data scientists and analysts, you help other teams and areas to succeed by incorporating the decisive data at the right time and in the right way. By that you will have a large impact on transforming the business at idealo, using the power of data.

Tasks


Be part of our leadership team in the data management area
Be a key player in the OKR planning process for our area
Translate objectives into tactics and a road-map
Use leading and lagging indicators to measure progress and success
Focus your team on delivering iterative value to our internal customers
Drive data awareness and the spread of an analytical mindset in the company
Work closely with a variety of stakeholders and derive product ideas for platform products and features from their needs
Own platform products which support technical and non-technical teams in generating insights based on data, end-to-end
Be a role model for hypothesis-driven product development

Requirements


You have a passion for solving business issues from an analytical point of view
You are familiar with agile and lean software development frameworks and have used them before
You aim for impact and outcome, not just output
You have a background in data analysis, data engineering or data science
You love to (and know how to) communicate with a wide range of stakeholders, like product owners, directors, developers
You have a basic understanding of good practices in software engineering, like pair programming, testing, clean code
You are fluent in English

Benefits


Upon starting at idealo you will get all the equipment you need to perform at your best and are invited to our welcome days for OnBoarding
We offer a large degree of responsibility and freedom in an international and inspirational environment
We provide training opportunities for your individual management or specialist career
We share knowledge and learnings through tech talks, tech communities, and product demos
We value our culture of trust, freedom, and responsibility. Employees are self-reliant and free to schedule their own work day
800 motivated colleagues, 37 childcare spots at our company Kita, and a cool office loft in the trendy district of Kreuzberg in Berlin!

idealo is a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Today, with 1.5 million visits per day, 50,000 shops and more than 330 million product offers, we are one of the most popular German e-commerce websites and one of the leading European shopping and comparison platforms. We are active as a price comparison platform in six countries (Austria, France, Germany, Great Britain, Italy and Spain).

As a member of our team, you can look forward to working with a large degree of freedom in an international and inspirational environment. We are located in the heart of Berlin and offer a unique idealo spirit. Your ideas are the driving force that moves our business forward. Not only our product portfolio is diverse, but also the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation or a degree of disability are irrelevant.

If you are passionate about improving the world of online shopping alongside 800 idealos from 40 nations, apply with us today.

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


WHICH PRODUCT TEAMS


Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. As a Product Analyst in the content composition team, you will work with data scientists and engineers, draw insights from the complex interaction of content, customers, and Zalando’s business and help to understand why which content is successful in front of the customer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle , connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Your profile:
You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.
