As the Business Development Analyst at JOIN.com you will be a pivotal driver to JOIN’s hyper growth and the upscaling of a product, that has gained traction with over 3000 clients worldwide, like Project A, foodspring, LimeBike and many more.

Together we will make hiring smarter, easier, and more efficient!

Tasks


Proactively supporting the management team to continuously improve the performance of the company
Contributing (through your analyses) to the increase in sales, as well as commitment and retention of customers
Analyzing customer acquisition data, identifying potential optimization and translating that into concrete measures
Design and implementation of controlling tools and measures
Generating reports and analyses on the development of different markets and compile target / actual comparisons for the management team
Working hands-on within the multifunctional team to implement measures and be responsible for their successful implementation

Requirements


You have successfully completed your degree in the fields of economics, business or mathematics
You already have 1-3 years of relevant work experience
You have a strong analytical understanding, you are structured, and you like to work quantitatively
You have an "Entrepreneurial Mindset", are hands-on and a team player
You are interested in the topics of sales and marketing and enjoy the optimization of processes
You know the common tools for statistical analysis of data (e.g. R, SPSS, Excel) and are ideally familiar with CRMs
You are fluent in English and German (spoken and written)

Benefits


A strong involvement and the opportunity to bring yourself and your ideas throughout the company and thus help shape product and customer developments
A diverse and highly motivated team in a dynamic environment
Start-up feeling, flat hierarchies, short decision-making paths and an inspiring international working atmosphere
Challenging tasks in our office in the heart of Berlin Mitte
The unique opportunity to help shape the revolution in recruiting at JOIN from an early stage

Hiring shouldn't be difficult and time-consuming, so we decided to build JOIN.com from the ground up to bring recruiting to the next level. We have scaled rapidly, attracting thousands of clients both in Europe and worldwide, with tens of thousands of candidates trusting our product. All this within a year of inception, making JOIN the fastest growing HR Tech startup on the market.

Are you ready to conquer the HR world by storm?!

---------------------
About the opportunity
---------------------

We are seeking a AFC QA Manager to lead and develop the existing QA structure within the Anti Financial Crime unit.

Our AFC function prevents and protects our bank from illegal activities, including departments such as KYC, Fraud and AML. As the AFC QA Manager, you will focus on maintaining and developing the QA structure and processes for our internal agent and external vendors.

-----------------------

In this role, you will:
-----------------------


Lead, grow and mentor the AFC QA team of 6+ analysts and growing
Consolidate and refine QA requirements for failed and successful reviews in existing structure of AFC ops and AFC compliance operations
Refining current processes, work with dedicated data resource to create the benchmark metrics for QA across different variables
Performance management, quality check, and workflow distribution within team
Lead AFC QA training team for internal functions and external vendors
Collaborate closely with vendor QC function in business operations/sourcing team
Act as liaison between upper management and team

-------------------------------

What you need to be successful:
-------------------------------


Related business degree/banking apprenticeship, 3+ years' AFC QA experience, banking experience highly preferred
1+ year team leading experience required, team building experience strongly preferred
Experience collaborating with and managing external vendor
Experience with qualitative and quantitative compliance measures
Superb excel skills, end to end project management experience preferred
Excellent communicator (fluency in English is a must!), strong stakeholder management skills
Strong problem solver who thrives in a fast pace and change driven environment

---------------------------

What's in it for you:
---------------------------


High degree of autonomy
Working with international, highly engaged peers ( https://medium.com/insiden26/our-500th-employee-milestone-f7769656271e )
Flat hierarchy and open communication
Getting things done attitude
Find a career path. Not just a job. Some of our benefits such as gym subsidy, BVG ticket subsidy, premium bank account, brown bag lunch, bring your dog to work twice a week...etc

----------
Who we are
----------

N26 has reimagined banking for today's digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do ( https://n26.com/en-eu/blog-archive/category/company ) and it's how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

N26 ( https://n26.com/en-eu/about-n26 ) has international offices in Berlin, Barcelona, New York and Vienna.

------

------

Sound good? Apply now for this position.

------

------

N26 is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Was erwartet dich?
Du unterstützt deine Kollegen aus Strategie und Performance Marketing bei der Recherche von digitalen Ökosystemen und der Analyse von datengetriebenen Marketingmaßnahmen
Du hilfst mit, Unternehmen und Social Media Kanäle aus externer Perspektive systematisch auszuwerten, daraus Wissen zu extrahieren und dieses anschaulich aufzubereiten.

Was solltest du mitbringen?
akademischer Hintergrund (zum Beispiel Mathe, Statistik, Physik, IT oder Wirtschaftswissenschaft)
Immatrikulation in „Data Science“ von Vorteil, aber kein Muss
erste Berufserfahrung (Praktikum) in Daten- und Wettbewerbsanalysen
fit in Excel; Interesse an Datenverarbeitungstools
gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, um komplexe Ergebnisse verständlich zu erklären
gute Powerpoint-Skills
neugierig auf innovative Marken- und Kommunikationsstrategien
perfektes Deutsch, sehr gute Englischkenntnisse

Was bieten wir dir?
Herausfordernde Projekte, namhafte Kunden
Inspirierenden Austausch mit 40 wunderbaren Kollegen aus den unterschiedlichsten Disziplinen
Getränke, Obst und Snacks
Gute Anbindung an die ÖPNV

Wenn diese Stelle dein Interesse weckt, bewirb dich jetzt über Campusjäger bei uns! Wir freuen uns darauf.

SENIOR DATA ANALYST - CONTENT ATTRIBUTION (F/D/M)
BERLIN
SALARY: 70,000 - 80,000 + BONUS + BENEFITS
My Client is Europe's largest E-Commerce company based in Berlin, Germany. The company follows a platform approach, offering Fashion and Lifestyle products to customers in multiple European markets. Join them now and give your career a home and focus on Marketing data.
THE ROLE
As an Analyst in the Attribution Team, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimising the Clients on-site content.
They build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of the Companies features & campaigns.
You will be helping the internal customers to analyse media content on website and app based real-time data, available in various data sources. Your primary role would involve identifying business problems based on requirements from stakeholders, coming up with solutions, creating reports and dashboards.
Work with large data sets to solve difficult cases, applying advanced analytical methods.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make recommendations and building data visualisations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from SQL and using statistics.
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Degree with an analytical focus (Statistics, Psychology, Mathematics )
3 years minimum relevant experience
Extensive SQL knowledge. Experience with large Data sets
Knowledge of Python/R
Google Analytics experience
THE BENEFITS
flexible working hours schemes and diverse career opportunities
individual development programs and international perspectives
company pension scheme and modern health care services
Discounts
Sounds interesting? Send your CV to Dominik Probst via the Apply link on this page

job_title: Working Student – Web Analyst & User Tracking- (m/f/d)
full_text:
Scout24 operates ImmobilienScout24 – the leading digital real estate classifieds platform in Germany, based on consumer traffic and time spent as well as customer numbers and listings. As market leader we have built an extensive dataset on offers and demand in the German real estate market for more than 20 years now. Our Data& Analytics team plays a key role in taking this data, and turning it into smart products with the use of state-of-the-art Machine Learning. Thus, we empower a more personalized user experience, make the real estate market more transparent and bring tedious offline tasks during real estate transactions online – all aligned to our company goal of turning www.immobilienscout24.de ( http://www.immobilienscout24.de/ ) into the networked marketplace for real estates.

Your Tasks:

Support the Insights & Analytics team at Scout24 AG! We need help in improving our company-wide User Tracking Environment.
You support complex tracking processes such as enhanced e-commerce concepts or customized business measurements using our tag management system
You help to improve and revise our JavaScript-based tracking environment across platforms (Web, iOS, Android)
You help the automation of quality assurance processes in our user tracking environment
You are in exchange with business and tech colleagues to support and optimize our tracking implementations
You act out your analytical streak within the Data & Analytics team

What we need you to bring:

You are enrolled in a university or technical college
You have a solid understanding of web and app technologies (JavaScript, JSON, Cookies, LocalStorage)
Interest in working with tag management tools like Tealium and Google Tag Manager
You like to work in teams and have an analytical and conceptual way of working
You have good communication skills as you mediate between marketing/product teams and the data department
Basic knowledge of web analytics tools such as Google Analytics would be nice to have

What you can expect from us:
At Scout24 we value the diversity of our employees as much as our users' individual life scripts. Our doors are open for everyone and free of stereotyped thinking. The power of our team grows with the variety of individual perspectives. Our culture embraces a workplace that fits in with your personal way of life. Together, we build leading digital marketplaces in Europe. Some of the things we offer include:


Support to pass Google Analytics certification (GAIQ) and access to related online courses for self-learning (ScoutAcademy, Udemy, Coursera)
An environment that provides the opportunity for impact you would find in a start-up combined with the resources of a market leader
Competitive salaries, an attractive company pension plan and personal benefits such as gym membership discount as a start
Great work-life balance, including flexible working hours, home office and 30 days of vacation annually
A commitment to diversity and a positive environment where we are not just colleagues but teammates and friends
Continuous development including skills training, language courses, and many other workshops and sessions
Our on-site canteen, fresh fruit, free drinks and more

Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Berlin, Dalia develops B2B/SaaS solutions to facilitate market and opinion research in >100 countries. We harness the app economy and advanced data science to distribute millions of micro-surveys worldwide to gather and analyze real-time data on consumer attitudes, public opinion, and market trends. Backed by some of Europe’s leading venture capital firms, Dalia is one of Germany’s fastest-growing tech startups with a team from 29 different countries driven by one mission: to generate information that helps us better understand the world around us.

We are looking for a Senior Python Developer to work in close collaboration with Data Science, Business Intelligence, Engineering, and others to steer innovation in Dalia’s data analytics capacities.

The journey that awaits you:

You will be a key catalyst for enabling our data scientists to conceptualize and implement algorithmic solutions to challenging problems. This can include machine learning techniques, but also definition and analysis of product use cases.

You will work on MRP (Multi-level Regression and Poststratification) and machine learning algorithms, both of which are revolutionising the way we extract insights from the tremendous amount of survey data we collect from tens of millions of people in over 150 countries.

Ultimately, you will have a one of a kind opportunity to work on the tools and technologies which enable organisations around the world to make better data-driven decisions.

Your challenge:

Take full ownership of the Python-based codebase for all machine learning models and analytics-driven solutions.
Become the internal expert on all things Python, working shoulder to shoulder with our Data Scientists and Data Analysts, plus our Business Intelligence, Engineering, DevOps, Researchers and Analysts when needed.
Deliver clean, maintainable and error-proof code with good test coverage. Write test automation, conduct code reviews, and take end-to-end ownership, from development to production.
Design the architecture with the goal of making our codebase better, faster, and scalable.


Your profile includes:

Over 5 years of software development experience within a professional setting.
Proven expertise with Python.
Any experience with scikit-learn, pymc3, theano, pandas, numpy, jupyter, falcon and django is a plus.
Strong computer science fundamentals: data structures and algorithms.
In-depth understanding of software architecture.
Strong experience in DB Design, SQL queries and optimisation.
Great Object Oriented coding practices, including strong design pattern knowledge, Refactoring, Clean Code, Domain Driven Design and Encapsulation.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines.
Proven experience with AWS Services.
Experience with Docker/Containers.
Excellent command of written and spoken English.
Strong inner drive to get things done: you are able to work autonomously without micro-management and possess the self-motivation and inner drive to set and deliver against tight deadlines.
Dalia Research is committed to providing a respectful, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone who works here or with us, regardless of their gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, or religion (or lack thereof).

PRODUCT ANALYST- MACHINE LEARNING (W/D/M)
BERLIN
SALARY 60.000- 80.000
THE COMPANY
My client is Europe's leading online platform, connecting customers, brands and partners across several markets. They drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing products to many customers every day.
THE ROLE
As a Product Analyst dedicated to the algorithmic pricing product, you will generate critical data-driven insights by understanding customers and acting as a key interface between the business and data science teams.
Leverage the data to identify what drives the business impact of the product and where the biggest opportunities are. Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology.
Recommend new product features and collaborate closely with the team of engineers and data scientists in developing and testing them.
Monitor the product performance by developing reporting solutions and performing ad-hoc analysis.
Communicate with departmental and cross-departmental stakeholders.
Own the A/B-testing pipeline. Coordinate A/B test setup, monitor ongoing tests, and analyze results.
YOUR SKILL-SET
3+ years of experience using data to build analytical solutions at big industry leading companies in technology, Retail or E-Commerce and an eagerness to develop as an analyst, product manager, or data scientist
Ability to turn complex findings and results into a compelling narrative and a set of actions
Familiarity with SQL and an objection-oriented programming language (Python, R, Java)
Excellent educational background in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or similar quantitative field.
THE BENEFITS
Flexible working hours with the option of working from home
Develop your skills with your personal educational budget for conferences and external training
Learn German with free classes, access our e-learning platform and participate in our in-house training
Save responsibly with our attractive corporate pension options
Join company parties, team, cultural and sports events
Daily fruits, cereals, beverages, tea and coffee in our lounges
HOW TO APPLY
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Dominik Probst via the apply link on this page.

job_title: Oliver Wyman - Team Leader - FSQA - Berlin
full_text:
WHO WE ARE
Oliver Wyman is a global leader in management consulting. With offices in 60 cities across 29 countries, Oliver Wyman combines deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise in strategy, operations, risk management, and organization transformation. The firm has more than 5,000 professionals around the world who work with clients to optimize their business, improve their operations and risk profile, and accelerate their organizational performance to seize the most attractive opportunities. Oliver Wyman is a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies [NYSE: MMC]. For more information, visitwww.oliverwyman.com. Follow Oliver Wyman on Twitter @OliverWyman.
Financial Services Quantitative Analytics is a specialist business unit within Oliver Wyman, set up in Newcastle-upon-Tyne in 2017 and has since expanded to Milan and Berlin. The business unit has a fast-paced start-up culture and provides high quality quantitative analytics for Oliver Wyman's global client base with a primary focus on the financial services sector.
We are looking for highly talented quantitative analysts who are excited to work in an entrepreneurial environment to continue the success and development of FSQA in Berlin.
THE ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Working with us offers excellent career and growth opportunities for highly motivated professionals with relevant prior experience in specialised consulting firms, top tier banking or financial institutions, focused in quantitatively intense areas of financial services. We are passionate about developing our people and support your progression to partner.
YOUR ATTRIBUTES AND EXPERIENCE
Clients hire Oliver Wyman for specialized expertise, the ideal candidate will have most of the following:
Required Skills & Experience:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline. Ideally Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science or EngineeringStrong analysis, documentation, and communication skillsExperience in using advanced analytics and data manipulation software - SAS, R, SQL, SPSS, or PythonWork effectively and collaboratively in a teamBe independent and work under limited supervision respecting defined timelines.Present effectively results, potential issues and implications.Excellent command of German and English language (verbal and written)Ability to manage a heavy work volume and meet deadlines in an extremely fast paced environmentAbility to maintain and respect confidentiality
Preferred Skills:
Previous experience in banking and financial institutions, with content in one or more of the following areas: credit risk measurement (e.g. Probability of Default, Loss Given Default, Exposure at Default), stress testing, financial modelling, RWA calculations, credit portfolio modelling, derivative pricing, fair value calculations, Asset Quality reviews, model validation, VaR, CVA or IRC modelling
OUR VALUES & CULTURE
We’re serious about making OW a rewarding, progressive, enjoyable and balanced place to work.
Self starters and free thinkers who work well in a team
We are individuals who are self starting, motivated, energetic, entrepreneurial about what we do
Common aspiration, collective endeavour, shared success
We have the common aspiration to have an impact, leave a legacy and change the world. We have no interest in running a steady-state business. We want to build, grow and shape the environment around us
Straightforward, open, respectful interaction
We value an environment where every member of Oliver Wyman is encouraged and expected to voice his or her opinion
Opportunity without artificial barriers
We value merit and believe that to create a true meritocracy we need to remove artificial barriers to opportunity
Balanced lives
We value people whose lives balance work and non-work activities because we believe they are both more interesting colleagues and are able to make better contributions to the Firm. We push ourselves hard to deliver excellence, but we also work to extract the maximum benefit from the flexibility of a project-based business. We provide the ability to take career breaks for personal or family reasons. We fundamentally value each other’s time, and are sensitive to how it is used. We are an output not input-based culture, have respect for people’s personal decisions, and believe that one's workload must be sustainable. We seek balance for ourselves and our colleagues.

HOW TO APPLY
If you like what you’ve read, we’d love to hear from you.
If you’d like to learn more about the firm during your application process, please visit www.oliverwyman.com/careers,
Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer.
Our commitment to diversity is genuine, deep and growing. We’re not perfect yet, but we’re working hard right now to make our teams balanced, representative and diverse.

Stress from your landlord? Our selected partner lawyers will solve your renting problems – legally secure, fast and cost-effective. MieterEngel ist the new Tenancy Protection Club, a young online platform that offers easy solutions for rental problems. Our goal: care-free living for all tenants.

We are looking for a Growth Hacker (d/m/w) to help us gain more customers. You will think about how to attract more customers and generate additional revenue by running quick tests to verify your ideas and managing and executing the implementation. We are looking for doers who can set up and run the whole test by themselves and will not stop until the customers are in.

Your tasks as Growth Hacker:
Talk to our customers and help out in the sales team to get a better grip of who our customers are
Quantitatively analyse tracking data with tools like Google Analytics
Brainstorm ideas on how to get new customers based on both qualitative and quantitative understanding of our customers
Develop your ideas into full-fledged tests and align them with other stakeholder like our service and sales team
Write texts and generate landing pages with online tools to run the tests
Find creative solutions to be able to implement the whole test without e. g. needing a software developer by your side
Convert successful tests into requirement documents to bring them into our main processes



We put much more weight on your actual skills than your formal education. Practical experience, eagerness to learn and to give your best are of higher importance than what is written on a piece of paper. Knowledge of the tools we use is highly beneficial.

What we offer:
Work in an experienced and highly motivated team - most of us had our own problems with landlords and now try to help others not to suffer the same fate
Learn new things every day and try them out in practice
Freedom to directly influence the growth and direction of a start up
Use modern tools for your work and shape your own working environment
Stable start up working situation due to a broad network of investors
Fair compensation
Language
At MieterEngel we work in an international environment. Therefore the main language spoken is English. Nonetheless our product is currently focussed on the German market so speaking German is a requirement for this job.

Our team
We are a ~20 people working together. You will work most closely with our marketing analyst and our other growth hacker as well as two of the founders. In addition we are working with multiple freelancers and agencies for topics like SEO or Google AdWords.

Our processes
We work in a weekly Growth process where each week old tests are evaluated and new ones are started. We use Jira to manage work.

Our interview process
Our process is based on actual work. We don't believe in theoretical questions and instead focus on the actual work you will be doing at our company. Our process consists of the following steps:
A short get-to-know call mainly to answer any questions you might have
A case study that should take you 1-2 evenings and is based on an actual problem we had to solve in the past.
A day on site to get to now the team and our way of working.
The case study
The case is based on a problem we had to actually solve. It has been simplified to avoid unnecessary repetitive work. Feel free to use any methods to solve the case study that you would use during actual work. This includes e. g. googling or asking questions.

Salary
We offer a salary based on your skill level of 30,000 to 40,000 EUR per year, after a trial period at reduced salary.

Starting time
We are flexible on starting arrangements but will give preference to candidates with similar skillset who are able to start earlier.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

Job Description
Alexion Talent has opportunities across Europe and MENA for Professionals, who have an exceptional track record of driving impact for clients in various industries and various countries. As a candidate, you would be selected through professional, progressive stages, to be a best fit for the client and find a promising career for yourself. If you are in search for a new opportunity to bring out your experience and potential, we would like to meet you immediately .





Responsibilities




As part of the Business Systems team performing administrative duties, training software, data analysis, project coordination, project/policy documentation and othes tasks for the company, mainly Sales department. Business Systems team and Sales.






Provide support for Sales and Marketing via phone, email or in person to include data review, assit with report running,

Respond to field requests for information updates and modifications. Provide recommendations to manager for evaluation,

Assist with eliciting, analyzing, validating the needs of project stakeholders, including business customers and end-users,

Maintain and improve existing system; review, adjust workflows, ensuring key stake holders' deliverable and applicable industry standards are met,

Develop and review project plans for workflows, identify issues, resolve issues and communicate status of assigned project to users and management,

Participate in system upgrades, new functional implementations, documentation initiatives,

Provide support for for enterprise data integration,

Provide project coordination support tracking developers’ timeline of working projects. Raise project delays with Manager.

Test new workflows as they developed; confirmation to move to production or feedback to developers,

Orient new employees on the system

Prepare documents and reports as requested by customers.

·





Requirements
Bachelor's degree in computer sciences, business administration or similar,
3+ years’ experience in a technical customer support or IT support/analyst role,

Salesforce Administrator certification is preferred,

Solid skills in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint),

Experience with enterprise software support,

Meticulous attention to detail, solid organization skills, and strong sense of ownership,

Must be able to communicate well both verbally and in writing (including documentation),

Ability to work well within a team environment,

Ability to effectively interact in cross-functional teams,

Ability and desire to work in a high-pressure, fast-paced, fast growth environment and handle multiple projects and tasks daily.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined


PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Your profile:
You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined


PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

job_title: AML Analyst (m/f) für solarisBank – Schwerpunkt Italien
full_text:
solarisBank ist die weltweit erste digitale Banking Plattform für Finance Pioniere. Mit schneller und moderner Technologie ermöglicht unsere Plattform jedem, der selbst Finance Innovation kreieren will, einfach und schnell auf die benötigten Banking-Komponenten zuzugreifen. Wir sind ein Tech-Unternehmen mit Banklizenz. Unser internationales Team besteht bereits aus über 290 Mitarbeitern und verbindet digitalen Fokus, Tech-Expertise und Banking-Erfahrung. Ganz gleich ob Full Stack Developer, Banker oder Astronaut: Wenn Du bereit bist, Banking zu verändern, dann suchen wir genau Dich.

Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen AML Analyst, der uns in der Erweiterung unserer Geschäftstätigkeiten in Italien unterstützt. Du greifst als Ansprechpartner für die italienischen Geschäftstätigkeiten der solarisBank dem AML Team tatkräftig unter die Arme und unterstützt beim Aufbau der Compliance Funktion im Bereich Geldwäsche- und Betrugsprävention mit Bezug auf Italien.

Deine Aufgaben beziehen sich hauptsächlich auf die Geschäftstätigkeiten in Italien und umfassen:


Erstellung und Weiterführung von Richtlinien und Analysen zur Einhaltung italienischer Vorschriften und zur Bekämpfung der Geldwäsche
Unterstützung bei der Implementierung und Verbesserung von lokalen Verfahren
Direkte Unterstützung der Kommunikation mit den italienischen Aufsichtsbehörden
Abgabe von Verdachtsmeldungen an die italienische Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU)
Beantwortung externer Informationsanfragen und Kommunikation mit der lokalen FIU
Unterstützung bei der Identifizierung (KYC) von Unternehmen und Personen bei Kontoeröffnung oder bei der Annahme von neuen Kooperationspartnern mit Bezug auf solarisBank italienische Geschäftstätigkeiten
Qualifizierung von Treffern bei Sanktions-, PEP- und Blacklisten
Tägliche Bearbeitung der Ergebnisse aus unseren IT gestützten Überwachungsmaßnahmen
Bearbeitung von betrugsbekämpfungs- und geldwäschebezogenen Anfragen aus anderen Einheiten der solarisBank
Unterstützung zur Vorbereitung und Dokumentation von Schulungen
Anleitung und fachliche Begleitung der Mitarbeiter und der Kooperationspartner

Dein Profil:

1 bis 2 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Geldwäsche mit Bezug auf italienische Gesetzesanforderungen bzw. Erfahrungen aus der Praxis in Italien
Ausbildung zur/zum Bankkauffrau/-mann oder eine berufsspezifische Weiterbildung oder vergleichbare Qualifikation mit Berufserfahrung in der Geldwäsche-Funktion, oder einem kundennahen Bereich eines Finanzdienstleisters
Erfahrungen aus dem Kundenservice, dem Bereich der AML Compliance oder der Internen Revision
Kenntnisse regulatorischer Anforderungen (GwG, KWG etc.) sind von Vorteil
Kenntnis der Methoden und Systeme zur systemischen Prüfung
gutes Verständnis der IT-Landschaft
Belastbarkeit und schnelle Auffassungsgabe
Durchsetzungsstärke und hohe Leistungsbereitschaft
Teamfähigkeit und hohes Maß an Entscheidungsfähigkeit
Fähigkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte verständlich in Wort und Schrift darzustellen
Sorgfältige, selbstständige und pragmatische Arbeitsweise
Sicheres Auftreten, ausgezeichnete Sozialkompetenz, Hands-on Mentalität, hohe Eigenmotivation
Fließende Italienischkenntnisse und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Deutschkenntnisse sind von Vorteil

Was bieten wir?


Eigenverantwortliche und abwechslungsreiche Arbeit
Direkte Zusammenarbeit mit den Entscheidungsträgern und Mitgestaltung der Zukunft der solarisBank, einem der aktuell attraktivsten FinTechs der Branche
Eine ausgezeichnete Arbeitskultur mit flachen Hierarchien in einem internationalen, hochmotivierten Team

Interessiert? – Schick uns Deinen Lebenslauf mit relevanten Abschlusszeugnissen und Arbeitsdokumenten sowie der Angabe Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung online

Information on data processing:
DE: https://www.solarisbank.com/gdpr_notice_de

EN: https://www.solarisbank.com/gdpr_notice_en

Adjust is the industry leader in mobile measurement, fraud prevention and cybersecurity. Born at the heart of the mobile economy, more than 30,000 apps have now implemented Adjust's solutions to secure their budgets and improve performance. The globally operating company has growing number of offices around the world, from Tokyo to San Francisco and in 2019 secured one of the year's largest funding rounds in Europe to date, raising $227 million.

We are looking for a UX Researcher to join our team in Berlin and help us take our products to the next level in usability, utility, and design. Working within our growing User Research & UX team, you will help drive valuable experiences for our customers

We offer:

A competitive salary
Flexibility in work schedule
Relocation Assistance
An international team with strong focus on transparency
Regular team gatherings and company retreats
An opportunity to do office exchanges with company locations
Additional perks such as team lunches and free access to our company gym

More details about our company culture and perks can be found on our careers page ( https://www.adjust.com/company/careers/ ). Or have a sneak peek of our office in Berlin ( https://officedropin.com/adjust-berlin-office/?fbclid=IwAR1IgL28o7iR_U8Q3pZU4W-S8bJb1Ocg0ru5_E95ae9kILm_EQhG12ly5Wc ).

You will do:

Work closely with other UX researchers to conduct user research and usability testing
Create comprehensive research plans and be able to lead user research initiatives
Synthesize user research to produce easy-to-understand artifacts for non-researchers
Be the voice of the user
Understand and be an advocate for user-centered design processes
Analyze and incorporate quantitative data and qualitative insights into design
Work cross-functionally
Be able to juggle multiple priorities and escalate risk as needed

You bring:

Extensive hands-on experience designing and conducting user research - you are able to show how your work has had an impact. We want to learn how your research influenced product
Extremely data driven, experience as data analyst is a big plus
Strong self-initiative and motivation to seek new ideas, technology, and leading edge techniques roadmaps and informed design decisions.
Solid experience conducting usability studies, user interviews, contextual inquiry, and other user research tasks
A portfolio of work that you can talk through*
A user-centered, data informed, and agile design mindset
Ability to think big while paying attention to detail
Fluent in English, clear communicator, strong writer
Applications without a portfolio won't be taken into consideration

Interested? Let's talk!

Wir suchen Sie zur Unterstützung der Marketing- und Vertriebsabteilung des Tagesspiegels.
Ihre Aufgaben
Aufstellen und Weiterentwicklung von Reportings, Analysen, Prognosen und KPIs für unsere Vertriebsaktivitäten Print und Online
Ableiten von Strategien und Empfehlungen
Koordination und Mitarbeit an Forecast und Planung
Gemeinsames Aufsetzen einer zukunftsgerichteten Systemlandschaft im Vertrieb zusammen mit dem CTO, Controlling und dem Head of BI
Verknüpfung der klassischen Verlags-Systeme (SAP) mit neuen Technologien (z.B. Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, Tableau)
Nachhaltige Umsetzung von Optimierungsmaßnahmen & Automatisierungen in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Marketing-Team
Mitarbeit an interdisziplinären Projekten sowie eigenständige Leitung ausgewählter Teilprojekte
Ihr Profil
Mehrjährige praktische Erfahrungen im Controlling, als Business Analyst oder CRM-Manager, z.B. in einem digitalen Umfeld
Analytisches Denkvermögen, hohe Zahlenaffinität und gutes Prozessverständnis
Schnelle Auffassungsgabe & die Fähigkeit sich strukturiert und eigenverantwortlich in neue Themen einzuarbeiten
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Excel sowie belastbare Erfahrung im Umgang mit SAP und MySQL
Erfahrungen mit Google Data Studio, Google Analytics von Vorteil
Erfahrungen mit SAP MS/D und IVW von Vorteil
Wir bieten

Ein spannendes und dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld in einem wachsenden und motivierten Team. Sie erhalten einen umfassenden Einblick in ein modernes Unternehmen im Medienwandel im Herzen Kreuzbergs. In angenehmer Arbeitsatmosphäre unterstützen Sie das Team mit eigenen Ideen, lernen von anderen und wachsen mit Ihren Aufgaben. Zusätzlich fördern wir durch individuelle Fort- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten die berufliche Entwicklung unserer Mitarbeiter.
Als Mitarbeiter des Tagesspiegels profitieren Sie von unseren attraktiven Sozialleistungen wie z.B. 30 Tage Urlaub, vergünstigtes BVG-Firmenticket, vermögenswirksame Leistungen, flexible Arbeitszeiten, Eltern-Kind-Zimmer, u. a.
Wollen Sie ein Teil des Tagesspiegel-Teams werden? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre aussagekräftige Bewerbung unter Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung und des frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins.

We are looking for a skilled Fraud Manager to join a rapidly growing Fintech based in Amsterdam. They are looking for a candidate to oversee and developing new techniques to detect fraud on their platform. You’ll be working closely with their engineering and product teams to drive innovation and oversee a team of Fraud Analysts yourself.

Overview

Services

extensive experience in operations management

Experience in eCommerce, Payments or Fintech
Creative problem solving and critical thinking skills

The idea behind this company if based on life science and its connection to digital aggregation. A global provider for research materials to assist with life science.

This database is consistently expanding and growing to keep up with the service demands. Producing thousands of products which is categorised, standardised and characterised to be found easily through specific searches. Work with large amount of data to assist with the company growth and scalability due to high demand of these products and focus on decreasing bottlenecks to allow progression in Science. Join a team of highly skilled professionals in Data and Analytics to make a difference in the areas that matter most

Tasks


Scale, operate and maintain infrastructure/architecture
Work with Data Scientists and Business Analysts within data, production and support
Build and maintain real-time/third parties’ data and ETL pipelines
Have input on new architecture and technologies that will improve the data platform for Data Scientists and Backend Engineers
Improve DataOps processes

5 years of experience minimum
2+ years’ experience with Elasticsearch and Golang (or Python)
Proficient with:
Kubernetes, E-Commerce, Google Services
Data modeling and data warehousing

Postgres, Tableau, Kubernetes, JavaScript, Jenkin

Benefits


Monthly educational budget

At home office

EU Citizenship is Mandatory

Analyst - Workforce Management

that schedules are prepared within Labour law boundaries and coordinating Analysis with WFM and Customer service teams..

Excellent in MS Office tools like Excel, Words, Power Point, Access

Here is our offer:

Need more reasons to tuck into life at Takeaway.com? Here are the perks you’ll get to enjoy:
Competitive salary
Opportunities to make an international impact in an exciting sales role
A dynamic, friendly workplace in Berlin, close to Ostbahnhof station (when you’re not out securing deals!)
Great company-wide events like our summer party and snow event

Think you’re the sales specialist we’re looking for? Click the button below to send us your CV and motivational letter.

Klarna makes shopping smoooth. And we do it with flair because shopping is fun. Every day, we help customers, businesses, and partners explore just how smoooth the modern shopping experience can be.

It means we’re constantly changing the game. Always trying out new things. And we encourage our people to do the same. To grow. To develop. Because we don’t believe roles have to stay fixed. Instead we inspire our people to take an irregular career path. As a company of 350 dynamic start-ups, our whole business is built for it. So once you’re in, there’s no telling what will happen next.

Who we are looking for
An experienced UX writer to help shape and iterate the tone of voice and messaging for our next-generation banking product. You’ll work closely with product managers, product designers and content specialists to explore the full product journey from end to end, taking data-driven decisions and keeping the user in focus.
What you will do
Own the UX writing vision, best practices and execution for building a compelling tone of voice and clear messaging for consumer banking products
Collaborate with designers, product owners and developers to ensure that the product conveys the right tone and context in the entire experience
Continually test and improve our products by designing
UX research experiments in collaboration with product designers and researchers
Dig into quantitative and qualitative data to discover opportunities to improve product copy, USP messaging and flows in order to improve the user experience
You should have
4-5 years of experience with writing digital content for brands in both English and German
2-3 years experience working in UX writing for digital products, apps or websites
Experience working with global products
Fluent writing and speaking skills both in English and German
Great understanding of design process, usability and UX best practices
Experience with UX research and user flows, for example, designing and evaluating experiments, applying learnings to the product experience
Who you are
You love to work in a fast-paced environment together with people from all types of competences - from engineers and UX designers to marketeers and analysts
You take a data-driven approach to your work and aren’t afraid to start over from scratch
Experience with product design tools is a plus, but not required (Sketch, Abstract, etc.)
How to apply
Send over a CV in English
Send over your portfolio (this is an essential part in order for us to review your application).

About Klarna

Klarna was founded in Stockholm, Sweden in 2005. Since then, we’ve changed the banking industry forever. And now we’re creating the world’s smooothest shopping experience. We serve 80 million consumers worldwide, and partner with 190,000 merchants – with a new merchant joining us every 8 minutes. Including some of the world’s leading brands, such as H&M, ASOS, IKEA, Adidas, Samsung and Lufthansa. Our offices are spread over 17 different markets, hosted by +2,500 people from 90 nationalities.

Bayer is a global enterprise with core competencies in the Life Science fields of health care and agriculture. Its products and services are designed to benefit people and improve their quality of life. At Bayer you have the opportunity to be part of a culture where we value the passion of our employees to innovate and give them the power to change.

Senior Data Scientist for Radiology (m/f/d)


The Decision Science unit at Bayer Pharmaceutical is a one stop shop for all enterprise advanced analytics projects. We work across all functions in Bayer from R&D to marketing & sales to product supply. We solve hard analytical problems and build solutions with the mission to improve the overall efficiency and decision making in the company. If you are interested in joining a young and dynamic team applying bleeding edge machine learning algorithms to all kind of data types we would like to hear from you.

YOUR TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Support of business and innovation projects in the area of Radiology
Lead projects and other data scientists applying LEAN and agile approach to deliver fit-for-purpose solutions
Establish strong link with stakeholders in the business to help shape and execute the digital agenda strategy
Perform complex simulation, modelling and machine learning research integrating multi-layered data models from internal and external sources
Develop and train members of the Data Science team
Maintain awareness of state-of-the-art application of AI in life science industries and research
Publish innovative methodologies and scientific discoveries in peer reviewed journals
Create opportunities for data product development by identifying pain points in the business to improve efficiency and decision making
Lead scaling up activities transforming data science prototype to end to end solutions by leveraging skills across a large IT unit working with Business Domain Experts in their daily work
Search and explore external opportunities with academia and new solution vendors

WHO YOU ARE
PhD. in machine learning, statistics, applied mathematics or computer science, with strong applied side
Several years industry experience or very strong academic records leading the delivery of ground breaking machine learning projects
Expert level knowledge in at least one of the following area: Bayesian deep learning, Probabilistic Graphical Network, Gaussian processes, MCMC and/or Deep Learning (RNN, GAN…)
Very good coding knowledge in Python and/or R
Proficiency with machine learning and deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow
Strong business analyst skills and strong experience interacting with very diverse customers is required
Proven skills in presentation of results and outlining of solutions to the Business
Ability to work in an interdisciplinary and agile environment
Fluent in English, both written and spoken

YOUR APPLICATION
Are you looking for a new challenge where you can show your passion for innovation? Are you interested in working as part of a global team to improve people’s lives? Then send us your online application including cover letter, CV and references.
Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.
Location: Germany : Berlin : Berlin
Division: Corporate Functions
Reference Code: 69534

Job Segment: Database, Scientific, Agricultural, Scientist, Agronomy, Technology, Engineering, Agriculture, Science

ABOUT THE TEAM

As Data Science Lead for Payment Risk, you manage a high performing cross-functional team that builds the next generation of our AI-based risk management and fraud prevention systems. You create value for our customers in close collaboration with our Engineering and Product Leads in an atmosphere of respect and growth.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED


Guide and mentor a team of highly skilled research engineers and data scientists in the domain of payment risk management and fraud detection to build, operate and maintain scalable machine learning models.
Develop and maintain processes to ensure high quality applied research and delivery through documentation, peer review, and structured feedback.
Motivate innovation and prioritize opportunities to improve models through research, design and development of new machine learning features to create measurable business value.
Work closely with the leadership team and build cross-functional relationships with product managers, engineers and analysts to drive AI products, ensuring high-quality communication across diverse audiences and turning research findings into production.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


PhD or MSc in Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or other similar quantitative field with 3+ years of applied or industry research experience.
Experience in building, developing and coaching data science teams in an international, agile environment. You have effective communication skills in English, with an ability to understand and translate business and user requirements into ML problems.
Solid experience with Python, Scala, SQL, and big data frameworks like Spark. Solid understanding of cloud-based solutions, preferably AWS.
Deep understanding of statistics and machine learning and a proven track record of implementing machine learning to work at scale.

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

PERKS AT WORK


Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source ( https://opensource.zalando.com/ ) commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs ( https://jobs.zalando.com/tech/blog/ ), product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)

ABOUT ZALANDO

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
