full_text:
As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined


PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.

You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization

As an Engineering Lead in the newly formed Zalando Offprice data and data science team, you will provide technical direction, coaching and leadership to a cross-functional engineering team (backend and research engineers, data scientists and analysts) to deliver algorithmic data products for Zalando Lounge & Outlets.

You will act as a delivery lead, architect and team lead, and work closely with our product and business development managers and other engineering teams. Your team will build completely new tech products for pricing optimization and personalization to produce a step change in the performance of Zalando Group's fastest growing business unit.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED


Deliver high quality data products. You don't mind getting your hands dirty and enjoy building products from scratch (leveraging centrally provided tooling and infrastructure for AI whenever possible). You provide the right guidance to your team and help them solve their technical questions, such as choice of tech stack, system architecture, code quality and system performance.
Develop and execute mid and long-term technical vision and architecture with your team to deliver a stable, scalable production system, while closely collaborating with other engineering managers to be in line with our overall tech strategy.
Facilitate communication and decision-making between different engineering teams and stakeholders and act as a sparring partner to product owners to ensure seamless integration of our products with downstream services.
Lead and develop an agile world-class engineering team. You are a great coach to each team member and enjoy guiding them along their development path. You strike the right balance between giving your team sufficient freedom to grow while knowing when to step in and demonstrate.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


A strong and self-driven leader with a good understanding of technical landscapes and previous experience leading international, cross-functional teams of engineers and data scientists.
Proven ability to design and deliver end-to-end pipelines for algorithmic/ML data products from scratch. Extensive industry experience as a backend engineer, working mainly in Python.
Experience with distributed systems (Docker, Kubernetes), microservices architecture, and RESTful APIs, particularly using cloud infrastructure such as AWS. Experience with ML-related libraries (e.g. numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, Pytorch) and frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, Spark).
Effective communication skills in English. Ability to understand and translate business and user requirements across teams and senior leadership.

PERKS AT WORK


Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events.
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings.
Extensive on-boarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities, and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms.

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

We’re looking for an analytics expert who can decipher data and help optimise our online presence. Ready to make an international impact with your skills? Then keep reading…

Our story (the bitesize version):
Need gyoza for your guests or craving a post-work pizza? That’s what we’re here for. Whether they know us as Lieferando.de, Takeaway.com or even just ‘that food app’, we’re connecting food fans with the dishes they love, in cities across 11 countries – from Berlin to Bucharest!
But at our heart, we’re a tech company. While our partner restaurants cook up the food, we’re focused on everything from app development to analytics. That’s where you come in.
All about the role:
In a sentence: you’ll be leading data quality. That means being able to identify, track and use data to help optimise the user experience. You’ll be spotting improvement points and troubleshooting tracking implementations, as well as acting as our Google Analytics expert.
You’re also the first point of contact for colleagues, offering behavioural analysis and website optimisation in a range of areas – including Product and various IT-related matters. And we’re also counting on you to:
Understand what stakeholders need, communicating clearly and delivering the solution
Regularly use Tag Management Systems like Tealium and Google Tag Manager to boost our functionality
Assist with insights from the digital analytics platform, helping various departments optimise their internal and external, web and mobile app products
Understand how data is gathered and processed by a range of different analytics tools
Can you deliver...
Think you’re our next Web Analyst? That’s great. Even better if you can say ‘yes’ to the following:
5+ years’ experience as a Web Analyst, Product Analyst, Conversion Optimisation Specialist or similar
Significant working knowledge with Tealium or Google Tag Manager, A/B Testing, SQL and R and/or Python
Strong background in using Tag Management Systems, Tracking debugging, BigQuery, Firebase and/or Google Analytics
Train fellow team members on the usage of the various data & analytics tools available
Being able to do in-depth analyses, for example, performance analysis about the different steps in the funnel
You have been working together with product and different IT departments
Fluent English
Dashboarding experiences with tableau would be a plus
Enjoy helping and sharing knowledge with colleagues in various departments, teams and countries
Here's our offer:
It’s not all about what we need from you. Here’s a taste of what makes working here extra special:
Competitive salary
27 days of annual leave
Opportunity to travel to Amsterdam, Sofia and TelAviv
Amazing workplace events like our summer party and ski/snowboard event
Opportunities to develop and progress in a scalable international company
A dynamic, welcoming workplace at the heart of Berlin
A contribution to your pension plan
Office amenities: Great coffee, ping pong and our popular Friday drinks (to name a few!)
Ready to take our analytics to the next level? Click the button below to send us your motivational letter and CV.

Nach deinem Studium unter Regelstudienzeit inklusive Auslandsaufenthalten, karitativer Arbeit, Sprachschulen und Welpen retten, füttern und streicheln fehlt dir im Musterlebenslauf nur noch eins: Ein schicker Jobtitel als Belohnung des stringent gesponnen roten Karrierefadens. Sind wir nah dran? Dann bewirb dich bitte nicht bei uns. Auf gar keinen Fall. Danke. Was wir suchen sind die Hustler. Die Geeks. Die, die anders denken. Egal ob du als kleiner Scheißer einen Limonadenstand betrieben oder am Campus deine Studentenwohnung an Dozenten für gewisse Stunden vermietet hast: Du weißt dir zu helfen. Du bist ein Macher. Du benutzt Stolpersteine als Podest. Du weißt, “Action speaks louder than words” und für Erfolg gibt es keinen Ersatz als noch größeren Erfolg. Versteh uns nicht falsch. Nichts gegen Karriere, Aufstiegschancen und Verantwortung. Das alles bekommst du bei uns auch. Und zwar im Überfluss. Aber wir handhaben das anders. Bei uns zählt deine Leistung. Und sonst nichts. Lebensläufe, Noten und Zeugnisse sind uns egal. Schreib uns was von dir, gib Gas, häng dich rein. Werde mit uns erfolgreich. Dann kannst Du dich danach immer noch um die Welpen kümmern.

Hier kommst Du ins Spiel:

Als Junior-SEO bist Du dafür verantwortlich, gemeinsam mit unseren SEO-Managern, digitale Marketing-Strategien auszuführen. Als ein SEO-Mitarbeiter von BOY & MAN bist Du ein kreativ denkender Analyst, der es liebt neue Ideen auszuprobieren und der festen Überzeugung ist, dass strategische Entscheidungen auf Daten begründet sein müssen.

Du bist:

– ein leidenschaftlicher Marketer: Trotz deiner Passion für Digital Marketing siehst Du Business und Marketing aus einer holistischen Perspektive.

– schnell: „Die einzige Konstante ist Veränderung“. Wer auch immer das gesagt hat, hat wahrscheinlich über BOY & MAN gesprochen. Dinge bewegen sich bei uns in Lichtgeschwindigkeit und Du kommst mit unserem Speed zurecht.

– ein Macher: Du bist hands-on orientiert und gerne bereit zu helfen. Auch wenn du an vorderster Front im Einsatz bist, gibst Du trotzdem Deine Meinung zu Strategien und neuen Ideen aus der Firma weiter.

– technisch interessiert: Du hast erste technische SEO Erfahrung gesammelt und fällst nicht gleich um, wenn Du von HTML/CSS, JavaScript und iFrames hörst.

– ein Problemlöser: Du verschwendest keine Zeit damit, Probleme nur zu erklären. Du findest Lösungen.

– ein Schwamm: Du siehst einen Tag ohne etwas Neues zu lernen als einen verlorenen Tag an. Du bist immer auf dem neuesten Stand und liest täglich die aktuellsten Neuigkeiten.

– ein Visionär: Unser Team in Berlin befindet sich im Aufbau und wird schnell wachsen. Du bist bereit Deinen Teil beizutragen, und hast Lust, ein Team und dessen Kultur mit zu formen.

Du wirst:

– den Traffic und den ROI unserer Kunden sicherstellen, indem Du Konkurrenzanalysen, Keyword-Researches, Content-Erstellung und das damit verbundene Link-Building umsetzt.

– die Effektivität unserer Maßnahmen durch Reportings von verschiedenen Tools wie Searchmetrics, Google Analytics oder SimilarWeb Pro messen.

– jede Maßnahme von Dir, auf das Business-Goal unserer Kunden fokussieren

– ob Analyse von Reports oder Identifizierung neuer Trends durch Data: Du verlierst nie den Blick auf den ROI unserer Kunden.

Benötigte Skills:

– Keyword-Research

– Excel

– Content-Erstellung

– Technisches Wissen wie Canonical Tag etc.

– Gängige SEO-Tools wie Sistrix, Searchmetrics, OnPage.org

– Gängige Analyse-Tools wie: Google Analytics, SimilarWeb Pro

Each day, hundreds of thousands of customers make billions of transactions worldwide on our cloud. They are harnessing the power of Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enable innovative applications, websites, and businesses. However, there are always a few people that try to take unfair advantage of a good thing...

Are you interested in taking your skills and career to the next level, while having fun and fighting bad guys? Join a growing world class team to conduct investigations in order to prevent malicious and fraudulent usage on AWS.

You will be an integral member of a team of investigators, analysts and specialists conducting complex investigations of fraud activity. You will help drive related intelligence initiatives targeting new and emerging fraud threats to AWS.

You will leverage your analytical and data skills to deep dive on a myriad of fraud activity to help drive complex investigations and investigative strategies.

You will be at the forefront of keeping abreast of trends and fraud issues impacting the Cloud industry to ensure AWS is leading the curve in identifying, mitigating and preventing fraud attacks.

You will be in charge of managing multiple Investigation Specialists in our Berlin office who investigate fraudulent cloud computing behavior and complex transactions on accounts based on processes, tools and high-judgment decisions.

You will provide leadership and administrative support to your team and manage them to focus on development, meeting decision quality targets, constantly meeting and exceeding service levels based on capacity and team delivery, and executing priority projects with various internal and external stakeholders.
Responsibilities include:
Assist in building, then managing, a team of Investigators conducting complex and deep dive investigations of sophisticated criminals and criminalsDevelop the career and skills of Investigators by hiring the best, identifying growth opportunities, and implementing supplemental trainingAnalyze, meet, and report on goals aligned to fraud operating expense reduction, customer experience improvement, and service levelsWork with cross-functional teams across Amazon for collaboration on fraud risks and investigationsWork with stakeholders to drive process improvements that will impact internal and external customersMaintain the confidentiality of all information obtained during the investigations processTake on ad-hoc projects/assignments related to fraud investigations and risk management as necessaryDeliver significant business impact and contributions to AWS through quality, productivity, and customer experience improvements

Knowledge of fraud or risk trends impacting the cloud computing industryExperience collaborating with teams across multiple geographic regionsPrevious experience with cloud fraud, risk, compliance functions
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

AtomLeap is an AI company that collects and uses big data to track and analyze the latest high-impact innovations and technologies. We assess tech innovations and the organizations driving them, and we help industry and business leaders make their most important decisions through a combination of big data, an AI-augmented SaaS dashboard, and qualitative expertise.

We are looking for a machine learning engineer to join our growing international team. If you’re an enthusiastic professional keen on working in a fast-paced company, we look forward to your application. Our position is an excellent opportunity for you to shape the growth of an ambitious startup in the heart of Berlin Kreuzberg.

Tasks


Play a leading role in our growing R&D team and contribute to solving large scale challenges in the machine learning development cycle.
Identify, develop, and implement different machine learning approaches to solving the problems our business analysts have identified.
Make key decisions on our NLP architecture. Design and implement scalable NLP and machine learning models.
Work closely together with our data science team on the analysis of the machine learning results and any subsequent optimizations of the algorithms.
Explore ideas for practical and reliable models for data label quality and supervision.
Develop evaluation techniques to gauge the performance and accuracy of the models you build.
Keep the existing models up to date, track model degradation, set up autonomous retraining mechanisms, and manually retrain the model, if necessary.
Manipulate and harmonize data — structured, semi, and unstructured — from various sources to speed up our model building process.
Work and collaborate within a team of experienced people with diverse backgrounds.

Requirements


You have a university degree in a relevant field and at least two years of work experience in machine learning.
You have worked with large data sets, preferably have experience with NLP and text-based data, and ideally, have worked with data in a business and/or technology context.
You have experience with artificial neural networks, preferably with the PyTorch framework. You are highly experienced in Python development.
You have knowledge of or experience in building production quality and large scale deployment of applications related to NLP and machine learning.
You have experience with the latest machine learning infrastructure developments.
You enjoy cooperating and communicating both within and outside your core team.

Benefits


Five weeks of paid vacation each year.
A permanent contract, competitive salary, and flexible working hours.
Flat hierarchies with short decision paths.
A team of inquisitive minds to keep things interesting.
Talent development through individual education and courses, with opportunities for bonuses and career progression.

If this sounds like you, send your application — including a cover letter and CV — to Ms. Konstanze Neumann (konstanze(at)atomleap.com) by April 5th, 2020. Interviews will be held in the following weeks. Relevant references, certificates, and links to previous work are more than welcome.

momox ist der sechstgrößte Arbeitgeber der deutschen Digitalwirtschaft (Drittgrößter in Berlin). Mit über 200 Mio. € Umsatz und mehr als 1.800 Mitarbeiterinnen sowie Mitarbeitern wachsen wir stetig weiter. Wir sind der führende Online-Ankaufservice für Bücher, CDs, Filme, Games und Fashion. Über momox.de kaufen wir Artikel an, der Verkauf erfolgt über Online-Marktplätze sowie in den eigenen Shops medimops.de und ubup.com. Wir sind ständig auf der Suche nach begeisterungsfähigen Menschen, die Spaß daran haben, bei der momox Erfolgsstory mitzuwirken.
Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt für unseren Standort in Berlin eine kompetente und tatkräftige Persönlichkeit in der Funktion als Data Engineer (m/w/d).
DIESE AUFGABEN WIRST DU MEISTERN
Du verantwortest die Konzeption und Umsetzung von BI-Lösungen (DWH, ETL, Monitoring etc.)
Dir obliegt die eigenverantwortliche Umsetzung von Arbeitspaketen im Rahmen von Projekten
Du kümmerst Dich um die Sicherstellung des Betriebs der BI-Anwendung und um deren kontinuierliche Verbesserung (Monitoring, Alerting)
Du optimierst unsere Durchführung von technischen und inhaltlichen Tests, zudem erstellst Du Use Cases in Zusammenarbeit mit den BI-Analysten
Du bist zuständig für die Bearbeitung von Ad-Hoc Anfragen bei Daten, Reporting`s oder Analyse Fragestellungen
Du erstellst Reports, Dashboards und KPI
WARUM MOMOX?
Wir lieben es pragmatisch. Du arbeitest in einem agilen Umfeld mit Allem was dazu gehört, aber ohne die endlosen Planungsmeetings
Wir sind offen für neue Technologien und nutzen sie, wenn es Sinn macht
Wir haben keine Angst vor großen architektonischen Herausforderungen
Wir geben Dir die Möglichkeit, Dich durch die Teilnahme an Fachveranstaltungen und Konferenzen sowohl fachlich als auch persönlich weiterzuentwickeln
Wir leben agile Entwicklung, in unseren Teams arbeiten alle Fachbereiche zusammen, die Wege sind kurz
DAS BRINGST DU MIT
Du verfügst über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Betriebswirtschaftslehre mit Schwerpunkt (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Naturwissenschaften oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Du verfügst über mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung mit Python oder einer ähnlich analytisch orientierten Programmiersprache (z.B. R, Java)
Du hast Know-how in der Benutzung von Cloud Storage Lösungen (BigQuery, S3, Redshift), sowie von relationalen Datenbanken (MySQL, MSSQL, PostgreSQL)
Du bringst bestenfalls bereits erste Erfahrungen mit nicht-relationalen Datenbanken (MongoDB, Hadoop, MapReduce) mit
Du konntest tiefgehende Erfahrung bei ETL-Prozessen, der API Integration und automatisierten Verarbeitung von strukturierten sowie unstrukturierten Daten sammeln
Die Anbindung und Datenmodellierung in SQL, inkl. der damit verbundenen Frontend Tools (Tableau, Looker, Qlikview), stellen für Dich kein Problem dar
Du überzeugst durch Deine analytischen Fähigkeiten und Dein Verständnis von Geschäftsprozessen
DARAUF KANNST DU DICH FREUEN
Spannende Aufgaben und Herausforderungen im Herzen Berlins
Agiles Arbeitsumfeld mit flachen Hierarchien
Motiviertes, aufgeschlossenes Team mit Offenheit für neue Impulse
Unterstützung bei Open-Source-Projekten
Lounge mit Kicker, PlayStation und Tischtennis
Leistungsgerechte Bezahlung
Fit im Job durch Laufgruppen, Kooperation mit dem Urban Sports Club sowie gesundes Mittagessen von smunch.co
Ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Mitarbeiter/innen-Benefits wie vergünstigtes Jobticket, Kita-Zuschüsse, Einkaufsgutscheine für unseren medimops-Shop, freie Getränke, Obst und vieles mehr
 Individuelle Arbeitsumgebung
Gestalte deinen ergonomischen Arbeitsplatz mit höhenverstellbaren Tischen und dem Laptop deiner Wahl (MacBook oder ThinkPad). Wir arbeiten mit modernsten Technologien und du bekommst sogar deine eigenen Noise Cancelling Kopfhörer von Bose.
Nachhaltigkeit
Wir lieben Second Hand und integrieren unsere nachhaltige Geschäftsidee mit einfachen Methoden in den Büroalltag durch nachhaltige Verbrauchsmittel, doppelseitigen Druck, Energiesparmodus an Geräten, Mülltrennung, etc.
Weiterbildung
momox ist nur so gut wie du. Deshalb findest du bei uns Raum und Budget für deine individuelle professionelle Entwicklung mit Sprachkursen, internen Schulungen, Konferenzen, (Online-)Kursen und mehr.
Offenes Arbeitsumfeld
Ein helles Büro mit flachen Hierarchien und offenen Türen. Wir sind ein motiviertes Team, das gegenüber neuen Impulsen aufgeschlossen ist. Bring deine Ideen ein und setze sie um! In unseren Rückzugsräumen findest du nicht nur Ruhe, sondern auch Action mit Kicker, PS4 und Xbox.
1/2 Tag Urlaub am Geburtstag
An deinem Geburtstag bekommst du einen halben Tag Urlaub. Komm später, geh früher oder nimm einfach noch einen halben Tag Urlaub, um den ganzen Tag frei zu haben. Außerdem bekommst du am 24.12. und 31.12. je einen halben Tag frei.
Firmenfeiern
Wir feiern mit dem gesamten Team: Sommer, Weihnachten, Halloween, monatliche Frühstücke und Filmabende, Erfolge, etc.
Täglich frisches Obst und Gemüse
Wir versorgen dich im Büro mit Obst, Gemüse, Mate, Kaffee und Tee. Und zweimal pro Woche kannst du dein Mittagessen bei Smunch bestellen.
Sport- und Fitnessangebote
Jede Woche kommt ein Personal Trainer, um uns fit zu halten oder du schließt dich unserer Laufgruppe an. Für die Abkühlung danach ist durch eine Dusche gesorgt. Ansonsten findest du mit Gympass deinen Lieblingssport. Die mobile Massage besucht uns alle 2 Wochen.
Mitarbeiterrabatte
Als momox Mitarbeiter profitierst du natürlich von extra Rabatten bei medimops oder einem unserer zahlreichen Partner.
Bürohunde
Unsere Bürohunde sorgen für ein besonders angenehmes Betriebsklima und freuen sich über Streicheleinheiten.
Solltest du weitere Fragen haben, ruf gerne an: Alexandra Schulz (Recruiting), Tel: 030-610 8007 -520
Mehr Informationen über uns erhältst du unter momox.biz/karriere/.
Das ist genau das Richtige für dich? Dann bewirb dich jetzt!
momox GmbH | Schreiberhauer Str. 30 | 10317 Berlin

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined


PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

Your profile:
You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

job_title: Customer Experience Manager (Fluent English and Swedish)
full_text:
Degree qualifiedFluent in English and SwedishStrong knowledge in Microsoft Excel and WordAnalytical skillsProject management experience

Our EU Customer Services team is seeking a Customer Experience (CX) Manager with fluent English and Swedish to support various customer service projects. The role will be focused on establishing CX management mechanisms and frameworks, and to manage CX by focusing on two main areas of work i) Emerging Customer Impacting Issues Management and ii) Project Management.

Working with multiple operational teams including Retail, Marketing, Transportation, Legal and CS Support teams, the Customer Experience Manager will understand and report on the shopping experience processes impacting CX, and work on continuous improvement projects with the relevant teams to drive solutions which improve the customer experience.
The successful candidate will be an excellent analyst, communicator and influencer with the ability to drive change throughout the organization.
To analyze and drive process improvements, this role requires frequent interactions with stakeholders within and outside of CS organization, mainly Retail teams.

This role will be based out of Luxembourg.

Role Scope:
Establish all the policies and CX management processes pertaining to all CS projects, in partnership with Retail and CS Stakeholders (CS Ops, CSI, Legal, etc.)Benchmark and advocate for processes that would improve the shopping experienceEstablish a Voice of the Customer (VOC) framework, contact reduction / defect elimination mechanisms and CX improvement culture with Retail teamDaily interaction with Retail and CS Stakeholders (CS Ops, CSI, Legal, etc.) to ensure a prompt response to emerging customer impacting issuesAct as Subject Matter Expert (SME) on how Retail’s performance impacts CX.Act as the liaison between various Amazon teams, providing reporting and analysis to ensure change is driven in the areas which have the biggest potential for CX improvementUnderstand, analyze and communicate metrics such as CPU, Concessions, DPMO.Analyze and propose process improvement initiatives within every step of the shopping experienceWork with internal teams to benchmark and design processes which improve the shopping experienceEstablish awareness of the way Retail operates to ensure process improvement initiatives can be driven through without frictionProject management of initiatives identified to improve the shopping experience
Experience/Skills:
Successful candidate will be able to manage several projects/initiatives at same time.Track record of sourcing and analyzing multiple sources of data to provide clear reporting of issues and how they affect the shopping experienceDemonstrated skills in communicating (both verbally and in writing), and influencing stakeholders across multiple disciplines and different levels of the businessCapability to make efficient and effective process improvement proposalsFlexibility to respond quickly to change and to reprioritize in the face of emerging issues and daily operations needs.Ability to deal with ambiguity and to solve problems even with limited informationStrong evidence of relationship-building across various internal departments within an organization

Experience within Customer Service or Retail organizations is a strong plusFluency in other Nordic languagesWorking knowledge of SQL

As Senior Threat Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d) at our location in Berlin you are responsible for cyber threat intelligence collection, consolidation and distribution.
You perform threat modelling, assessment and classification as well as thread and attack trending to ensure proactive counter threat management.
You create cyber security tactics, techniques, procedures (TTPs) and organizes the information distribution within the cyber security operations teams and drive information sharing with other cyber security organizations.

Tasks and Responsibilities

Analyze and respond to previously undisclosed software and hardware vulnerabilities and provide threat and vulnerability analysis as well as security advisory based on reports from internal, commercial and public sources including incidents, threat hunting results, penetration tests and read teaming activities
Participate in security incident management and vulnerability management processes
Maintain situational awareness of latest cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities and mitigation strategies
Performs analysis of all threat/vulnerability sources assessing any impacts to infrastructure and systems and provides an assessment, recommendations and potential actions correlative to the security threat posture
Conducts complex analysis and interpret cybersecurity threat intelligence to identify emerging risks and vulnerabilities, quantifies potential impact, and develops conclusions and recommend supervisory responses as written reports
Analyze threat intelligence reports to identify vulnerabilities, understand how they could be exploited, and the potential impact on the protected environment
Support detection process and investigations with optimized signatures (IoCs)
Participate in threat hunting, threat modeling, and threat intel activities
Develop appropriate response strategies based on intelligence received

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in a relevant area of study, or equivalent demonstrated experience and knowledge
Information Security professional designations such as CISSP, CISM, CISA, GCIA, GCIH (desired)
Strong understanding of security incident management, malware management and vulnerability management processes as well as various cyber-attacks and recent hacking techniques and attack vectors
Basic understanding of Operating Systems, Virtualization technologies, Network Devices, Cloud computing concepts, Web Proxies, Firewalls, IDS/IPS, AV Systems, DLP, Vulnerability Assessment tools
Advanced SQL and scripting experience (PowerShell, Python, Shell, etc.)
Understanding of attack methodologies and defense strategies (i.e. SQL injection, buffer overflow, DoS, ARP poisoning, etc)
Must understand basic security principles with an understanding of malware, cryptography, threats and vulnerabilities, access control, and application, data, and host security
Demonstrates a broad awareness of cybersecurity events, threats and actors, including trends and emerging systemic risks.
Excellent English written and verbal skills

Personal Qualities

Innovative and eager to learn in a rapidly evolving field
Personality traits, work habits, communication, and social skills necessary to work effectively within a dynamic and highly operational environment
Exemplary personal and professional integrity and demonstrate strong interpersonal skills.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with strong attention to detail
Ability to work independently (with moderate supervision) or on projects
Ability to manage multiple tasks, priorities, and operational assignments in a high pressure environment
Must have good time management skills with a demonstrated ability to complete assignments in a timely, high quality manner

Working Conditions & Compensation

On-call/stand-by availability required
Salary: Based on experience, education and certification
Travel: on occasion
Security Operation Center positions require employees to obtain and maintain a security clearance

There is no "we" without our employees

With our innovative IT solutions, we support our customers' digital transformation worldwide. In a wide range of sectors – from global trade in the international media industry to energy and utility companies. Over 2,700 dedicated employees work for us at more than 25 locations. Our customers especially appreciate our outstanding expertise, comprehensive technological knowledge and entrepreneurial spirit. Our employees appreciate our corporate culture of partnership, state-of-the-art technology and range of different challenges. We give our employees the freedom to be innovative and to take on entrepreneurial responsibility as part of a team.
We look forward to receiving your online application, including references and salary expectations.

The International Operations Team's mission is to help HubSpot grow better internationally through strategic research, analysis, and ultimately decisions that increase HubSpot's reach and penetration into new and existing markets. The Director of International Operations and Strategy will play a pivotal role in our International GTM strategy in collaboration with key functional leaders across sales, marketing, customer success, finance, and people ops. This person will also be responsible for keeping our International business and the various functions pointing in the right direction through an operating system that comprises of key meetings, reporting, and communication channels to ensure we're making good decisions in the most efficient manner. This role ultimately will be responsible for keeping our international trains running on time and on track, overseeing major international projects, tracking performance against targets, recommending plays to drive over performance and serving as the "global glue" that keeps our regions well connected to each other.

In this role, you'll get to:

Manage the International operating system: As part of the role, you will work closely with the SVP of International to own and manage key weekly, monthly and quarterly meetings to align stakeholders on key initiatives and also provide a channel to strategize new opportunities and how to overcome challenges. This also includes driving forward the overarching strategic plan for the following year during HubSpot's annual planning cycle. Additionally, as the person who owns the international operating system, this role is also responsible for proactively identifying areas for efficiencies in how the international business is run to enable us to move faster and better solve for the international customer.
Drive Key Projects and Initiatives forward: As part of our international strategy, there will be key projects and opportunities identified that require cross-functional alignment, project management, and eventual implementation. This person will be responsible for either directly owning these key projects or be a member of a core group in order to drive these initiatives forward. In addition, this person will be responsible for identifying recurring themes that may come up in these projects and accordingly identify opportunities to make changes in the operating system to solve for these themes permanently.
Projects may include but are not limited to: items that create new growth opportunities or remove blockers for local teams such as new office openings, addition of currencies in local markets, direct or partner GTM changes to meet local market needs, and sales and marketing growth plays.
Cross-Functional Alignment with International leaders: In order to drive projects to successful outcomes, this role requires a significant level of cross-functional alignment across key leaders in the business. The alignment will require partnership with functional and local leaders, to understand the challenges they may be facing in local geographies, and recommend approaches through which the International Ops team can support and resolve blockers. The support may be in the form of data analysis, raising the issue with supporting data in a key leadership meeting, or collaborating and influencing members in the business to prioritize the appropriate issues that have been identified.
Reporting and analysis: In order to have a well run operating system that drives successful outcomes, data and analysis is a cornerstone towards making great decisions. This role is responsible for owning a layer of our reporting and analysis to help outline where opportunities and challenges exist and what solutions will help move forward. You should be comfortable with using Excel, creating reports using BI tools like Looker and HubSpot CRM, and eventually sharing this in a consumable format that clearly paints a picture of what the data is highlighting. You will have the support of analysts to help you with the reporting but you should be comfortable using existing reports and making needed adjustments. As part of this role and working with the analysts, there will be regular summaries and decks that this person will share that highlight KPIs including business growth, customer success, market penetration, and partner performance.
Communicating progress on key initiatives: The International business is a key growth driver for HubSpot and keeping the various teams and exec team aligned on progress is a key part of the role. The communication may include ongoing post-meeting summaries, monthly and quarterly progress updates across projects and performance, and GTM decisions.

We're looking for people who:

Have experience working with Excel and BI tools to analyze datasets and make recommendations backed up with objective viewpoints
Have strong communication skills; the ability to articulate decisions in the form of presentations and narratives that help drive buy-in and alignment.
Are highly collaborative with proven abilities to drive alignment and change through partnership and influence.
Have experience leading cross-functional strategic projects that span multiple offices and regions.
Have a strong track record of being a self-starter and working through ambiguity to successful implementation of key initiatives.
Have 5+ years experience working in an international business and experience in a consulting or strategy role

An MBA degree would be an added bonus but is not required

Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But we'll let you in on a secret: there's no such thing as a perfect candidate. HubSpot is a place where everyone can grow. So however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day.

About HubSpot
-------------

HubSpot helps millions of organizations grow better, and we'd love to grow better with you. Our business builds the software and systems that power the world's small to medium-sized businesses. Our company culture builds connections, careers, and employee growth. How? By creating a workplace that values flexibility, autonomy, and transparency. If that sounds like something you'd like to be part of, we'd love to hear from you.

You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code ( https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/34234/The-HubSpot-Culture-Code-Creating-a-Company-We-Love.aspx ), which has more than 4M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace ( https://www.hubspot.com/diversity-inclusion ), too. Thanks to the work of every HubSpotter globally who has helped build our remarkable culture, HubSpot has been named a top workplace by Glassdoor, Fortune, Entrepreneur, and more. HubSpot was founded in 2006. We're headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, and we have offices in Dublin (Ireland), Sydney (Australia), New Hampshire, Singapore, Tokyo (Japan), Berlin (Germany), Bogotá (Colombia), and Paris (France).

By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Recruiting Privacy Notice ( https://legal.hubspot.com/recruiting-privacy-notice ) explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot's use of your personal information.

As Senior Incident Response Analyst (m/f/d) at our location in Berlin or Gütersloh you are responsible for verification, assessment and classification of reported Cyber Security incidents. You communicate incident remediation status and escalate to relevant parties.
You engage in incident response and countermeasure coordination with affected parties and review incidents after closure for potential defense and process improvements.

Tasks and Responsibilities

Manage incident response including incident detection, analysis, containment, eradication, recovery and chain of evidence/ forensic artifacts required for additional investigations
Review and analyze incidents escalated from Monitoring Analyst Team and validate incident risk and priority scoring
Utilize advanced network and host forensic tools in order to triage and scope an incident
Perform investigation and analytics of network and host-based payloads and artifacts in relation to the incident
Correlate additional context from Threat Intelligence team for incident during investigation and analysis
Participate vulnerability management processes
Work as part of a team to ensure that corporate data and technology platform components are safeguarded from known threats
Create recommendations and requirements for content detection and response, enhancements to response process & procedures and systems
Provide technical support for forensics services to include evidence seizure, computer forensic analysis and data recovery, in support of computer crime investigation

Qualifications

Basic understanding of Operating Systems, Virtualization technologies, Network Devices, Cloud computing concepts, Web Proxies, Firewalls, Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems, Antivirus Systems, Data Loss Prevention, Vulnerability Assessment tools
Strong understanding of security incident management, malware management and vulnerability management processes
Ability to follow through on all phases of the incident response and identify attacks, determine initial vectors, and complete scope of incidents
Good understanding of basic security principles with an understanding of malware, cryptography, threats and vulnerabilities, access control, and application, data, and host security
Knowledge of TCP/IP Protocols, network analysis, and network/security applications and common Internet protocols and applications
Experience in troubleshooting in a technical environment as well as basic forensics tools and web history tools
Excellent English and German written and verbal skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, case management and ticketing system

Personal Qualities

Innovative and eager to learn in a rapidly evolving field
Personality traits, work habits, communication, and social skills necessary to work effectively within a dynamic and highly operational environment.
Exemplary personal and professional integrity and demonstrate strong interpersonal skills
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail
Ability to manage multiple tasks, priorities, and operational assignments in a high-pressure environment
Must have good time management skills with a demonstrated ability to complete assignments in a timely, high quality manner

Working Conditions & Compensation

Shift work required
On-call/stand-by availability required
Salary: Based on experience, education and certification
Travel: on occasion
Security Operation Center positions require employees to obtain and maintain a security clearance

In a wide range of sectors – from global trade in the international media industry to energy and utility companies. Over 2,700 dedicated employees work for us at more than 25 locations. Our customers especially appreciate our outstanding expertise, comprehensive technological knowledge and entrepreneurial spirit. Our employees appreciate our corporate culture of partnership, state-of-the-art technology and range of different challenges. We give our employees the freedom to be innovative and to take on entrepreneurial responsibility as part of a team.
