OptioPay’s product team is looking for a Product Manager to help us generate smart personalized financial recommendations for our customers using banking data. Recommendations are important to the core of our business to help improve our customer's financial lives. You have an entrepreneurial mindset with a bias towards independent problem-solving. Clear communication and prioritization will be important as you plan, design, and deliver the best-personalized financial recommendations for our customers. Your passion for using AI and Machine Learning to improve people’s financial lives, and your experience leading complex technology projects will help you make strong business judgments.

Develop the product roadmap and strategy for recommendations
Work closely with senior management, data analysts, and engineers to deliver highly scalable and robust recommendation products
Collaborate closely with the head of product in building consensus for the product vision both internally and externally and evangelize that vision within the organization
Plan, develop, test and implement personalized financial recommendations and track performance using relevant KPIs
Manage the delivery of current products concurrently with future product planning

Job requirements
Academic degree in computer science, engineering, math, finance, or economics
Several years of product management or finance experience in technology-focused business leaning towards recommendations and personalisation
Great communication and analytical abilities, including the expertise to solve ambiguous problems
High consideration to detail and the ability to manage multiple, opposing priorities concurrently
Entrepreneurial drive, and confirmed capability to inspire others
Fluency in English

Nice-to-have qualifications:

Prior P&L ownership for a product or service
Experience delivering software products and features using agile methodologies

Are you ready to be a Java Engineer for the leading virtual analytics hub product?

You live in Berlin / Halle (Saale) / Leipzig area?

You are ready to join one of the most innovative tech companies?

Do you get lightheaded thinking about the endless possibilities held by big data insights and collaborative data analytics? We dare you to show us your bold, fierce, passionate side; you'll feel right at home among our people!

At Datameer, we're data nerds through and through. We're here to consistently innovate, to build the virtual analytics hub that's always on the bleeding edge. We're here to lead the charge in this data revolution. Care to join us?

Anna's problems are our problems:
Anna is an analyst and Anna and her colleagues are working with hundreds of files each day. They like, they share, and they collaborate on these files and datasets. They create new workflows to get the insights their company needs to be successful. And guess what, in a short time, Anna and her colleagues created are repeating their work.

We want to help Anna by showing her duplicates or similar objects, by suggesting next steps, by finding the right collaborators. Therefore, we need your skills.

Helpful experience, and some buzzwords:

5 years industry experience with Java and other JVM technologies
Experience with Mongo and Elasticsearch
Experience with duplicate detection and recommendation systems
Experience developing distributed systems
Experience developing with SQL and RDBMS(s)
Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly and master diverse technologies and techniques
Strong communication and self-management skills
Passion for working with data analytics, with a focus on efficiency, simplicity and building high impact customer features
Experience with Agile development teams and excellent interpersonal skills

About Us

We aren't your average Engineering team, that's why we're looking for somebody who likes pushing the limits of what's possible and delivering amazing features to our customers day after day. We are a fast paced, collaborative, kickass team that is always trying to find ways to blow our customer's minds. If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you.

We are a well-funded, global software company headquartered in San Francisco with global offices across Europe backed by top tier investors including KPCB, Redpoint Ventures, and Next World Capital among others. Our customers include who's who of the fortune 100 and the list is growing!

We have a history of continued innovation since 2010, serving the fortune 100 providing an enterprise grade platform enabling trusted data-driven insights anywhere. Datameer's advanced data preparation, exploration and governance functionality makes it easy to transform big data into curated data sets to feed any analytics initiative. Using a hybrid architecture that spans on-premise and the cloud, Datameer helps organizations deliver new insights in days and operationalize them immediately, increasing agility and responsiveness of the analytics that drive the business.

We recently introduced our latest innovation in analytics - Neebo - 'The Virtual Analytics Hub' - a powerful cloud solution designed to enable teams of analysts and data scientists to perform analyses on complex and disparate data landscapes. With Neebo, teams can now, at the click of a mouse without coding, find, create and collaborate on complex data sets and drive insights from their data faster than ever.


We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

**Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: Datameer does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Datameer will not pay fees to any third party recruitment agency or firm in the absence of a signed agreement and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of Datameer.

job_title: Technical Account Manager / Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Integrations & Reportings
full_text:
Als Technical Account Manager / Technical Analyst (m/w/d) bist du Teil unseres 25-köpfigen Support und Customer Success Management sowie Account Management Teams in Berlin. In deiner Rolle bist du erster Anlaufpunkt unserer Kunden für automatisierte Reportings sowie Datenabfragen. Du beziehst Daten externer API's, um diese weiter zu verarbeiten und so neue Insights und Auswertungen zu generieren. Nach deinem erfolgreichen Onboarding entwickelst du Actionpläne und Projektstrategien, um den ROI für deine Kunden zu maximieren und arbeitest eng mit deinen Kollegen*innen aus dem Account Management zusammen, um deine Accounts langfristig zu entwickeln und an uns zu binden.

Deine Mission im Detail
Du bist in erster Linie verantwortlich für die Sicherstellung der Zufriedenheit und die langfristige Bindung unseres schnell wachsenden Kundenstammes an unser Unternehmen.
Du berätst unsere internationalen Bestandskunden als technischer Produkt-Experte um einen Mehrwert für unsere Kunden zu generieren
Du erstellst individuelle Reportings in verschiedenen Tools, um unseren Kunden eine Entscheidungsgrundlage zu liefern
Du unterstützt Kunden bei der Optimierung von automatisierten Workflows basierend auf unserer Searchmetrics-API
Du unterstützt und schulst unsere Kollegen im Umgang mit unserer API und Datenintegrationen
Du bist verantwortlich für die Koordination und Durchführung von Präsentationen unserer API, Integrationen und Datenanalysen über verschiedene Medien (Telefon, Web-Konferenzen, Live-Präsentationen) zur Schulung und Information unserer Kunden
Du bildest die Schnittstelle zu unserem Produkt Management, um Feedback deiner Accounts mit einfließen zu lassen
Was wir dir bieten

Einen klar definierten Karrierepfad zum Senior sowie die Möglichkeit einer Führungs- oder Expertenlaufbahn
Ein Umfeld, in dem du direkten Einfluss auf deinen Job und darüber hinaus hast
Internationale Kollegen*innen aus über 25 Nationen
Soft-Drinks und Obst sowie regelmäßiges Frühstück und Pizza Days
Team und Company Events
Urban Sports (M) oder Fitness First Mitgliedschaft sowie ein in-house Gym
28 Tage Urlaub zum Einstieg, 30 Tage nach zwei Jahren
Zuschuss zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge
Die coolsten Bürohunde Berlins


Was du mitbringst
Du hast mindestens zwei Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung, idealerweise im Bereich der technischen Betreuung von Accounts
Du kannst ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik oder IT, alternativ eine Ausbildung zum Fachinformatiker für Anwendungsentwicklung mit anschließender Berufserfahrung vorweisen
Du besitzt Programmiergrundkenntnisse und fühlst dich sicher im Umgang mit Softwaretechnik
Du hast Erfahrung in der Automatisierung von Reportings und Datenabfragen sowie im Bezug von Daten externer API's
Du bringst Leidenschaft für das Lernen und Lehren komplexer Sachverhalte mit
Ausgeprägtes analytisches sowie konzeptionelles Denken und Handeln zeichnen Dich aus
Sichere Kommunikationsfähigkeit in deutscher und englischer Sprache runden dein Profil ab
Interesse geweckt? Lass uns miteinander darüber sprechen, wie gut wir zueinander passen. Bewirb dich ganz einfach in einer Minute über unsere Karriereseite. Du wirst nach Erhalt deiner Bewerbung unverzüglich eine Bestätigungs-E-Mail von uns erhalten. Solltest du diese nicht bekommen, checke bitte deinen Spam Ordner und leite Mails von unserer Mailadresse in deinen Posteingang um.

As the Data Management area at idealo, we are building a cutting-edge, cloud-based data platform suitable for self-service analytics as well as for machine learning, data products, and our enterprise reporting. We believe that a data-driven approach is a key success factor for our business. Therefore we aim to enable our technical and non-technical internal customers to base their everyday business decisions on hypotheses that are proved by data.

We are looking for a Team Lead highly passionate about enabling people and teams to work at their best. You foster an environment of trust where autonomy and alignment are no contradiction. Actively, you strive for diversity in your team to reflect the diversity of our customers. Inspired, guided and supported by you, the team is set up for success.

By leading our DWH/BI-team specialized in the area of data engineering, business intelligence and data analysis you help other teams and areas at idealo to succeed by incorporating the decisive data at the right time and in the right way. By that you will have a large impact on transforming the business at idealo, using the power of data.

Tasks


Be part of our leadership team in the data management area
Lead an autonomous team of data engineers and analysts
Connect your team with our overall strategy in the data management area
Be a key player in our migration of our Data Warehouse from on-premise to AWS
Be a key player in enabling self-service analytics and reporting at idealo
Support your team members in their personal growth
Support your team to establish effective and efficient collaboration structures
Foster leadership and entrepreneurship in your team members’ attitude
Be a role model for giving and receiving feedback

Requirements


You have a passion for developing people and teams
You are familiar with agile leadership principles and methods and have used them before
You facilitate learning
You know how to hire and retain talent for your team
You communicate clearly and trustworthy
You have a background in engineering or data analysis
You have a solid understanding of good practices in software engineering, like pair programming, testing, clean code
You are fluent in English

Benefits


Training opportunities for your individual management or specialist career
The provision of all necessary equipment that you need to deliver top performances
Employees are self-reliant and free to schedule their own work day
Onboarding program including Welcome Day, Trainings and individual incorporation
The chance to work together on our goals, while also working to create something new
800 motivated colleagues and a cool office loft in the trendy district of Kreuzberg

idealo is a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Today, with 1.5 million visits per day, 50,000 shops and more than 330 million product offers, we are one of the most popular German e-commerce websites and one of the leading European shopping and comparison platforms. We are active as a price comparison platform in six countries (Austria, France, Germany, Great Britain, Italy and Spain).

As a member of our team, you can look forward to working with a large degree of freedom in an international and inspirational environment. We are located in the heart of Berlin and offer a unique idealo spirit. Your ideas are the driving force that moves our business forward. Not only our product portfolio is diverse, but also the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation or a degree of disability are irrelevant.

If you are passionate about improving the world of online shopping alongside 800 idealos from 40 nations, apply with us today.

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.

You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.

In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED


Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined

PERKS AT WORK


Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source ( https://opensource.zalando.com/ ) commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs ( https://jobs.zalando.com/tech/blog/ ), product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)

WHICH PRODUCT TEAMS


Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. As a Product Analyst in the content composition team, you will work with data scientists and engineers, draw insights from the complex interaction of content, customers, and Zalando's business and help to understand why which content is successful in front of the customer.We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO

Zalando is Europe's leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages ( https://opensource.zalando.com/tech-radar/ ) our teams choose to use.

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

job_title: Analyst (m/w/d) – Risikomodelle, Banksteuerung und Regulatorik für Spezialinstitute und Landesbausparkassen
full_text:
Die Sparkassen Rating und Risikosysteme GmbH (SR) ist ein innovatives Unternehmen mit Sitz in der Mitte Berlins. Wir unterstützen die Institute der Sparkassen-Finanzgruppe mit Methoden und Verfahren im Risikomanagement, in der Kapitalplanung und in der Risikotragfähigkeit sowie in den damit verbundenen Themen Meldewesen, Reporting und Datenhaushalt.

Für den Ausbau unserer Beratungs- und Entwicklungsaktivitäten im Themenfeld der aufsichtlichen und betriebswirtschaftlichen Risikomessung/-steuerung für Landesbausparkassen suchen wir ab sofort Ihre qualifizierte Unterstützung.

Analyst (m/w/d) – Risikomodelle, Banksteuerung und Regulatorik für Spezialinstitute und Landesbausparkassen, ab sofort


Aufgaben: Prognosemodelle und praxistaugliche Lösungen entwickeln

Konzeption, Analysen, Methodenbenchmarking und Umsetzung von ökonometrischen Modellen zu wirtschaftlichen, aufsichtlichen und risikorelevanten Fragen
Parameterschätzung, Validierung und Modell-/Methodenpflege des zentralen Simulationsmodells für die Steuerung und Geschäftsplanung der LBS-Bausparkollektive
Eigenverantwortliche Durchführung von Projekten im Umfeld der Risikobewertung, Banksteuerung und Regulatorik von Bausparkassen
Fachkonzeption, Implementierung und Test geeigneter IT-Lösungen
Unterstützung in der betriebswirtschaftlichen und regulatorischen Banksteuerung

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

About Sellics:

Sellics is revolutionizing commerce, starting with the world’s biggest online marketplace: Amazon. From starting as a group of friends with targeted business insights and under €2,000 in self-invested startup capital, we’ve transformed into the force we are today: a fast-growing and funded Scale-Up company providing data-driven and Ai-powered B2B SaaS solutions to help Sellers, Vendors, and Agencies across the world be successful on Amazon.


The secret to our success is our team, a group of more than 125 highly-engaged, intelligent, dynamic employees from over 35 countries, spread out across our offices in Berlin and New York City. We’re a pack of people who care about each other, the values we live by, and the success story we’re all helping to write. Are you ready to be a Java Engineer for the leading virtual analytics hub product?

You live in Berlin / Halle (Saale) / Leipzig area?

You are ready to join one of the most innovative tech companies?

Do you get lightheaded thinking about the endless possibilities held by big data insights and collaborative data analytics? We dare you to show us your bold, fierce, passionate side; you'll feel right at home among our people!

At Datameer, we're data nerds through and through. We're here to consistently innovate, to build the virtual analytics hub that's always on the bleeding edge. We're here to lead the charge in this data revolution. Care to join us?

Anna's problems are our problems:
Anna is an analyst and Anna and her colleagues are working with hundreds of files each day. They like, they share, and they collaborate on these files and datasets. They create new workflows to get the insights their company needs to be successful. And guess what, in a short time, Anna and her colleagues created are repeating their work.

We want to help Anna by showing her duplicates or similar objects, by suggesting next steps, by finding the right collaborators. Therefore, we need your skills.

Helpful experience, and some buzzwords:

5 years industry experience with Java and other JVM technologies
Experience with Mongo and Elasticsearch
Experience with duplicate detection and recommendation systems
Experience developing distributed systems
Experience developing with SQL and RDBMS(s)
Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly and master diverse technologies and techniques
Strong communication and self-management skills
Passion for working with data analytics, with a focus on efficiency, simplicity and building high impact customer features
Experience with Agile development teams and excellent interpersonal skills

About Us

We aren't your average Engineering team, that's why we're looking for somebody who likes pushing the limits of what's possible and delivering amazing features to our customers day after day. We are a fast paced, collaborative, kickass team that is always trying to find ways to blow our customer's minds. If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you.

We are a well-funded, global software company headquartered in San Francisco with global offices across Europe backed by top tier investors including KPCB, Redpoint Ventures, and Next World Capital among others. Our customers include who's who of the fortune 100 and the list is growing!

We have a history of continued innovation since 2010, serving the fortune 100 providing an enterprise grade platform enabling trusted data-driven insights anywhere. Datameer's advanced data preparation, exploration and governance functionality makes it easy to transform big data into curated data sets to feed any analytics initiative. Using a hybrid architecture that spans on-premise and the cloud, Datameer helps organizations deliver new insights in days and operationalize them immediately, increasing agility and responsiveness of the analytics that drive the business.

We recently introduced our latest innovation in analytics - Neebo - 'The Virtual Analytics Hub' - a powerful cloud solution designed to enable teams of analysts and data scientists to perform analyses on complex and disparate data landscapes. With Neebo, teams can now, at the click of a mouse without coding, find, create and collaborate on complex data sets and drive insights from their data faster than ever.


We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

Honest Food is Europe’s leading „Ghost Restaurant“ chain - parent company to the most beloved and successful food delivery brands on the continent. All our virtual restaurant brands are developed specifically for delivery and can only be purchased online through platforms like Delivery Hero. Our family of digitally optimized partner restaurants prepare the food with the highest attention to detail to make sure that each household in every region can enjoy the perfect food delivery experience at any time.

Since the company’s foundation in 2017, we’ve worked hard to become one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies in food tech. Whilst a lot has been achieved already, we are hungrier than ever to completely change the rules of global food delivery. We believe that highly motivated and talented people are the key to master our ambitious goals ahead. We are expanding strongly and will enter several new markets within this year!

In order to exponentially grow our business by giving meaningful data insights, we are hiring a Business Intelligence Team Lead (m/f/d), that brings our existing analytical capabilities to the next level. In this role, you will be responsible to set up and constantly improve our BI infrastructure. Your work is the foundation to our data driven management approach for every department from product to finance.

Your tasks:

Develop a state of the art reporting infrastructureChallenge and optimize our current data architecture and reporting setupDevelop our end-to-end BI approach and secure the most insightful data for every departmentProactively understand department specific data needs and translate them in a powerful setupOwn the data integration with Delivery Hero worldwide and build the foundations for a new level of business intelligence.

Get the best insights out of our dataCreate an efficient and reliable data backbone for all our tech toolsDetect operative inefficiencies and find data driven tech solutionsDive into the data and create smart algorithms that optimize our order and partner management.

Lead the teamLead a team of driven data analysts – set goals, define workloads and structure processesReport directly to one of the founders.
Your profile:
5 years (+) of previous experience in Business Intelligence at a senior and operational level
Ability to effectively coach and form a team of best-in-class business-driven BI analysts
Profound experience in data modelling and data architecture
Proven experiences with tool stacks in the area of ETL, DWH and Data Analytics
Commitment, diligence, structure, communication and team skills are attributes by which you would describe yourself
High degree of proactiveness and curiosity to understand, measure and improve business operations through data
In addition, you have very good knowledge of written and spoken English.
What we offer:
Revolutionize one of the rapidly developing industries and enrich food deliveries worldwide
Opportunity to have a real impact on the success story of the company and significantly shape one of the fastest-growing consumer brand companies in food tech with massive public exposure
An energetic, positive, self-managed work environment with a team culture that prizes excellence and commitment to our company mission
High potential for personal growth and fast career development.
In case you don't have a CV at hand, you can also apply with your compelling LinkedIn profile.

Ready to become part of Honest Food’s Operations Intelligence team? We are looking forward to meeting you.

job_title: Senior Sales and Customer Success Analyst (m/f/d)
full_text:
Project A is the operational VC that provides its ventures with capital, an extensive network and exclusive access to a wide range of operational expertise. The Berlin-based investor makes use of the €260m in assets under its management to back early-stage companies in the digital technology space. With its unique organizational structure featuring 100 operational experts, Project A offers its portfolio companies hands-on support in the areas of Software Engineering, Digital Marketing, Design, Communications, Business Intelligence, Sales and Recruiting. The portfolio includes companies such as Artisense, Catawiki, Horizn Studios, KRY, LIQID, Spryker, uberall and WorldRemit. You can find more information at www.project-a.com and on the blog insights.project-a.com.

We are looking for:
A new team member for our A-Team.

“Nothing happens until someone sells something”. As a VC, we see it everyday: the smartest founding team with the best product idea in the world will fail if they can’t figure out how to scalably sell it. With our own department of specialists in the area of Sales & Customer Success, we’re determined to help our ventures sell by building and providing industry-leading expertise throughout their entire commercial funnel.

Your role in our team will be to work closely with our portfolio of digital leaders and help them implement excellent sales & customer success organizations. You will be exposed to different business models, company maturities and analytical problems all the while getting unique insights into our VC investment process.

Tasks


Development of client acquisition and customer success strategies for our start-ups and private equity co-investments
Review of their messaging, processes and organizational setup
Implementation of value-driving improvements like customer segmentation to the selection of the right channels and pitch design
Data-driven optimization and further development of direct customer contact
Evaluation and implementation of sales CRM tools (e.g. Salesforce)
Conceptualization and execution of trainings and workshops with founders and commercial teams
Further development of Project A best practices for sales & customer success

Requirements


Successful completion of your studies in economics or related fields with top-in-class results
Min. of 3 years of sales or customer success work experience in the start-up or consulting ecosphere and an entrepreneurial mindset
Experience in optimizing and scaling sales processes
Outstanding analytical and organizational skills and fluency in German and English
High motivation, very quick comprehension and willingness to make decisions as your strengths
Strong interest in sales and customer success and ideally, you have already gained experience with Sales CRM tools
Self-confidence, a lot of initiative and you enjoy highly dynamic environments
Strong team spirit and excellent communication skills

Benefits


An instant network within the Project A family - among it our 50 portfolio companies - to help you succeed throughout your entire career
Becoming part of a highly motivated and professional team
Having the unique opportunity to experience and to make an impact on recently founded companies
Working independently, have all freedom you need and are thus able to personally grow and develop yourself on a constant basis
Working at a modern and well-equipped office in the heart of Berlin
Benefiting from a communicative, creative and stimulating environment

Do you want to be part of our success story?

We are looking forward to your online application.

---------------------
The opportunity
---------------------

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our Analytics & BI at our Berlin Headquarters. In this role, you will ensure our data infrastructure is optimally set up to deliver high-quality, reliable data for driving business decisions. You'll lead efforts such as growing into more scalable cloud data warehousing and big data tooling. You will directly contribute to our mission to inspire others to live healthy and active lives by empowering our teams through data which will ensure we provide an enjoyable, smooth experience to our members and partners while simultaneously building up a sustainable business to serve these groups for the years to come.

---------------------------
Your responsibilities
---------------------------


Provide topical leadership to the small but growing team of data engineers
Scale up our data pipelines by moving our processes to cloud technologies
Maintain and optimize existing data transformation processes
Choose technologies and build software to support the work of data scientists, analysts, and other team members in their daily work
Work together with the analysts to find the best solutions to handle data pipelines and data processing
Manage the daily data warehouse operations

------------------------------
What you need to succeed
------------------------------


Several years of professional experience as a data engineer in a cross-functional team setup
Proven track record of working with cloud technologies (AWS)
Proven experience scaling data infrastructures
You have a strong desire to experiment with new technologies and acquire new skills to find clever solutions to the unique challenges we will encounter along the way
A desire to develop into a team lead and a drive to inspire your team and colleagues

----------------------
Our offer to you
----------------------


The opportunity to work with a modern tech stack (Postgres, Metabase, Airflow, Python)
"Workout. Life. Balance." Life happens, and work can't always come first. We support you in finding a way to balance the two through initiatives like flexible working hours and the option to work from home
Many additional perks including: regular team events, foreign language classes, choice of computer/technology, dog-friendly workplace, fully-equipped kitchens with healthy snacks & beverages, employee referral bonuses, and more
A free Urban Sports Club L Membership (and lots of colleagues to use it with!)

Urban Sports Club is committed to providing a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for everyone who works here or with us, regardless of their sports preferences, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, or religion (or lack thereof).

Fyber is hiring a Working Student to join our Corporate Systems and IT Team.

In this role, you will be based in our Berlin office and you are responsible for assisting our Business Analyst and System Analysts. You will be involved in day-to-day work processes providing support to our internal stakeholders from Business, Finance, HR and other Operations teams.

About us:
Fyber is a leading technology company developing tools for smarter app monetization. It combines proprietary technologies and expertise in mediation, RTB, video, and audience segmentation to create solutions that shape the future of the app economy. Fyber's flagship product, Fyber Fairbid, is a holistic publisher platform that revolutionizes mediation, reporting, and connects to one of the most advanced mobile ad marketplaces. Our mission is to empower mobile publishers to unlock the true value of their properties by building a holistic, efficient, and transparent monetization environment. Fyber has seven global offices in San Francisco, New York, London, Berlin, Tel Aviv, Seoul, and Beijing.

Learn and grow with some of the best experts in the mobile industry. Work within a high-growth, software company (with over 250 employees worldwide). Join a friendly, culturally diverse team where people live values like dedication, team spirit, mutual respect, and accountability.

Your responsibilities:

Support of the Corporate Systems and Office IT teams in the areas of system & data maintenance and business analysis
Support of larger projects and smaller change requests in Oracle, Jira, Salesforce and other systems owned by the teams
Process design, functional specification, testing, go-live and operations support
Guided interaction with Fyber business teams as part of the wider Operations initiatives

Your qualifications:

You have experience with administrating and maintaining applications and are curious in improving your knowledge
You have first experience with/basic understanding of corporate systems like CRM, Finance applications, HR information systems, ticket applications
You have first experience with/basic understanding of IT systems like GSuite, Slack, Office 365, etc
You are proactive with the willingness to cover tasks end-to-end with high engagement
You have safe communication skills, verbally and in writing in English (German is not a must)
You have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and to cope with related frequent changes as well as new business requirements
You have first experience with agile methodologies

Missing a required skill but still think this is a perfect job for you? Don't hesitate - tell us why you are a great fit in your cover letter.


Fyber is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our Fyber team no matter your gender, race, color, ethnicity, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability, family status or any other matter.

Standorte: Berlin
Vertragsart: Vollzeit, unbefristet
Von Anfang an Teil unseres Systems Development-Teams als Trainee on the Job! Sie haben Ihr Studium bzw. Ausbildung als Fachinformatiker (m/w/d) gerade erfolgreich abgeschlossen, wollen praktische Erfahrungen im Consulting sammeln und dort einsteigen, wo Zukunft gestaltet wird? Dann sind Sie mit einem Karrierestart bei Syncwork im Rahmen unseres Traineeprogramms genau richtig. Gemeinsam setzen wir herausfordernde Projekte um.
Über Syncwork
Die Syncwork AG ist eine inhabergeführte unabhängige IT-Beratungsgesellschaft mit Niederlassungen in Berlin, Dresden, Wiesbaden, München, Köln und Zürich. Mit namhaften und renommierten Kunden aus unterschiedlichsten Branchen wie Pharma, Industrie, Finanzen, Telekommunikation und dem öffentlichen Sektor verbindet uns eine langjährige und vertrauensvolle Kooperation. Wir bieten ein Beratungsportfolio, welches von der Organisations- und Prozessberatung über die Planung und Umsetzung bis zur Auswahl und Realisierung von IT-Lösungen reicht.
Ihre Aufgaben
Sie lernen die Grundlagen und Methoden zum Aufbau von Data Warehouse und Business Intelligence Systemen kennen. Dazu gehören:

Modellierung mit Data Vault sowie die dimensionale Modellierung
Design und Implementierung von ETL Prozessen zur Datenversorgung
Entwurf von Reports und Dashboards
Requirements Engineering und Testmanagement für BI-Systeme
Techniken des Data Analysten und Techniken des Data Scientist
Modellierung, Speicherung und Analyse von Daten in relationalen, als auch Big Data Systemen

Während des Traineeprogramms steht Ihnen ein erfahrener Kollege (m/w/d) zur Seite und begleitet Sie systematisch.

Ihr Profil
Sie haben Ihr Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Naturwissenschaften, ein vergleichbares Studium oder Ihre Ausbildung als Fachinformatiker (m/w/d) erfolgreich abgeschlossen.
Sie interessieren sich für die Verarbeitung und Analyse von Daten.
Sie punkten mit Ihren guten Deutsch- und Englischkenntnissen.
Sie wollen durch Ihren Einsatz zum Projekterfolg beitragen und verkörpern unsere durch Teamgeist, Flexibilität und Erfolgswillen geprägte Unternehmenskultur.

Unser Angebot
Ein attraktives und unbefristetes Anstellungsverhältnis mit erstklassigen Perspektiven.
Wir wünschen uns, dass Sie mit uns wachsen. Mit zielgerichteten Schulungen, Trainings und individuellen Weiterbildungen durchlaufen Sie ein intensives 12-monatiges Traineeprogramm, das zu Ihren beruflichen Vorhaben passt.
Es erwarten Sie ein kollegiales Betriebsklima, zahlreiche Annehmlichkeiten für den beruflichen Alltag sowie verschiedene Rahmenbedingungen, mit denen wir die Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf unterstützen.
Interessiert?
Dann freuen wir uns darauf, Sie kennenzulernen! Bitte senden Sie uns Ihre Bewerbung per E-Mail an: karriere@syncwork.de
Ihre Ansprechpartnerin
Syncwork AG
Bärbel Zeuske
Lietzenburger Straße 69
10719 Berlin, Deutschland
Tel: +49 (0) 30 854081-62
E-Mail: karriere@syncwork.de
www.syncwork.de

job_title: Working Student, Supply Chain Management EU (m/f/d)
full_text:
----------------------------------------
Looking for a job to get you out of bed?
----------------------------------------

Casper is seeking a Working Student, Supply Chain Management EU to join the EU team based in Berlin. Reporting directly to the Operations Manager EU Supply Chain, the Working Studen, Supply Chain Management EU will help monitor the flow of inventory working closely together with our Production Analyst and the rest of the Operations team.

Casper (casper.com) is a global sleep company that launched in 2014 with an obsessively engineered, outrageously comfortable mattress sold directly to consumers. Its critically acclaimed sleep surface was developed in-house, has a sleek design, and is delivered in a small, "how did they do that?"-sized box. The company is one of the fastest-growing consumer brands of all time, and its product line has expanded to include sheets, pillows, a matching foundation, and a dog mattress. Casper was named one of Fast Company's 50 Most Innovative Companies in 2017, and its eponymous mattress was crowned one of TIME Magazine's Best Inventions.

We are deeply committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce so that we represent all those who dream big equally.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
When you're not catching zzz's, this is what you'll do
------------------------------------------------------------------------


Monitor inventory levels for all Casper products across EU markets
Work closely with and communicate updates between Supply Chain, Fulfillment and CX; specifically inventory inquiries and inventory availability messaging on our website
Support work with production partners, freight forwarders and Casper warehouses (several locations across Europe)
Update and maintain product and supplier master data to share with multiple stakeholders
Support new product launches or product changes
Maintain Supply Chain KPI's and report to relevant stakeholders to continuously improve operations

----------------------
Our dream candidate...
----------------------


Is enrolled with an official German university and can provide an enrollment certificate
Ideally, has already gained some practical experience through an internship or a student job in supplier relationship management
Has experience in working in an innovative, industry leading e-commerce organization
Is highly motivated, engaged and thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment
Is reliable and problem-solving oriented with a strong analytical mind and a "hands on" mentality
Is fluent in German and English with excellent written and verbal communication skills; another European language is a big plus
Is experienced with MS Office tools, Google Forms and ERP systems
Loves sleep!

-------------------------
The syrup on your waffles
-------------------------


Unlimited vacation policy. If you need time off just take it; we trust you!
Bi-weekly catered lunches to catch up with your teammates
Free snacks and coffee, including a huge breakfast selection (10 types of cereal anyone?)
Nap pods, for those days when you stayed out a little too late...

If you dream about this stuff this job is probably right for you. We look forward to learning more about you, but if you're feeling sleepy, take a nap before applying!

Tasks

We are an independent team of technical diverse engineers and analysts taking care of the data platform at FRIDAY. Our mission is to bring data & statistics to FRIDAY's products and processes which includes data ingestion, analysis and software development.

For instance, last year we developed an internal product that simulates the yearly renewal process in car insurance in order to help our pricing team to adjust premiums to the best for our customers. In this project, we are connecting a lot of different data sources, analyze data using statistical models and provide a simple user interface for our pricing team so they can run simulations on their own.

Your first task could include an extension of this product. You would work hand-in-hand with our data analysts in order to improve statistical models that were developed by them, add more data sources, improve the user interface and the overall - still PoC-ish - architecture.

Requirements

Python powers most of our microservices which are deployed to Kubernetes. We prefer quality over high output: All code is committed to Git. We use GitLab CI and manage our infrastructure in Terraform. Our services are running on AWS exclusively.

Data processing and business logic happen in SQL, Spark, workflow orchestration are done by Airflow.

Interested? If yes - we're looking forward to hearing from you!

Senior Web Analyst (m/w)
Für unseren Standort Berlin suchen wir einen Senior Web Analyst (m/w), der unsere Projektteams und Kunden, wie Mercedes-Benz, BOSCH und KfW, rund um das Thema Data Analytics berät und betreut. Unser Ziel ist es, die Produkte unserer Kunden kontinuierlich noch besser auf die Bedürfnisse ihrer Nutzer abzustimmen. Daher wirst du frühzeitig in unsere Projekte integriert um, zusammen mit Konzeptern und Designern, von Beginn an Daten für Mitarbeiter und Kunden verfügbar und verständlich zu machen.
Deine Aufgabe
Du wandelst strategische Projektziele in statistisch sinnvolle Dimensionen und Metriken um
Für interne Projekte und unsere Kunden konzipierst du Reporte und Analysen
Unsere Kunden schulst du im Umgang mit Analytics-Systemen
Du konzipierst und dokumentierst technische Trackingkonzepten
Du übernimmst die Beratung zu alternativen Marktforschungsinstrumenten im Web-Bereich
Die Durchführung von A/B-Tests begleitest du zur Optimierung von Conversions in Zusammenarbeit mit unserem UX- und Design-Team
Du entwickelst ein firmeninternes Data Analytics-Framework, kommunizierst dieses im Unternehmen und definierst Standards der Datenanalyse

Dein Profil
Eine für die Position angemessene Berufserfahrung im Bereich Web Analytics
Eine Vorliebe für Zahlen, Fakten und Zusammenhänge und den Willen, diese sympathisch und zielgerichtet zu kommunizieren
Ein ganzheitliches Produktverständnis und Freude daran in cross-funktionalen Teams zu arbeiten
Dein Profil runden deine ausgezeichnete analytische und konzeptionelle Denkweise ab
Du hast außerdem einen sicheren Umgang mit Tag-Managern und Webanalyse-Tools (z.B. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Webtrekk oder e-Tracker)
Kenntnisse in Power BI, Tableau, oder den Wunsch, dein Wissen noch zu vertiefen
Als i-Tüpfelchen besitzt du Grundkenntnisse in HTML und Javascript
NOLTE&LAUTH
Bei uns arbeitest du mit 175 Mitarbeitern an den Standorten Berlin, Frankfurt am Main und Stuttgart zusammen. Für unsere Kunden wie Mercedes-Benz, Postbank, KfW, Danone und Bosch schaffen wir ganzheitliche Lösungen und faszinierende Kundenerlebnisse. Unsere Expertise liegt darin, Unternehmen zu beraten, innovative Kundenservices zu entwickeln und entsprechende Digital-Konzepte für Vertrieb und Marketing zu gestalten.
Im Digital-Experience-Team entwickeln UX Designer, Visual & Interaction Designer und Data Analysts gemeinsam mit unserer Technology-Division digitale Ökosysteme, Services und Produkte. Unsere produktnahe und kundenzentrierte Denkweise ist in allen Phasen unseres Design-und Entwicklungsprozesses die Grundlage für nachhaltige Lösungen, die echte Kundenprobleme adressieren und Freude bereiten.
 In Berlin-Mitte mit direktem Blick auf die Museumsinsel erwartet dich unser brandneues Office. Unsere 1700m2 bieten viel Raum für Inspiration, Kreativität und Austausch in interdisziplinären Teams – sei es in unseren Workspaces oder der großzügigen Lounge. Für die Mittagspause oder einen entspannten Kaffee zwischendurch sorgen unsere modernen und topausgestatteten Coffee- und Cooking Areas.
Du hast Lust auf herausfordernde, nachhaltige Projekte? Dann freut sich Margit auf deine Bewerbung inklusive deiner Gehaltsvorstellung sowie deines frühesten Eintrittstermins.

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined


PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

Your tasksYou will support Risk Management department with various tasks related to underwriting, scoring, risk reporting, fraud prevention, risk-adjusted pricing, etc.Perform ad-hoc analysis/reporting for top managementMonitor various risk KPIs on segment levelBuild and update scorecard models using statistical toolsMonitor scorecard performance and variable stability, define new segments, monitor cut-offs, strategies for credit decisionTake active role in integrating external risk management and fraud prevention toolsImprove our current reporting process and develop reports from scratchSupport impact analysis of various changes to product and pricingPerform testing and validation of risk measures in internal systemsWork closely with customer support, collection and IT on risk and underwriting topicsGain valuable experience in credit risk management and become knowledgeable with risk management tools and KPIsRequired skills and experienceBachelor or Master's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, IT, Finance or similar areaAt least three years of relevant experience in risk management and data analysisRelevant experience in financial sectorProficient knowledge of MS Office, especially ExcelStrong SQL/MySQL Python, or R user. Knowledge of VBA, SAS, Tableau will be considered an advantageStrong communication and analytical skills, specialist in data analysisCapacity to work independently and reliably with attention to detailsFluenty in English, German is a plusResponsible and willing to learn and go the extra mileWe offerPermanent employment contractFair remuneration28 holidays / yearInternational environment with a dynamic, dedicated and collegial teamOffice in the heart of Berlin near Checkpoint CharliePersonal and professional developmentModern working conditions and processes that we constantly improveA secure job in a company that prepares for the future like no otherTeam Events - e.g. Summer festival, Halloween Party, X-mas eventWeekly fresh fruit basketsZusätzliche Leistungen:Flexible ArbeitszeitenKostenlose GetränkeHome OfficeErfolgsbeteiligungZusätzliche UrlaubstageJob Types: Full-time, Permanent

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


WHICH PRODUCT TEAMS


Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. As a Product Analyst in the content composition team, you will work with data scientists and engineers, draw insights from the complex interaction of content, customers, and Zalando’s business and help to understand why which content is successful in front of the customer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle , connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts

Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).

Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

-----------
DESCRIPTION
-----------

Clue helps everyone who menstruates to understand their bodies—and to be empowered by that knowledge. Our vision is to enable women and people with cycles to live in tune with their biology, not in spite of it.

Founded by Ida Tin, Clue is a VC-­backed startup ( https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fhelloclue.com%2Farticles%2Fabout-clue%2Fclue-raises-20-million-in-series-b-funding ) based in Berlin helping over 10 million people each month get insights into their reproductive health via our Android ( https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fplay.google.com%2Fstore%2Fapps%2Fdetails%3Fid%3Dcom.clue.android ) and iOS ( https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fitunes.apple.com%2Fus%2Fapp%2Fclue-period-ovulation-tracker%2Fid657189652 ) apps. We collaborate with world-leading universities and institutes to advance female health research ( https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fhelloclue.com%2Farticles%2Fabout-clue%2Fscientific-research-at-clue ) with our dataset, and deliver essential education about health, periods, and sex via our website, helloclue.com ( https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fhelloclue.com%2F ).

To learn more about how Clue works behind the scenes, read our engineering blog, Bleeding edge ( https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2Fbleeding-edge ).

----
ROLE
----


Provide Data Scientists and Business Analysts a consistent way to access data, and support their work from research to production.
Be part of a team responsible for the design, development and maintenance of data pipelines.
Own relevant parts of new features, while working closely with Data Scientists and Backend Engineers.
Collaborate with Backend and Operations Engineers to ensure systems reliability.
You'd help hire and build a data engineering team.

------------
REQUIREMENTS
------------


Experience in a JVM language and Python, with a willingness to learn another language if necessary.
Experience of using a pub/sub or streaming platform such as Kafka or Amazon Kinesis Data Streams.
Practical experience with one or more streaming engines such as Spark, Flink or similar.
Experience with analytical databases like Redshift.
Experience with creating aggregated data schemas that allow for efficient and flexible use by analysts.
Experience processing and storing large and unstructured data for analytical purposes.
Good knowledge of unit and integration testing techniques.
A grasp of the importance of writing good documentation—for developers, as well as for other colleagues.
Hands on, with a willingness to dive into data quality problems and find root causes.
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes is a plus.

--------
BENEFITS
--------

We believe personal growth is essential for professional growth which is why we offer all the standard benefits, plus some that are uniquely Clue.


Care for your body and mind with free weekly yoga and personal trainer sessions, a free on-site therapist and low-cost massages in the office
Learn and grow with a personal education budget and subsidized German lessons at work
Work your way in our child-friendly and dog-friendly office. We'll help with relocation if you're not already in Berlin.
Five weeks of paid vacation each year, a competitive salary and the option to join the company pension plan.

Clue is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect, where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and team members. Our users are global and multicultural—and we want our team to reflect this. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us.

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. Amazon Customer Service Team is looking for an exceptional analyst who can diagnose and solve complex business problems by analyzing data and providing recommendations, who can work closely with multiple stakeholders in different geographies internally and with our partners, and who has the ability to drive new innovations in the customer service industry to join us as Capacity Planning Manager Outsourcing, Worldwide Capacity Planning team. The ideal candidate will possess both an analytical background that enables him/her to manage global network planning, and a demonstrated ability to think broadly and strategically about customer service initiatives. She/he will experience a wide range of problem-solving situations, strategic to real-time, requiring extensive use of data collection and analysis.

The successful candidate for GO Capacity Planning Manager Outsourcing will work in lock-step with multiple business teams, CS Operations, Global Outsourcing, Program Management, Finance leadership and the Management of CS Partners.

The role can be based in Edinburgh or Berlin.

Create best capacity plan for business by managing trade-offs between customer experience/service levels, employee experience, and cost effectiveness, mitigate capacity risks by managing dependencies across multiple operating units and sites.Clearly communicate dependencies and manage/track exceptions, partner with customer service technology teams on new initiatives, participate in wider customer service projects and initiatives such as new merchant partner initiatives or project roll-outs on a global basis.Forecast contacts and plan capacity for worldwide contact center network for partner call center of Amazon Customer Service.Manage contact forecasting and scheduling for a headcount that runs to tens of thousands supporting multiple business and geographies.Cost and service optimization for customer service organization spread across 20+ countries worldwide.Build mid/long-term operational plans for different global sites to optimize variable costs associated with staffing.Improve performance to plan by identifying, measuring and managing key metrics related to customer service.Lead critical projects to improve planning and forecasting efficiency for global operations.Participate in global customer service initiatives and project rollouts to cater to growing business needs.Coordinate with internal and outsourcing network operation teams to meet business service levels.Promote process improvement and standardization of processes across all sites in the network.
