The concerned individual should be motivated/flexible enough to work in US/Europe day time.

Senior Product Manager (f/m/x)

Full-time employment | Permanent | ASAP | Berlin

At Architrave, we build a state of the art software for Digital Real-Estate Management. We focus on a deep understanding of workflows and organizational principles of the industry that we combine with intuitive and inspiring business software. First released in April 2014, the novelty in design and speed of our web-based document management system has gained huge attention in the industry.

Just last year, Architrave won the PropTech of the Year Award!


Your Future Responsibilities:


As Senior Product Manager, you will be responsible for a cross-functional team in an end-2-end setting - from analysis to roll-out and optimization.
Your goal is to craft innovative technical solutions according to the needs of the business. These solutions will be the foundation for the Architrave product portfolio
You will work closely with Stakeholders, Senior Management and other Product Owners in the Product Division.
Your responsibilities include planning the road-map, managing the backlog, conceptualizing and writing user stories, planning sprints, coordinating the roll-out and constantly measuring and optimizing.

What you should bring with you:


A passion for excellent product development that digitizes a paper-based industry.
You have a business-driven mindset with a deep understanding of technology.
Exceptional communication skills across disciplines, roles and levels.
Minimum of 5 years of relevant professional experience as a Software Product Manager, Business Analyst or Business Architect, preferably in B2B software startups or enterprise solutions.
Previous experience in Agile and in working with cross-functional teams
Self-starter and fast learner
Fluent in English, German skills are a plus

What you could bring with you:


Insights into the real estate industry, document management, Data solutions or process management

What we offer you:


The opportunity to genuinely shape an exceptional product of one of - if not the leading PropTech in Europe
A competitive compensation, flexible working hours and a family-friendly work ethic
A great place to grow and to take over responsibility, professionally and personally with a personal education budget to spend on training, conferences and personal growth
Flat hierarchies, short and open communication flows and quick decision-making processes
A working environment that values individuals and embraces knowledge sharing
A highly motivated and talented team that likes to prepare lunch together but also loves to play ping-pong in a light-flooded office area
Free drinks and a fully equipped kitchen
Employee discounts for BVG, Urban Sports Club, LPG Biomarkt and more

So, what are you waiting for? We look forward to receiving your application (CV and cover letter)!

We’d also appreciate if you forward this to anyone you think might be interested. Thanks a bunch!

job_title: Junior Consultant (all genders) Digital Transformation- Public Services
full_text:
Deine Persönlichkeit und Individualität machen den Unterschied. Im Team von Accenture steigern wir die unternehmerische Leistungsfähigkeit unserer Kunden und weisen ihnen den Weg ins digitale Zeitalter. So auch im Bereich Consulting: Hier kombinieren wir unser betriebswirtschaftliches, digitales und technologisches Know-how, um Organisationen auf ein neues Innovations- und Performance-Level zu heben. Und hier setzt du frische Impulse in unserem Bereich Health & Public Services.
Das ist genau dein Ding? Dann lebe deine Leidenschaft in einer Position, in der du innerhalb eines internationalen und interdisziplinären Teams zukunftsweisenden Innovationen für den Public Sektor mitentwickelst. Bewirb dich bei uns, um in einer hoch dynamischen Unternehmenskultur deine Kreativität zu entfalten und gemeinsam mit uns den öffentlichen Sektor der Zukunft zu gestalten.
Make Accenture More You

Du erarbeitest in interdisziplinären Teams gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden aus dem öffentlichen Sektor Konzepte und Strategien zur digitalen Transformation (z.B. Prozess-Digitalisierung, Chatbots, Cognitive PRA, eAkte).
In agilen Projekten arbeitest du in unterschiedlichen Rollen und hilfst dadurch unseren Kunden, ihre digitale Agenda umzusetzen. (z.B. als Konzeptionist, Product Owner und Business Analyst)
Dafür setzt du innovative Methoden wie Design Thinking zur Entwicklung ein
Change bringst du durch deine hervorragende Kommunikation nicht nur in die IT, sondern auch zum Mitarbeiter.
Durch die Verantwortung, die du im Projekt übernimmst, stellst du die Qualität des Projektes sicher (z.B. durch agiles Projektmanagement, Risikomanagement, Qualitätssicherung, Leitung Strategy-Squads).

Hiermit kommst du bei uns an
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium (BWL, Informatik, Mathematik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder Wirtschaftsinformatik)
Idealerweise erste Praxiseinblicke im Consulting oder im öffentlichen Sektor
Basiskenntnisse in und starkes Interesse an neuen Technologien (z.B. Blockchain, Cloud Digitales Marketing, Data Engineering, Agile, Enterprise Architekturen, DevOps, Security).
Mobilität und vor allem: Spaß am Lernen und an der Zusammenarbeit in interdisziplinären Projektteams
Deutsch auf muttersprachlichem Niveau und sehr gutes Englisch
Dein Kontakt

Du hast Fragen? Dann wende dich an unser Recruiting Team per E-Mail an recruiting.germany@accenture.com oder telefonisch unter 00800 45045045.Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung über unser Online-Formular.

Client Solutions Manager
ABOUT US
Opinary has one mission: We help people make up their mind. Globally, millions of people use our polling technology to share their opinion, engage in open dialogue, and understand complex debates - all with one simple click. And, by harnessing the latest advances in Machine Learning, NLP and distributed systems design, our platform ensures that readers get the right question at the right time.
With over 80 million monthly users, we're one of the fastest-growing startups in the media space. You've probably used our tools yourself on publishers like The Times, Spiegel Online, NBC, Huffington Post or the Independent.
As a Client Solutions Manager at Opinary, you are a strategic and analytical solution-driver who puts our customer at the core of everything we do. You are a true project management hero and the number one go-to person for our brands & agency clients regarding their campaigns. You will work closely together with our content team, our Agency Partners and our Digital Analysts. With a passion for online marketing, this role is responsible for building executional and functional partnerships, whilst driving campaigns towards the KPI targets of the client.

WHAT YOU DO
Own and execute the Customer Campaigns end-to-end
Responsible for educating clients on products, new solutions and best practices to drive adoption and grow the existing business partnership
Organize and execute Campaign Kick-Off meetings with internal and external stakeholders
Collaboration with internal cross-functional teams and ability to co-manage complex workstreams
Management of internal account operations (revenue delivery, troubleshooting issues, optimization opportunities, identifying upsell potential)
Get the chance to own projects
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
You ideally have 2+ years of working experience or have gained experience through relevant internships in a media agency or in the field of online marketing
You have outstanding communication skills and know exactly how to prioritise and when to say no - to internal stakeholder but also to clients (English and German)
You are able to juggle multiple projects at once with high attention to detail
You're a true team player and are excited to put projects together with colleagues
You are fluent in German
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Understanding of ad tech ecosystem a plus
Demonstrated experience with digital media platforms, advertising metrics, and industry trends (Direct Response marketing, data and technology solutions, ad-tech, partnerships)
WHAT WE OFFER
You can help shape the growth of Opinary and learn countless new skills
You'll be responsible for implementing your own ideas and projects from day one
You'll gain vital experience in a digital environment
You'll have a flexible working environment – choose your working hours & place of work
You'll be awarded a competitive salary
You'll receive a learning budget of at least 2000 EUR per year
If you succeed in our selection process, you'll work in our headquarter in Berlin. Our exciting, tech-driven team with diverse backgrounds (Oxford, Harvard, McKinsey, 8 nationalities) is looking forward to getting to know you.
Interested? Start your application with a click below!

Berlin, BE, DE Home Office, DE Wildpoldsried, BY, DE

At the earliest date possible we are looking for support for our #teamsonnen
At sonnen, we believe clean, affordable, and reliable energy for all is one of the greatest challenges of our time. With over 40,000 sonnenBatterie-systems installed worldwide, sonnen is a proven global leader in intelligent energy management solutions providing greater energy control for residential customers through increased solar self-consumption, reduced peak energy usage and reliable backup power during outages – contributing to a cleaner and more reliable energy future.
sonnen has won several awards for its energy innovations and sonnenBatterie products, including Fast Company’s Top 10 Most Innovative Companies in Energy, the 2017 Zayed Energy Innovation Award, MIT’s Technology Review’s 50 Smartest Companies in 2016, Global Cleantech 100 for 2015-2017, Greentech Media’s 2016 Grid Edge Award for innovation, and Cleantech’s 2015 Company of the Year Award in both Israel and Europe.
Main Responsibilities:
Interpret your insights and predictions in our energy industry context, interchange with domain specialists from various departments
Co-create our future products and services together with Management, Designers, Developers, Data Experts and Business Analysts
Apply your expertise in statistics and machine learning on various data sets, e.g. market data, sales data and IoT machine data from our batteries and devices
Develop prototypical data pipelines and microservices to evaluate your insights on a larger scale
Contribute to our agile working methodology (Scaled Scrum & DevOps)


Qualifications:
University degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, physics or a comparable quantitative field
Very well understanding of statistics and machine learning techniques
Experience in data analysis including data cleaning, data preparation, visualization, model evaluation

job_title: Head of DS & AA for Radiology (m/f/d)
full_text:
Bayer is a global enterprise with core competencies in the Life Science fields of health care and agriculture. Its products and services are designed to benefit people and improve their quality of life. At Bayer you have the opportunity to be part of a culture where we value the passion of our employees to innovate and give them the power to change.

Head of DS & AA for Radiology (m/f/d)


The Decision Science unit at Bayer Pharmaceutical is a one stop shop for all enterprise data science projects. We work across all functions in Bayer from R&D to marketing & sales to product supply. We solve hard analytical problems and build solutions with the mission to improve the overall efficiency and decision making in the company. If you are interested in joining and leading a young and dynamic team applying bleeding edge machine learning algorithms to all kind of data types we would like to hear from you.

YOUR TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead the global Decision Science & Advanced Analytics team for Radiology in Digital Transformation & IT
You are accountable for the conception, architecture, engineering and delivery of leading-edge Data Science solutions to our colleagues in the Radiology pharmaceutical function
Attract, build a global team of world-class data scientists / decision scientists in the creation of transformational solutions
Work with the Pharmaceutical functional leads, Digital Leads and Platform leads to establish ambitious and visionary portfolios of data science related projects that enable Bayer digital transformation
Ensure development and training of data scientists in the team
Ensure the team is applying LEAN and agile approach to deliver fit-for-purpose solutions
Lead and distribute resources required to work as part of agile product teams within platforms
Maintain awareness of state-of-the-art application of AI in life science industries and research
Publish innovative methodologies and scientific discoveries in peer reviewed journals
Create opportunities for data product development by identifying pain points in the business to improve efficiency and decision making
Ensure exploration and scale up activities are staffed for success following the data science play book
Ensure that data used in data science use cases are made FAIR
Search and explore external opportunities with academia and new solution vendors

WHO YOU ARE
PhD., MSc. in machine learning, statistics, applied mathematics, bioinformatics or computer science
Several years of industry experience and/or academic tract records leading people and initiative to success in the space of machine learning and AI
Strong business analyst skills and strong experience interacting with very diverse customers is required
Expert level knowledge in statistics and/or machine learning
Strong skills in presentation of results and in outlining vision for solutions to the Business
Applied knowledge of coding in Python and/or R
Ability to work in an international, interdisciplinary and agile environment
Fluent in English both written and spoken
You are somebody passionate about solving real world challenge using the latest innovation in the space of statistics, machine learning and deep learning

YOUR APPLICATION
Are you looking for a new challenge where you can show your passion for innovation? Are you interested in working as part of a global team to improve people’s lives? Then send us your online application including cover letter, CV and references.
Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.
Location: Germany : Berlin : Berlin
Division: Corporate Functions
Reference Code: 69531

Job Segment: Biotech, Agricultural, Engineer, Product Development, Radiology, Science, Agriculture, Engineering, Research, Healthcare

Data Architect/Engineer (m/w/d)

Ihre Aufgaben:

Sie entwickeln und implementieren mit unseren Kunden Konzepte zur (automatisierten) Bereitstellung, Verwaltung und dem Management von Daten unter Berücksichtigung von Beschränkungen und notwendigen Qualitätsanforderungen
Sie erstellen operative Datenbankarchitekturen und Prozesse (Workflows/Procedures) zum Schutz, zur Integration, Zentralisierung, Aufbereitung, Bearbeitung, Speicherung und Bereitstellung von Daten(quellen)
Sie strukturieren, in Kooperation mit Data Analysten und Scientisten, komplexe Daten aus verschiedenen Datenquellen (z. B. IoT, Sensoren, CRM- & ERP-Systeme)

Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit
Selbständige, strukturierte Arbeitsweise

Experte für Datenmodellierung und Datenarchitekturen sowie den Umgang mit Data Lakes, Data Marts und relationellen Datenbanken

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.

Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights

Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.

BigQuery / SQL

Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten

Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich

Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

Do you want to join the visionary innovators in finance automation technology? We help our customers to
simplify complex processes to streamline businesses and deliver competitive advantages.

ION Reference data and Pricing solutions supportmultiple asset classes (Fixed Income, FX, Repo etc.),across the full trading lifecycle (pre-trade, trading, middle office, back office),tailored for global operations,serving around-the-clock

The ION Reference data and Pricing team is located across Germany, Italy and India. We are currently accelerating our expansion and are looking to strengthen the UI/UX development in Berlin with talented individuals, looking for responsibilities, continuous learning and financial market exposure.
If you are a seasoned professional and thrilled to contribute to our mission, you may join us in maintaining and enhancing our suite of Reference data and Pricing products used by more than 60 of the largest financial institutions across the world.

Senior Data Scientist – Growth, Autos Marketplace (f/m/d)

OUR COMPANY
The eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative global leader in online classifieds. Our sites help people find whatever they are looking for in their local communities. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. We have eleven brands that span the globe offering online classifieds in more than 1,000 cities around the world.
eBay Classified Group is always looking for high-energy, self-motivated, committed individuals who are passionate about their work. Our team members enjoy a challenging environment that places the highest value on innovation, accountability and playing to win. Our culture is based on open and honest communication, respect for other points of view and a spirit of fun. We look forward to hearing from you.
OUR TEAM
We believe that data is the voice of the customer. Through customer research and continuous experimentation, we make sure the customer is involved in building the best classifieds experience in the world. We’ve organized around the key stages of the customer, where every journey team is a matrix team consisting of product managers, business owners, UX designers, developers and marketers.
You will be part of a new Growth Team for our Global Autos Marketplace. This is a fast-paced team that will be responsible for optimizing the customer funnel – acquisition, activation, and retention growth rates. The individuals on this team are highly motivated to create new channels and optimize features that drive user activation and engagement with our Autos marketplace. This team’s core capability will be data-driven rapid experimentation to identify winners that ultimately increase our drive Auto buyers to connect with Sellers.
YOUR JOB
We are looking for someone who has helped grow world-class products that people love. As a senior data scientist, you’ll work closely with product, engineering, design, marketing, and other data teams. You’ll dig in to deeply understand to derive customer insights, define and analyze growth experiments, and guide/help the team to build their data analysis and experimentation acumen. Key responsibilities include:
Identify opportunities and validate factors that drive the acquisition & activation of users.
Design experiments and interpret results to bring quick and actionable insights to the table.
Lead, manage, and maintain best practices for rapid experimentation.
Uncover users’ needs using exploratory analysis, predictive modelling, and statistics.
Actively participate in hypothesis generation and driving product decisions.
Communicate findings with stakeholders, including senior management.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, UX designers, and product managers from local and global teams.
Be a contributing member of a global data community. Coach and mentor more junior colleagues.
YOUR SKILLS
3-5 years of experience in an Analytical function applying insights/models and working with product/marketing teams.
An M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree (e.g. Economics, Physics, Computer Science, Statistics, or similar).
Background and/or experience in Marketing sciences is a plus.
Advanced knowledge in A/B testing and related statistical methods.
Experience using statistical models and ML for data exploration, predictive analysis, and causal inference.
Proficient at working with large data. Good knowledge of SQL. Familiarity with Hadoop, Presto and/or Spark is a plus. Experienced in R and/or Python.
Coaching or teaching experience is a plus.
Strong communicator and fluent in English.
Driven and demonstrating creativity and initiative.

That’s us

TD Reply is an innovation and marketing consultancy and part of the Reply Group. We take a data driven and execution-oriented approach to drive organizational change through meaningful insights. In our Berlin, Munich and Beijing offices we are around 90 thinkers, developers, analysts, designers, consultants, visualizers, futurologists, data scientists and organizers. We are working on international data and innovation projects for our clients such as Adidas, BMW, Coca-Cola, L’Oréal, Miele, and Telefonica.

That’s you

You know that in the midst of endless flows of data and information lies hidden value. You believe in the power of digital data, and you understand business needs. You are eager to communicate with different stakeholders and develop clients to transform their marketing, sales or product development – based on smart data. The past was innovative, now we are standing on the shoulder of giants.


Your tasks will include

Be instrumental in discovering and maintaining new business opportunities, from initial prospect identification to the development and presentation of concrete project proposals including CRM management
Work closely with New Business Director and support the entrepreneurial decisions to reach profit and loss targets
Collaborate closely with a wide range of international clients, understanding their business needs and challenges
Support in developing the marketing and sales funnel and its operational implementation


There’s a match if…

... you are studying Business Administration, Economics or a comparable field of study.

… you have gained first experience, preferably in an agency, and you bring along a passion for all things digital and data-driven

… you have great communication skills, the ability to deal with different stakeholders and teams, fluent in German and in English

… you like to prepare presentations and to boil down complex subjects to the most relevant messages and key take a ways


That’s in it for you

You will collaborate with an experienced and enthusiastic team of experts with a lot of ideas, great and challenging clients and projects – and an awesome work environment with great colleagues and benefits. Berlin Mitte and Hackescher Markt are at your feet.


Application

We want to hire you!

OK, to be totally honest, we should qualify that statement: If you’re talented, hardworking, smart, brave, innovative, humble, confident, nice and love working in a data driven industry, then we want to hire you.

Interested?

reBuy is the simple buying and selling Internet Shop. Users can buy and sell refurbished media and electronic items. Compared to online auction houses and marketplaces reBuy is particularly simple, fast and secure in its user interface and implementation. All in all, users can buy refurbished qualitative products up to 50% cheaper. All items are sold with an 36-months functional warranty.

Job Description

What’s the opportunity?

As the Head of CRM, you will be responsible for defining and delivering our CRM strategy. reBuy is the largest re-commerce platform for electronics and media in Europe. Success in this role will lead to significantly higher customer loyalty and growth, and offers real potential for personal development.

Tasks

What will I be doing?

Supporting and developing the existing CRM team, you'll step by step create a more personalised future where reBuy builds an authentic emotional bond to customers. You'll work with customer service, product, data, engineering, content marketing, and category managers to ensure consistency and real customer value is at the heart of all communication. To be successful, you'll balance the big picture with minute detail, and provide an outstanding atmosphere for your team and colleagues to prosper.

Example work in this role:

Create and own the CRM strategy. You will design a crm strategy that supports our company strategy, stays relevant as the business evolves, and delivers tangible value covering all relevant communication platforms.
Drive evolution to personalised messaging to build emotional connection with customers, bringing it to life in a clear and consistent way that resonates with and motivates our target audiences. You’ll choose and lead our mix of internal and external tooling to deliver this.
Evidenced based experiments are meticulously designed and run on a weekly and monthly basis to gain insights to customer behaviour and the value of our program.
Collaborate and lead across the organization. You will directly lead and mentor a growing team of experts across CRM, engineers, analysts, and designers. You will represent the voice of the CRM, and the customer within the organization, bringing your insights, and ensuring a consistent message across Content, Marketing, Onsite Merchandising, Product, Customer Service, and Logistics.
Make a lasting impact on society and the environment working with a purpose driven company with sustainability at its core.

Requirements

What skills do I need?


An experienced leader of CRM teams, ideally with an ecommerce or other high volume business. Able to define a strategy, KPIs, forecast, and steps to deliver.
Deep user and customer empathy with dedication to offering authentic value while growing the business.
A true servant leader capable of supporting an ambitious team
Fluent user of data, from tracking technology, storage, streaming, analysis, and are able to alter both tactics and strategy as needed.
Demonstrate experience and ability with CRM delivery technology, personalisation, and predictive analytics.
Exceptional communication and organisation skills allow you to operate effectively with all levels of the organisation, across multiple verticals.
A passion for setting CRM up right, in a sustainable business that matters.

Benefits

Additional Information

We are offering an exciting job in an innovation-friendly company within an inspiring and flourishing environment. We are the Grown-Up Start-Up: with several years of experience and nevertheless with the young spirit of continuous innovation. We will provide you state of the art hardware in a modern office in the heart of Berlin-Schöneberg. Fresh fruits, free drinks and many company events are awaiting you at reBuy! Our hierarchy is and will always be flat. Our atmosphere is open-minded: Something you want to change? Or something to introduce? Let us talk about it. Our goals are ambitious and they will lead us to exciting paths.

\*At reBuy, we strive every day to live and improve integration and equal opportunities. Of course, this also applies - and in particular - to all our recruiting processes. That's why we seek you, regardless of age, disability, national origin, race, skin color, religion, gender identity and sexual orientation. Just be who you are!

As a Data Engineer in Team Content Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content by building attribution models to quantify the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.

You will be helping not only our internal stakeholders but also our top brand partners to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data available in various data sources such as Google Analytics and Data Lake. Your primary role would involve building end-to-end fully automated data pipelines, setting up reliable monitoring and alerting systems, and creating reports and dashboards to visualize the data.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED


Ability to translate business requirements into technical language, and designing data-processing applications
Collaborate with Analysts, Data Scientists, and Product Managers to build and continuously improve a variety of data products that create value for our business
Ability to translate business requirements into technical language, and designing data-processing applications
Designing, developing, and operating data integration pipelines to provide high-quality datasets for analytical use-cases. You and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well as operate large-scale applications on AWS

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


Strong programming skills in Python or Scala
Solid knowledge in deployment and operation technologies like Apache Airflow
Strong Data warehousing concepts, logical design modeling, and SQL development
Knowledge in Apache Spark is nice to have
Good understanding of design, development, and software development cycle
Ability to write scalable, robust, and maintainable code

PERKS AT WORK


Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback,open source ( https://opensource.zalando.com/ ) commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy andblogs ( https://jobs.zalando.com/tech/blog/ ), product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO

Zalando is Europe's leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests andlanguages ( https://opensource.zalando.com/tech-radar/ ) our teams choose to use.

You will work for Digital Experience's Demand Pillar in Zalando in the team that is responsible for building attribution models of onsite content for both internal stakeholders as well as brand partners. The Demand Pillar aims to drive incremental customer acquisition, deepen Zalando's relationship with customers and match consumers to content along their journey.

Fit Analytics — the world’s leading size advisor solution for online clothes shopping — is looking for a motivated full-time Team Lead for its Back-end team. If you are passionate about writing correct, elegant, flexible and performant code, sharing your knowledge with your team members and are ready to use your skills to shape the future of the online fashion industry, we want to hear from you!Who We AreBased in Berlin and Chicago, we’re a team of data scientists, fashionistas, physicists, business analysts, designers, and hackers, working together to tackle a single problem: making it easy for online shoppers to find the right clothes size. We help some of the world’s largest clothing brands solve sizing issues, boost conversions and slash returns.What We DoOur core product, Fit Finder, helps clothing and apparel companies instantly access the power of machine learning to deliver a perfect fit for customers. The Fit Analytics’ platform combines the world's largest database of garment and fit information with hundreds of billions of euros of purchasing records and consumer preferences. By applying the power of machine learning to this unique data set, we've created a range of innovative solutions — Fit Connect, Fit Intelligence and Fit Source — to help drive improvements throughout the apparel lifecycle from manufacturing to marketing. Leading apparel brands and retailers across six continents trust our platform to solve sizing at scale and deliver meaningful bottom-line impact. Our clients include the likes of Zara, Asos, Hugo Boss, JD Sports, Bershka, The North Face, Tommy Hilfiger, Uniqlo, Calvin Klein and many more!What The Role InvolvesLeading, managing, and growing our back-end development teamMaintaining a positive, productive, and open-minded work environmentUsing your extensive practical expertise to help teams design, build and scale efficient, elegant back-end and full-stack applications on Google Cloud PlatformContributing to our Golang and Node.js code basePlaying a key role in designing microservices architectureMentoring team members, reviewing source code, discussing technical concepts, documenting architecture and engineering practices, and encouraging writing maintainable high-quality softwareDeveloping tools to seamlessly control our Google Cloud-based infrastructureWorking together with other technical and non-technical team leaders to ensure that our products stay the best on the marketWhat We're Looking for in YouDegree in Computer Science (or other relevant field) or equivalent experience5+ years of relevant industry experience as a Software Developer2+ years experience in leading tech teamsSolid experience and understanding of idioms in at least one of the following languages: Golang, Node.js, CFamiliarity with cloud computing, specifically Kubernetes and DockerKnowledge of Linux / Unix systemsInnovative and self-motivated, with strong problem-solving skillsFluency in EnglishResident of BerlinWhat We Offer YouHands-on experience building a product that is revolutionizing the apparel & footwear marketThe opportunity to become a key part of Fit Analytics’ growth storyA competitive salaryA spot in our smart, creative and highly motivated international teamDaily breakfast and lunch plus regular team eventsWhy We’re DifferentWe're not sitting around wondering what the product is and burning other people's money while expecting everyone to work ridiculous hours for little reward. We're profitable, organised, and already providing a unique solution that delivers huge value to our partners while helping millions of people shop better online.If you're excellent at what you do and want to apply those skills to solving a genuinely hard problem together with a great bunch of people, you've come to the right place. To take the next step, send us your CV and a brief message explaining why you’re the perfect fit!Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Unser Versprechen: idealo Nutzer*innen finden über die gesamte Journey hinweg immer das beste Angebot und können ihr Produkt inkl. Preisvergleich auch direkt über idealo auf jedem Gerät kaufen. Damit wir allen Bedürfnissen gerecht werden, freuen wir uns auf Dich als Unterstützung im UX-Design-Team! Gemeinsam mit Product Owner, Entwicklern und einem Data Analysten betreust Du vor allem die Kategorieseiten und die Produktsuche auf idealo.de.

Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil eines agilen Teams verantwortest Du Interaktionskonzepte und visuelle Designs eines idealo Produktbereiches
In Abstimmung mit dem Product Owner, Deinem Team und weiteren Stakeholdern bringst Du Business-Anforderungen mit Nutzererwartungen in Übereinstimmung und entwickelst daraus intuitiv nutzbare Bedienkonzepte
Dein Verantwortungsbereich umfasst mit den Kategorieseiten und der Suche ein zentrales Handlungsfeld unseres Produktes. Erfahrung im E-Commerce ist daher von Vorteil
Neben der Erarbeitung von Konzept-Wireframes und Mockups sowie interaktiver Prototypen unterstützt Du die Research-Kollegen bei Nutzertests und finalisierst die UI auf Basis bestehender Guidelines
Du berätst interne Kund*innen, Stakeholder oder Kolleg*innen in Bezug auf User Experience, Usability und intuitive Bedienoberflächen sowie visuelles Design
Du gestaltest die Team- wie auch die Gesamtstrategie proaktiv mit

Das bringst Du mit
Du hast mindestens 3-4 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung in der Konzeption von Webseiten, E-Commerce-Plattformen oder Mobile Applications
Du verfügst über ein umfangreiches Wissen in den Bereichen Informationsarchitektur, Usability und visuellem Design
Du hast ein gutes Gespür für Design und triffst Entscheidungen unter Berücksichtigung von Nutzungsdaten und A/B-Test-Ergebnissen
Du bist vertraut mit Tools wie Sketch, Invision und Zeplin und agiler Projektsoftware (bsw. Wikis, Confluence oder Jira)
Du hast Erfahrung mit Usability-Tests und kannst diese vorbereiten sowie bei der Durchführung und Auswertung unterstützen
Du arbeitest zielorientiert und bist entscheidungs- sowie kommunikationsstark
Für eine gute Zusammenarbeit in unserem internationalen Team bringst Du außerdem sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse mit
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Fach- oder Führungskarriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding-Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
Über 800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, betriebseigene Kita und ein cooler Büro-Loft-Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter*innen aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.
Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen Dich so, wie Du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.

We want to find the right people to join our well-funded, growing open-source startup and to help us to continue to build exciting technology that makes our users happy. We are looking for a data scientist to join the Life Sciences team. The Life Sciences team is based mainly in Berlin, it would be great if you want to join us there.

Who are you?
You’ve gathered several years of experience doing practical data analysis, ideally in the pharmaceutical industry. You like to engage with Life Science customers, build new relationships, and help spread the word about KNIME. You appreciate how important it is to be able to communicate what you’ve done, particularly a diverse audience that includes non-experts. You have a deep understanding of parts of the life sciences domain and a desire to expand that understanding to other life sciences areas. This probably means that you have an advanced degree in life sciences or a physical science, but maybe you just have equivalent experience. We’re more interested in your expertise and your desire to expand it than how you got it.
You know the tools and methods of data science in the life sciences and are already proficient with KNIME, R, and/or Python. We’d love it if you were a KNIME expert, but we think we can teach you that.
What’s the job?
In this position you will join the Life Sciences team at KNIME and will be working with our current and potential customers to deliver solutions to their real-world data-science problems. Your top priority will be to ensure the success of our customers - we want to keep them happy! Our data scientists also do things like pre-sales support, customer-driven project work, training, workshops, experimenting with new algorithms and methods, and using KNIME to tell interesting stories. You’ll take what you learn from all of this and feed that back to the development team so that we can keep pushing the KNIME software forward.
Who are we?

We are a rapidly growing, young company developing analytics software for performing advanced data science. We are a highly interactive team and very enthusiastic about developing solutions for our users. Our open source KNIME Analytics Platform, developed together with the community, is transforming the data science landscape. It is popular among its very active user community as well as among IT analysts, who regularly place us in their "leaders" category - next to some still surprised industry dinosaurs. Our commercial KNIME Server enables enterprises to responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.
Though we are happy to have applicants from further away, we’re not offering relocation benefits for this position. If you think you would be a great fit and would like to learn together with us, apply here, and let us know why you want to join us.

Das sind wir:
Mal ehrlich: Finanzthemen sind kompliziert. Darum sind wir bei Arvato Financial Solutions stolz darauf, sowohl international agierende als auch renommierte, lokale Unternehmen durch die komplexe Welt der Zahlungsströme zu steuern. Ganz gleich ob unsere Kunden im E-Commerce Schuhe verkaufen oder Telekommunikationsdienstleistungen anbieten, unsere Dienstleistungen sichern effizientes Credit Management für bestmögliche finanzielle Performance. Dazu lösen unsere rund 7.500 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter täglich neue Herausforderungen im Zahlungsverkehr und komplexe Datenrätsel – clever, analytisch und mit Blick für jedes Detail – denn das ist unsere DNA. Wir suchen Kolleginnen und Kollegen, die Lust haben mitzugestalten und genau hinzuschauen - egal ob Berufsanfänger, IT-Spezialisten, Data Analysten, Sachbearbeiter, Führungskräfte oder Quereinsteiger. Und dank unserer Präsenz in rund 20 Ländern mit Fokus auf Europa und Amerika ist ein passender Job zumeist in der Nähe. Innovate yourself.
Im Geschäftsbereich Accounting und Payment bieten wir konkrete Antworten auf die Herausforderungen unser Kunden, insbesondere wenn es um die Erschließung von Kaufkraft, internationaler Märkte, das Stärken der Kundenbeziehung und die Digitalisierung von Unternehmen geht. Dazu setzen wir auf passgenaue Gesamtpakete, Plattformen sowie den gezielten Einsatz von Robots, künstlicher Intelligenz und Big Data Analytics.

About Penta

At Penta we're on a mission to simplify business banking, allowing business owners to focus on the things they really love. They can open a bank account online in minutes, get debit cards for employees, send affordable foreign transfers and easily integrate their accounting solution with Penta. More than 17.000 businesses use Penta today and we are growing quickly.

We are currently looking for a Product Operations Lead for our HQ in Berlin, with a focus on helping our product, design & data teams scale.

The mission of the Penta product team is to provide our customers with new products & improvements to save them time & money with their banking & expense management process. In order to scale our product organisation, we need to be able to consistently improve our product processes and set the product (incl. design & data) team up for scale. You will be in charge of this.

About your new role:


Document, measure & refine
You'll lead the improvement of our internal product processes (e.g. our customer feedback loop time).

You'll be in charge of consistently measuring core KPIs of our product development lifecycles to have a data-driven understanding of our efficiency.
You'll be responsible for setting up new processes with various stakeholders where there are no processes today and you will have the full power to consistently improve them.
You will be closely working together with the Product Leadership team to standardise, maintain & share our internal product principles.
Automate & communicate

You'll be in charge of standardising, improving & automating as many internal processes as possible across multiple functions to increase the productivity (e.g. bug-reporting).
Educate & collaborate
You'll be in charge to build up a reporting system that allows key stakeholders to better understand key metrics of the product, design & data teams. Both process & product metrics.

You'll be responsible for maintaining our internal knowledge base across the company and adapting it to our team members' needs.
You'll be responsible for making sure that each existing and new team member has access to the right material & sessions in their onboarding time.
Special Projects
As a quasi-"Chief of Staff" in the product team, you'll be attending all key product leadership meetings and will have to ensure the delivery of key initiatives together with the CPO.
You will be tasked with setting up new projects/products from scratch and closely align with the respective execution teams. These projects can be customer-, partner- or internal-facing.

What do we expect from you?


Character

Our customers are not retail customers but SMEs with 1-100 employees who are the economic backbone of all European markets. For too long, they had to deal with clunky, intransparent banks and financial products. To change this unacceptable status quo, we at Penta need to be bold, ambitious and crazy every single day. And that's also what's expected from every single team member.
Experience
You are an all-round talent who is able to easily navigate between new projects and existing process.
You have a proven track-record in implementing new processes within scaling organisations.
You are an expert in communicating within a larger organization and have experience in working in a product-driven organisation.
You agree that setting up a process without obsessing on measuring & looking for the right metrics is close to playing Russian Roulette.
Product management tools like Jira and Confluence and usual office tools such as Excel and Powerpoint are part of your skillset.
You are skilled in operating in an agile environment and have experience in following best-practices when it comes to agile management.
You have previous experience in working as an analyst/associate in an investment bank, consulting company or fast-scaling growth startup.
You are able to use your SQL skills to tackle larger and more complex problems whenever needed.
Preferably, you have prior experience in working in a Fintech environment or in a company who was working together with other Fintech companies.
Other
As we have offices in three locations, frequent travelling will be part of this role.


What you can expect from us?

A strong remuneration package.
High degree of autonomy paired with a flat hierarchy.
Great office atmosphere and the ability to change the way banking works for SMEs.
Company-wide events: we believe hard work and success deserve to be celebrated both in and out of our office.
Strong network of companies and experts as part of the FinLeap family, Europe's No.1 fintech ecosystem.
Choice of computer - Mac/Windows.
Personal learning budget.

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED

Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.

You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

Senior Business Analyst - Logistics Business Development
full_text:
Logistics Platform Services (LPS) identifies strategic and innovative logistics solutions for customers and partners, supporting the Zalando Platform Strategy. The purpose of the team is to ´envision the future of Logistics by creating convenience beyond boundaries´. As a Business Analyst in LPS you are an analytics and data expert when it comes to different maturity stages of logistics products: ideation, launch, optimization and scaling, which requires close collaboration between a Business Analyst and respective task force leads in LPS.

------------------------------
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
------------------------------


Be the driving force behind the creation and scaling of the data landscape for LPS and work with the set-up data infrastructure.
Develop logical and easy-to-understand frameworks that predict implications of decisions and guide others to use them for data-driven decision making, at any point of the product life cycle.
Create predictive commercial models for LPS products to assure stability and scalability, to conduct root cause and variance analysis, to create forecasting models that help to prioritize business requirements for LPS products.
Support product recommendations by establishment of automated reporting in an up-scaling reporting landscape, engineering and re-design of budgeting processes and business cases, definition of product-related KPIs and balancing of tailored KPI definitions that assure consistency with Zalando's established KPI schemes across the product portfolio of LPS
Manage both transactional and onsite consumer data, sometimes even clean massive datasets, as well as visualization of the data landscape.

----------------------------
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
----------------------------


A creative and entrepreneurial mind who is eager to do some data-driven pioneering in the field of e-commerce logistics services, brings initiative, good judgment, collaboration and is comfortable with working against deadlines and can work on multiple tasks through to completion even when under pressure.
Experience with defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities with special focus on models concerning customers and partners (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, commercial KPIs etc.)
Excellent Excel skills, very strong knowledge of different BI solutions and visualization such as MicroStrategy/Tableau combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations and good knowledge of SQL and databases/analytical tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Python).
Relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research and ability to communicate precisely with results.
A quantitative degree (Bachelor, Master, MBA) in Economics, Statistics, Business Administration, Engineering, or its equivalent with at least 3-5 years of work experience

MARKETING ANALYST (w/m/d)
BERLIN
60.000-70.000
Ein internationales Retailunternehmen ist momentan auf der Suche nach einem ambitionierten Marketing Analysten in Berlin.
Hast du bereits Erfahrung im Bereich Customer Analytics/ Marketing Analysis? Falls du nach einer neuen Herausforderung suchst, Teamgeist und einen starken Kommunikationsstil mitbringst dann lies' weiter!
DIE FIRMA
Mein Kunde ist ein sehr etabliertes Retailunternehmen, das ihr Data and Analytics Team ausbaut. Die Firma bietet ihren Kunden nicht nur nachhaltige und hochqualitative Produkte, sondern ist auch um den Umweltschutz bemüht und investiert regelmäßig in Umweltschutzprogramme.
DIE POSITION
Falls du bereits Erfahrung in den Bereichen Data Analytics sammeln konntest, Enthusiasmus und Teamgeist mitbringst, dann könnte das die Gelegenheit sein, dich in einem wachsenden Unternehmen zu etablieren. Deine Aufgabe ist es, Insights über Kunden bereitzustellen, Customer Analysen durchzuführen, regelmäßige Reports bereitzustellen und mit anderen internen Teams zu kooperieren. Außerdem bist du an der Analyse von momentanen Produkten beteiligt und stellst Verbesserungsvorschläge vor Kollegen aller Ebenen vor.
DEINE SKILLS
Kenntnisse in SQL und Python oder R
Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaft, Marketing oder einem ähnlichen Studiengang mit statistischer Komponente
Idealerweise Kenntnisse in Google Analytics
Fließende Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse
Enthusiasmus und den Wunsch, dazuzulernen!
WAS WIRD GEBOTEN
Die Firma bietet eine offene Mentalität und ein attraktives, modernes Arbeitsumfeld. Außerdem eine großzügige Vergütung, sowie flexible Arbeitszeiten, Fitness Vouchers und viele andere Benefits.

With Babbel anyone can learn a language.

Whether on the go, in the subway or at home on the sofa, Babbel supports those who enjoy learning outside of work or school. Since its founding in 2007, the company has grown to become the market leader in app based language learning. In total, Babbel offers 14 learning languages, from English to Indonesian. Professional courses are readily available via the Babbel website as well as on your smartphone or tablet. At Babbel, 750 team members from over 50 different countries work hard to set standards for creating a new learning experience.

We are looking for a Head of Business Intelligence and Analytics for our office in Berlin!

You will:

Manage, mentor and support a team of 8+ business analysts, data scientists and business intelligence engineers.
Partner with stakeholders from marketing, product, CRM and finance to support them achieving their goals and to drive functional improvements by means of data-insights
Evolve our understanding of business processes and operations with smartly designed reports, data visualisations and the definition of effective performance metrics
Enable the team to create actionable insights from data and develop statistical models to drive business decisions and to support sales and revenue growth under your leadership
Report to the VP Data & Intelligence and be responsible for the strategic development and optimization of the entire business analytics and reporting landscape at Babbel

You have:

Master's degree or equivalent in Data or Computer Science, Information Technology or Systems, Economics, Statistics, Applied Math, Business Administration, or any other related field.
6+ years of work experience in business intelligence and analytics preferably in an online business
3+ years of experience in developing and leading a team of analysts and business intelligence engineers
Ability to present & communicate your analyses and insights likewise to business stakeholders and a technical audience

job_title: Product Manager - Fraud Accountable Group Lead
full_text:
Klarna makes shopping smoooth. And we do it with flair because shopping is fun. Every day, we help customers, businesses, and partners explore just how smoooth the modern shopping experience can be.

It means we’re constantly changing the game. Always trying out new things. And we encourage our people to do the same. To grow. To develop. Because we don’t believe roles have to stay fixed. Instead we inspire our people to take an irregular career path. As a company of 350 dynamic start-ups, our whole business is built for it. So once you’re in, there’s no telling what will happen next.

Klarna strives to become the world’s favourite way to buy, and you can contribute to reaching this goal! We are looking to hire great people, who are passionate about using their talents to generate success. We are currently looking for Product Managers to play a key role in our mission to be the rebels of banking.

What you will do

At Klarna, Customers are our obsession. From innovative products like our Consumer Mobile App or Consumer Card, to our game changing Klarna Checkout, Klarna payment methods, and scalable Platforms, we build products with the customer in mind.

Product Managers are at the heart of this obsession, always solving challenges that customers are facing or delighting them with products they didn’t know they needed. One of the main reasons that Klarna is able to bring innovative payment and banking solutions to its customers is because of the collaborate work that Product Managers lead with Engineering, Product Design, Analytics, Business Development and Support teams.

At Klarna, Fraud Prevention is critical - we strive to protect our consumers and merchants against all types of fraud. To do so, we have a variety of teams within Business Analytics, Data Science, and Product & Engineering which deliver policies/products/and data science models which help us to prevent fraud both in online transaction flows, as well as offline post-purchase flows. You will lead a collection of Business Analytics, Data Science, and Product & Engineering teams in setting the vision and scope for Fraud Prevention globally at Klarna, covering all aspects of Fraud (e.g. 1st party vs. 3rd party fraud). The group will be responsible for owning and maintaining the existing tooling and infrastructure supporting Fraud prevention, while also developing new and innovative toolsets to improve our effectiveness at fighting fraud.
Understand markets, competition, and user requirements in depth
Build product strategy, including definition of scope, roadmap, and KPIs
Work with cross-functional teams including engineers, designers, data scientists and business analysts
Own and articulate end-to-end product requirements across technology and analytical teams
Who you are
Courageous - Willing to speak up, make decisions, take calculated risks
Detailed Thinkers - Passionate and open-minded while meticulously about data and details
Delivers Results - Able to see beyond their own problem space and dependencies to find solutions
Challenges the Status Quo - Never misses an opportunity to disrupt the industry and embraces change
Lets the Team Shine - Leads with integrity, giving respect and earning trust along the way
Starts Small and Learns Fast - Tests, iterates, measures and learns in order to drive innovation
You should have
4+ years of Product Management experience
Previous experience in the field of Fraud prevention is preferred but not required
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
A background in leading multiple cross functional teams to deliver value to end consumers
Knowledgeable in agile and lean development methodologies
Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English
How to apply

Send over a CV in English.

About Klarna

Klarna was founded in Stockholm, Sweden in 2005. Since then, we’ve changed the banking industry forever. And now we’re creating the world’s smooothest shopping experience. We serve 80 million consumers worldwide, and partner with 190,000 merchants – with a new merchant joining us every 8 minutes. Including some of the world’s leading brands, such as H&M, ASOS, IKEA, Adidas, Samsung and Lufthansa. Our offices are spread over 17 different markets, hosted by +2,500 people from 90 nationalities.

Monitor the company's infrastructure across all locations
Analyze information security and log data to analyze and detect potential threats
Investigate security events, requests and incidents
Review, validate, classify and respond to alerts within SLA's
Maintain precise investigation and case management records
Help initiate and implement future SOC processes and technologies
Assist with producing a broad range of reports to deliver current and reliable data to the management board

Leading pharmaceutical company in the field of genetic diagnostics for heredit

Theoretical and ideally hands-on experience in IT Security
Security systems such as SIEM, TLM, IDS/IPS, FW or Endpoint Protection are no novelty to you
You demonstrate strong analytical and problem-solving skills
You enjoy working both independently and in collaboration with others.
You have strong communication skills in English- German is a plus
You are excited to work in an international and interdisciplinary environment

Our client is a leading pharmaceutical company in the field of genetic diagnostics for hereditary diseases, with its headquarters in Germany. Operating on a global level with offices in India, U.S. and UAE, the company is internationally renowned for its cutting-edge technical solutions and innovative products in the field of genetics and as such has established the largest mutation database for hereditary diseases.

Attractive salary

German and English classes if you are eager to learn the language

Consulting. Software. Ventures.

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle , connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.

This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!
