As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Doctolib, an eHealth Startup founded in 2013 now used daily by thousands of doctors and millions of patients. We commit to deliver user friendly tools & services with the goal to improve people's health and quality of life of people working in healthcare.

Our mission is; contribute to improving the healthcare system. By building a company of thousands people sharing our humanistic values, where they can grow and have high impact through their work. That's why we are looking for a new Product Manager to join our team!

Our Product Managers are building the product road map for their team and ensuring that the solutions are suitable for our users needs while identifying ways to improve our products. You will:

Take charge of defining the project specifications and establish key product management processes
Drive execution of the project, validation of the development and follow up on the production.
Go on field trips to study habits and workflows in practices and doctors to gather their needs.
Work cross functionally with development teams, user researchers, designers and data analysts in an agile environment.

Changing healthcare is not easy, our product managers are working on different challenges from framing the hospital system connectors during full project life cycle to coach and mentor a more junior Product Manager.

You will care deeply about defining, collecting and measuring key product metrics. You work every day on things like analyzing and prioritizing incoming bugs.

Under the hood, our systems integrate with doctors and hospitals booking systems so patients can access the healthcare they need at any time. We build systems that help tens of thousands of doctors focus on taking care of their patients.

You are technical focused at heart but also love closely communicating with users in German or French. You previously aced product owner or manager role with direct product ownership and a large amount of users, have the ability to work with software development teams on daily, drive product pilots and roll-out processes and have strong understanding of applications and web services.

We are a team of 20+ product managers across Berlin and Paris. You will have the opportunity to travel between offices, go to conferences, interview future colleagues. We want you to help us build an amazing team and a brilliant company. You will have the support of our leadership academy and ongoing training from day one.

Here at Doctolib, we all share the same obsession: provide the best experience for our users and change the way people access healthcare.

We are moving into our new offices in central Berlin by the beginning of 2020.

Apply now. Join us on this mission. We are excited to help you grow with us.

At Doctolib, we don't just accept diversity, we celebrate it! We're proudly committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability or place of origin. We take care of each other and are grateful for each person's individual contribution to our mission!

Orange Quarter are working with the marketing vertical of one of Europe’s e-Commerce trailblazers. This company uses data to provide meaningful links between brands and their customers. Their technology hits the perfect balance between privacy compliant innovations, and insightful solutions to ensure brand content is successful and reaches the right audiences. Their data findings are transmitted across a variety of channels to help brands make informed and strategic decisions to improve their business.

Industry:
E-commerce

What to expect:
You will be creating and operating data integration pipelines to supply high-quality datasets for analytical and machine learning use-cases. You will be responsible for your own code and for making the call on the tools and technologies that are adopted and implemented. You will be collaborating with Product Managers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists create and should constantly reinvent data products in order to add value to the business. Your input will greatly shape the company’s integrated data and machine learning models. As a Senior, you will share your knowledge and wisdom with the rest of your team, helping them to grow and for you all to advance as a team.

job_title: Corporate Field Sales Representative, Google Cloud (German, English)
full_text:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a technical or engineering field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in direct client sales/management.
Ability to speak and write in English and German fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications:

Experience building and cultivating lasting relationships with accounts.
Customer and relationship management experience with technology-using platforms or in the area of infrastructure-as-a-service.
Knowledge of how various cloud technologies (PaaS and IaaS) work together to drive deeper technology adoption within the existing large account base.
Demonstrated ability to engage with developer audiences as well as C-level IT and business leaders.
About the job
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
As a Corporate Field Sales Representative, you'll advocate for the Cloud Platform, promoting technology for business innovation. You'll introduce Google Cloud Platform to our customers and accounts, drive awareness in the developer and startup community, and leverage and build the Google Cloud Platform partner ecosystem.
Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.
Responsibilities
Engage with prospect organizations to effectively position Google Cloud Platform solutions using strategic value-based solution proposals, references and analyst data.
Work with the wider Google Ads and Google Cloud Account teams to develop and drive pipeline, and to provide guidance. Work with Google Cloud Platform partners to develop campaigns.
Serve as the primary customer contact during bid submission, pilot test, legal review and procurement. Keep records of customer interactions and provide quarterly projections.
Leverage Sales Engineering and Marketing resources, and provide input on current collateral materials and ideas on how to improve them.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Senior Product Owner (f/m/x)

Full-time employment | Permanent | ASAP | Berlin

At Architrave, we build a state of the art software for Digital Real-Estate Management. We focus on a deep understanding of workflows and organizational principles of the industry that we combine with intuitive and inspiring business software. First released in April 2014, the novelty in design and speed of our web-based document management system has gained huge attention in the industry.

Just last year, Architrave won the PropTech of the Year Award!


Your Future Responsibilities:


As a Senior Product Owner, you will be responsible for a cross-functional team in an end-2-end setting - from analysis to roll-out and optimization.
Your goal is to craft innovative technical solutions according to the needs of the business. These solutions will be the foundation for the Architrave product portfolio
You will work closely with Stakeholders, Senior Management and other Product Owners in the Product Division.
Your responsibilities include planning the road-map, managing the backlog, conceptualizing and writing user stories, planning sprints, coordinating the roll-out and constantly measuring and optimizing.

What you should bring with you:


A passion for excellent product development that digitizes a paper-based industry.
You have a business-driven mindset with a deep understanding of technology.
Exceptional communication skills across disciplines, roles and levels.
Minimum of 5 years of relevant professional experience as a Software Product Owner, Business Analyst or Business Architect, preferably in B2B software startups or enterprise solutions.
Previous experience in Agile and in working with cross-functional teams
Self-starter and fast learner
Fluent in English, German skills are a plus

What you could bring with you:


Insights into the real estate industry, document management, Data solutions or process management

What we offer you:


The opportunity to genuinely shape an exceptional product of one of - if not the leading PropTech in Europe
A competitive compensation, flexible working hours and a family-friendly work ethic
A great place to grow and to take over responsibility, professionally and personally with a personal education budget to spend on training, conferences and personal growth
Flat hierarchies, short and open communication flows and quick decision-making processes
A working environment that values individuals and embraces knowledge sharing
A highly motivated and talented team that likes to prepare lunch together but also loves to play ping-pong in a light-flooded office area
Free drinks and a fully equipped kitchen
Employee discounts for BVG, Urban Sports Club, LPG Biomarkt and more

So, what are you waiting for? We look forward to receiving your application (CV and cover letter)!

We’d also appreciate if you forward this to anyone you think might be interested. Thanks a bunch!

Being an equal opportunities employer, we at Architrave strive for a diverse, inclusive and healthy working environment. We invite all qualified humans to apply, regardless of ethnicity, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.

By clicking the “Apply for this Job” button you expressly make the following representations and warranties and give your consents as described below:

Architrave collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Architrave’s recruitment related activities. Consequently, Architrave may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants including, for example, setting up and conducting interviews and tests, evaluating and assessing the results thereto and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment processes including the final recruitment.

Architrave does not disclose your personal data to unauthorized third parties. You agree to the fact that to the extent necessary your personal data may be transferred and/or disclosed to third parties acting on Architrave’s behalf, including also transfers to servers and databases outside the country where you provided Architrave with your personal data. Such transfers may include for example transfers and/or disclosures outside the European Economic Area and in the United States of America.

Find us on Glassdoor!

Keywords: Product Owner, B2B SaaS, Big Data, AI, crossfunctional teams, great office location in the heart of Berlin, family-friendly, diverse team, Product Owner

Company Description

About Publicis Emil
Headquartered in Berlin, Publicis Emil is a bespoke global agency within Publicis Groupe for Daimler (Mercedes-Benz, smart). We are on a single-minded mission to help accelerate their journey to become the world’s automotive digital champion.
To do this, we have drawn on the best talent from agencies across the Groupe: cutting-edge expertise and diverse skills as one integrated end-to-end agency to serve advertising and marketing, digital experience & services, data intelligence and analytics, CRM, web and social commerce as well as local dealer communications.
We work with data at the heart to give Daimler’s entire marketing organization the ability to make better and smarter decisions.
We put customer centricity at the heart of everything we do, using ‘living’ customer profiles and journeys to engage people for purchases and beyond.
We are agile, collaborative and interdisciplinary. As we establish new teams across borders, we will ensure our work culture continues to reflect the spirit and behaviors that convinced Daimler that we should be their transformation partner.
We are pioneering the agency model of the future, recognizing that our success will be as much about the digital transformation and growth of our client, as it will be about the development and fulfilment of our people.

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced and dedicated Scrum Master to join our Global Data team. The individual in this role would be responsible for overseeing one of our data teams and working under the agile methodology. We are seeking a candidate who has proven leadership skills, the ability to think problem-solve.
The Scrum Master will be working within the Publicis Emil Acceleration Team who are responsible for driving the future of the Transformation agenda for Daimler. Specifically the Scrum Master will be responsible for managing the ongoing delivery of the programme of work – that will demonstrate how, by investing in Martech and Data insight, the client is able to achieve both greater operational efficiency and increased level of engagements to drive a lower cost per acquisition. In delivering the programme of work the Scrum Master will be working with the full Daimler Martech stack – Saleforce Marketing Cloud, Salesforce DMP, Adobe Target and Adobe Engagement Manager as well as end-to-end digital communications – eCRM, Onsite, Display and Social and alongside Data Strategist and Scientists, Business Analysts and Consultants and channel subject matter experts.
Main Responsibilities
Act as a servant leader and moderator to your team
Facilitate Scrum Meetings and creating an inspiring atmosphere
Help building and refining the Product Backlog as a team sport
Shape team behavior through excellent management via agile methods
Take responsibility for impediment removal
Help build a safe and agile environment to enable high team performance
Help prioritize, optimize and enable value driven thinking
Document progress and communicate to upper management and stakeholders

Qualifications

Master’s degree in business, computer science or related field required
Scrum Master certification required
5-7 years’ experience in information technology (IT) project management required
Must possess leadership skills and experience
Must possess excellent interpersonal communication skills, both verbal and written
Must possess the ability to explain intricate and complicated concepts and ideas
Must possess the ability to work well with many different kind of people, departments, and divisions
Data standardisation, onboarding and cleansing
Working Experience of Salesforce systems (DMP and SFMC), Adobe systems (AEM, Analytics and Target)
Marcomms, particularly DMP driven activity in CRM, on-site and paid digital
Ability to quickly upskill and onboard new tools and systems
Global understanding of Data Connections/Data Process and the general Customer Journey
Fluent English
Additional Information

null

GetYourGuide is the place to book the best experiences in destinations across the globe. We are now looking for a full-time Business Analytics Manager at our Berlin office.

Reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will lead a team of analysts and work with operations and product managers to help make GetYourGuide the best place to book experiences in destinations across the globe. In this role, you'll not only lead a team, but also directly contribute to analytics projects. You and your team will analyze the organization's most complex business problems and deliver insights to drive important decisions at GetYourGuide.

Team Mission:
The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organization to take action based on data. We work on business problems across GetYourGuide -- including understanding customer experience, measuring marketing efficiency, and understanding our online marketplace. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement.

Responsibilities:

You will lead, inspire, and develop a team of data analysts
You will work with cross functional teams to turn ambiguous problems into clear business questions
You will prioritize analytics work among various stakeholders
You will define key metrics to evaluate the success of operations initiatives
You will design and implement experiments to evaluate the impact of new initiatives
You will build reports and dashboards to track the long-term success of products
You will analyze opportunities and problems to drive project prioritization and strategy
You will collaborate with data engineers to ensure and improve data availability, integrity, accuracy, and reliability

Requirements:

You have 5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in analytics, data science or management consulting
You have at least 2 years of experience in people management
You have strong knowledge of SQL and experience with statistical packages (e.g. R, Python)
You have experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
You have the ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
You have a desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals

Nice to have:

You have experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus

We Offer:

Virtual stock options that make you an integral part of the company's growth and success
Breakfast, drinks, and fruit every day
Relocation assistance / a great team to help you with your move to Berlin
Be part of an international team from over 70 nationalities
An open, friendly, energetic work environment where every voice is heard
Regular learning opportunities via training sessions, conferences and our network of industry experts
Weekly all-hands meetings and monthly updates
And many, many more! ( https://recruiting.getyourguide.com/berlin-benefits )

Curious?

Please send in your CV and Cover Letter in English through the form below. We're committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, race, sexual orientation, disability status, parental or marital status, or religion. The recruiter for this role is Stephen Rose ( https://www.linkedin.com/in/stephen-rose-2577b13a/ ).

We'd love to hear from you by emailing jobs@getyourguide.com and make sure you check out life at GetYourGuide on our blog ( http://inside.getyourguide.com/ ).

job_title: Senior Associate Business Development and M&A (m/f/x), Berlin, Munich or Vienna
full_text:
Speedinvest is a European venture capital fund with €400M+ AUM and more than 40 investment professionals working from Berlin, London, Munich, Paris, Vienna and San Francisco. Employing a sector-focused investment structure, we fund innovative early-stage technology startups in the areas of Fintech, Digital Health, Consumer Tech, Network Effects, Deep Tech and Industrial Tech. Speedinvest actively deploys its global network and dedicated team of more than 20, in-house operational experts to support our 140+ portfolio companies, including with US market expansion.

Speedinvest has successfully invested in companies such as Bitmovin, Stateless, Hitbox, Sipwise, Tourradar, Wefox, Shpock and Wikifolio. Learn more: www.speedinvest.com


Be part of our international and diverse team of motivated, talented and results-focused colleagues who share a passion to drive impact and be a true partner to start-ups.

About the Position


As a Speedinvest Senior Analyst BD and M&A, you will support our Head of BD and M&A in researching & prospecting, new M&A or BD opportunities. You will support/take the lead in analytics, presentations, and communication of respective opportunities. You will use your excellent analytical and communication skills to play an active role in establishing a new business function within Speedinvest.

Your responsibility

Conduct research on potential M&A buyers and BD partners
Position start-ups and their products in a way to access new markets, enhance acquisition stories
Prepare presentations that position the business with potential acquiring targets
Help generate potential buyer list and take initiative to contact prospective mergers and acquisitions candidates to meet with corporate leadership and senior management of the startup
Work with senior members of the Speedinvest team to access potential strategic partners for BD and/or M&A projects
Help with data entry and -maintenance to create reliable portfolio management- and investment process
Create financial model analyses based on shared private and public information, inclusive of the prospective business’s company revenue, staff resources assessments, and general due diligence
Maintain healthy stakeholder relations during the period of an M&A deal from the first contact to the signed agreement

This is you


A Bachelor's and/or Master's degree holder in a business-related field (finance, accounting or economics preferred)
Work experience in a fast-paced environment (e.g. consulting, investment banking, M&A)
Work experience in a Startup or VC is a plus
Fluent in English
You are analytical and diligent, have strong interpersonal skills and an outgoing nature
Interest in the latest technological developments and working hands-on with startup
You are passionate about collaborating and communicating with internal and external
stakeholders

We offer

The chance to gain insights and work experience operationally in a Venture Capital Fund
Opportunity to work with an open-minded, passionate and international team
Flexible working hours and home office opportunities.

Speedinvest believes in equal opportunities for everyone and encourages diversity and inclusion. We want to encourage applicants with diverse backgrounds to apply to the Venture Capital world. We process all applications without regard to gender, nationality, race, color, religion, age, disability status, sexual orientation or marital status.

If you like being able to drive impact and enjoy working closely with start-ups, we look forward to receiving your application via job.lvpuk@speedinvestgmbh.recruitee.com.

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined


PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


WHICH PRODUCT TEAMS


Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. As a Product Analyst in the content composition team, you will work with data scientists and engineers, draw insights from the complex interaction of content, customers, and Zalando’s business and help to understand why which content is successful in front of the customer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

full_text: Job OverviewAre you interested in the financial markets and its instruments, such as ETFs? Are you highly motivated and keen on working in a strongly growing, successful and challenging environment? Do you enjoy working in small and agile teams? Do you like analyzing complex problems and finding elegant solutions? Do you love to connect the latest technologies with complex products? Then you will very likely fit into our team!Your TasksAnalyze business processes and articulate API architecture requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, platform environment, software, and system interfacesContribute to the conceptual and physical design of application integration using APIs and event-driven architectureManage the feature backlog and agree with stakeholders on the scope for the next development sprintGuide a cross-functional team of developers, QA and Service Operations Analysts in navigating through finance and software development topicsCollaborate with product development, software development and global operations teams to continuously improve our robust index platformWork closely with senior management to drive change and to support growthYour ProfileExperience in product ownership in an agile environment, ideally in running API as a product in digital products for financial marketsExperience in structuring APIs and building on a set of APIsExperience in working in a global environment with distributed teamsExperience in technology tools (JIRA) and database (SQL)Good knowledge of financial instruments, financial markets, and financial market dataGreat communication- and excellent organizational skillsHighly proactive demeanor and passion for collaborationFluent in English, German is a plusOur OfferA challenging and exciting field in a very successful and strongly growing FinTechActive teamwork and a steep learning curve right from the startWorking with modern, exciting technologies in a fast-paced, highly professional environment30 days annual leave, a permanent contract and an attractive salary packageFree choice of technical equipment (Apple MacBook / Thinkpads) and operating system (Linux, Windows, Mac OS)Centrally located office in Berlin-Friedrichshain with an amazing viewYour ApplicationInterested? job_title: Senior Consumer & Market Insights Researcher, Audience Insights
full_text:
Why Mozilla?
------------

A lot of companies say they're "mission-driven." Our unique corporate structure guarantees that every decision we make upholds our mission: to make sure the internet stays available, safe, and welcoming to everyone. Beholden to neither shareholders nor investors, Mozilla Corporation is wholly owned by the not-for-profit Mozilla Foundation.

Along with 20,000+ volunteer contributors and collaborators all over the world, Mozilla Corporation's staff designs, builds, and distributes software that allows people to enjoy the internet on their own terms. Our flagship product — the Firefox browser — has expanded into a family of products that protects users and alerts them of risks. Mozilla's Emerging Technologies group incubated and sponsors Rust — Stack Overflow's "most loved programming language" for the last four years — and is building safe, private versions of virtual reality, internet of things, and voice recognition.

Mozilla is in a category of one: a global technology nonprofit super-powered by a worldwide group of volunteers, and with a mission to ensure the Internet is a global public resource open and accessible to all. We drive impact through our products, technology and people by advocating for individuals' online lives and on their behalf for the health of the Internet.

The Role
--------

Our ideal candidate will want to help teams understand people better, be passionate about data and using it to inspire change, and have a knack for translating data in a way that inspires others.

This Audience Insights team (part of the Marketing organization) focuses on understanding Mozilla's key audiences. You will generate, collect, analyze and translate data into shareable, relatable insights which will impact how the teams within marketing, as well as within the organization, will craft their work. You will help teams see their work through the audience's eyes and influence how we engage with our audiences better.

Some types of research you'll be involved with include:
-------------------------------------------------------------


Designing surveys as well as processing, analyzing and visualizing survey data.
Collaborating on the design and implementation of marketing studies such as Brand lift studies, A/B testing, messaging and concept testing etc

The role is based in Berlin.

Key Responsibilities
--------------------

The Consumer & Market Insights Researcher will be responsible for conducting research, acquiring and analyzing audience-related qualitative and quantitative data to drive insights and actionable business recommendations. They will be intimately familiar with data and are able to balance ad-hoc data requests. Specifically, they will:


Partner with key Marketing team members (Brand, Communications, Product Marketing, Integrated Marketing, Creative), Advocacy, Emerging Technologies, Data Science and Firefox as a resource for data and insights related to our key audiences.
Lead all aspects of primary research, including partnering with key collaborators to frame problems, designing research methodologies, implementing high-quality data collection, and analyzing results.
Analyze and synthesize disparate information from primary and secondary research to our global brand tracker tool and product usage data to derive actionable insights that lead to brand/marketing wins and help our team better understand our users.
Translate research findings into clear and actionable insights through thoughtful data collection, in-depth analysis, sharp observations, strong story-telling, and compelling presentations.
Present easily digestible presentations and evangelize results and recommendations to teams.

Your Professional Profile
-------------------------


Track record of framing problems and creatively using research methods to answer questions to meet business objectives
Broad and deep research experience across qualitative, quantitative and mixed methods
Strong quantitative analysis skills and keen analytical abilities, expertise with Excel and Qualtrics, and one or more statistical computing packages/environments (R, Python, or SPSS)
Strategic thinker that can interpret data and communicate findings recommendations in an accessible way
Excellent communication (written, oral and presentation), organization and time management
Enjoys working in a cross-functional team, and have the ability to work independently
Ability to prioritize and work across multiple projects and teams
Proactive, curious, adaptable, self-starter attitude; comfortable with ambiguity and balancing multiple priorities/needs
B.A/B.S. or equivalent experience
At least 3 years experience in a Market Research, Consumer Insights or Data Analyst role

About Mozilla
-------------

Mozilla exists to build the Internet as a public resource accessible to all because we believe that open and free is better than closed and controlled. When you work at Mozilla, you give yourself a chance to make a difference in the lives of Web users everywhere. And you give us a chance to make a difference in your life every single day. Join us to work on the Web as the platform and help create more opportunity and innovation for everyone online.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race (including hairstyle and texture), religion (including religious grooming and dress practices), gender, gender identity, gender expression, color, national origin, pregnancy, ancestry, domestic partner status, disability, sexual orientation, age, genetic predisposition, medical condition, marital status, citizenship status, military or veteran status, or any other basis covered by applicable laws. We will provide reasonable accommodation to an employee or job applicant with a disability.

Group: C

#LI-RH1

---------------------
About the opportunity
---------------------

We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst Lead to establish the growth analytics team and ensure decisions are made based on data to drive revenue and retention.

Our Growth Analytics Team makes use of our huge treasure of quantitative and qualitative data about our customers and how they use our platform to help understand their needs and behavior. They believe in constantly reassessing the status quo and are looking for new and interesting opportunities that help us to drive growth.

You will be the internal go-to-person for marketing measurement related questions and support in analysis of key initiatives and challenge existing measurement frameworks. In the long run you will manage a small team of analysts to scale data driven decisions across all growth team functions and expand knowledge within the company.

-----------------------

In this role, you will:
-----------------------


Design test plans, enable prioritisation based on business impact, obtain cross-functional alignment, execute robust analysis, and deliver actionable insights
Enable cross functional relationships across the whole org. (i.e. operations, finance, data, tech, product) to drive actionable insights and framework consistency following our customer journey
Work extremely close to the analysts and the leads in the data team to ensure we have the best tech stack to scale.
Define frameworks and automated analysis of different types of campaigns.
Drive the budgeting and forecasting process across different channels and markets.
Drive innovation by developing new measurement methodologies, using advanced data modeling techniques (e.g. causal inference, media mix modeling and marketing attribution)
Drive strategic marketing investment recommendations, utilising leadership and influencer skills to ensure alignment and action from the team
Collaborate with a broad range of analytics teams at N26 to utilize shared platforms, insights and innovations

-------------------------------

What you need to be successful:
-------------------------------

Background:

6+ years of experience in analytics, ideally within the marketing field at a startup company
Strong understanding of data infrastructure
Experience in managing a team of analysts
Experience with SQL (Python or similar language is a big plus)

Skills:

You are great at crystalizing vague problems into impactful experiments or statistical analysis
LTV modelling and automation of clusters to enable the team to focus on high value customers (incl. 3rd party platforms and their algorithms)
Experience working with various analytics tools for data collection platforms, visualisation tools and Google Analytics
Strong analytical skills, including experience with A/B testing, statistical analysis (e.g. regression models, mix media modelling) and marketing attribution.
Experience with measurement of digital media, CRM and traditional media and the relationship between all channels to model hypothesis for less trackable channels and indirect impact
Great presentation skills and experience in working with senior leadership

Traits:

Actively help yourself (and others) be successful
Continuously learn and challenge the status quo
Think globally, act locally
Strong bias for action
Give and receive open, direct and timely feedback

---------------------------

What's in it for you:
---------------------------


Accelerate your career growth by joining Germany's #1 Top Startup, named by LinkedIn two years running
Personal development budget, discounted public transit pass, German language classes, fitness memberships, childcare services, N26 premium bank card, employee loans, and your choice of a Mac or Windows laptop
26 vacation days per year, with an additional day for each year of service - up to 30 days
A high degree of collaboration and autonomy while working with a group of international peers, getting things done attitude ( https://medium.com/insiden26/getting-more-stuff-done-days-at-n26-6886951da4f8 ), and access to cutting edge technologies
Dogs in the office - bring your canine companion twice per week
Rotating selection of hot and cold drinks, snacks, complimentary lunch on Wednesdays, plus pizza, wine and beer on Fridays
A relocation package with visa support for those who need it

Sound good? Apply now for this position.

----------
Who we are
----------

N26 has reimagined banking for today's digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and it's how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

N26 has international offices in Berlin, Barcelona, New York and Vienna.

N26 is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Monitor the company's infrastructure across all locations
Analyze information security and log data to analyze and detect potential threats
Investigate security events, requests and incidents
Review, validate, classify and respond to alerts within SLA's
Maintain precise investigation and case management records
Help initiate and implement future SOC processes and technologies
Assist with producing a broad range of reports to deliver current and reliable data to the management board

Leading pharmaceutical company in the field of genetic diagnostics for heredit

IT Security Analyst (m/f/d)

Theoretical and ideally hands-on experience in IT Security
Security systems such as SIEM, TLM, IDS/IPS, FW or Endpoint Protection are no novelty to you
You demonstrate strong analytical and problem-solving skills
You enjoy working both independently and in collaboration with others.
You have strong communication skills in English- German is a plus
You are excited to work in an international and interdisciplinary environment

Our client is a leading pharmaceutical company in the field of genetic diagnostics for hereditary diseases, with its headquarters in Germany. Operating on a global level with offices in India, U.S. and UAE, the company is internationally renowned for its cutting-edge technical solutions and innovative products in the field of genetics and as such has established the largest mutation database for hereditary diseases.

Attractive salary
Free bike rental for an environmental-friendly commute to work
Access to individual internal and external training sessions
Regular team-building company events
In-house yoga classes, back exercises and a gym area with free access
German and English classes if you are eager to learn the language

On behalf of our client we are looking for an IT Security Analyst (m/f/d).

Fit Analytics - the world's leading sizing and data platform for the apparel industry - is looking for a highly-motivated, performance-driven Account Executive DACH (m/f/d) to join our sales team in Berlin. You will oversee sales activities for the German-speaking market.

Who We Are

Based in Berlin and Chicago, we're a team of data scientists, fashionistas, physicists, business analysts, designers, and hackers, working together to tackle a single problem: making it easy for online shoppers to find the right clothes size. We help some of the world's largest clothing brands solve sizing issues, boost conversions and slash returns.

What We Do

The Fit Analytics' platform combines the world's largest database of garment and fit information with hundreds of billions of purchase records and consumer preferences. Our products Fit Finder, Fit Connect, Fit Intelligence and Fit Source help clothing and apparel companies instantly access the power of machine learning to deliver a perfect fit for customers. By applying the power of machine learning to this unique data set, we've created a range of innovative solutions to help drive improvements throughout the apparel lifecycle from manufacturing to marketing. Leading apparel brands and retailers across six continents trust our platform to solve sizing at scale and deliver meaningful bottom-line impact. Our clients include the likes of Zara, Asos, Hugo Boss, JD Sports, Bershka, The North Face, Tommy Hilfiger, Uniqlo, Calvin Klein and many more!

What the Role Involves


Increase customer awareness of Fit Analytics' solution in the DACH market
Develop and grow the Fit Analytics business in the DACH market
Close new business consistently at or above quota level by selling Fit Analytics' value proposition to apparel brands and retailers in DACH through product demos and ROI presentations
60% of your focus will be on client engagement; 30% on prospecting; and 10% on post-signing handovers
Connecting with prospects remote and onsite supported by CRM processes
Follow up on highly-qualified inbound leads at enterprise-level companies
Frequent travel required

What We're Looking for in You


5+ years of B2B sales experience, ideally software enterprise, carrying a quota of at least €500,000 per year (ACV)
BA/BS degree or higher
Experience in successfully executing complex sales cycles with CXOs
Superior communication skills and exceptional closing skills
Strong presentation, word processing and analytical skills
Goal-oriented, highly-organized and persistent
Comfortable with both phone selling and in-the-field selling

What We Offer You


A competitive salary
Hands-on experience building a revolutionary e-commerce product
A spot in our smart, creative and motivated international team
Daily breakfast and lunch plus regular team events

Why We're Different

We're not sitting around wondering what the product is and burning other people's money while expecting everyone to work ridiculous hours for little reward. We're profitable, organized, and already providing a unique solution that delivers huge value to our partners while helping millions of people shop better online.

If you're excellent at what you do and want to apply those skills to solving a genuinely hard problem together with a great bunch of people, you've come to the right place. To take the next step, send us your CV and a brief message explaining why you're the perfect fit!

Weber Shandwick ist eine international führende Kommunikationsagentur für Marken, Unternehmen und Organisationen in allen wichtigen Märkten der Welt. Durch ein vielfältiges und spezialisiertes Team kann die Agentur auf zahlreiche Auszeichnungen für innovative und kreative Kampagnen blicken. So wurde Weber Shandwick 2019 von der Ad Age für „Best Places to Work“ ausgezeichnet und ist die einzige PR-Agentur, die es 2017 und 2018 auf die Ad Age A-List „Agency Standout“ schaffte. Mit datengestützten, einzigartigen Ideen im Mittelpunkt und einem vielseitigen Team aus Strategen, Analysten, Technologen und Kreativen, gestaltet die Agentur integrierte Kampagnen, die mehr können als Aufmerksamkeit zu generieren – sie ermöglichen Interaktionen, die einen nachhaltigen Impact für unsere Kunden schaffen. An den deutschen Standorten Berlin, Frankfurt, Köln und München bietet Weber Shandwick strategische Beratung, Planung und die Umsetzung integrierter Kommunikationsdienstleistungen in den zentralen Geschäftsbereichen Brand- und B2B-Marketing, Healthcare, Change Management, Employee Engagement, Corporate Reputation, Krisenkommunikation, Data & Analytics, Technology, Public Affairs, Social Impact sowie Finance-Kommunikation. Weber Shandwick gehört zur Interpublic Group (NYSE: IPG).Für unser Technology-Team suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen erfahrenenIT-Fachredakteur (w/m/d)für unseren Berliner Standort. Auf Dich warten eine Vielzahl anspruchsvoller Kunden aus der B2B-Technologie-Branche, darunter Bereiche wie industrielle Fertigung, Gebäudeautomation, Automotive, Datenbanken, Telekommunikation, Logistik oder Retail. Das Themenfeld ist sehr breit und reicht von Sensoren und Raumreglern bis hin zu (I)IoT-Anwendungen, Mixed Reality und Künstlicher Intelligenz. Der Fokus liegt dabei auf PR-Textarbeit, Social Media und Digital Services.DEINE AUFGABEN- DU… recherchierst und erstellst Presseinformationen, Expertenkommentare, Fachartikel, Anwenderberichte o.Ärecherchierst und bereitest Themen bzw. Inhalte für Print & Digital zielgruppen- und mediengerecht aufarbeitest bei strategischen Kommunikationskampagnen konzeptionell und operativ mit – insbesondere bei der Entwicklung von Formaten und inhaltlichen Weiterentwicklung der zentralen Kommuni­kations­kanälebist verantwortlich für die onlinespezifische Aufbereitung von Inhalten sowie das Erstellen und Einbinden multimedialer Inhalte in Websites und Social-Media-Kanälepflegst eine enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Kundenberatern und Kundennimmst an Kunden-Meetings und –Briefings teilDEIN PROFIL- DU… hast mindestens drei Jahre Erfahrung als IT-Fachredakteurhast Erfahrung im B2B-Umfeldpunktest durch eine ausgefallene & kreative Ausdrucksweise in Wort und Schrifthast kommunikationssichere Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch & EnglischUNSER ANGEBOT – WIR… ermöglichen dir modernes Arbeiten mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit, flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und Home-Office-Regelungenbieten dir ein professionelles und strukturiertes Onboarding mit deinem persönlichen Mentorbieten dir Gestaltungsspielraum und Entwicklungsperspektiven in verschiedene Richtungenofferieren dir einen reizvollen Job mit anspruchsvollen Themen in einem internationalen und innovativen Umfeldmachen 28 Tage Urlaub im Jahr und haben zusätzlich Heiligabend und Silvester freifrühstücken gemeinsam, lassen öfter mal die Woche zusammen ausklingen und feiern unsere Erfolgebieten Mitarbeiterrabatte bei ausgewählten Shopping-PartnernWerde Teil unseres Erfolges als IT-Fachredakteur (w/m/d) in unserem Tech-Team. Deine zukünftigen Kolleginnen und Kollegen freuen sich auf deine vollständige Bewerbung (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf und Arbeitsproben) mit Angabe deiner Gehaltsvorstellung sowie deines frühestmöglichen Starttermins per Email.Du willst mehr über uns/die oben genannte Position erfahren? Office Manager (m/w/d)
in Vollzeit am Standort Berlin

Wir bieten Dir:
Hohe Flexibilität: Damit Privates nicht zu kurz kommt, unterstützen wir Dich mit flexiblen Arbeitszeitmodellen.
Attraktive Zusatzleistungen: Erfreue Dich neben dem Fixgehalt an einer Beteiligung am Konzern- und Unternehmenserfolg sowie einem Zuschuss zu vermögenswirksamen Leistungen.
Ausgefallene Feiern: Wir veranstalten After-Work-Partys, Team-Events und Sommer- & Weihnachtsfeiern.
Selbstverständliche Angebote: Wir bieten Dir kostenlose Obstkörbe und Wasserspender für Deine tägliche Versorgung am Arbeitsplatz.
Vielfältige Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten: Wir bieten eine Vielzahl an internen Weiterbildungsangeboten, sowie persönliche E-Learning-Angebote - auch für zu Hause.
Starke Sportangebote: Wir bieten Rabatte für Fitnessstudios in der Umgebung und veranstalten Firmenläufe, an denen wir als Team antreten.
Gesundheitliche Fürsorge: Mithilfe unseres Betriebssozialdienstes und eigener Betriebsärzte kümmern wir uns um Deine Gesundheit.
Neue Chancen: Auch als Berufs- oder Quereinsteiger erhältst Du die Möglichkeit, Dich in abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben einzuarbeiten.
Offene Unternehmenskultur: Wir stehen für Vielfalt im Unternehmen - und das in jeder Hinsicht.
Tolle Aussichten: In einem dynamischen und gleichzeitig zukunftssicheren Arbeitsumfeld mit Aufstiegsperspektiven erhältst Du einen befristeten Arbeitsvertrag mit der Möglichkeit zur unbefristeten Übernahme.

Das sind wir:
Mal ehrlich: Finanzthemen sind kompliziert. Darum sind wir bei Arvato Financial Solutions stolz darauf, sowohl international agierende als auch renommierte, lokale Unternehmen durch die komplexe Welt der Zahlungsströme zu steuern. Ganz gleich ob unsere Kunden im E-Commerce Schuhe verkaufen oder Telekommunikationsdienstleistungen anbieten, unsere Dienstleistungen sichern effizientes Credit Management für bestmögliche finanzielle Performance. Dazu lösen unsere rund 7.500 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter täglich neue Herausforderungen im Zahlungsverkehr und komplexe Datenrätsel – clever, analytisch und mit Blick für jedes Detail – denn das ist unsere DNA. Wir suchen Kolleginnen und Kollegen, die Lust haben mitzugestalten und genau hinzuschauen - egal ob Berufsanfänger, IT-Spezialisten, Data Analysten, Sachbearbeiter, Führungskräfte oder Quereinsteiger. Und dank unserer Präsenz in rund 20 Ländern mit Fokus auf Europa und Amerika ist ein passender Job zumeist in der Nähe. Innovate yourself.
Im Geschäftsbereich Accounting und Payment bieten wir konkrete Antworten auf die Herausforderungen unser Kunden, insbesondere wenn es um die Erschließung von Kaufkraft, internationaler Märkte, das Stärken der Kundenbeziehung und die Digitalisierung von Unternehmen geht. Dazu setzen wir auf passgenaue Gesamtpakete, Plattformen sowie den gezielten Einsatz von Robots, künstlicher Intelligenz und Big Data Analytics.

Wir halten was wir versprechen:
Mehr Informationen unter www.innovateyourself.de. Bist Du schon überzeugt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Online-Bewerbung mit Gehaltsvorstellung und frühestmöglichen Eintrittsdatum.

Bayer is a global enterprise with core competencies in the Life Science fields of health care and agriculture. Its products and services are designed to benefit people and improve their quality of life. At Bayer you have the opportunity to be part of a culture where we value the passion of our employees to innovate and give them the power to change.

Manager Analytics and Insights (m/f/d)


YOUR TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Provide Senior Management with measurable insights into clinical trial operational health as well as strategies and tactics for successful trial delivery and serve as a key analytics and insight contact and trusted advisor for the organization
Set up a sustainable framework to ensure that a standardized set of KPIs and metrics are in place, monitored and reported regularly using an appropriate dashboard
Manage the exploration and implementation of new data capture methods, analytical capabilities to formulate strategies related to trials
Manage the development of new analysis platforms and dashboards using appropriate programming tools (e.g. “R”, Python etc.)
Ensure timely conduct of data driven protocol and site selection assessments, own protocol and site survey system and analysis
Develop recommendations using statistical modelling and Real World Evidence (RWE) and present appropriately
Lead development of predictive tools to ensure that clinical trial performance related signals are detected early
Work closely with external suppliers and internal data to generate patients’ insights as well as manage and maintain a database of country specific standard of care, decision making framework, point of diagnosis, patient journey, referral networks for the portfolio


WHO YOU ARE

MD, PhD, MSc, or MA degree with several years of pharmaceutical industry experience or BSc or equivalent with long-term pharmaceutical industry experience
Deep knowledge and several years of experience in clinical operations, management of clinical studies, protocol synopsis assessment, site identification, trial and site performance metrics, patient enrollment forecasting and modeling
Proven ability to build/select appropriate analysis techniques, quantitative models and present analysis findings effectively to the team
Strong ability to formulate recommendations/generate insights from complex analysis
Strong communication, coordination and negotiation skills to ensure that accurate and concise feasibility reports are developed using inputs from functions as well as internal and external experts
High level of accuracy, persistence, resilience and creativity
Teamplayer (m/w/d) with the ability to work independently as well
Fluent in German and English, both written and spoken

YOUR APPLICATION
Are you looking for a new challenge where you can show your passion for innovation? Are you interested in working as part of a global team to improve people’s lives? Then send us your online application including cover letter, CV and references.
Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.

job_title: Praktikum (m/w/d) Data Analyst / Performance Marketing / Berlin
full_text:
Was erwartet dich?
Du unterstützt deine Kollegen aus Strategie und Performance Marketing bei der Recherche von digitalen Ökosystem und der Analyse von datengetriebenen Marketingmaßnahmen
Du hilfst mit, Unternehmen und Social Media Kanäle aus externer Perspektive systematisch auszuwerten, daraus Wissen zu extrahieren und dieses anschaulich aufzubereiten.

Was solltest du mitbringen?
akademischer Hintergrund (zum Beispiel Mathe, Statistik, Physik, IT oder Wirtschaftswissenschaft)
Immatrikulation in „Data Science“ von Vorteil, aber kein Muss
erste Erfahrung in Daten- und Wettbewerbsanalysen (Studieninhalte oder Praktikum)
fit in Excel; Interesse an Datenverarbeitungstools
Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und gute Powerpoint-Skills
Neugier auf innovative Marken- und Kommunikationsstrategien
Perfektes Deutsch und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse

Was bieten wir dir?
Ein Praktikumsplatz für 3 Monate (Bei Pflichtpraktikum auch gern länger)
Herausfordernde Projekte, steile Lernkurve
Inspirierenden Austausch mit 40 wunderbaren Kollegen aus unterschiedlichsten Disziplinen
Getränke, Obst und Snacks, Lunch&Learn
Gute Anbindung an die ÖPNV

Wenn diese Stelle dein Interesse weckt, bewirb dich jetzt über Campusjäger bei uns! Wir freuen uns darauf.

A Pricing Data Analyst in our Pricing & Forecasting team is passionate about creating accurate data solutions and have a proven record of developing trusting relationships with product and commercial leads who will turn your insights into actions.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Build and improve upon the system which measures sales forecasting, price optimisation and customer lifetime value
Act as the point of contact between Analytics and external product, engineering and ops teams to ensure key projects are successful
Build and own periodic reporting - Take advantage of the ever-growing amount of data we have at our fingertips to help stakeholders build best in class forecasting tools
Managing and leading key initiatives in the Analytics team and Pricing & Forecasting
Mentor and guide junior members of the Analytics team
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
3+ years of experience using data to build analytical solutions at industry leading companies in Technology, Retail or e-commerce.
Ability to turn complex findings and results into a compelling narrative and a set of actions
Familiarity with SQL and an objection-oriented programing language (Python, R,Java)
Undergraduate degree in a technical field (Science, Economics, Physics, Maths, Engineering)
Led or contributing to a complex technical project related to analytics, testing or data modeling/Warehousing
Experience mentoring or leading
Passion for analytics as a craft
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
The Pricing & Forecasting Department plays a pivotal role in the organisation by producing algorithmic-based price recommendations, forecasting sales, defining and implementing pricing strategies across 16 countries and 500k articles . The Department is a self-sufficient team of product, engineering, Analytics and operations. As a member of the Pricing Analytics team, you’ll build tools and data products that impacts millions of Zalando shoppers, the top and bottom line of our company and the many internal teams that rely on your analytics solutions.
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form – we do not accept applications via e-mail.

Your profile:
You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere

Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience

Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
