Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


WHICH PRODUCT TEAMS


Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. As a Product Analyst in the content composition team, you will work with data scientists and engineers, draw insights from the complex interaction of content, customers, and Zalando’s business and help to understand why which content is successful in front of the customer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können

Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig

Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

Unser Versprechen: idealo Nutzer*innen finden über die gesamte Geräte-Journey hinweg immer das beste Angebot und können es, neben dem Preisvergleich, auch direkt über idealo auf jedem Gerät kaufen. Damit wir wirklich allen Bedürfnissen gerecht werden können, freuen wir uns auf Dich zur Unterstützung im Design-Team! Gemeinsam mit weiteren UX-Kollegen, Product Owner, Entwicklern und einem Data Analysten betreust Du die Android und iOS Shopping App von idealo.

Deine Aufgaben
Du bist Teil eines agilen Teams und erstellst Interaktionskonzepte und visuelle Designs für unsere idealo Shopping Apps
In Abstimmung mit dem Product Owner, Deinem Team und weiteren Stakeholdern bringst Du Business-Anforderungen mit Nutzererwartungen in Übereinstimmung und entwickelst daraus intuitiv nutzbare Bedienkonzepte
Darüber hinaus erarbeitest Du interaktive Prototypen, unterstützt die Customer-Insights-Kolleg*innen bei Nutzertests und finalisierst die UI auf Basis bestehender Guidelines
Du unterstützt Dein Team, die User Experience und das visuelle Design zu verfeinern
Du unterstützt aktiv die Weiterentwicklung der Team- und Gesamtstrategie bei idealo

Das bringst Du mit
Du bringst erste relevante Erfahrung in der device-übergreifenden Konzeption und Gestaltung von iOS und Android Apps mit
Du bist ein leidenschaftlicher Gestalter
Du kennst Dich in den Bereichen Usability, Konzeption und visuelles Design aus und bist vertraut mit Prototyping-Tools wie Sketch und Invision sowie agiler Arbeitsweise
Du hast Erfahrung mit Usability-Tests, kannst Dich bei der Vorbereitung einbringen sowie bei der Durchführung unterstützen
Für eine gute Zusammenarbeit in unserem internationalen und interdisziplinären Team bringst Du außerdem sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse mit
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Fach- oder Führungskarriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding-Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen

AtomLeap is an AI company that collects and uses big data to track and analyze the latest high-impact innovations and technologies. We assess tech innovations and the organizations driving them, and we help industry and business leaders make their most important decisions through a combination of big data, an AI-augmented Saas dashboard, and qualitative expertise.

We are looking for a front-end developer to join our growing international team. If you’re an enthusiastic professional keen on working in a fast-paced company, we look forward to your application. Our position is an excellent opportunity for you to shape the growth of an ambitious startup in the heart of Berlin Kreuzberg.

Tasks


Play a leading role in our growing software development team. You will be involved in all steps of our product development and maintenance including design, architecture, implementation, and automated tests.
Work as a front-end architect by using your excellent knowledge of JavaScript. Define technology and development standards for the front-end domain and build the architecture of our front-end products.
Develop new versions of our existing front-end tools while improving the analyst tools used by our team. Collaborate with our back-end engineers to design and implement new API endpoints.
Develop our new customer dashboard, based on a well thought-out dashboard design and effective dynamic visualization tools that streamline the visual presentation of large and complex data sets, as well as AI-based data insights.
Translate business requirements into new features or apply changes to existing ones. Brainstorm features with the management team, our product managers, and designers, and guide decisions based on your knowledge and experience.
Cooperate with highly skilled developers, product managers, QAs, and designers to ship new components and features.

Requirements


You have a university degree in a relevant field and at least two years of work experience as a front-end developer or engineer.
You have experience writing client-side JavaScript and expertise in building layouts with CSS and HTML.
You are very familiar with JavaScript and Node.js, and are knowledgeable in at least one major framework (e.g., Angular 5+/ ReactJS/VueJS). Moreover, you know how to apply MongoDB and have worked with Git.
You have a good background in building complex, customer-facing products, and possess excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
You are familiar with handling data models, dealing with asynchronous requests, and updating UI components to reflect underlying data.
You think about the user to provide the optimal experience for her. You have strong UX and design sensibilities and an interest in sweating the small stuff.
You are passionate about writing well-structured, efficient and maintainable code, and actively keeping the quality of the code base in check.
You have worked in an agile software development area and feel comfortable in this culture. You can comfortably collaborate with the whole development team.
You are enthusiastic about usability, design, and new technologies.
You are fluent in English; German language skills are a plus.

Benefits


Five weeks of paid vacation each year.
A permanent contract, competitive salary, and flexible working hours.
Flat hierarchies with short decision paths.
A team of inquisitive minds to keep things interesting.
Talent development through individual education and courses, with opportunities for bonuses and career progression.

If this sounds like you, send your application — including cover letter and CV — to Ms. Konstanze Neumann (konstanze(at)atomleap.com) by April 5th, 2020. Interviews will be held in the following weeks. Relevant references, certificates, and links to previous work are more than welcome.

Senior Technical Product Owner (f/m/x)

Full time employment | Permanent | ASAP | Berlin

At Architrave, we build state of the art software for Digital Real-Estate Management. We focus on a deep understanding of workflows and organizational principles of the industry that we combine with intuitive and inspiring business software. First released in April 2014, the novelty in design and speed of our web-based document management system has gained huge attention in the industry.
Just last year, Architrave won the PropTech of the Year Award!


Your Future Responsibilities:


As Senior Technical Product Owner, you will be responsible for a cross-functional team in an end-2-end setting - from analysis to roll-out and optimization.
Your goal is to craft innovative technical solutions according to the needs of the business. These solutions will be the foundation for the Architrave product portfolio
You will work closely with Stakeholders, Senior Management and other Product Owners in the Product Division.
Your responsibilities include planning the road-map, managing the backlog, conceptualizing and writing user stories, planning sprints, coordinating the roll-out and constantly measuring and optimizing.

What you should bring with you:


A passion for excellent product development that digitizes a paper-based industry.
You have a business-driven mindset with deep understanding of technology.
Exceptional communication skills across disciplines, roles and levels.
Minimum of 5 years of relevant professional experience as a Software Product Owner, Business Analyst or Business Architect, preferably in B2B software startups or enterprise solutions.
Previous experience in Agile and in working with cross-functional teams
Self-starter and fast learner
Fluent in English, German skills are a plus

What you could bring with you:


Insights into the real estate industry, document management, Data solutions or process management

What we offer you:


The opportunity to genuinely shape an exceptional product of one of - if not the leading PropTech in Europe
A competitive compensation, flexible working hours and a family friendly work ethic
A great place to grow and to take over responsibility, professionally and personally with a personal education budget to spend on training, conferences and personal growth
Flat hierarchies, short and open communication flows and quick decision-making processes
A working environment that values individuals and embraces knowledge sharing
A highly motivated and talented team that likes to prepare lunch together but also loves to play ping-pong in a light-flooded office area
Free drinks and a fully equipped kitchen
Employee discounts for BVG, Urban Sports Club, LPG Biomarkt and more

So, what are you waiting for? We look forward to receiving your application (CV and cover letter)!

We’d also appreciate if you forward this to anyone you think might be interested. Thanks a bunch!

Wir bieten Dir:

Das sind wir:
Mal ehrlich: Finanzthemen sind kompliziert. Ganz gleich ob unsere Kunden im E-Commerce Schuhe verkaufen oder Telekommunikationsdienstleistungen anbieten, unsere Dienstleistungen sichern effizientes Credit Management für bestmögliche finanzielle Performance. Und dank unserer Präsenz in rund 20 Ländern mit Fokus auf Europa und Amerika ist ein passender Job zumeist in der Nähe. Innovate yourself.
Im Geschäftsbereich Accounting und Payment bieten wir konkrete Antworten auf die Herausforderungen unser Kunden, insbesondere wenn es um die Erschließung von Kaufkraft, internationaler Märkte, das Stärken der Kundenbeziehung und die Digitalisierung von Unternehmen geht. Dazu setzen wir auf passgenaue Gesamtpakete, Plattformen sowie den gezielten Einsatz von Robots, künstlicher Intelligenz und Big Data Analytics.

Wir halten was wir versprechen:
Mehr Informationen unter www.innovateyourself.de. Bist Du schon überzeugt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Online-Bewerbung mit Gehaltsvorstellung und frühestmöglichen Eintrittsdatum.

Hohe Kunden- und Serviceorientierung sowie Verhandlungsgeschick und betriebswirtschaftliches Verständnis zählen zu Deinen Stärken
Du bist eine kommunikative Persönlichkeit mit überzeugungsstarkem wie lösungsorientiertem Verhandlungs- und Verkaufsgeschick
Du besitzt eine selbständige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise mit ausgeprägtem Zahlenverständnis
Du hast sehr gute Deutsch- sowie Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Wir bieten Dir:
Hohe Flexibilität: Damit Privates nicht zu kurz kommt, unterstützen wir Dich mit flexiblen Arbeitszeitmodellen – Gleitzeit in Vollzeit oder Teilzeit.
Attraktive Zusatzleistungen: Unsere Mitarbeiter erfreuen sich neben dem Fixgehalt an einer Beteiligung am Konzern- und Unternehmenserfolg sowie einem Zuschuss zu vermögenswirksamen Leistungen.
Ausgefallene Feiern: Wir veranstalten After-Work-Partys, Team-Events und Sommer- & Weihnachtsfeiern.
Selbstverständliche Angebote: Wir bieten Dir kostenlose Obstkörbe und Wasserspender für Deine tägliche Versorgung am Arbeitsplatz.
Vielfältige Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten: Wir bieten eine Vielzahl an internen Weiterbildungsangeboten, sowie persönliche E-Learning-Angebote - auch für zu Hause.
Starke Sportangebote: Wir bieten Rabatte für Fitnessstudios in der Umgebung und veranstalten Firmenläufe, an denen wir als Team antreten.
Gesundheitliche Fürsorge: Mithilfe unseres Betriebssozialdienstes und eigener Betriebsärzte kümmern wir uns um Deine Gesundheit.
Neue Chancen: Auch als Berufs- oder Quereinsteiger erhältst Du die Möglichkeit, Dich in abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben einzuarbeiten.
Offene Unternehmenskultur: Wir stehen für Vielfalt im Unternehmen - und das in jeder Hinsicht. Zum Beispiel fördern wir mit unserem LGBTIQ-Netzwerk „be.queer“ ein offenes Arbeitsumfeld für alle Mitarbeiter.
Das sind wir:
Mal ehrlich: Finanzthemen sind kompliziert. Darum sind wir bei Arvato Financial Solutions stolz darauf, sowohl international agierende als auch renommierte, lokale Unternehmen durch die komplexe Welt der Zahlungsströme zu steuern. Ganz gleich ob unsere Kunden im E-Commerce Schuhe verkaufen oder Telekommunikationsdienstleistungen anbieten, unsere Dienstleistungen sichern effizientes Credit Management für bestmögliche finanzielle Performance. Dazu lösen unsere rund 7.500 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter täglich neue Herausforderungen im Zahlungsverkehr und komplexe Datenrätsel – clever, analytisch und mit Blick für jedes Detail – denn das ist unsere DNA. Wir suchen Kolleginnen und Kollegen, die Lust haben mitzugestalten und genau hinzuschauen - egal ob Berufsanfänger, IT-Spezialisten, Data Analysten, Sachbearbeiter, Führungskräfte oder Quereinsteiger. Und dank unserer Präsenz in rund 20 Ländern mit Fokus auf Europa und Amerika ist ein passender Job zumeist in der Nähe. Innovate yourself.
Im Geschäftsbereich Accounting und Payment bieten wir konkrete Antworten auf die Herausforderungen unser Kunden, insbesondere wenn es um die Erschließung von Kaufkraft, internationaler Märkte, das Stärken der Kundenbeziehung und die Digitalisierung von Unternehmen geht. Dazu setzen wir auf passgenaue Gesamtpakete, Plattformen sowie den gezielten Einsatz von Robots, künstlicher Intelligenz und Big Data Analytics.

Wir halten was wir versprechen:
Mehr Informationen unter www.innovateyourself.de. Bist Du schon überzeugt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Online-Bewerbung mit Gehaltsvorstellung und frühestmöglichen Eintrittsdatum.

Company and Position Overview:
Edison Energy’s Renewables Advisory practice was originally founded as Altenex in Boston, Massachusetts in 2010. As a founder of the corporate power purchase agreement (PPA) market in the United States, Edison’s team has spent the last nine years helping multinational corporations, cities and universities develop holistic sustainability and renewable energy strategies and execute on those strategies with innovative contract structures (virtual PPAs, physically delivered PPAs, onsite generation and storage, and community solar, to name a few). In all, Edison has advised on 4,100 MW of transactions. To date, most of the transactions Edison has sourced and advised on have been in North America based on the renewable energy market, policy and project development fundamentals in the US and Mexico. Increasingly, Edison is advising clients on opportunities in Europe as the market opens up with more competitive options for corporate buyers.
Edison has been serving European clients, and the European teams of our American clients, with its US based Renewables Advisory team. Given the growth in Edison’s European business, Edison plans to build a physical presence in Europe to better serve these advisory engagements with continued support coming from the large US-based team.
The Senior Director of European Renewables Advisory will be Edison’s first hire in Europe. The Senior Director will play a key role in developing Edison’s strategy for growth in Europe and will be responsible for both the business development and operational aspects of building the practice in Europe. This position will be the face of Edison’s Renewables Advisory practice to prospective and current clients, at industry conferences as a thought leader, and with renewable energy developers as Edison continues to grow its developer network in Europe.
The position will focus heavily on business development to start. The Senior Director will leverage Edison’s current multinational client base as well as expand relationships with other companies seeking renewable energy advisory services. Once a client has engaged Edison for advisory services, the Senior Director will manage the client relationship throughout the lifecycle of the engagement. The Senior Director will work as a partner to the client’s internal energy and sustainability teams – analyzing the client’s electricity portfolio to understand how new contracts would interact with the existing energy strategy and load, educating stakeholders and senior executives on key issues in signing a PPA, developing a cohesive renewable energy strategy and project plan, coordinating internally to execute on the project plan, using analytics to evaluate the most favorable project selection and identify key risks, and supporting commercial discussions as well as executive approvals of a definitive agreement. The Senior Director will have a support team of US-based analysts and managers to conduct RFPs, provide project due diligence, run financial analyses and provide commercial structuring advice. As the European business grows, Edison would seek to add more support team members in Europe with the Senior Director.
Job Requirements
Business Development
Actively seek new clients and expand Edison Energy’s market presence in Europe through own network, conferences, trade associations, NGO membership, in-bound leads and coordination with the broader Edison Energy Sales and Strategy teams
Develop proposals and effectively present them to clients, incorporating market feedback and customized messaging for different client types and country markets
Maintain ongoing customer relationships using account management principals to ensure customer satisfaction and develop future
opportunities
Meet and exceed client growth targets in Europe to generate revenue for Edison
Client Delivery
Manage client relationship by delivering high quality, timely and value-added services. This work will include:
Educating clients on renewable energy options by region in Europe – highlighting key PPA terms, project development timelines, market price forecasts and risks, accounting considerations for PPAs, and changing policy considerations to name a few of the topics to be covered
Helping clients develop renewable energy strategies once education of the options has been completed
Working with the US-based team to prepare financial and commercial analyses of contract structures, and advising how to build a portfolio of projects to mitigate risk, run RFPs, conduct project due diligence and financial modeling, and provide commercial support for negotiations
Preparing and delivering presentations to senior leadership at Global Fortune 500 companies
Keeping abreast of EU and member state policy changes that affect renewable energy development and electricity markets
Desired Background
 10 years of experience, with at least 5 years of electricity market experience at any of the following: energy management team at a corporation or institution having experience evaluating and procuring renewable energy, utility or energy supplier with experience in renewable energy, renewable project developer, consulting firm with experience in renewable energy
 Detailed understanding of power purchase agreements (PPAs) for renewable energy
 Comprehensive understanding of European electricity markets, renewable energy development and financing in Europe, rules regarding Guarantees of Origin, and corporate energy procurement strategies
Required Skills
 Must be a strong communicator, both in writing and in presentation skills, as the role involves significant senior level client interaction. Must be fluent in English;
fluency in other language is a plus.
 Must possess strong analytical skills to understand energy market fundamentals and translate data into commercial strategies and advice for clients
 Must be highly organized and able to manage multiple client engagements
 Must be willing to travel up to 50% of time, with trips around Europe for business development and to the US to meet with the Edison Energy team, primarily in Boston, Massachusetts.
NOTE: Edison Energy is not the same company as Southern California Edison, the utility, and Edison Energy is not regulated by the California Public Utilities Commission.

Are you ready to be a Frontend / UI Engineer for the leading data analytics product?

You live in Berlin area?

You are ready to join one of the most innovative tech companies?

Do you get lightheaded thinking about the endless possibilities held by big data insights and collaborative data analytics? We dare you to show us your bold, fierce, passionate side; you'll feel right at home among our people!

At our Neebo team, we're data nerds through and through. We're here to consistently innovate, to build the data analytics software that's always on the bleeding edge. We're here to lead the charge in this data revolution. Care to join us?

Anna's problems are our problems:
Anna is an analyst and Anna and her colleagues are not only dealing with data. They have to do research before starting analysis and hence they have to organize dozens to hundreds of documents in any form before starting the work on ONE analytics task. These documents can be pictures, PDFs, text files, code snippets, presentations etc.

And guess what, in a short time, Anna and her colleagues generate thousands of documents. Anna's problem now is to find stuff she already did to not repeat her or others work.

We want to solve Anna's problem by building:

a visual appealing search experience and
an easy to use flow to organize and contextualize all the uploaded entities.

Therefore, we need your skills.

Helpful experience and our requirements:

4+ years industry experience working with JavaScript/ES6 (React, Redux ), HTML5 and CSS3 (LESS, others ...)
Unit, Integration & End-to-End Tests (Jest, React Testing Library)
Build tools/pipeline (Webpack, Babel)
Version Control Systems (Git, GitHub)
Experience collaborating with design and UX teams
Experience integrating backend services using REST
You've built and maintained medium-to-large scale front-end web applications
Passion for creating a high impact quality experience for users with a focus on usability, simplicity & efficiency
Ability to work and thrive in an environment of continuous improvement, learning and mastery of new technologies and techniques
Strong communication and self-management skills
Experience with Agile development, working as part of a team and excellent interpersonal skills

About us

We aren't your average Engineering team, that's why we're looking for somebody who likes pushing the limits of what's possible and delivering amazing features to our customers day after day. We are a fast paced, collaborative, kickass team that is always trying to find ways to blow our customer's minds. If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you.

We are a well-funded, global software company headquartered in San Francisco with global offices across Europe backed by top tier investors including KPCB, Redpoint Ventures, and Next World Capital among others. Our customers include who's who of the fortune 100 and the list is growing!

We have a history of continued innovation since 2010, serving the fortune 100 providing an enterprise grade platform enabling trusted data-driven insights anywhere. Datameer's advanced data preparation, exploration and governance functionality makes it easy to transform big data into curated data sets to feed any analytics initiative. Using a hybrid architecture that spans on-premise and the cloud, Datameer helps organizations deliver new insights in days and operationalize them immediately, increasing agility and responsiveness of the analytics that drive the business.

We recently introduced our latest innovation in analytics - Neebo - 'The Virtual Analytics Hub' - a powerful cloud solution designed to enable teams of analysts and data scientists to perform analyses on complex and disparate data landscapes. With Neebo, teams can now, at the click of a mouse without coding, find, create and collaborate on complex data sets and drive insights from their data faster than ever.


We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

**Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: Datameer does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Datameer will not pay fees to any third party recruitment agency or firm in the absence of a signed agreement and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of Datameer.

job_title: Software Development Engineer (Full Stack) - Amazon Redshift
full_text:
3 or more years of relevant work experience in software developmentA Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical discipline (or the equivalent)Proficiency in full-stack development, with experience in one or more relevant front-end frameworks: React, Angular, JQuery, Electron, UI test automation frameworksSkilled in developing rich applications with JavaScript (focus on Node and React), HTML, and CSSSome coding skills in Java or C++Good problem-solving skills and knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented design

Are you passionate in building high quality products that users find super-efficient and powerful? Are you interested in building excellent Data Analyst tools that simplify finding, analyzing, and visualizing data? Do you appreciate great software craftsmanship and are motivated by building applications that scale? If so, please read on about the opportunity to set a new standard for data analytics tooling.

Our cloud data warehouse Amazon Redshift manages all the work needed to set up, operate, and scale a data warehouse, from provisioning capacity and installing software to monitoring and backing up the cluster, to applying patches and upgrades. AWS offers various frontends for the different personas to manage the service and query and analyze the data that is stored in Amazon Redshift. Come join a new Redshift team to extend Redshift’s ease of use to Data Analysts. You’ll build intuitive tools Analysts can use to query and visualize trends in Redshift data, discover new insights, collaborate within teams through shared queries and analyses, and easily create query result visualizations that help improve business decision making.

As a Software Development Engineer (Full Stack) at Amazon Redshift, you will:
Help define the system architecture, own and implement specific components, and help shape the overall experienceCollaborate closely with UX designers, and other SDE team members to help define the scope of the product.As an early team member, you will take responsibility for technical problem solving, creatively meeting product objectives, and developing best practices.Build highly available, secure, scalable, distributed and event-driven systems.Find out what it takes to engineer secured systems for "Amazon Scale".Contribute to planning, architecture design, implementation, testing, and process improvement.
Joining the Amazon Redshift team gives you the opportunity to:
Work on the latest technology, as we constantly build the latest research concepts into our applications.Be part of something big, as you are working on a key pillar of AWSs extensive service portfolio and thousands of Amazon Redshift customers benefit from your contributions.Learn from the best, as you are working on challenging engineering tasks in a team of very experienced experts that are close to support you.Be part of a great team, as we invest a lot to create an inclusive environment that allows you to perform at your best, while maintaining a fun atmosphere.

Experience designing, building, and operating large-scale distributed systems and web services on AWS technologyExperience with relational and non-relational database systems.A track record of successfully delivering projects as part of an agile software development team.Strong design skills around user experience. Eye for design and attention to detail. Experience with responsive web design.
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Fit Analytics ( http://www.fitanalytics.com/ ) — the world's leading sizing solution for apparel & footwear — is looking for a highly motivated Product Manager (m/f/d) for our office in Berlin to take responsibility for one of our core products. If you're passionate about building great products, and ready to use your skills to shape the future of the apparel and fashion industry, we want to hear from you!

Who We Are

Based in Berlin and Chicago, we're a team of data scientists, fashionistas, physicists, business analysts, designers, and hackers, working together to tackle a single problem: making it easy for online shoppers to find the right clothes size. We help some of the world's largest clothing brands solve sizing issues, boost conversions and slash returns.

What We Do

The Fit Analytics' platform combines the world's largest database of garment and fit information with hundreds of billions of purchase records and consumer preferences. Our products Fit Finder, Fit Connect, Fit Intelligence and Fit Source help clothing and apparel companies instantly access the power of machine learning to deliver a perfect fit for customers. By applying the power of machine learning to this unique data set, we've created a range of innovative solutions to help drive improvements throughout the apparel lifecycle from manufacturing to marketing. Leading apparel brands and retailers across six continents trust our platform to solve sizing at scale and deliver meaningful bottom-line impact. Our clients include the likes of Zara, Asos, Hugo Boss, JD Sports, Bershka, The North Face, Tommy Hilfiger, Uniqlo, Calvin Klein and many more!

What The Role Involves


Develop and execute the product strategy and product roadmap
Identify product enhancement opportunities through research and data analysis
Weigh competing initiatives and make clear decisions on priority
Be the voice of the product and voice of the customer within the company
Define and improve key metrics relating to the success of the product
Drive new feature development from conception to final delivery
Design and run A/B tests to measure the success of product changes
Report and manage project risks & issues
Help the marketing team to communicate the value of product features to clients
Maintain an up-to-date library of marketing collateral for the product
Plan and drive upsell campaigns with the sales and client success teams
Share product insights throughout the company

What We're Looking for in You


Proven success at building tech products
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to communicate complex concepts and ideas to stakeholders at all levels
Confident personality to help guide and influence decision-making
Ability to balance short-term goals and long-term vision
Technically fluent
Passionate about building great user experiences
Experience with tools such as JIRA and Confluence is a plus

What We Offer You


Hands-on experience building a product that is revolutionizing the apparel & footwear market
The opportunity to become a key part of Fit Analytics' growth story
A competitive salary
A spot in our smart, creative, and highly motivated international team
Daily breakfast and lunch plus regular team events

Why We're Different

We're not sitting around wondering what the product is and burning other people's money while expecting everyone to work ridiculous hours for little reward. We're profitable, organized, and already providing a unique solution that delivers huge value to our partners while helping millions of people a month shop better online.

If you're excellent at what you do and want to apply those skills to solving a genuinely challenging problem together with a great bunch of people, you've come to the right place. To take the next step, send us your CV and a brief message explaining why you're the perfect fit!

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience

Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined

We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Your profile:
You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

Your profile:
You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:

(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).

Preferred Qualifications:
