This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

We’re looking for an experienced Product Manager who loves agile software development. Help us move faster and craft an awesome user experience for existing and new customers alike.
If you’re a pragmatic self-starter and love a challenge, if you enjoy working with smart and opinionated people, then this is for you!
What you’ll do
We’re a company of 35 smart and opinionated people, we have 700+ paying customers, and want to grow. Help us build great functionality that inspires prospects and keeps customers happy! You will be in charge of the following:
Contribute to the product vision and strategy together with the VP of Product
Gather input from across the company, and interview customers and prospects and users in our target market
Manage the backlog and discovery pipeline
Work closely with our data analyst to really understand feature usage and patterns
Collaborate with the Design Team during the wireframes/prototypes/mockup phases and test them with clients and target market test users
Work closely with developers to ensure they have the level of detail they need to solve the user problem in the right way
Communicate across the organization on progress, clarify in-depth questions, and keep everyone in the loop
Launch (and sunset) features together with marketing and support
Keep up with the HR Tech market and how we stack up against competitors
Our cross-functional dev-teams plus the design-team typically work on many features or improvements in parallel on both the discovery/experiment side as well as implementation. Every project can be different, but most likely you’ll be heavily involved in many of these at any given time, and you’ll have a chance to contribute to others too.
Who we’re looking for
We believe that the following traits will be beneficial:
You love to approach things incrementally, understanding that it is important to validate assumptions and invest accordingly
You’re analytical and really thrive when designing complex features and workflows
You routinely consider the business impact of decisions — ROI and MRR are just as central to you as customer satisfaction.
You are very interested in the topic of how organizations can work better, and how feedback and reflection can promote energizing work cultures
You’re an optimist and make things happen!
We expect you to have a strong background in building complex software the agile way:
You have at least three years of “core” product management experience on advanced web-based applications
You’ve made major contributions to at least two different products
You’re used to working in small companies or startups where individual impact really matters
You have plenty of experience collaborating directly with developers and customers
You are a creative problem solver understanding there is never just one solution
Experience working in B2B settings would be a huge plus
We’re serious about our open and tolerant company culture, and we value diversity. We’re looking for friendly and bright people who can develop a great product without developing a huge ego.
More reasons to work at SI
We’re self-funded — our only “investors” are our amazing customers who have helped us grow our customer base largely through word of mouth.
We balance life at work with life outside of work, and we don’t believe in overtime. If you want to work from home one day a week or a few weeks a year, that’s fine too.
We’re serious about our open and tolerant company culture, and we believe diversity makes our culture and our product better.
We invest in our people. You’ll get a learning & development budget, days off for attending conferences, and if you like, we’ll support you in learning German.
We want to do well by doing good, so we turn down dodgy clients and donate 2% of our profits to charity.
Our office near Hackescher Markt is stylish yet cozy, and it has has plenty of doors to reduce distractions to a minimum. Take an office tour.
There are free snacks, fresh fruit, juices, tea and lemonades, you can make your own lattes with our amazing coffee machine, and we never run out of Club Mate.
We care about our employees’ happiness. Check out Glassdoor to learn more about how it’s like to work here!
And we love to travel! Check out our last company trip:
Apply now!
Interested in the position? We’d love to learn more about you! Don’t spend too much time tuning and adjusting your CV — your LinkedIn or Xing profile will be sufficient. We care a lot more about a friendly cover-letter that explains why you’d be a good fit for this role at Small Improvements, and the impact you had and what you learned in your previous company or projects.

At HelloFresh, our mission is to change the way people eat - forever. From our 2011 founding in Europe's vibrant tech hub Berlin, we've become the global market leader in the meal kit sector and inspire millions of energised home cooks across the globe every week.

We offer our meal kit boxes full of exciting recipes and thoughtfully sourced, fresh ingredients in more than 12 countries, operating from offices in Berlin, New York City, Sydney, Toronto, London, Amsterdam and Copenhagen and shipped out more than 250 Million meals in 2019.

Our more than 5,000 employees are the heart and soul of our highly international, fast-paced, and dynamic environment where innovation and smart, fast action is encouraged. We want you to join us and help take HelloFresh to the next level - as a company in its growth phase this is a great time to join. Career and development opportunities are endless.

We will encourage you to make an immediate impact in your area of work as well as empower you to grow your career with us.

-------------
About the job
-------------


As part of our Berlin-based Marketing Business Intelligence team, you will be responsible for availability and reliability of dashboards to deliver detailed insights into our customer behaviour and business performance to enable data-driven strategic decision making across 10+ countries world-wide
Further improve and design our Marketing BI cloud architecture to support reporting and visualizations using Tableau
You will develop and maintain ETL processes and data models
Proactively identify gaps in data usage and define processes to complete them
Document all releases and versions of our system according to requirements
Organize users and permissions in Tableau and databases
You will not only take responsibility for data integrity, but also be a project leader and team player to collaborate and share knowledge with the BI analysts
Maintain documentation on new data sources, intermediate structures, and how best to access data

----------------------
Who we're looking for?
----------------------


5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence/ Analytics/ Data Science
2+ years of experience in e-commerce
Graduated from a top-tier university with an excellent academic record in a business or MINT/STEM and/or previous internship experiences in business intelligence, management consulting, tech-start-ups, supply chain management or other relevant areas
You are a very experienced SQL and Python coder and you are keen on learning more on the technical side
You are experienced with cloud platform services such as Google Cloud Platform and AWS
You are experienced with data modeling and data warehousing solutions
Experience with GitHub and automation software (Jenkins, Airflow) is a big plus
Demonstrable past experience with Agile methodologies, with a strong focus on data-driven experimentation, lean thinking, and quick iterations
You enjoy making a direct business impact on our marketing efficiency

-------------
What we offer
-------------


The chance to have a serious impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase
A guaranteed steep learning curve & a boost for your career
Competitive compensation with annual budget for training and development
A vibrant international environment
Work in our office located in the heart of Berlin
Windows or Apple equipment (depending on preference)
Sabbatical policy
A range of additional perks (significant reduction on your HelloFresh boxes, weekly allowance for HelloFresh GO vending machines, budget for German classes, discounts for our neighbouring Fitness Studio & Urban Sports Club, weekly Yoga Classes, Friday Beers, Summer & Winter parties, daily fruits in the office)

---------------------------
Are you up for a challenge?
---------------------------

Please submit your complete application below including your earliest starting date and salary expectation.

Weber Shandwick ist eine international führende Kommunikationsagentur für Marken, Unternehmen und Organisationen in allen wichtigen Märkten der Welt. Durch ein vielfältiges und spezialisiertes Team kann die Agentur auf zahlreiche Auszeichnungen für innovative und kreative Kampagnen blicken. So wurde Weber Shandwick 2019 von der Ad Age für „Best Places to Work“ ausgezeichnet und ist die einzige PR-Agentur, die es 2017 und 2018 auf die Ad Age A-List „Agency Standout“ schaffte.Mit datengestützten, einzigartigen Ideen im Mittelpunkt und einem vielseitigen Team aus Strategen, Analysten, Technologen und Kreativen, gestaltet die Agentur integrierte Kampagnen, die mehr können als Aufmerksamkeit zu generieren – sie ermöglichen Interaktionen, die einen nachhaltigen Impact für unsere Kunden schaffen.An den deutschen Standorten Berlin, Frankfurt, Köln und München bietet Weber Shandwick strategische Beratung, Planung und die Umsetzung integrierter Kommunikationsdienstleistungen in den zentralen Geschäftsbereichen Brand- und B2B-Marketing, Healthcare, Change Management, Employee Engagement, Corporate Reputation, Krisenkommunikation, Data & Analytics, Technology, Public Affairs, Social Impact sowie Finance-Kommunikation. Weber Shandwick gehört zur Interpublic Group (NYSE: IPG).Du bist kreativ und verfolgst Trendthemen rund um das Thema Design? Du genießt gerne gestalterische Freiheiten? Du arbeitest gerne cross-medial und kennst die Anforderungen der unterschiedlichen Medienkanäle und kannst sie inhaltlich wie auch technisch aufbereiten? Dann müssen wir uns unbedingt kennenlernen!Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Berlin suchen wir Dich zum 01.04.2020 alsWerkstudent für den Bereich Grafikdesign (w/m/d)DEINE AUFGABEN – DU …unterstützt unser Kreativteam und erarbeitest gemeinsam ideenstarke und visuell anspruchsvolle Lösungenerstellst nicht nur ansprechende Designs, sondern bist auch in die Konzeptentwicklung und in Brainstormings involvierterhältst also Einblicke vom Konzeptionsprozess bis hin zu der finalen Kampagne und kannst diese mit deinen Ideen und Engagement zum Leben erweckenDEIN PROFIL – DU … studierst im Bereich Grafik-/Kommunikationsdesign oder einen vergleichbaren Studiengangsuchst idealerweise ein 6-monatiges Pflichtpraktikum während deines Studiums oder alternativ ein freiwilliges Praktikum für 3 Monateverfügst über visuelles Gespür für Design und Ästhetik sowie über ein sehr gutes Gefühl für Sprachebringst im besten Fall erste Erfahrung im Arbeiten mit der Adobe Creative Suite mitbist kommunikativ, engagiert und kannst sowohl im Team als auch selbstständig verantwortungsbewusst arbeitenUNSER ANGEBOT – WIR …bieten dir einen spannenden Blick hinter die Kulissen einer global aufgestellten und innovativen Kommunikationsagenturgeben dir die Möglichkeit, viele eigene Erfahrungen im Bereich Design und Konzeption zu sammeln und an unterschiedlichsten Projekten mitzuwirkenbieten dir ein professionelles und strukturiertes Onboarding – von Beginn an steht dir ein persönlicher Mentor für alle organisatorischen und fachlichen Fragen zur Verfügungsorgen für frisches Obst, endlos Kaffee und Mitarbeiterrabatte bei ausgewählten Shopping-Partnernfolgen den Grundsätze von Fair CompanyKlingt das spannend? Dann werde Teil unseres Erfolges als Werkstudent für den Bereich Grafikdesign (w/m/d)! Wir freuen uns auf deine vollständige Bewerbung (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf und Portfolio) mit Angabe deines frühestmöglichen Starttermins und der gewünschten Praktikumsdauer per Email.Du willst mehr über uns oder die oben genannte Position erfahren?Einfach anrufen: deine Ansprechpartnerin ist Lisa Döcke (030 2035 10).Zusätzliche Leistungen:Flexible ArbeitszeitenArt der Stelle: Vollzeit, Minijob

job_title: Account/ Client Success Manager Southern Europe (m/w/d)
full_text:
Fit Analytics ( http://www.fitanalytics.com/ ) — the world's leading sizing solution for apparel & footwear and one of the fastest growing tech companies in Berlin — is seeking a highly motivated, driven Client Partner based in Berlin. If you're passionate about building strategic relationships with clients, we want to hear from you!

Who We Are

Based in Berlin and Chicago, we're a team of data scientists, fashionistas, physicists, business analysts, designers, and hackers, working together to tackle a single problem: making it easy for online shoppers to find the right clothes size. We help some of the world's largest clothing brands solve sizing issues, boost conversions and slash returns.

What We Do

The Fit Analytics' platform combines the world's largest database of garment and fit information with hundreds of billions of purchase records and consumer preferences. Our products Fit Finder, Fit Connect, Fit Intelligence and Fit Source help clothing and apparel companies instantly access the power of machine learning to deliver a perfect fit for customers. By applying the power of machine learning to this unique data set, we've created a range of innovative solutions to help drive improvements throughout the apparel lifecycle from manufacturing to marketing. Leading apparel brands and retailers across six continents trust our platform to solve sizing at scale and deliver meaningful bottom-line impact. Our clients include the likes of Zara, Asos, Hugo Boss, JD Sports, Bershka, The North Face, Tommy Hilfiger, Uniqlo, Calvin Klein and many more!

What The Role Involves


Building strong and close relationships with key stakeholders and decision-makers among our clients
Driving retention and growth among our client base by understanding their business needs and helping them succeed
Providing insights and best practices to clients in order to ensure that they get the most out of our platform
Delivering and communicating ROI for our clients throughout the entire client lifecycle
Collaborating closely with internal stakeholders to manage contract renewals successfully and to explore expansion opportunities
Identifying and managing up-sell or cross-sell opportunities of services and products
Shaping and driving our internal strategic goals to keep our client churn rate at zero

What We're Looking for in You


Proven track record (4+ years) in client success, relationship, account management, or similar role
Proficient language skills in English and Spanish is required, other languages (FR, IT) are a plus
Experience in working with large and complex enterprise clients
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into insights
Experience in building and maintaining relationships, while working to mitigate churn and drive engagement and renewals
Experience in sales (up-selling and cross-selling experience is an advantage)
Results-driven and hands-on mentality
Thorough with a keen eye for detail
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
Driven, self-motivated, enthusiastic and with a "can do" attitude

What We Offer You


A competitive salary
Hands-on experience building a product that is revolutionizing the apparel & footwear market
A spot in our smart, creative and highly motivated international team
Daily breakfast and lunch plus regular team events

Why We're Different

We're not sitting around wondering what the product is and burning other people's money while expecting everyone to work ridiculous hours for little reward. We're profitable, organized, and already providing a unique solution that delivers huge value to our partners while helping millions of people a month shop better online.

If you're excellent at what you do and want to apply those skills to solving a genuinely hard problem together with a great bunch of people, you've come to the right place. To take the next step, send us your CV and a brief message explaining why you're the perfect fit!

As the Program Manager Data Education at Zalando Offprice, you will be responsible for the design and implementation of business unit wide upskilling initiatives related to data literacy for our workforce of ~500 FTEs. Existing education programs include our Data Analyst Trainee Programme (aimed at recent graduates) and our forthcoming Offprice Data Academy (catering to existing colleagues). These programs play a central role in our strategic objective to enable colleagues to turn data into a core driver of business value.

------------------------------
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
------------------------------


Lead and drive our data education programs end-to-end, from defining the structure and learning objectives, implementation and evaluation to ensure successful learning outcomes
Handle organizational and operational tasks to keep the program running
Recruit and onboard trainers, jumping in as a trainer yourself when necessary. Enable experts to share their knowledge effectively (Didactics)
Design and implement other knowledge-sharing formats for the Offprice data community, such as our bi-monthly analytics breakfast

----------------------------
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
----------------------------


University degree (preferably in the field of Education) coupled with a fluency in standard office tools (Word, Powerpoint, Excel, email, etc.)
Proven track record of creating successful learning programs at scale. Hands-on experience carrying out all activities in the training life cycle: Design, Delivery, Evaluation
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. German is a plus
Keen ability to drive understanding and enable others to do so, leveraging the right tools wherever necessary (e.g. visual aids, specialized learning formats, etc.). Familiarity with best practices and the theory behind different teaching methods

-------------
PERKS AT WORK
-------------


A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

--------------------
ABOUT ZALANDO LOUNGE
--------------------

Zalando Lounge is an online shopping club for fashion and lifestyle products in 14 European countries. We offer our members daily, time-limited sale campaigns with discounts of up to 75% off the recommended retail price. However, Zalando Lounge is so much more than discounts. Our strength lies in our focus on fashion: from sought-after labels to niche brands, from famous international names to trendy luxury brands, we make sure to meet the fashion taste of all our customers, who are always on the hunt for the best products at the best prices. Working with our brand partners, we're pioneering innovative supply-chain and production processes and offer them an impactful and smart solution, creating a new way to shop for fashion - and a new way to sell it.

https://www.zalando-lounge.de ( https://www.zalando-lounge.de/ )

Company Intro & Mission
---------------------------

As one of the most successful and fast-growing FinTech startup companies in Europe, we are currently experiencing exciting growth and development. We are revolutionising the way people file their taxes; helping them to save money, time and stress by putting a personalised digital tax consultant into the palm of their hands. Our user-friendly Taxfix App enables people to file their tax declaration within 22 minutes on average, without any prior tax knowledge or the complicated forms associated with it.

Our offices in Berlin and Madrid are home to a diverse team of 200+ people who come from more than 40 nations around the world!

Country Manager - Italy (m/w/d), this is your challenge
-------------------------------------------------------

As a Product Lead for Italy, your mission will be to help people get the maximum return from their tax submissions.

Your mission will be to create a compelling product value proposition for the users in your market. Then you'll partner with product teams, tax experts, user researchers, designers, and product analysts to deliver that value proposition.

You bring a strong track record in product discovery and are comfortable working with user researchers to uncover the most pressing needs of our customers. At the same time, you have a strong business acumen and can lead market estimations and discussions with market partners.

Your responsibilities
---------------------


Own the P&L and product KPIs of your market. You evangelise and guard our business targets.
Shape up the Italian product strategy through continuous user research, market sizing, and feasibility analysis.
Keep the product roadmap in sync with our Italian market strategy while building alignment across product teams and stakeholders.
Collaborate with product teams to design & build solutions that meet customer needs and market constraints identified by your team during the discovery process.
Ensure successful go-to-market of product features by partnering with customer success, marketing, operations, legal, and other teams.

We're a fit if you bring these qualities with you
-------------------------------------------------


5+ years of experience in a product or business management role, with experience on digital consumer products.
Strong leadership skills with the ability to lead and inspire the whole organisation by providing a vision, context and clarity built on strong customer and market research.
Strategic business acumen with a proven track record launching and growing products while being accountable for their P&L, competitive analysis, market sizing, etc.
Entrepreneurial mindset with solid business development attitude. You build a close relationship with our market partners, advisors, and authorities.
You are an outstanding project manager capable of planning and executing complex projects across product teams, and business functions, and keeping the management team always up to date on market developments.
You are a data person. Your decisions and impact is measured against data and facts. However, you value and know when to deploy qualitative user research methods.
Excellent communication skills in English and Italian.

What's in it for you?
---------------------

Of course, we offer you all the perks you would expect from a tech startup that you can check out here ( https://taxfix.de/en/careers/ ). Additionally this role also offers:


Be supported in your personal and professional development by an experienced team and take leadership from day one.
Opportunity to take leadership from day one.
Get relocation and visa support
A beautiful office located near to Alexanderplatz.

We're proudly committed to equal employment opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability or place of origin. We care about one another at Taxfix and are grateful for each person's individual contribution to our overall identity, purpose, and goals.

We are looking for a creative mind who likes to jump on new projects, creates exciting content around meditation, mindfulness and stress science.

You support our UX design and marketing team
You will be writing in-app content as well as website content
You will gain

insight into internet startup
learn day-to-day management
build functional expertise in digital healthcare
What is it like to work @Kenkou?

We are a diverse tribe of App Developers, UX Experts, Bioinformatics, Industrial Designers, Doctors, and other Health Specialists. And together we are on a pursuit to disrupt the health industry.

Our office is located in a modern coworking space in Berlin Mitte. All our employees benefit from free drinks, snacks, fresh fruits, coffee, tea, and an easygoing company culture.

The Kenkou Team

A group of open minded App Developers, Designers, Electronic Engineers, Business Analysts and Marketing Experts with an interest in data driven approaches.

Room to grow

Fit Analytics ( http://www.fitanalytics.com/ ) — the world's leading size advisor solution for online clothes shopping — is looking for a motivated full-time Back-end Developer - Golang (m/f/d). You will work with the largest and most extensive data set in the industry to help ensure accuracy in clothing and apparel fit prediction. If you're passionate about writing correct, elegant, flexible and performant code and ready to use your skills to shape the future of the online fashion industry, we want to hear from you!

-------------------------------------------------
What The Backend Developer (Golang) Role Involves
-------------------------------------------------


Designing, implementing and improving back-end code
Deploying the code to our infrastructure (Google Cloud, Kubernetes)
Developing tools for monitoring, ensuring that the problems promptly detected and fixed (Prometheus, InfluxDB, Grafana)
Developing tools to control our Google Cloud-based infrastructure

-----------------------------
What We're Looking for in You
-----------------------------


5+ years of relevant industry experience
Ability to write clean and robost code in Go / Golang
Knowledge of software design principles
Comfortable working in Linux environment
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Fluency in English

-----------------
What We Offer You
-----------------


Hands-on experience building a product that is revolutionizing the apparel & footwear market
The opportunity to become a key part of Fit Analytics' growth story
A competitive salary
A spot in our smart, creative and highly motivated international team
Daily breakfast and lunch plus regular team events

------

------

----------
Who We Are
----------

Based in Berlin and Chicago, we're a team of data scientists, fashionistas, physicists, business analysts, designers, and hackers, working together to tackle a single problem: making it easy for online shoppers to find the right clothes size. We help some of the world's largest clothing brands solve sizing issues, boost conversions and slash returns.

----------
What We Do
----------

The Fit Analytics' platform ( https://www.fitanalytics.com/platform ) combines the world's largest database of garment and fit information with hundreds of billions of purchase records and consumer preferences. Our products Fit Finder ( https://www.fitanalytics.com/fit-finder ), Fit Connect ( https://www.fitanalytics.com/fit-connect ), Fit Intelligence ( https://www.fitanalytics.com/fit-intelligence ) and Fit Source ( https://www.fitanalytics.com/fit-source ) help clothing and apparel companies instantly access the power of machine learning to deliver a perfect fit for customers. By applying the power of machine learning to this unique data set, we've created a range of innovative solutions to help drive improvements throughout the apparel lifecycle from manufacturing to marketing. Leading apparel brands and retailers across six continents trust our platform to solve sizing at scale and deliver meaningful bottom-line impact. Our clients include the likes of Zara, Asos, Hugo Boss, JD Sports, Bershka, The North Face, Tommy Hilfiger, Uniqlo, Calvin Klein and many more!

-------------------------
Why We're Different
-------------------------

We're not sitting around wondering what the product is and burning other people's money while expecting everyone to work ridiculous hours for little reward. We're profitable, organized, and already providing a unique solution that delivers huge value to our partners while helping millions of people a month shop better online.

If you're excellent at what you do and want to apply those skills to solving a genuinely challenging problem together with a great bunch of people, you've come to the right place. To take the next step, send us your CV and a brief message explaining why you're the perfect fit!

Why Mozilla?
------------

A lot of companies say they're "mission-driven." Our unique corporate structure guarantees that every decision we make upholds our mission: to make sure the internet stays available, safe, and welcoming to everyone. Beholden to neither shareholders nor investors, Mozilla Corporation is wholly owned by the not-for-profit Mozilla Foundation.

Along with 20,000+ volunteer contributors and collaborators all over the world, Mozilla Corporation's staff designs, builds, and distributes software that allows people to enjoy the internet on their own terms. Our flagship product — the Firefox browser — has expanded into a family of products that protects users and alerts them of risks. Mozilla's Emerging Technologies group incubated and sponsors Rust — Stack Overflow's "most loved programming language" for the last four years — and is building safe, private versions of virtual reality, internet of things, and voice recognition.

Our Team
--------

The Mozilla creative team delivers the visual and verbal expression of the Firefox brand. We craft experiences that attract interest, enlighten users, and make our products beloved. You will work with fellow brand, product, social, PR, events, and communications team members to build content and experiences that spread our story to like-minded people all over the world.

Our Moment
----------

Firefox is more than a browser: it's a whole family of products designed to help you safely navigate your relationship with technology, so you can own your data and your digital life. We've just debuted our new brand system, and are exploring new ways to deepen our relationship with users. It's an exciting time to join us as we seek to amplify our impact, fight for peoples' rights online, and help protect the internet for future generations.

About the Role
--------------

We're seeking a candidate to support brand marketing for all Firefox products.

Each day will be spent on two teams: one focused on improving peoples' perception of our brand in the EU, and the other focused on enticing people to download and use our products. On these teams, you'll work in the agile marketing method, collaborating with and learning from a diverse set of colleagues, from product managers and marketing strategists to engineers, data analysts, and designers.

Once the team decides what goals you'll tackle, you'll work sprint by sprint to accomplish them together. In your role, you'll inform the planning and briefing process, making sure the strategy for the French market is sound. You'll flex your creative skills to deliver concepts that answer the objectives, and then make those ideas a reality with your design partners. You'll also review French writing by others to ensure consistency. In doing so, you'll come to define the brand voice in French, embodying and expressing the Firefox personality: Radical, Opinionated, Open and Kind.

This role is full-time, based in Berlin, reporting to the Head of Copywriting.

Specific responsibilities include...
------------------------------------


Draft original content for Firefox that's culturally relevant, strategic and tone-appropriate for the French market — including digital advertising, email, blog and social posts, snippets, web pages, video scripts
Collaborate with Managing Editor to identify global stories that can be trans-created for France, and French stories that would work well globally
Review and edit key touchpoints written or translated by others for appropriate tone, content and intention
Collaborate with English copy team to name global products, concept campaigns, and keep an eye on the high-level marketing that might need to be adapted into French
Help evaluate and improve the process for localizing content, and execute some translation work
Develop and promote the tools that guide translation of content in French
Participate in user testing and SEO optimization for French website copy

About You
---------

You're native to the culture, with recent experience living and working in France. You know that context is content's best friend. You're passionate about the creative. You know how to present and defend your work. And you're the kind of person who's not afraid to ask questions and run down the answers — nor let a little ambiguity (or unexpected feedback) get between you and the task at hand. Talking and brainstorming is f, but there's nothing like writing your way to the answer. You're organized, proactive, self-starting, and on top of your to-do list.

Professional Profile
--------------------


7+ years experience in advertising copywriting, journalism, content creation or related field
5+ years in the technology field
Proven ability to craft marketing that improves product experience, increases user base, and brand equity
Ability to pitch work-in-progress ideas and present final work to multiple partners and draw inspiration from their feedback
Experience working collaboratively and in the open using Google documents
Self-motivated to prioritize projects, set appropriate expectations with partners, and meet project deadlines
Experience publishing your own content in a blog, on a site, or in print
Ability to write in a variety of styles with an ear for modern, conversational French
Proficient at French - English cross translation and English-to-French transliteration
Proficient in German and English

About Mozilla
-------------

Mozilla exists to build the Internet as a public resource accessible to all because we believe that open and free is better than closed and controlled. When you work at Mozilla, you give yourself a chance to make a difference in the lives of Web users everywhere. And you give us a chance to make a difference in your life every single day. Join us to work on the Web as the platform and help create more opportunity and innovation for everyone online.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race (including hairstyle and texture), religion (including religious grooming and dress practices), gender, gender identity, gender expression, color, national origin, pregnancy, ancestry, domestic partner status, disability, sexual orientation, age, genetic predisposition, medical condition, marital status, citizenship status, military or veteran status, or any other basis covered by applicable laws. We will provide reasonable accommodation to an employee or job applicant with a disability.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization

Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

Your profile:
You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings

ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience

Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings

Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. You will be leading or supporting telecoms network technology assessments, benchmarking and provider sourcing engagements with enterprise customers as they explore their telecoms networking requirements and options in this exciting period of network technology transformation.We have several roles open either for an Analyst or a (Senior) Consultant:As an Analyst you will be supportingAs a Consultant you will be leadingtransactions including discovery, solutioning, final negotiations and interaction with the client decision-makers for procurement from telecommunication companies.This key analytical position has a direct role in the data collection, analysis, reporting and modelling of clients’ telecommunications services and IT transformation initiatives both in the sales & strategy development areas as well as engagement delivery. Are you ready to be a Frontend / UI Engineer for the leading data analytics product?

You live in Berlin area?

You are ready to join one of the most innovative tech companies?

Do you get lightheaded thinking about the endless possibilities held by big data insights and collaborative data analytics? We dare you to show us your bold, fierce, passionate side; you'll feel right at home among our people!

At our Neebo team, we're data nerds through and through. We're here to consistently innovate, to build the data analytics software that's always on the bleeding edge. We're here to lead the charge in this data revolution. Care to join us?

Anna's problems are our problems:
Anna is an analyst and Anna and her colleagues are not only dealing with data. They have to do research before starting analysis and hence they have to organize dozens to hundreds of documents in any form before starting the work on ONE analytics task. These documents can be pictures, PDFs, text files, code snippets, presentations etc.

And guess what, in a short time, Anna and her colleagues generate thousands of documents. Anna's problem now is to find stuff she already did to not repeat her or others work.

We want to solve Anna's problem by building:

a visual appealing search experience and
an easy to use flow to organize and contextualize all the uploaded entities.

Therefore, we need your skills.

Helpful experience and our requirements:

4+ years industry experience working with JavaScript/ES6 (React, Redux ), HTML5 and CSS3 (LESS, others ...)
Unit, Integration & End-to-End Tests (Jest, React Testing Library)
Build tools/pipeline (Webpack, Babel)
Version Control Systems (Git, GitHub)
Experience collaborating with design and UX teams
Experience integrating backend services using REST
You've built and maintained medium-to-large scale front-end web applications
Passion for creating a high impact quality experience for users with a focus on usability, simplicity & efficiency
Ability to work and thrive in an environment of continuous improvement, learning and mastery of new technologies and techniques
Strong communication and self-management skills
Experience with Agile development, working as part of a team and excellent interpersonal skills

About us

We aren't your average Engineering team, that's why we're looking for somebody who likes pushing the limits of what's possible and delivering amazing features to our customers day after day. We are a fast paced, collaborative, kickass team that is always trying to find ways to blow our customer's minds. If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you.

We are a well-funded, global software company headquartered in San Francisco with global offices across Europe backed by top tier investors including KPCB, Redpoint Ventures, and Next World Capital among others. Our customers include who's who of the fortune 100 and the list is growing!

We have a history of continued innovation since 2010, serving the fortune 100 providing an enterprise grade platform enabling trusted data-driven insights anywhere. Datameer's advanced data preparation, exploration and governance functionality makes it easy to transform big data into curated data sets to feed any analytics initiative. Using a hybrid architecture that spans on-premise and the cloud, Datameer helps organizations deliver new insights in days and operationalize them immediately, increasing agility and responsiveness of the analytics that drive the business.

We recently introduced our latest innovation in analytics - Neebo - 'The Virtual Analytics Hub' - a powerful cloud solution designed to enable teams of analysts and data scientists to perform analyses on complex and disparate data landscapes. With Neebo, teams can now, at the click of a mouse without coding, find, create and collaborate on complex data sets and drive insights from their data faster than ever.


We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

**Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: Datameer does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Datameer will not pay fees to any third party recruitment agency or firm in the absence of a signed agreement and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of Datameer.

JOIN is a unique opportunity to get on board with a high-growth startup based out of the heart of Berlin with a fantastic product and an experienced and dedicated leadership team. JOIN.com represents the future of recruiting, empowering you to more efficiently find and hire your dream candidates when you need them. With key features such as job page creation, automatic cross channel multi-posting as well as applicant management, JOIN.com accelerates and simplifies the recruiting process, whilst massively reducing costs at the same time. With thousands of corporate clients across Europe and globally and tens of thousands of candidates trusting the product as well as substantial funding, JOIN.com is in an exceptional position to conquer the HR Tech world by storm.

You are the only missing piece in the puzzle: JOIN simply. Simply JOIN.

Be a pivotal driver to JOIN’s hypergrowth and become part of our success story as a

Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

Tasks


Driving forward the strategic vision and internal projects
Prioritizing and taking responsibility for data analysis and forecasting, modeling and simulation projects to take JOIN to the next level
Being responsible for data acquisition and data management and evaluating this data in order to offer concrete recommendations in the areas of sales, marketing and product
Designing the digital business intelligence roadmap and developing standards for analytics, reports and dashboards that enable data-driven decision-making
Analyzing of existing approaches for further development of JOIN and implementation of necessary changes as well as optimization of company-wide processes

Requirements


You have successfully completed a degree in the fields of Business Informatics, Industrial Engineering, Business Administration or similar fields with a strong quantitative focus
You have a few years of professional experience in the area of Business Intelligence in fast-moving, performance-oriented companies as well as a good understanding of web technology
You are an expert in handling tracking and analysis tools such as Tag Manager and BigQuery, Mixpanel, Heap, Mode Analytics or Tableau and experience with the application fields of Machine Learning
You have an entrepreneurial mindset, a hands-on mentality and great teamwork abilities
You ideally have leadership experience, very good communication skills and a solution- and customer-oriented way of working
You are fluent in English and German (spoken and written)

Benefits


A strong involvement and the opportunity to bring yourself and your ideas throughout the company and thus help shape product and customer developments
A diverse and highly motivated team in a dynamic environment
Start-up feeling, flat hierarchies, short decision-making paths and an inspiring international working atmosphere
Challenging tasks in our office in the heart of Berlin Mitte
The unique opportunity to help shape the revolution in recruiting at JOIN from an early stage

INTERESTED?

If you would like to be part of our success story, we look forward to receiving your application (letter of motivation, CV, certificates), including entry date and salary expectations!

job_title: Senior Data Analyst Marketing Intelligence - Zalando Lounge
full_text:
As part of Demand Analytics, the Marketing Intelligence Team focuses on monitoring and analyzing the performance of our online and offline marketing. Using all available information and directly collaborating with many other teams across the business we assess the value of each marketing campaign to create a short and long term marketing strategy.

As a Senior Data Analyst Marketing Intelligence, you will play a key role in improving the effectiveness of our marketing processes and support data driven decision making by providing meaningful data analyses to our Lounge Demand organization.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED


Drive the development of core areas such as: marketing attribution, budgeting, forecasting and A/B testing, which have a direct impact on the daily business and the long term development of the Zalando Lounge.
Use state of the art methods and keep up with new innovations in the area of marketing and analytics. You will look for new ways to improve our current reporting and analytics landscape.
Develop existing and implement new steering KPIs to continuously improve marketing strategies.
Work closely together with our Lifecycle, Marketing and other Demand Analytics Teams to enable data driven decision making.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


Academic degree in an analytical subject, e.g. economics, business analysis, statistics, mathematics, marketing or its' equivalent.
Experience in a relevant field: ideally at least 5 years in a similar analytical context with comparable questions, e.g. in marketing intelligence and data analytics, as well working and interacting with senior stakeholders.
Deep understanding of Marketing and statistical methods (e.g. databases and data structures, statistical data analysis); Must have good knowledge of SQL and experience with R or Python.
Additional expertise with visualization tools like Tableau and experience with A/B testing is a plus.
Your work showcases your quick thinking and proactive attitude, which also means you keep on top of things in a fast-paced & changing environment. You are able to easily adapt to change and work independently.

PERKS AT WORK


Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source ( https://opensource.zalando.com/ ) commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs ( https://jobs.zalando.com/tech/blog/ ), product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO LOUNGE

Zalando Lounge is an online shopping club for fashion and lifestyle products in 14 European countries. We offer our members daily, time-limited sale campaigns with discounts of up to 75% off the recommended retail price. However, Zalando Lounge is so much more than discounts. Our strength lies in our focus on fashion: from sought-after labels to niche brands, from famous international names to trendy luxury brands, we make sure to meet the fashion taste of all our customers, who are always on the hunt for the best products at the best prices. Working with our brand partners, we're pioneering innovative supply-chain and production processes and offer them an impactful and smart solution, creating a new way to shop for fashion - and a new way to sell.

Unser Versprechen: idealo Nutzer*innen finden über die gesamte Geräte-Journey hinweg immer das beste Angebot und können ihr Produkt inkl. Preisvergleich auch direkt über idealo auf jedem Gerät kaufen. Damit wir allen Bedürfnissen gerecht werden, freuen wir uns auf Dich als Unterstützung im UX-Design-Team! Gemeinsam mit Product Owner, Entwicklern und einem Data Analysten betreust Du die Android und iOS Shopping App von idealo.

Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil eines agilen Teams erstellst Du Interaktionskonzepte und visuelle Designs für unsere idealo Shopping Apps
In Abstimmung mit dem Product Owner, Deinem Team und weiteren Stakeholdern bringst Du Business-Anforderungen mit Nutzererwartungen in Übereinstimmung und entwickelst daraus intuitiv nutzbare Bedienkonzepte
Darüber hinaus erarbeitest Du interaktive Prototypen, unterstützt die Research-Kolleg*innen bei Nutzertests und finalisiert die UI auf Basis bestehender Guidelines
Du arbeitest kontinuierlich an der Weiterentwicklung des Design-Systems für unsere Apps
Du gestaltest die Team- wie auch die Gesamtstrategie proaktiv mit

Das bringst Du mit
Du hast mindestens 3-4 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung in der Konzeption von Webseiten, E-Commerce-Plattformen oder Web/Mobile Applications
Du verfügst über ein umfangreiches Wissen in den Bereichen User Experience, Usability und visuelles Design
Du bist vertraut mit Tools wie Sketch, Figma, Invision, Zeplin oder Principle
Du hast Erfahrung mit Usability-Tests und kannst auch hier bei der Durchführung unterstützen
Du bist vertraut mit agiler Projektsoftware (z.B. Confluence oder Jira)
Du bist ein leidenschaftlicher Gestalter
Für eine gute Zusammenarbeit in unserem internationalen Team bringst Du außerdem sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse mit
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Fach- oder Führungskarriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding-Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
Über 800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, betriebseigene Kita und ein cooler Büro-Loft-Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter*innen aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.
Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen Dich so, wie Du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.

That's us:

TD Reply is an innovation and marketing consultancy and part of the Reply Group. We take a data-driven and execution-oriented approach to drive organizational change through meaningful insights. In our Berlin and Beijing offices we are around 90 thinkers, developers, analysts, designers, consultants, visualizers, futurologists and organizers. We are working with international premium brands such as Adidas, BMW, Coca-Cola, Telefonica and Miele to optimize their marketing. For our team in Berlin we are looking for a working student in the field of Social Media.

Your tasks will include:

Editing and proofreading PR articles and marketing texts
Editing Social Media Posts
Copywriting for our websites
Maintaining PR and Social Media editorial calendars

There’s a match if you …

have excellent writing skills, this is the most important requirement and some work samples, ideally journalistic articles, that prove your skills
are a native speaker in either German and English and skilled on a native level in both
are studying Journalism, Public Relations, Area Studies, or or a comparable field of study
have already gained first experience in journalism, social media editing, public relations, or comparable
have an affinity towards techonological topics like AI, Data-Driven Marketing, Business Intelligence
are an enthusiastic social media user and have already experience in the creation of social media content
Thorough, accurate work with an eye for detail completes your profile

That’s in it for you

You will collaborate with an experienced and enthusiastic team with a lot of ideas, great and challenging clients and highly diverse projects. Berlin Mitte and Hackescher Markt are at your feet. Be part of an awesome work environment and a team that warmly welcome you. Have open discussions during a drink on our roof terrace, enjoy daily lunches with the team or challenge your colleagues to a kicker match.


Application


We want to hire you!

OK, to be totally honest, we should qualify that statement: If you’re talented, hard working, smart, brave, innovative, humble, confident, nice and love working in a data driven industry, then we want to hire you.

Interested?

Please submit 3 writing samples, ideally some in German and some in English, your resume and earliest start date to our REPLY Recruiters here.

Ecosia, the search engine that plants trees, is one of the world's leading social businesses and the first B Corporation in Germany. As part of our mission to cultivate a more environmentally, socially and economically sustainable world, we want to reverse the tide of deforestation by planting a billion native trees. So far our 15 million users have planted over 80 million trees. Our reach is expanding in all means and we are growing and planting worldwide.
We're looking for a passionate Product Manager to join us in Berlin. Do you want to take ownership of our mobile products which are used by millions of people around the world, join a unique workplace and be part of reforesting the planet?

Tasks


As the Product Manager / Product Owner of a cross-functional product team you make sure it has all the conditions to be successful, enabling it to continuously execute and ship, evaluate, learn and grow.
Lead the discovery, development and release of innovative features and products through collaboration with stakeholders across the organization (that includes developers, designers, analysts, marketers and leadership).
Enable your team to design and optimize robust software, that can guarantee the highest quality, uptime and scalability for millions of users.
Take strategic ownership of our mobile apps, covering topics across the whole user journey from user acquisition and onboarding to long-term retention and monetization.
Keep learning new things, stay open minded and look to the broader industry for inspiration and partnerships.

Requirements


You have several years of relevant work experience as a Product Manager where you have continuously added value to digital products, ideally consumer facing with an international userbase.
Your heart is beating for our users and our cause, you connect with our core values and the way we work.
You’re always looking for opportunities to learn and you love to teach yourself and others new things.
You have demonstrated the ability to make strategic decisions and move a team forward confidently under ambiguity.
You have a solid technical understanding, an eye for a good user experience and you have worked on native mobile apps in the iOS and Android ecosystems before, allowing you to trust and empower skilled specialists to create great outcomes.
You are a good communicator, listening and expressing your thoughts and you can adjust your communication style to the people and the situation around you.
Fluent spoken and written English (German not required).

Benefits

Work for a purpose!


Instead of working for an additional million to your CEO’s annual bonus, you'll add millions of trees for the planet you live on
Your work will be used daily by millions of people across the globe
Eco-activism is not expected, but fully supported by the company

Grow your expertise!


Become a member of a diverse, highly-skilled, multi-functional team that’s eager to collaborate and change the world
Opportunities and support for you to advance your professional growth like monthly learning days, hack days and free book policy
Entrepreneurial environment open for your ideas and initiatives

Balance work with other sides of your life!


Outstanding flexibility in terms of working hours and location
Two no-meeting days per week, open for periods of remote work
30 vacation days

Get compensated well and fairly!


A fair compensation package that reflects your skills and experience
Subsidized public transport ticket, gym membership or your green-electricity bill
More perks like weekly team breakfasts, free vegetarian/vegan snacks, and drinks

We recognize that you may need further development in some areas, and we encourage you to apply even if your profile does not meet all of the requirements for the role.
All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical disability or length of time spent unemployed.

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
