We have loved SEO since our inception in 2000 and analyzing SEO data is at the heart of what we do.

If you love pulling data from all kinds of sources to make better decisions, and like to be part of the movement to make SEO more data driven, predictable and testable, come join the idealo SEO team at idealo!


Your Tasks
You are in charge of combining data from multiple data sources (Data Lake, MySQL databases) for analysis and reporting to enable data driven decision making
As SEO Analyst you are responsible for creating and maintaining a library of dashboards with Tableau, Google Analytics & Data Studio to monitor important KPIs for the SEO team
You play a key role in supporting the SEO team with A/B testing to ensure meaningful insights
As a part of the marketing team at idealo, you also collaborate with data analysts across the Marketing department and channels to align on marketing-wide targets and data management topics
Based on your analysis, you will be able to derive and represent recommendations for action and develop self-explanatory, thus meaningful dashboards
Stellenanforderungen
Your Profile
You feel comfortable working with data analytics and tracking tools (i.e. Google Analytics, Data Studio, Tableau)
You have professional experience using SQL and are not intimidated working with programming languages (i.e. Python)
You possess a strong analytical mindset, a passion for working with data and statistics
You are interested in online marketing + e-commerce trends; a background in SEO would be ideal
You are a passionate team player and enjoy supporting other team members with your data driven approach
Excellent communication skills in English, both oral and written; German is nice to have
Your benefits at idealo

No room for stagnancy! Whether tech talks, conferences or individual training, there are countless opportunities for constructive discussion and input
Influence in creating and deciding individual tasks as well as direct
contact with idealo partner
Various idealo benefits to satisfy every heart's desire, ranging from organic breakfasts to bikes that
can be rented during the lunch break
With countless opportunities for team building such as team events and parties at Christmas and in
summer, you'll be able to strengthen team spirit as well as the professional development of your department
About idealo

idealo is a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Right in the heart of Berlin, over 800 employees from 40 nations are working on the future of online shopping. We focussing on agile and self-reliant work, sustainability and a healthy relationship between work and private life. These values are firmly anchored in our corporate culture and an integral part of our corporate philosophy.

As part of our team, you can look forward to freedom, an international and inspiring working environment. Your ideas are particularly important to us. Not only our product portfolio is diverse, but also the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation or a severely handicapped degree do not play a role.

Factorymarket ist ein schnellwachsendes, international tätiges Tech Unternehmen mit Hauptsitz in Berlin
Unser Fokus liegt auf der Vernetzung von Online Marktplätzen und stationärem Handel im Zuge unserer Omnichannel Strategie (einschließlich entsprechender Software Entwicklung)
Für unser Data Team suchen wir am Standort Berlin HQ ab sofort DICH als Data Analyst (m/w/d)

Tasks


Du erarbeitest Konzepte und Anforderungen eigenständig und verantwortungsvoll
Du bist Teil eines Scrum-Teams und wirkst durch aktive Teilnahme am agilen Softwareentwicklungsprozess mit
Du unterstützt den Product Owner bei dem Management der Sprint-Vorbereitung, -Durchführung und -Nachbereitung
Du erstellst und führst Anwendertests zur Verbesserung der Nutzerfreundlichkeit unserer Software durch
Du arbeitest eng zusammen mit den Stakeholdern, dem Produkt- und dem Entwicklungs-Team
Du agierst gemeinsam mit dem Produkt-Team als Schnittstelle zu anderen Fachbereichen
Du koordinierst den internen Produkt-Support und leitest wertvolle Weiterentwicklungen ab
Du identifizierst Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten für ausgewählte Produkte und unterstützt bei der Koordinierung der erforderlichen Umsetzung

Requirements


Du kannst einen Bachelor- oder Masterabschluss mit dem Fokus Produktentwicklung vorweisen
Du konntest bereits erste Produktmanagement-Erfahrung mit agilen Methoden sammeln
Du kannst Kundenbedürfnisse in Produktanforderungen übersetzen
Du sprichst Deutsch und Englisch

Benefits


Ein lichtdurchflutetes Büro über den Dächern Berlins mit direktem Blick auf den Potsdamer und Leipziger Platz
Kostenloses Obst, Müsli, Getränke und Sandwiches
Regelmäßige Teamevents als wichtiger Bestandteil unserer Unternehmenskultur
Optimale Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten - Weiterbildung wird gefördert
Ein motiviertes, internationales und dynamisches Team mit flachen Hierarchien

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

OptioPay’s product team is looking for a Product Manager to help us generate smart personalized financial recommendations for our customers using banking data. Recommendations are important to the core of our business to help improve our customer's financial lives. You have an entrepreneurial mindset with a bias towards independent problem-solving. Clear communication and prioritization will be important as you plan, design, and deliver the best-personalized financial recommendations for our customers. Your passion for using AI and Machine Learning to improve people’s financial lives, and your experience leading complex technology projects will help you make strong business judgments.

Tasks


Develop the product roadmap and strategy for recommendations
Work closely with senior management, data analysts, and engineers to deliver highly scalable and robust recommendation products
Collaborate closely with the head of product in building consensus for the product vision both internally and externally and evangelize that vision within the organization
Plan, develop, test and implement personalized financial recommendations and track performance using relevant KPIs
Manage the delivery of current products concurrently with future product planning

Requirements


Academic degree in computer science, engineering, math, finance, or economics
 Several years of product management or finance experience in technology-focused business leaning towards recommendations and personalisation
Great communication and analytical abilities, including the expertise to solve ambiguous problems High consideration to detail and the ability to manage multiple, opposing priorities concurrently
Entrepreneurial drive, and confirmed capability to inspire others
Fluency in English

Nice-to-have qualifications:

Prior P&L ownership for a product or service
Experience delivering software products and features using agile methodologies

Benefits


Flexible working hours and home office options!
Competitive salary!

Innerhalb unserer Serviceline Operations berät die Kompetenzgruppe Maintenance & Service-Management weltweit führende nationale und internationale Industrieunternehmen bei der Analyse, Konzeption und Implementierung innovativer, praxisbezogener und umsetzbarer Lösungen im Bereich der digitalen Transformation der Instandhaltung von Maschinen sowie zugehöriger Prozesse der Anlagenbewirtschaftung.

Are you an Amazonian?

Come build the future with us! What unites all Amazonians (across teams and geographies) is that we are striving to delight our customers and make their lives easier—whoever they may be. In pursuit of delighting customers, Amazonians have developed many products and services that have transformed the way our customers live their lives and run their businesses. Together we are building the future, one innovative product, service, and idea at a time. Wherever you are in the business – whatever team, whatever level - we all work to one set of Leadership Principles that help us hire the right people and run our business in the best way. These principles are followed every single day. They are highlighted in the way we interact with each other and how we behave. They are: Customer Obsession; Ownership; Invent and Simplify; Are Right, A Lot; Learn and Be Curious; Hire and Develop the Best; Insist on the Highest Standards; Think Big; Bias for Action, Frugality; Earn Trust; Dive Deep; Have Backbone – Disagree and Commit; and Deliver Results.

About Amazon Operations

Amazon Operations sits at the heart of the Amazon customer experience. We deal with the ‘everyday experience’ of shopping on Amazon. We look after everything from the moment a customer click’s buy, to the moment that item gets delivered – from desktop to doorstep. Across Europe we have more than 50 fulfilment centres, hundreds of delivery stations, thousands of machines, and tens of thousands of employees, all working together in harmony to make sure the right item gets delivered to the right person in the right place at the right time.
At Amazon we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Amazon is one of the most recognizable brand names in the world and we distribute millions of products each year to our loyal customers.

Berlin, Germany Apparel E-Commerce fashion
Fit Analytics — the world’s leading size advisor solution for online clothes shopping — is seeking a full-time Senior Consultant – Apparel (m/f/d) for our office in Berlin to provide consulting services to our global list of fashion retail clients. If you’re ready to use your skills to shape the future of the apparel and fashion industry, we want to hear from you!

Who We Are

Based in Berlin and Chicago, we’re a team of data scientists, fashionistas, physicists, business analysts, designers, and hackers, working together to tackle a single problem: making it easy for online shoppers to find the right clothes size. We help some of the world’s largest clothing brands solve sizing issues, boost conversions and slash returns.

What We Do

The Fit Analytics’ platform combines the world’s largest database of garment and fit information with hundreds of billions of purchase records and consumer preferences. Our products Fit Finder, Fit Connect, Fit Intelligence and Fit Source help clothing and apparel companies instantly access the power of machine learning to deliver a perfect fit for customers. By applying the power of machine learning to this unique data set, we’ve created a range of innovative solutions to help drive improvements throughout the apparel lifecycle from manufacturing to marketing. Leading apparel brands and retailers across six continents trust our platform to solve sizing at scale and deliver meaningful bottom-line impact. Our clients include the likes of Zara, Asos, Hugo Boss, JD Sports, Bershka, The North Face, Tommy Hilfiger, Uniqlo, Calvin Klein and many more!

What The Role Involves

Becoming a trusted advisor to our clients (the world’s largest fashion retail brands)
Meeting with clients to understand their businesses and their pain points relating to returns, size and fit
Leveraging our data and analytics tools to synthesize actionable insights for our clients
Writing up reports, integrating findings and presenting results to clients
Working with our product teams and technical teams to help design new data products and software solutions
Helping write up industry research reports for public dissemination
Taking a thought-leadership role in the company for the returns-, size- and fit domains

What We’re Looking for in You

Deep understanding of the apparel/fashion industry (either bricks-and-mortar retail, ecommerce or wholesale channels)
Previous work experience as a product manager, brand manager, merchandising manager, buying manager or supply-chain manager at a global apparel company
Ideally, experience at a top-tier strategy consulting firm advising fashion retail clients
Data-driven approach to solving problems
Executive-level communication and presentation skills as well as ability to build strong relationships with key decision makers
Previous experience with ecommerce platforms is a an advantage
Excellent communication skills in English, German is a plus

What We Offer You

A competitive salary
The opportunity to become a key part of Fit Analytics’ growth story
Hands-on experience building a product that is revolutionizing e-commerce
A spot in our smart, creative and highly motivated international team
Daily breakfast and lunch plus regular team events

Why We’re Different

We’re not sitting around wondering what the product is and burning other people’s money while expecting everyone to work ridiculous hours for little reward. We’re profitable, organised, and already providing a unique solution that delivers huge value to our partners while helping millions of people a month shop better online.

If you’re excellent at what you do and want to apply those skills to solving a genuinely hard problem together with a great bunch of people, you’ve come to the right place. To take the next step, send us your CV and a brief message explaining why you’re the perfect fit.

That’s us

TD Reply is an innovation and marketing consultancy and part of the Reply Group. We take a data driven and execution oriented approach to drive organizational change through meaningful insights. In our Berlin and Beijing offices we are around 90 thinkers, developers, analysts, designers, consultants, visualizers, futurologists and organizers. We have customized our Smart Data solution for various of our clients, including Coca Cola, BMW, MINI, Adidas, E-Plus/Telefónica, L’Oréal, FrieslandCampina, Hyundai and AkzoNobel.

That’s you:

You see programming as an art and like to focus on important tasks that challenge your creativity. That is why you want to get rid of repetitious work through automation. DevOps and Continuous Integration are not just buzzwords, but paradigms that you embrace. And you bring a healthy amount of pragmatism since you know that each situation might need to be handled differently.

Your tasks will include:

building sophisticated analytics tools which consume and process huge sets of data points on a daily basis
develop frameworks to solve the problems we are facing in big data processing, data warehousing and data visualization technical architecture, development / deployment processes, etc.
implement solutions based on Ruby, Python, MongoDB and Elasticsearch
keep our code quality high by using concepts like TDD and unit testing
roll out solutions on cloud, e.g. AWS, leveraging their existing services
manage our infrastructure for delivering client services
promote the spirit of good coding practices, agile development, and create awareness for it
enable connectivity for our services to external data sources, e.g. via ETL/ELT pipelines

There’s a match if:

You have solid experience (3+ years) in developing applications with Ruby
You have worked with No-SQL databases like MongoDB or Elasticsearch
You know your way around Linux-based operating systems and you are familiar with AWS ecosystems
You know API development, database query optimization, performance testing
You prefer a test-driven development approach
You are always eager to look into new technologies, like working in an agile environment and being responsible for the technical design and implementation of solutions
You are a team player who likes to share, discuss and work on ideas / tasks with your colleagues
You speak English (German is a big plus)

That’s in it for you:

A startup atmosphere within an economically solid company right in the center of Berlin – with rooftop access and a stunning view
Software product development on a high level with challenging tasks
Flexible, family-friendly working hours
A competitive salary, plus: we pay for further education like conferences
Work with a like-minded team
Get an opportunity to try out new technologies
Products, projects & clients that will make you feel proud to work for

OK, to be totally honest, we should qualify that statement: If you’re talented, hard working, smart, brave, innovative, humble, confident, nice and love working in a data driven industry, then we want to hire you.

Data is one of the fastest growing disciplines at AKQA with executive support, a globally connected team, and a wide set of professional tools and data engineering capabilities. Our clients are building the future of their business and more than ever data is at the heart of making this future work.

We're looking for an Analytics Manager who is passionate about using data to drive insights and optimizations that create better connections for consumers and improve bottom line business results. Our Berlin office is in need of a lead who can bring this practical application of data to key accounts, define data projects and roadmaps for our clients, as well as get their hands on the work to deliver exceptional results.

The ideal candidate has extensive analytics and data expertise, client service / agency background, and Fortune 500 marketing analytics experience.

For the right person this role offers the chance to shine on top tier clients, impact experiences that touch millions, scope and build out a team to deliver on our vision. This role will work directly with department and account leads in Berlin, as well as the Executive Director of Data & Analytics in Europe.

ROLE REQUIREMENTS

Below are core areas we expect any applicant to be able to speak to comfortably. However, we understand that each applicant will have varying strengths in these areas. What is important is having experience or training to provide an informed POV.


Data Strategy: Ability to go from a client's business goals to a complete measurement plan that defines the metrics, systems, and methodologies needed to meet those objectives. Can see the forest for the trees and communicate coherent strategies that tie all the technical details together in executing a business-impacting program.
Client Service: Always keeping our client's success top of mind. Experience defining and launching data programs from start to finish: conception, proposal, scoping, and fulfilment. Willing to go the extra distance to ensure projects are a success means ensuring data capture is clean, analysis is thorough, and thinking is sound/relevant to the clients' business to get a report out.
Domain Aptitude: Knowledge and mastery in some of the relevant marketing analytics systems, such as web analytics (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.), A/B testing, programmatic marketing, CRM, Social, etc. Ability to guide and train new analysts, setup and configure these systems, and fully utilize these systems for insight and marketing success.
Mathematical Fluency: Familiarity with core mathematical methods, and relevant applications to marketing analytics; including statistical techniques, knowledge of data science applications, AI/machine learning use cases. Basically, a functional knowledge of when and how to apply these tools sets in a marketing science context; such as A/B and multivariate testing, personalization strategies, ad targeting, and customer clustering.
Software and Technical Knowledge: Working knowledge of common tools and software (Google 360, Adobe Marketing Cloud, etc). Such as experience with visualization programs like Tableau, proficiency with Excel and knowing what it's really good for, basic knowledge of SQL databases and how to use them, as well as general knowledge of how statistical software packages (SAS/SPSS, R, Python) can be used to improve or automate work.
Industry Expertise: Ideally expertise in some major verticals such as retail, telecommunications and technology, automotive, or CPG. Could also speak to an area you are passionate about.

QUALITIES AND CHARACTERISTICS


Good signs of this include experience putting together presentations, speaking at conferences, and writing original thinking or POVs on data problems.
Thought Leadership: An evangelist for data products and services, able to ensure our clients and our teams see the possibilities that data opens up for producing greater insight and better work (through cross-disciplinary collaboration with UX, Design, Creative, Strategy, etc.).
Ownership: Critical sense of ownership for the success of each account. This person must manage deliverables, understanding scope and timelines in detail in order to help program directors and client team support work and grow relationship with key clients.

Hast du Spaß am Entwickeln und Betreiben von modernen und einfachen Lösungen? Packst du auch gerne mit an, wenn es komplizierter wird? Perfekt. Wir kümmern uns um das Baufinanzierungs-Angebot von Morgen bei Europace.
Wir – das ist ein kleines, vollfunktionales Team innerhalb der über 100 Leute umfassenden Baufinanzierungs-Unit.
Wir sind einerseits ein Teil der erfolgreichen Europace Produktfamilie und andererseits in einem cloud-basierten Greenfield-Setup unterwegs. Wir werden mit der Unterstützung von KI den Marktstandard für die schnellste und einfachste Baufinanzierung entwickeln.

Wir freuen uns auf dich - come as you are!
Wie sehen deine Aufgaben bei uns aus?

Du entwickelst im Herzen Berlins: Du implementierst neue Features in einer nutzerzentrierten Vorgehensweise und behältst den Überblick über das Gesamtsystem.
Du integrierst: Europace als Plattform lebt von der Integration neuer Funktionalitäten über Services. Du bringst deine Erfahrung in der Anbindung von APIs ein und denkst in Standard-APIs.
Du betreibst: Nach der Implementierung hört dein Job nicht auf. Du hast schon bei der Entwicklung den Betrieb im Blick und stellst diesen auch weiterhin sicher.
Du bringst dich ein: Du bist Sparrings-Partner auch in sehr frühen Phasen der Produktentwicklung und schon bei der Konzeption neuer Funktionalitäten mit dabei.
Du bringst uns weiter: Wir entwickeln nicht nur Code, sondern auch uns selbst. Du trägst dazu bei, dass wir als Team immer besser werden.

Was erwarten wir von dir?

Einfachheit: Du strebst nach einfachen und übersichtlichen Lösungen. Dabei helfen dir deine berufliche Erfahrung und dein Interesse an Open Source.
Überblick: Dir fällt es leicht einen Schritt zurück zu machen und zu hinterfragen, ob Dinge zielführend sind, ohne das Ziel aus den Augen zu verlieren.
Kommunikationsstarker Teamplayer: Du bist mit Herz und Seele Teamplayer. Du formulierst klar und verständlich, bist zudem offen und gehst auch auf andere Teams zu, um gemeinsam die bestmögliche Lösung zu erreichen.
Interesse und Lernbereitschaft: Dein Interesse hilft dir mit deiner schnellen Auffassungsgabe
rasch neue Themen zu adaptieren. Außerdem engagierst du dich, bringst dich ein und bist motiviert uns voranzubringen.
Kenntnisse: Idealerweise hast Du bereits Erfahrung in Java, AWS, Python, CDK und Typescript gesammelt.

Was dich bei uns erwartet?

Selbstorganisation: Bei uns gibt es kein Micro-Management und keine klassischen Hierarchien. Du hast Raum zum Gestalten und Wirken.
Cross-Functional: Business Analysten, Developer, Data Scientists, UX-Designer und Key Account Manager arbeiten an der Anwendung bei uns auf Augenhöhe.
Teamplay: Echtes Miteinander im Team mit freundlichen Kollegen, sowie gegenseitiger Respekt & Wertschätzung und ein hohes Maß an sozialer Kompetenz erwarten dich.
Fehlerkultur: Wir gehen offen mit unseren Fehlern um und nutzen sie als Chance um zu lernen.
Flexibilität: Flexibles Arbeiten im Office oder Remote - du hast die Wahl. Ist die Betreuung deines Kindes nicht möglich, kannst du neben Home- Office gerne auch unser Kids-Office nutzen.
Innovation Time: Du hast viele Möglichkeiten deine Innovationskraft zu nutzen und dich weiterzuentwickeln. Neben dem Einbringen in das Produkt kannst du auch eigene Projekte, Wissenstage, Exploration Days, Meetups, Konferenzen und vieles mehr nutzen.

Ach ja, wer sind wir?

Hidden Champion: Die Europace AG ist ein Tochterunternehmen der Hypoport Gruppe. Wir sind seit über zehn Jahren erfolgreich und haben den Finanzierungsmarkt revolutioniert. Mit unseren Transaktionsvolumen von über 4 Mrd. Euro im Monat und einem Wachstum, das deutlich über dem Markt liegt, schreiben wir gerne mit dir unsere Erfolgsstory fort.
FinTech: Wir sind Deutschlands größter Finanzmarktplatz für Immobilienfinanzierungen, Bausparprodukte und Privatkredite. Wir gestalten und bewegen Märkte und befinden uns auf einer stetigen Mission für den Verbraucher.
B2B2C: Wir sind B2B und denken B2C. Wir bringen Banken und Vertriebe zusammen, um für den Verbraucher den einfachsten Zugang zu den besten Finanzierungen zu schaffen.
Mehr Informationen dazu, wie wir hier arbeiten bekommst du auch auf unserem EUROPACE-Blog und PnO-Blog.
Wir verwenden die weibliche Form von geschlechterspezifischen Bezeichnungen und meinen damit jeweils alle Geschlechter.

Und jetzt?

Wenn wir dein Interesse geweckt haben, dann freuen wir uns auf deine Beweggründe und auf deine Bewerbung. Bitte mit Gehaltsvorstellung und möglichem Starttermin. Auch wenn du nicht alle unsere Anforderungen bereits komplett erfüllst, würden wir uns über deine Bewerbung freuen.

We now have an exciting opportunity to bring an Analyst onboard our Marketing Business Intelligence team, based in Berlin, working across all brands and territories. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to be part of the food revolution and join our food-tech startup as we take our growth to the next level.

As part of the Marketing Business Intelligence team, our expectation from you is to:
Be the champion of data driven decision making at Marley Spoon

What is your passion?
Let us tell you ours: Give us any software-related data and we will create the most stunning and beautiful analytics you have ever seen.
We are Seerene, a growing technology start-up from Potsdam that helps businesses, public organizations and software-affine users to access the power of advanced analytics. The spin-off of the Hasso Plattner Institute for Digital Engineering (HPI) relies on artificial intelligence and machine learning to analyze complex relationships in the development of software systems. The Seerene software analytics platform integrates the existing development infrastructure, the repositories and data already isolated in the various sub-disciplines of software development with its own analyses and makes the knowledge available in a “digital boardroom” to those responsible.

Meaningful key metrics, dashboards and software maps make the development process visible as a whole and in real time for the first time and form a common basis for the end-to-end management of software processes across all expert fields.

In this way, efficiency potentials of 30 percent and more can be realized, quality and robustness can be increased, and risks minimized.

For business issues we are advised by German Deep Tech, an experienced incubator for Deep Tech companies. Our services include an open API and developing applications for our customers by either extending existing ones or designing them from scratch. If you are passionate a vibrating Startup atmosphere with a lot of exciting opportunities and want to develop state of the art software engineering-solutions with us, we should talk. As the company is constantly growing, we are always looking for excellent people to join our friendly and high motivated team.
THE JOB
We are looking for an outstanding Product Marketing Manager to be part of Seerene’s story. This position in our growing start-up is a rare opportunity to use and also grow your skills with an innovative product helping engineering organizations to deliver reliable, dependable and affordable software systems. Join Seerene and become a part of a high-class international team.
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
Set the product marketing strategy
Develop and strengthen the messaging and positioning to gain a competitive edge
Coordinate writing, design, and web development resources
Drive effective messaging that cascades across marketing campaigns, the website, sales decks, events, and PR channels
Work closely with our product team to understand what's being built
Work closely with our sales team to understand what resonates in the market and where there are gaps
Use measurement tools to assess and drive the team’s performance
Develop compelling positioning and thought leadership content
YOUR SKILLS
An ability to successfully define and drive projects
A clear understanding of how-to tailor messaging for buying personas
Very self-organized - easy to keep track of tasks and deliverables
Confidence in structuring work for other people and able to give clear, valuable feedback
Fast learner and self-starter on new topics
Understanding technology and keen to learn about the details of Seerene’s value propositions
Balance limited resources
Great negotiator
YOUR WORK EXPERIENCE
Must have a university degree; an MBA is a bonus, but not required
Must have 2+ years of product marketing experience, ideally at a high-growth B2B tech company
Must have proven results in marketing application software; experience selling to CIOs is a bonus
Presentations to a wide range of people, from analysts to C-suite executives
Hands-on creation of a range of marketing assets, including decks, demo videos, eBooks, and online campaigns
Experience working with a distributed sales team, preferably in SaaS companies, fintech or startups
Proven track record in meeting or exceeding deadlines and targets on multiple projects, simultaneously
WHAT WE OFFER
A unique challenge: we are about to expand into new markets. For this we build up a new team and you become part of it! We are not an ordinary online shop but a very scientifically oriented and technology driven company. Many features of our software are not available anywhere else. So you have the opportunity to find solutions for completely new problem based on profund constant research with the Hasso Plattner Insitute the number one excellence center in software engineering int central Europe.
IMPORTANT DETAILS
This is a full-time, permanent position. You must be fluent in English and German and you are free to work from either Berlin or Potsdam. Due to its broad focus it is an excellent opportunity to develop more competencies, grow further as a “Full-Stack Marketer” and prepare yourself for a management role in Marketing.

Marley Spoon (ASE:MMM) is bringing delightful, market fresh and easy cooking back to the people, while re-inventing the global food supply chain to reduce unethical food waste. We are connecting consumers with quality producers, providing fresh food directly to customer's homes and we are present in Europe, the US and Australia, shipping our product to about 50 000 zip codes.
The Data Team
We are integrating data sources and supporting our stakeholders in using our analytics visualization tools and working on applying machine learning to offer our customers a better, personalised service.
The Role
The role is a mix of business intelligence and data engineering.
On the data engineering side, you will:
Design and implement components for data extraction, storage, and manipulation
Design and implement our new data architecture in AWS using Terraform and Terragrunt
Work closely with data scientists to make machine-learning algorithms production-ready using AWS services, Docker and Kubernetes
On the BI side, you will:
Enrich and maintain our data warehouse
Work on its infrastructure
Create SQL reports
Support business analysts with visualizations
Requirements
Experience as a software engineer, preferably in Python
Experience with Postgres or comparable
Experience with AWS or other cloud providers
Experience with Big Data Solutions, such as Apache Spark
DevOps basic understanding and willingness to take on infrastructure tasks
Experience with designing & building DWHs and ETL processes
A structured way of working
Passion for building things from scratch and improving existing components
Passionate about food and/or cooking
You're a team player and a fan of knowledge sharing & learning
You are proactive and come up with ideas on how to move the product forward
Benefits
Autonomy, Impact, Collaboration, Learning & Growth
Flexible working hours, home office and remote work
Spend 5% of your working time on personal learning and development
Conference / Training budget
Our beautiful and cozy office is located in the heart of Berlin Kreuzberg close to some of the best restaurants
Free food boxes delivered to your doorstep
Cooked food from our test kitchen & free drinks
Gym membership
Friday drinks and many after work events
An open, diverse and respectful culture with over 50 nationalities
Possibility to trade part of your salary for double the amount of stock options
Visa support & relocation package

job_title: Product Manager - Home Seller Acquisition & Engagement (m/w/d)
full_text:
Deine Aufgaben:

Als Teil der Sales Journey bist du Teil der größten Abteilung bei Immobilienscout24
Du entwickelst mit unserem Team Features, die Eigentümer überzeugen, ihre Verkaufsprojekte über Immobilienscout24 zu steuern
Du arbeitest bei uns in einem kreativen, agilen Umfeld und entwickelst zusammen mit einem cross-funktionalen Team großartige nutzerzentrierte Produkte
Unser Team besteht aus UX Designern, UX Researchern, Data Analysts, Marketing Managern sowie Software Entwicklern
Du verantwortest KPIs, Productroadmap und Strategie und stimmst dich eng mit allen beteiligten Stakeholdern ab.

Dein Profil :

Du hast Lust als Teil eines agilen und ambitionierten Teams ImmoScout24 auf das nächste Level zu bringen
Du hast bereits Erfahrung als Produktmanager in einem Digitalunternehmen und verstehst Online-Marketing zur Akquise neuer Nutzer
Du hast praktische Erfahrungen in der Ideenfindung und Validierung neuer digitaler Produkte und bist mit den relevanten Methoden vertraut
Du hast zusammen mit agilen Entwicklerteams in verantwortlicher Rolle Produkte (weiter-) entwickelt und beherrscht die Methoden zur Priorisierung und Zusammenarbeit mit Entwicklern
Du arbeitest eigenverantwortlich und deine Arbeitsweise ist in hohem Maße pragmatisch, analytisch und datengetrieben
Du hältst dich auf dem neusten Stand, was Trends und Technologien anbelangt und lässt diese in deine Produktentwicklung einfließen
Du sprichst gut Deutsch und Englisch

Was wir dir bieten, damit du diese Stelle noch erfolgreicher meistern kannst:

Seit 20 Jahren sind wir ein agiles, dynamisches und vor allem multikulturelles Unternehmen. Talente können bei uns viel bewegen und Tag täglich einen Mehrwert für unsere Kunden schaffen.


Ein attraktives Gehaltspaket sowie eine lukrative betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Eine ausgewogene Work-Live Balance mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, Möglichkeit auf Home Office und 30 Urlaubstagen pro Jahr
Persönliche Weiterentwicklung durch individuelle Trainings, Sprachkurse, Workshops und Seminare
Persönliche Benefits, wie zum Beispiel Vergünstigung im Fitnessstudio oder in der Kantine
Frisches Obst und selbstverständlich freie Getränke
Erfolge feiern wir gemeinsam mit: Team Events, Sommerfest oder Weihnachtsfeier
High-End Hardware
Hundefreundliches Büro

Wir möchten gerne mehr über dich erfahren und freuen uns auf deine Onlinebewerbung.

Berlin, Germany Artificial Intelligence c Computer Science GANs Machine Learning Python software engineering
About Us

PCH Innovations is a multi-disciplinary innovation studio based in Berlin and Los Angeles. For 15 years, we have helped our clients navigate their respective futures by developing adaptive strategies, concepts, and high-fidelity prototypes. We engage diverse topics, including: mobility, logistics, robotics, AI, science, and consciousness.

We are a team of engineers, designers, technologists, futurists, coders, filmmakers, writers, and artists. We are looking for a Machine Learning & Software Engineer, Data enthusiast & analyst for our Berlin office – someone with a passion for innovation, focused on research and data.

Over the last year, we have developed proprietary workflows, software frameworks, and algorithms that allow us to feed Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) with thousands of highly detailed 3D data models. This combined solution, called ‘Blank Compose’, enables us to train neural networks on spatial data of any object, opening the field of deep & machine learning to industrial CAD applications – enabling what we call ‘dreamtelligence in product design & engineering’.

About You

Have at least a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or related with a focus on Machine Learning (Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science)
Have excellent knowledge of Python; other languages such as C#, C++ are appreciated
Have already gathered practical experiences in the field of Machine Learning, and applied corresponding frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras
Your software engineering skills and interest extend beyond prototype development, into deploying software as a service
Have creative thinking and multi-tasking skills
Have excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Can quickly adapt to new objectives and dynamically evolving strategic directions

Plus Points

Experience with training & optimizing Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
Experience in handling 3D data formats, including mesh analysis and visualization

Your tasks

Participate in cutting edge research & developments in the fields of computer vision, artificial intelligence, and machine learning applications
Conduct foundational research and develop big data-driven systems & automated processes, as well as concrete solutions for industrial AI applications – in close collaboration with our research team, coders, and engineers
Due to the high interest in our solution we’re currently investigating a spin-off of this project; therefore the ideal candidate should be interested in a long-term commitment and be willing to take over a leading position in the medium term
The ideal candidate will be employed full time in our Berlin studio

What we offer

A diverse, international, and caring team that supports one another at work and beyond
A culture of responsibility, co-determination, openness, and mindfulness
Opportunity to explore a wide variety of exciting territories at the forefront of technological and societal innovation
A space for creative freedom and expression – a beautiful, quiet, and dog-friendly studio in a repurposed kindergarten, with a big garden and multiple terraces
Fresh fruits throughout the week, and weekly shared lunches cooked by the most lovely chef (vegan/vegetarian)
Team-building activities to support our team interaction & culture
Individual and team coaching (on request)

If you are interested in working with us, we’d love to hear from you.

Please reach out to us with your CV, relevant work references, and preferably your Master/Bachelor Thesis abstract via talent@pch-innovations.com

We are a diverse group of people from all corners of the world. Every day we love to rewrite the international success story of idealo and are committed to pushing our five international portals to the next level. Similar to a start-up within idealo itself, we are constantly experimenting and looking for innovations to fuel our exceptional growth. As a Country Manager you have the opportunity to actively promote the operational and strategic development of idealo.co.uk and are responsible for the portal's success.


About your new role

You will be responsible for growth, revenue, profit and budgets within all of idealo's UK operations
You will lead, motivate and coordinate team members in each department dedicated to the UK project
Within our company´s matrix organisational structure, you will elaborate growth, distribution, and marketing strategies to define business goals in accordance with the head management of assigned departments
Furthermore you are in charge of annual business and budget planning in conjunction with head management of dedicated departments
You are always on the lookout for suitable future business partners, with a view to building strategically wise collaborations
You´re constantly aware of your project´s KPIs. You know the market and competition inside out, and will always keep your team´s best interests in mind
You take sustained responsibility for controlling all actions related to the UK operation and report to heads of assigned departments

Skills & Requirements
You have at least five years of experience, preferably gained at a renowned e-commerce company, consulting agency, or start-up, as well as two years of experience as an executive leader to a team and respectable operation
You graduated with honours in an Economics degree or a degree with similar or more impressive status
You strike us as an independent, well-structured, assertive, and respected colleague that leads with good examples, who convinces and inspires throughout the hierarchy
Data, numbers and facts are the foundation of your decisions
You have the mind of an analyst, and your ideas arise out of your economic experience and understanding as a professional
You have a dynamic, thriving personality, as well as a constant urge to succeed
Fluency in English is a must. German and other languages are a plus
Your benefits at idealo
Training opportunities for your individual management or specialist career
The provision of all necessary equipment that you need to deliver top performances
Employees are self-reliant and free to schedule their own work day
Onboarding program including Welcome Day, Trainings and individual incorporation
The chance to work together on our goals, while also working to create something new
800 motivated colleagues and a cool office loft in the trendy district of Kreuzberg
About idealo

idealo is a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Right in the heart of Berlin, over 800 employees from 40 nations are working on the future of online shopping. We focus on agile and self-reliant work, sustainability and a healthy relationship between work and private life. These values are firmly anchored in our corporate culture and are an integral part of our corporate philosophy.


As part of our team, you can look forward to freedom, an international atmosphere and inspiring working environment. Your ideas are particularly important to us. Not only is our product portfolio diverse, but so are the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Background, religion, gender, sexual orientation or a disability do not play a role.

We are Datawrapper - a web-based charting tool, and we want you to join us as a client-facing software engineer in our office in Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg.

What's this exciting new position about? Well, although Datawrapper is used primarily by journalists, our customer base is growing and diversifying, and some of our users come with special requirements and challenges. We want to be able to accommodate these people as well. Enabling us to provide them with a flawless Datawrapper experience will be your job.

The kind of stuff you’ll be doing:
Developing new visualization features for specific customer groups. For example, an analyst at a financial institution might need different charting features than a data journalist at a local newspaper. We work with both, so that will be part of what you're responsible for.
Building & maintaining integrations with other software and tools. There are all kinds of other apps and tools that Datawrapper interacts with in the real world, like CMS’s and databases. Part of your job will be ensuring that those integrations are easy to build and run smoothly.
Extending Datawrapper to make sure it works well with large customer teams. When one person uses Datawrapper on their own, creating and organizing charts is pretty straight-forward. When there are hundreds of people creating charts in a large team, not so much! Ensuring that even the largest of our customers' teams don’t hit any walls when using Datawrapper will be part of this job.
Who we’re looking for:
We’re looking for a full stack web developer to join our Berlin development team, preferrably full-time, but open to flexible work time arrangements.
You will have a full, regular employment contract. Due to the nature of this job, it will not be possible to do this job entirely remote. Please save yourself and us some time and only apply if you want to work with us in Berlin.
On the technical side, most of the work we’re doing is front end development work in JavaScript/ES6, D3.js, Bootstrap and Svelte. There’s a PHP and MySQL backend as well, but that won’t be too much of your concern.
We’re looking for somebody who has worked in web development before, but you don't need to have specific experience with our tooling or choice of frameworks. We’re happy to show you how our stack works.
What the "client-facing" part entails:
A significant part of the job will involve interacting with users and customers. be it by phone, video call or email. We encourage everybody in our company to do this, but in this role it will be particularly prevalent
That means we're looking for someone with good communication, interpersonal and written skills.
Strong English skills will also be necessary, as our users and customers sit all over the world.
Not a must-have, but a plus: German skills, interest in or experience with data visualization, experience working in a software company.
If you have any prior work you can show us, open-source or not, please feel free to include it in your application. We'd love to take a look at it. Even if you don’t, please don’t feel discouraged to apply.
What we can offer:

A big desk in our office in Berlin Prenzlauer Berg, where seven of us work (Ivan, Lisa, Anna, Gregor, Elana, Hans & David). We have a massive library of data vis books, a coffee machine, tea en masse & interesting conversations about mapping, data vis and UX. Also, we honour lunch breaks.

Flexible working hours. We're looking for someone who wants to work for us at least four days a week. There's no 9-to-5 culture in our office, though. Some people come at 11 am, some leave at 4 pm, others like to work from home from time to time.

A question-happy, communication-happy atmosphere. We're all learning, and we want you to learn with us. If someone has an idea or a problem, we just talk. No meetings for most of us, a bit of Slack, lots of fun.

We don't care about CVs, just skills and attitude. If you don't find yourself 100% in the description, write Lisa an email anyway. Talk a bit about yourself and how your skills & experience could be a good fit for this job, and ask us aaaaall the questions you might have:
lisa@datawrapper.de

We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Weber Shandwick ist eine international führende Kommunikationsagentur für Marken, Unternehmen und Organisationen in allen wichtigen Märkten der Welt. Durch ein vielfältiges und spezialisiertes Team kann die Agentur auf zahlreiche Auszeichnungen für innovative und kreative Kampagnen blicken. So wurde Weber Shandwick 2019 von der Ad Age für „Best Places to Work“ ausgezeichnet und ist die einzige PR-Agentur, die es 2017 und 2018 auf die Ad Age A-List „Agency Standout“ schaffte.Mit datengestützten, einzigartigen Ideen im Mittelpunkt und einem vielseitigen Team aus Strategen, Analysten, Technologen und Kreativen, gestaltet die Agentur integrierte Kampagnen, die mehr können als Aufmerksamkeit zu generieren – sie ermöglichen Interaktionen, die einen nachhaltigen Impact für unsere Kunden schaffen.An den deutschen Standorten Berlin, Frankfurt, Köln und München bietet Weber Shandwick strategische Beratung, Planung und die Umsetzung integrierter Kommunikationsdienstleistungen in den zentralen Geschäftsbereichen Brand- und B2B-Marketing, Healthcare, Change Management, Employee Engagement, Corporate Reputation, Krisenkommunikation, Data & Analytics, Technology, Public Affairs, Social Impact sowie Finance-Kommunikation. Weber Shandwick gehört zur Interpublic Group (NYSE: IPG).Unser Talent Acquisition Team spielt eine zentrale Rolle im Auf- und Ausbau unserer Teams an allen vier Standorten. Von Praktikanten bei Public Relations bis zu Account Managern unseres Corporate Teams und Medical Writer für unsere Healthcare Practice, das Portfolio an offenen Positionen ist stets abwechslungsreich und spannend.Für unser HR-Team am Standort Berlin suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Verstärkung in Form eines:SENIOR TALENT ACQUISITION MANAGER (W/M/D)DEINE AUFGABEN – DU… trägst die Verantwortung für Talent Acquisition bei Weber Shandwick Deutschland – über alle Teams und Standorte hinweg – mit Unterstützung unserer Junior Recruiterinbist Process Owner und Begleiter für den gesamten Recruiting-Prozess: Vom Einholen der Briefings bis hin zur Besetzung der Stelleerstellst und streust Stellenausschreibungen über diverse Kanälefindest die besten Talente im Markt (von Praktikanten/Trainees bis zu erfahrenen Spezialisten), durch Active Sourcing, Networking, Referrals, Events etc.bist Ansprechpartner und Begleiter im gesamten Recruiting-Prozess für unsere Hiring Managerübernimmst die proaktive Weiterentwicklung von TA und unserer Prozesse in Zusammenarbeit mit der HR Direktorin und dem gesamten HR-Teamtreibst unser Employer Branding und Outreach Programm voran, vor allem im Bereich Hochschulmarketingverwaltest relevante TA Daten, Tools und Reportingsbist Schnittstelle zu unserem HR Operations TeamDEIN PROFIL – DU… hast ein abgeschlossenes (Fach-) Hochschulstudiumhast mindestens 3 bis 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Recruiting / TAhast Erfahrung beim Besetzen unterschiedlicher Positionen (Fachgebiet / Seniorität)kennst Dich mit Active Sourcing (LinkedIn, Xing) aushast Erfahrung im Umgang mit einem ATS (gerne Greenhouse)bringst einen hohen Grad an Eigenverantwortung, Proaktivität und Organisationstalent mitbist proaktiv, lösungsorientiert, und immer professionellkennst innovative Recruitingstrategien und hast Spaß daran diese weiterzuentwickeln, um die besten Talente im Markt zu findenhast fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und SchriftUNSER ANGEBOT – WIR… bieten einen abwechslungsreichen Job mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum und Entwicklungsperspektiven in einem internationalen Netzwerk-Umfeldermöglichen dir modernes Arbeiten mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit, flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und Home-Office-Regelungen (mit Bereitstellung eines Laptops und Diensthandys)bieten dir ein professionelles und strukturiertes Onboarding mit deinem persönlichen Mentormachen 28 Tage Urlaub im Jahr und haben zusätzlich Heiligabend und Silvester freibieten Mitarbeiterrabatte bei ausgewählten Shopping-PartnernUNSER PROFIL – WIR… … legen Wert auf ein teamorientiertes, wertschätzendes und hierarchie-übergreifendes, respektvolles Miteinander.… fördern eigenständiges und verantwortungsvolles Arbeiten.… sind ein Team und feiern Erfolge immer gemeinsam.Werde Teil unseres Erfolges als Senior Talent Acquisition Manager (w/m/d) in unserem HR Team. Wir freuen uns auf deine vollständige Bewerbung (Anschreiben und Lebenslauf) mit Angabe deiner Gehaltsvorstellung sowie deines frühestmöglichen Starttermins per Email.Du willst mehr über uns/die oben genannte Position erfahren?Einfach anrufen: deine Ansprechpartnerin ist Lisa Döcke (+49 (0) 30 2035 1231).Zusätzliche Leistungen:Flexible ArbeitszeitenHome OfficeKostenlose GetränkeWeiterbildungFirmenhandyArt der Stelle: Vollzeit, FestanstellungBerufserfahrung:Recruiting: 3 Jahre (Erforderlich)

Work with fascinating data sets to uncover insights from data and translate them into recommendations, constantly finding a new angle to it that advances our projects and helps our clients
Lead and develop client relationships with a fundamental understanding of their questions and challenges
Aggregate and interpret raw data to take it into business contexts in the field of online search engines, tools and social media
Work with quantitative methods to answer questions and find opportunities to improve user engagement, optimize marketing activities and help to grow our clients’ business
Concept and realize cross-channel dashboards based on various data sources (including web analytics, buzz tracking, CRM, search)
Collaborate and work across disparate client teams and internal departments. You will be interfacing regularly to ensure projects are running smoothly and experience and knowledge are transferred
Create and hold precise and compelling presentations. You stand up for your ideas
There’s a match if…
You are both a creative analyst and an analytic creative
You have a minimum of 4 years of relevant experience – relevant is marketing, statistics, media, (advertising) agency and any other fast-paced company
You are familiar with the digital landscape and possess a great affinity for a wide range of industries, including FMCG, automotive or telecommunication
Your methodical and logical approach is underlined by your empathy. At the heart of your analysis lies a nugget of deep human insight
You love solving big, hairy problems. You are comfortable handling high volumes of data from a number of sources and tools
You are an open minded and enthusiastic individual. You are energized by bringing together different views, personalities, goals, and needs
You have excellent communication and negotiation skills, both in English and in German
You are high proficiency with all MS Office Application, particularly Excel and Powerpoint as well as with common social & web analytic tools. Skills in SPSS, R or Python are a plus.

A Pricing Data Analyst in our Pricing & Forecasting team is passionate about creating accurate data solutions and have a proven record of developing trusting relationships with product and commercial leads who will turn your insights into actions.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Build and improve upon the system which measures sales forecasting, price optimisation and customer lifetime value
Act as the point of contact between Analytics and external product, engineering and ops teams to ensure key projects are successful
Build and own periodic reporting - Take advantage of the ever-growing amount of data we have at our fingertips to help stakeholders build best in class forecasting tools
Managing and leading key initiatives in the Analytics team and Pricing & Forecasting
Mentor and guide junior members of the Analytics team
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
3+ years of experience using data to build analytical solutions at industry leading companies in Technology, Retail or e-commerce.
Ability to turn complex findings and results into a compelling narrative and a set of actions
Familiarity with SQL and an objection-oriented programing language (Python, R,Java)
Undergraduate degree in a technical field (Science, Economics, Physics, Maths, Engineering)
Led or contributing to a complex technical project related to analytics, testing or data modeling/Warehousing
Experience mentoring or leading
Passion for analytics as a craft
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
The Pricing & Forecasting Department plays a pivotal role in the organisation by producing algorithmic-based price recommendations, forecasting sales, defining and implementing pricing strategies across 16 countries and 500k articles . The Department is a self-sufficient team of product, engineering, Analytics and operations. As a member of the Pricing Analytics team, you’ll build tools and data products that impacts millions of Zalando shoppers, the top and bottom line of our company and the many internal teams that rely on your analytics solutions.
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form – we do not accept applications via e-mail.

Your tasksYou will support Risk Management department with various tasks related to underwriting, scoring, risk reporting, fraud prevention, risk-adjusted pricing, etc.Perform ad-hoc analysis/reporting for top managementMonitor various risk KPIs on segment levelBuild and update scorecard models using statistical toolsMonitor scorecard performance and variable stability, define new segments, monitor cut-offs, strategies for credit decisionTake active role in integrating external risk management and fraud prevention toolsImprove our current reporting process and develop reports from scratchSupport impact analysis of various changes to product and pricingPerform testing and validation of risk measures in internal systemsWork closely with customer support, collection and IT on risk and underwriting topicsGain valuable experience in credit risk management and become knowledgeable with risk management tools and KPIsRequired skills and experienceBachelor or Master's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, IT, Finance or similar areaAt least three years of relevant experience in risk management and data analysisRelevant experience in financial sectorProficient knowledge of MS Office, especially ExcelStrong SQL/MySQL Python, or R user. Knowledge of VBA, SAS, Tableau will be considered an advantageStrong communication and analytical skills, specialist in data analysisCapacity to work independently and reliably with attention to detailsFluenty in English, German is a plusResponsible and willing to learn and go the extra mileWe offerPermanent employment contractFair remuneration28 holidays / yearInternational environment with a dynamic, dedicated and collegial teamOffice in the heart of Berlin near Checkpoint CharliePersonal and professional developmentModern working conditions and processes that we constantly improveA secure job in a company that prepares for the future like no otherTeam Events - e.g. Summer festival, Halloween Party, X-mas eventWeekly fresh fruit basketsZusätzliche Leistungen:Flexible ArbeitszeitenKostenlose GetränkeHome OfficeErfolgsbeteiligungZusätzliche UrlaubstageJob Types: Full-time, Permanent

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service, and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:

(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).

Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts

ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience

Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.

You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
