The New Business Team at idealo is building new products for our Business Partners to generate an additional Revenue Stream for the company.
Be part of a new data related venture from day one backed by the idealo ecosystem.
As a Data Engineer you will have the ownership to envision and generate meaningful data-driven insights for our B2B Partners.
With your passion for analytics, statistics and predictive approaches you will fundamentally impact and drive the product’s success.
About your new role
You proactively combine data from multiple data sources (Databases, APIs etc.) to create meaningful analysis and reportings for our business partners, in line with our product strategy and customer feedback
You drive the full data analytics stack of our product by covering all aspects of data exploration, extraction and modelling
You are in charge of maintaining and extending our ETL pipelines (based on Airflow), as well as to integrate it with new data sources as they are discovered
You will work close to data scientists, business analysts and product managers in order to tackle our customers’ real-life business challenges through analytics solutions to be implemented into our product
Within the scope of your work you derive the needs of our partners from large amounts of data and validate findings using qualitative methods.
You ensure the validity of the data we produce and implement processes to prevent inaccuracies


Skills & Requirements
At least 2+ years of work experience as data engineer
Experience running and scaling an Airflow cluster as an ETL solution, handling multiple data sources and large data volumes
Experience with Terraform as an automatic configuration management tool
Experience with Docker
Proficient in SQL, especially extensive experience with PostgreSQL databases and good knowledge of BigQuery / Athena databases
Proficient in Python as a programming language, Java being a strong plus
Experience in managing resources on AWS (RDS, EC2 instances etc.) and implementing solid security measures to ensure the safety of data
Proficient with linux and commonly associated shells and commands
Excellent communication skills in English, both oral and written; German is nice to have
Ability to multi-task and work effectively in a dynamic environment
At idealo you can expect
No room for stagnancy! Whether tech talks, conferences or individual training, there are countless opportunities for constructive discussion and input
Influence in creating and deciding individual tasks as well as direct
contact with idealo partner
Various idealo benefits to satisfy every heart's desire, ranging from organic breakfasts to bikes that
can be rented during the lunch break
With countless opportunities for team building such as team events and parties at Christmas and in
summer, you'll be able to strengthen team spirit as well as the professional development of your department
About idealo

idealo is a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Right in the heart of Berlin, over 800 employees from 40 nations are working on the future of online shopping. We focussing on agile and self-reliant work, sustainability and a healthy relationship between work and private life. These values are firmly anchored in our corporate culture and an integral part of our corporate philosophy.

As part of our team, you can look forward to freedom, an international and inspiring working environment. Your ideas are particularly important to us. Not only our product portfolio is diverse, but also the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation or a severely handicapped degree do not play a role.

job_title: Senior Sales and Customer Success Analyst (m/f/d)
company_name: Project A Services GmbH & Co. KG
full_text:
-------------------

We are looking for:
-------------------

A new team member for our A-Team.

"Nothing happens until someone sells something". As a VC, we see it everyday: the smartest founding team with the best product idea in the world will fail if they can't figure out how to scalably sell it. With our own department of specialists in the area of Sales & Customer Success, we're determined to help our ventures sell by building and providing industry-leading expertise throughout their entire commercial funnel.

Your role in our team will be to work closely with our portfolio of digital leaders and help them implement excellent sales & customer success organizations. You will be exposed to different business models, company maturities and analytical problems all the while getting unique insights into our VC investment process.

------------------------------
What will keep you challenged?
------------------------------


Development of client acquisition and customer success strategies for our start-ups and private equity co-investments
Review of their messaging, processes and organizational setup
Implementation of value-driving improvements like customer segmentation to the selection of the right channels and pitch design
Data-driven optimization and further development of direct customer contact
Evaluation and implementation of sales CRM tools (e.g. Salesforce)
Conceptualization and execution of trainings and workshops with founders and commercial teams
Further development of Project A best practices for sales & customer success

----------------------------------------
Which traits contribute to your success?
----------------------------------------


Successful completion of your studies in economics or related fields with top-in-class results
Min. of 3 years of sales or customer success work experience in the start-up or consulting ecosphere and an entrepreneurial mindset
Experience in optimizing and scaling sales processes
Outstanding analytical and organizational skills and fluency in German and English
High motivation, very quick comprehension and willingness to make decisions as your strengths
Strong interest in sales and customer success and ideally, you have already gained experience with Sales CRM tools
Self-confidence, a lot of initiative and you enjoy highly dynamic environments
Strong team spirit and excellent communication skills

-------------------------------

What to expect working with us:
-------------------------------


An instant network within the Project A family - among it our 50 portfolio companies - to help you succeed throughout your entire career
Becoming part of a highly motivated and professional team
Having the unique opportunity to experience and to make an impact on recently founded companies
Working independently, have all freedom you need and are thus able to personally grow and develop yourself on a constant basis
Working at a modern and well-equipped office in the heart of Berlin
Benefiting from a communicative, creative and stimulating environment

Do you want to be part of our success story?
We are looking forward to your online application.

Fit Analytics ( http://www.fitanalytics.com/ ) — the world's leading size advisor solution for online clothes shopping — is looking for a motivated full-time Team Lead for its Back-end team (m/f/d). If you are passionate about writing correct, elegant, flexible and performant code, sharing your knowledge with your team members and are ready to use your skills to shape the future of the online fashion industry, we want to hear from you!

Who We Are

Based in Berlin and Chicago, we're a team of data scientists, fashionistas, physicists, business analysts, designers, and hackers, working together to tackle a single problem: making it easy for online shoppers to find the right clothes size. We help some of the world's largest clothing brands solve sizing issues, boost conversions and slash returns.

What We Do

Our core product,Fit Finder ( https://www.fitanalytics.com/fit-finder ), helps clothing and apparel companies instantly access the power of machine learning to deliver a perfect fit for customers. The Fit Analytics' platform combines the world's largest database of garment and fit information with hundreds of billions of euros of purchasing records and consumer preferences. By applying the power of machine learning to this unique data set, we've created a range of innovative solutions — Fit Connect, Fit Intelligence and Fit Source — to help drive improvements throughout the apparel lifecycle from manufacturing to marketing. Leading apparel brands and retailers across six continents trust our platform to solve sizing at scale and deliver meaningful bottom-line impact. Our clients include the likes of Zara, Asos, Hugo Boss, JD Sports, Bershka, The North Face, Tommy Hilfiger, Uniqlo, Calvin Klein and many more!

What The Role Involves


Leading, managing, and growing our back-end development team
Maintaining a positive, productive, and open-minded work environment
Using your extensive practical expertise to help teams design, build and scale efficient, elegant back-end and full-stack applications on Google Cloud Platform
Contributing to our Golang and Node.js code base
Playing a key role in designing microservices architecture
Mentoring team members, reviewing source code, discussing technical concepts, documenting architecture and engineering practices, and encouraging writing maintainable high-quality software
Developing tools to seamlessly control our Google Cloud-based infrastructure
Working together with other technical and non-technical team leaders to ensure that our products stay the best on the market

What We're Looking for in You


Degree in Computer Science (or other relevant field) or equivalent experience
5+ years of relevant industry experience as a Software Developer
2+ years experience in leading tech teams
Solid experience and understanding of idioms in at least one of the following languages: Golang, Node.js, C
Familiarity with cloud computing, specifically Kubernetes and Docker
Knowledge of Linux / Unix systems
Innovative and self-motivated, with strong problem-solving skills
Fluency in English

What We Offer You


Hands-on experience building a product that is revolutionizing the apparel & footwear market
The opportunity to become a key part of Fit Analytics' growth story
A competitive salary
A spot in our smart, creative and highly motivated international team
Daily breakfast and lunch plus regular team events

Why We're Different

We're not sitting around wondering what the product is and burning other people's money while expecting everyone to work ridiculous hours for little reward. We're profitable, organised, and already providing a unique solution that delivers huge value to our partners while helping millions of people shop better online.

If you're excellent at what you do and want to apply those skills to solving a genuinely hard problem together with a great bunch of people, you've come to the right place. To take the next step, send us your CV and a brief message explaining why you're the perfect fit!

Deine Aufgaben:

Baue schnelle und skalierbare ETL Pipelines in der Programmiersprache Scala auf, die Terabytes an Daten laden
Auslesen von Daten aus Datenbanken und von externen Systemen über APIs
Integriere unternehmensübergreifende Daten in ein Redshift Data Warehouse
Arbeite in moderner und flexibler Cloudumgebung von AWS
Kümmere dich um das Workflow Scheduling mit Apache Airflow
Erstelle Ad-hoc Reports für die Geschäftsführung und das Business
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Analysts und Data Scientists
Möglichkeit erste Erfahrungen im Big Data Umfeld zu sammeln
Was wir bieten:

Weltgrößte Präsenz im Bereich der Remote-Konnektivität
Unter den Top 3 der führenden Unternehmen in der Branche
Innovatives und schnelllebiges Unternehmen mit schnellem und klarem Entscheidungsprozess
Raum für Kreativität und die Möglichkeit, die Entwicklung des Unternehmens in Ihrem Markt zu beeinflussen
Internationales Arbeitsumfeld
Was du mitbringst:

Hochschulabschluss in Mathematik, Statistik, Informatik oder einem verwandten Fach oder vergleichbare einschlägige Berufserfahrung
Mindestens 2 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung im Bereich Business Intelligence
Programmiere sicher in einer funktionalen oder objektorientierten Programmiersprache - idealerweise in Scala
Kenntnisse mit Cloud Architekturen - idealerweise AWS
Erfahrung im Aufbau und der Weiterentwicklung von einem Data Warehouse wie AWS Redshift ist ein Pluspunkt
Fließende Englisch- und gute Deutschkenntnisse

job_title: Engineering Manager / People Lead - Data Warehouse/BI (m/f/x)
full_text:
As the Data Management area at idealo, we are building a cutting-edge, cloud-based data platform suitable for self-service analytics as well as for machine learning, data products, and our enterprise reporting. We believe that a data-driven approach is a key success factor for our business. Therefore we aim to enable our technical and non-technical internal customers to base their everyday business decisions on hypotheses that are proved by data.

We are looking for a Team Lead highly passionate about enabling people and teams to work at their best. You foster an environment of trust where autonomy and alignment are no contradiction. Actively, you strive for diversity in your team to reflect the diversity of our customers. Inspired, guided and supported by you, the team is set up for success.

By leading our DWH/BI-team specialized in the area of data engineering, business intelligence and data analysis you help other teams and areas at idealo to succeed by incorporating the decisive data at the right time and in the right way. By that you will have a large impact on transforming the business at idealo, using the power of data.

About your new role
Be part of our leadership team in the data management area
Lead an autonomous team of data engineers and analysts
Connect your team with our overall strategy in the data management area
Support your team members in their personal growth
Support your team to establish effective and efficient collaboration structures
Facilitate discussions on team processes and technical implementations
Foster leadership and entrepreneurship in your team members’ attitude
Be a role model for giving and receiving feedback
Skill & Requirements
You have a passion for developing people and teams
You are familiar with agile leadership principles and methods and have used them before
You facilitate learning
You know how to hire and retain talent for your team
You communicate clearly and trustworthy
You have a background in engineering or data analysis
You have a solid understanding of good practices in software engineering, like pair programming, testing, clean code
You are fluent in English
Your benefits at idealo
Training opportunities for your individual management or specialist career
The provision of all necessary equipment that you need to deliver top performances
Employees are self-reliant and free to schedule their own work day
Onboarding program including Welcome Day, Training and individual incorporation
The chance to work together on our goals, while also working to create something new
800 motivated colleagues and a cool office loft in the trendy district of Kreuzberg
About idealo

idealo is a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Today, with 1.5 million visits per day, 50,000 shops and more than 330 million product offers, we are one of the most popular German e-commerce websites and one of the leading European shopping and comparison platforms. We are active as a price comparison platform in six countries (Austria, France, Germany, Great Britain, Italy, and Spain).
As a member of our team, you can look forward to working with a large degree of freedom in an international and inspirational environment. We are located in the heart of Berlin and offer a unique idealo spirit. Your ideas are the driving force that moves our business forward. Not only our product portfolio is diverse, but also the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation or a degree of disability are irrelevant.
If you are passionate about improving the world of online shopping alongside 800 idealo's from 40 nations, apply with us today.
NOT_FOUND

Scope SE & Co. KGaA is looking for a Junior Controller to support out Finance Team. We offer a challenging task in a company with very interesting development and growth potential. You will be responsible for providing reports and analysis and ensure the monthly revenue recognition as part of a committed and professional international team in Berlin. The company’s working language is English.
Your tasks & responsibilities
Ensuring the monthly revenue recognition process under IFRS 15
You generate weekly and monthly revenue forecasts based on order income
Providing reports and analysis on weekly / monthly / quarterly / annually basis and ad-hoc analysis for various internal stakeholders, e.g. Markets, Ratings Operations and Finance
You build up and maintain a reporting / controlling landscape to improve our basis of decision-making
Provides tools to the management to plan and control strategic projects
Ensures that all relevant systems are up to date (Sales activities, contract database, LucaNet financial warehouse, ongoing forecast)
Assists all teams by streamlining the workflow and reporting process
Your personal & professional profile
Minimum of 1 year of work experience in the financial industry as a Controller or Business Analyst
Knowledge of data and information processing and reporting
Practice of financial modelling and unit economic analysis
Knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (HGB & IFRS)
Advanced knowledge in programming languages, tools, MS Access and VBA
Must be able to prioritize work to meet scheduled deadlines while handling multiple tasks
Strong team player with proven experience of working in an international team
Excellent communication, analytical and problem-solving skills
Bachelor´s degree in business administration or relevant field
IT relevant studies and courses or high data and information processing affinity
Fluent in English and German
Interested?

We look forward to learning more about you from your convincing application. Please apply online using our application tool quoting the reference “20200132“. Please note: for non-EU applicants, a valid work and residence permit is a prerequisite for this post.
What we want to see
Signed current CV
Criminal record certificate
At least 1 letter of reference
Copy of your university degrees and certificates
About Scope

Scope SE & Co. KGaA is the holding company of the Scope Group and the leading EU-based provider of independent ratings, research and risk analysis solutions across all asset classes. The Scope Group is based in Berlin and has offices in Frankfurt, London, Madrid, Milan, Oslo and Paris. The core brand Scope Ratings offers clients opinion-driven, forward-looking and non-mechanistic credit risk analysis and contributes to a greater diversity of opinions for institutional investors. Scope Ratings is a credit rating agency registered in accordance with the EU rating regulation and operating in the European Union with External Credit Assessment Institution (ECAI) status.

Daten sind das digitale Vermögen eines Unternehmens. M2 zeigt pragmatische und intelligente Wege, dieses wertvolle Potential freizulegen und zu visualisieren – für strukturierte Lösungen, die Raum für Wachstum schaffen.

Gesucht wird ein Java Entwickler (m/w/d), idealerweise mit Erfahrungen im Web- und Datenbank-Entwicklung sowie im Bereich Cloud-Computing.

Aufgaben


Konzeption, Entwicklung und Betrieb analytischer Gesamtlösungen
Zusammenarbeit mit Analysten und Datawarehouse-Experten zur Weiterentwicklung firmeninterner Tools
Konzeption und Entwicklung von neuen Software-Lösungen
Teilnahme an Konferenzen und Fachveranstaltungen, um auf dem neuesten Stand zu bleiben

Qualifikation

Muss-Kriterien

Erfahrung mit:

Java Web Entwicklung
Entwicklung von Web Services
Datenbanken (SQL)
Versionsmanagement (Git)
Build + Deploymentprozesse
Sehr gute Selbstorganisation und Koordination mit anderen
Ein gutes Verständnis für Kommunikation, sowohl sprachlich als auch visuell
Sehr gutes Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift

Wunsch-Kriterien


Erfahrung im Schreiben von Unit Tests, idealerweise Erfahrung in der Umsetzung von Integrationstests
Erfahrung mit Werkzeugen aus dem Business Intelligence und Data Science Umfeld
Erfahrung mit Tableau Software, Alteryx, Amazon Web Services

Benefits


Du bist Teil eines jungen und dynamischen Teams
Aktive Mitgestaltung im Unternehmen und eigenständiges Arbeiten gehören zu den Grundpfeilern unserer Unternehmensphilosophie
Etablierung von neuen Prozessen und gestalterische Freiheiten bei der Nutzung von Tools
Verwendung der modernsten Werkzeuge im Bereich Überwachung, Steuerung und Analyse von Infrastruktur und Betrieb von Services (z.B. in Amazon Web Services)
Branchenübergreifende Projekt bei namhaften, internationalen Kunden

Fit Analytics ( http://www.fitanalytics.com/ ) — the world's leading sizing solution for apparel & footwear — is looking for a motivated full-time Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f/d). You will work with our development teams to ensure that we provide a reliable service with the highest possible quality. If you're ready to use your skills to shape the future of the online fashion industry and you are not afraid of billions of requests a day, we want to hear from you!

Who We Are

Based in Berlin and Chicago, we're a team of data scientists, fashionistas, physicists, business analysts, designers, and hackers, working together to tackle a single problem: making it easy for online shoppers to find the right clothes size. We help some of the world's largest clothing brands solve sizing issues, boost conversions and slash returns.

What We Do

The Fit Analytics' platform combines the world's largest database of garment and fit information with hundreds of billions of purchase records and consumer preferences. Our products Fit Finder, Fit Connect, Fit Intelligence and Fit Source help clothing and apparel companies instantly access the power of machine learning to deliver a perfect fit for customers. By applying the power of machine learning to this unique data set, we've created a range of innovative solutions to help drive improvements throughout the apparel lifecycle from manufacturing to marketing. Leading apparel brands and retailers across six continents trust our platform to solve sizing at scale and deliver meaningful bottom-line impact. Our clients include the likes of Zara, Asos, Hugo Boss, JD Sports, Bershka, The North Face, Tommy Hilfiger, Uniqlo, Calvin Klein and many more!

What The Role Involves


Managing and enhancing our cloud production and staging environments
Implementing and advocating for using CI/CD delivery best practices across the engineering teams
Collaborating with passionate technologists across multiple disciplines to ensure security, resilience and performance requirements
Mentoring Junior DevOps Engineers and Developers
Improving our monitoring system and alert reporting
Having a direct impact on how tens of millions of people buy clothes online

What We're Looking for in You


Extensive experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) products or Amazon Web Services (AWS) products is a must
2+ years hands-on experience with Kubernetes and Docker
Good knowledge of infrastructure automation with Terraform
Good knowledge of network infrastructure design
In-depth understanding of web technologies
Experience with git
Good programming skills in at least one high level language, preferably in Golang or Node.js
Fluent English and excellent communication skills

What We Offer You


Hands-on experience building a product that is revolutionizing the apparel & footwear market
The opportunity to become a key part of Fit Analytics' growth story
A competitive salary
A spot in our smart, creative and highly motivated international team
Daily breakfast and lunch plus regular team events

Why We're Different

We're not sitting around wondering what the product is and burning other people's money while expecting everyone to work ridiculous hours for little reward. We're profitable, organized, and already providing a unique solution that delivers huge value to our partners while helping millions of people a month shop better online.

If you're excellent at what you do and want to apply those skills to solving a genuinely challenging problem together with a great bunch of people, you've come to the right place. To take the next step, send us your CV and a brief message explaining why you're the perfect fit!

ABOUT THE TEAM

As Principal Product Manager Core Payments you lead the product development of the Core Payments/Checkout department. Your direct area of responsibility covers all payment related user experiences, the API and SDK for merchants that integrate our payment offering into their e-commerce solution and the processing of payment related financial transactions for all the various payment methods we support currently in 17 European markets.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED


You will lead a team of product managers and product analysts that drive the product development with the various engineering teams and make sure that they apply efficient product development practices with predictable outcome.
You will drive the product roadmap for Core Payments and align it with other departments within Zalando Payments, but also stakeholders outside Payments.
You will contribute to the product strategy and product portfolio management of Zalando Payments and help identifying the right partners for those aspects of our product that we do not want to build ourselves.
You are a company-wide thought leader for payment solutions and help our clients in identifying how payment solutions can best support their business goals, based on your strong understanding of end-customers needs and behaviour.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


Visionary leader: You can develop and communicate a product vision that excites your team and the engineering teams, who together translate your vision into solutions. You know how to break down a long term vision into clearly shaped and value generating milestones, so that your teams can autonomously make the right decisions during execution.
Payments Professional: You've worked as product manager in the payments domain, ideally payments service provider or e-commerce company, covering all aspects of payments processes and user experiences. You are very aware of compliance topics and legal requirements around payment services within Europe and apply this in the specification of your product proposals.
Customer obsession, KPI and data driven: You always strive for a thorough understanding of your customer's problem before analyzing what it takes to build a solution and make it profitable. Using data and research to correctly understand customer behaviour is an essential part of your approach to product management. You know how to find the appropriate KPI that allow you to define success and track incremental progress.
Tech savvy: You challenge the solutions proposed by engineering teams and partners. You can ask the right questions that give you the confidence that proposals meet your expectations (both functional as non-functional).
Storm seeker: You enjoy working right in the eye of the storm of a multi-sided-business. You love to seek for solutions that balance the often conflicting demands and desires of consumers, merchants, developers.

PERKS AT WORK


Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source ( https://opensource.zalando.com/ ) commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds ( https://jobs.zalando.com/tech/blog/dublin-data-science-guild/ ), knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs ( https://jobs.zalando.com/tech/blog/ ), product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding ( https://jobs.zalando.com/tech/blog/all-aboard/ ), mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in selected locations)

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO

Zalando is Europe's leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages ( https://opensource.zalando.com/tech-radar/ ) our teams choose to use.

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined


PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings

WHICH PRODUCT TEAMS


Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. As a Product Analyst in the content composition team, you will work with data scientists and engineers, draw insights from the complex interaction of content, customers, and Zalando’s business and help to understand why which content is successful in front of the customer. A Pricing Data Analyst in our Pricing & Forecasting team is passionate about creating accurate data solutions and have a proven record of developing trusting relationships with product and commercial leads who will turn your insights into actions.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Build and improve upon the system which measures sales forecasting, price optimisation and customer lifetime value
Act as the point of contact between Analytics and external product, engineering and ops teams to ensure key projects are successful
Build and own periodic reporting - Take advantage of the ever-growing amount of data we have at our fingertips to help stakeholders build best in class forecasting tools
Managing and leading key initiatives in the Analytics team and Pricing & Forecasting
Mentor and guide junior members of the Analytics team
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
3+ years of experience using data to build analytical solutions at industry leading companies in Technology, Retail or e-commerce.
Ability to turn complex findings and results into a compelling narrative and a set of actions
Familiarity with SQL and an objection-oriented programing language (Python, R,Java)

ABOUT ZALANDO
The Pricing & Forecasting Department plays a pivotal role in the organisation by producing algorithmic-based price recommendations, forecasting sales, defining and implementing pricing strategies across 16 countries and 500k articles . The Department is a self-sufficient team of product, engineering, Analytics and operations. As a member of the Pricing Analytics team, you’ll build tools and data products that impacts millions of Zalando shoppers, the top and bottom line of our company and the many internal teams that rely on your analytics solutions.
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form – we do not accept applications via e-mail.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings

ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

Your profile:
You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDE
Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.
Understand and solve business challenges to achieve Operational Excellence in fluent business processes.
Work in collaboration with Software Engineering, Analytics and Product, other internal teams and resources to enable data-supported decision making.
Identify gaps and create strategies that help us and other teams scale.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
An analytical & entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
A business/data analyst with hands-on experience with statistical research techniques such as linear/non-linear regression, time-series modeling, sample size estimation, statistical tests, etc.
Experience in data engineering, ETLs, data modeling and data visualization with a high fluency in Python/R and SQL
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment.
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

As a Product Analyst in Team Attribution, you will be a part of a high-impact team that plays a pivotal role in optimizing Zalando's onsite content.
We build attribution models quantifying the financial impact of Zalando's inspirational features & campaigns.
You will be empowering our biggest client partners as well as internal stakeholders to analyze media content on Zalando web and app-based on real-time data. Your primary role would involve deep-diving into our vast data sources to develop creative solutions & analyses providing insights to our stakeholders.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Work with large, complex data sets applying advanced analytical methods to solve challenging use cases & customer problems.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Responsible for conducting data analysis to make business recommendations and building impactful data visualizations.
Experience in formulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to answer business questions.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BA/BS or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
3+ years of experience in a data-intensive analytics role such as Digital Analytics, Product Analytics or Business Intelligence
Strong proficiency with SQL- based languages. Experience with BigQuery, Python is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Nice to have:
Knowledge of statistical packages (Python/R, etc.)
Google Analytics Certification/experience
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles, we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Unser Auftraggeber gehört zu den 20 größten Textilien-Händlern Deutschlands und kann mit inzwischen 18.000 Mitarbeiter*innen in über 40 Ländern auf eine fast 50 jährige Geschichte zurückblicken. Mit stetigem Streben nach Individualität und Experimentierfreude hat das Unternehmen sich eine stabile Wachstumskurve erarbeitet. Das soll auch so weitergehen: von Braunschweig und Berlin in die ganze Welt!
Als BI-Analyst DAX (d/m/w) nehmen Sie sich der (Ad-Hoc-)Analyse der Unternehmensdaten an. Nebst Optimierung und Harmonisierung bereiten Sie die Quintessenz anschaulich für Fachbereiche und GF auf und rocken via ETL-Prozessen, DAX-Abfragen und Co. die ganze Bandbreite an Aufgaben rund um den MS BI-Stack. In Projekten ist auf Ihre Expertise Verlass, das Controlling freut sich in Sachen Kennzahlen, Berichte und mehr auf Sie.
Was bietet mir diese Position?
als Teil eines internationalen und -disziplinären Teams versiegt Ihre Lernkurve nie
in 30 Tagen Urlaub lässt es sich prima entspannen
eine betrieblich Altersvorsorge ist auch mit dabei
Sie können von diversen Vergünstigungen profitieren, wie Mitarbeiterrabatten und Sportangebot
Was werden meine Aufgaben sein?
versiert führen Sie (Ad-Hoc-)Analysen für Fachbereiche und GF durch und identifizieren Optimierungspotenziale sowie eine mögliche Harmonisierung der Daten
die entsprechenden Ergebnisse werden von Ihnen mit Blick auf Ziel- und Nutzerorientierung gekonnt aufbereitet und visualisiert
als Sparringspartner für Fachbereiche und Controlling wirken Sie bei der Definition von BI-Anwendungsfällen, Kennzahlensystemen, Berichten und Cockpits mit
Ihre Tätigkeit umfasst alles, was das MS BI-Herz begehrt: ETL-Prozesse, Datenmodelle (Staging, Core, Cube/Tabular), DAX-Abfragen etc.
zudem obliegt Ihnen die Umsetzung von BI-Projekten innerhalb eines interdisziplinären Teams
Support, Betrieb, Administration, Monitoring und Deployment der geliebten MS BI-Produkte meistern Sie mit links
den jeweils anderen Standort (Braunschweig oder Berlin) erfreuen Sie regelmäßig mit Ihrer Anwesenheit
Was sollte ich mitbringen?
ob (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, BWL oder Ökonometrie-Studium – mit einem Abschluss in einem dieser oder vergleichbaren Bereiche gehen Sie an den Start
im Anschluss haben Sie sich Ihre Sporen im BI-Beratungsumfeld verdient
daher durchblicken Sie Geschäftsprozesse mit adleräugiger Schärfe
Ihr Wissen rund um DAX, OLAP/Power BI sowie Optimierung und Statistik kann sich mehr als sehen lassen
ergänzt wird dies durch Ihre Kenntnisse des MS BI-Stacks (MSSQL, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS) in Kombination mit BI-Architektur- und Vorgehensmodellen
Sie legen neben hoher Eigenmotivation eine tiefes Dienstleisterverständnis an den Tag
als echter Teamplayer packen Sie mit an und wissen jeden Ansprechpartner kommunikativ gekonnt zu handeln
ob dabei auf Deutsch oder Englisch ist egal – beides ist für Sie kein Problem
Was ist ein Plus? (aber keine Voraussetzung)
Erfahrungen aus einem Handelsunternehmen kommen hier immer gut an
sollten Sie sich auch noch mit Data Mining auskennen, ziehen wir den Hut!

Wenn Ihnen das gefällt, schicken Sie mir einfach Ihre Unterlagen zu, sehr gerne auch per Mail. In einem ersten Gespräch können wir dann ganz offen über den Auftraggeber und alle Details zur Position sprechen.
Viele Grüße
Marcel Engling
IT-Personalberater
E-Mail: marcel.engling@nextlevel.de
Telefon: 0221 - 998 991 982

job_title: Product Manager - Home Seller Acquisition & Engagement (m/f/d)
full_text:
Responsibilities and goals you own:

As part of the Sales Journey you are part of the largest department at Immobilienscout24
Together with our team you develop features that convince owners to manage their sales projects via Immobilienscout24
You will work in a creative, agile environment and develop great user-centric products with a cross-functional team
Our team consists of UX designers, UX researchers, data analysts, marketing managers and software developers
You will be responsible for KPIs, product roadmap and strategy and will closely coordinate with all stakeholders involved

Who will love this job:

You are interested in taking Immobilienscout24 to the next level as part of an agile and ambitious team
You already have experience as a product manager in a digital company and understand online marketing to acquire new users
You have practical experience in idea generation and validation of new digital products and are familiar with the relevant methods
You have developed products together with agile development teams in a responsible role and are familiar with the methods for prioritizing and working with developers
You work independently and your approach is highly pragmatic, analytical and data-driven
You keep up to date with the latest trends and technologies and incorporate them into your product development
You speak good German and English

What you can expect from us:
For 20 years now we are an agile, dynamic and multicultural company. Talents can make a difference and support our customer every single day. What awaits you:


An environment that provides the opportunity for impact you would find in a start-up combined with the resources of a market leader
Competitive salaries, an attractive company pension plan and personal benefits such as gym membership discount as a start
Great work-life balance, including flexible working hours, home office and 30 days of vacation annually
Personal development trough individual trainings, language courses, workshops and seminars
Personal Benefits, such as price reduction at the gym or the cafeteria
Fresh fruits every day and of course free drinks
We celebrate achievements together with: team events, summer festival, Oktoberfest and Christmas party
We are a dog-friendly office
Got curious? Then take a look behind the scenes: working at Scout ( https://walls.io/scout24 )

We are looking forward to get to know you!

Capgemini ist einer der weltweit führenden Anbieter von Management- und IT-Beratung, Technologie-Services und Digitaler Transformation. Wir bieten dir ein tolles Team, schnelle Aufstiegschancen, herausfordernde Tätigkeiten mit Freiheiten und Verantwortung – auch in Teilzeit.
Die Welt wird digital. Unser Ziel ist es bei der Digitalisierung an der Spitze zu stehen und gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden wertschöpfende Konzepte und Lösungen umzusetzen. Dafür suchen wir Experten und Expertinnen, die im Digital Commerce und Digital Advertising etwas bewegt haben und bewegen wollen.

Ihre Aufgaben
Beratung von namhaften Kunden im Bereich Display und Online Advertising
Analyse von bestehenden Kampagnen (z.B. Trigger-Based Kampagnen) und eingesetzten Technologien
Erstellen von User Centricity Konzepten unter Einbezug von Programmatic Advertising Ansätzen
Konzeption von Technologielandschaften, Beratung bei der Auswahl und Begleitung bei der Implementierung neuer Technologien (z.B. DMP, DSP, SSP, Adserver…)
Administration, Nutzung und Ausbau der eingesetzten Display Advertising Technologien
Setup, Umsetzung und Optimierung von Reichweiten-, Prospecting- und Retargeting-Kampagnen entlang der Customer Journey (mittels programmatischem und klassischem Mediaeinkauf)
Sie halten Trainings für Mitarbeiter
Durchführung von Testing und Qualitätsmanagement
Ihr Profil
Mehrjährige strategische und operative Erfahrung im Bereich Display Advertising (Reichweite, Prospecting, Real Time Bidding) auf allen gängigen Devices
Langjährige Erfahrung im Konzipieren, Aufsetzen und Steuern von RTB/RTA Kampagnen (Adserving, DSP, SSP, Dynamic Creative Optimization)
Erfahrungen bei der Einführung einer DMP und deren Nutzung zur Aussteuerung von Kampagnen
Tiefgreifendes technologisches Know-how im Bereich Adserving, Tracking, Visibility-Messung, Pixel-Erstellung, -Ausspielung und -Einbau in Tag-Management-Systeme
Starke analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten
Gute Vernetzung in der Branche und Kenntnisse der aktuellen Technologie-Landschaft
Kollaborationsfähigkeit mit anderen Experten (z.B. UX und UI Designer / Data-Analysten / Developern)
Projektabhängige Reisebereitschaft, sehr gute Englischkenntnisse sowie Präsentations-Skills sind für Sie selbstverständlich
Bewerben Sie sich jetzt

Zwei Wege zum Topjob: Direkt und unkompliziert über unser System oder per Mail an ts-bewerben.de@capgemini.com. Bei Fragen steht Ihnen Melanie Meßner (+49 89 38 338 2554) zur Seite. Diese Anzeige ist online, solange die Stelle verfügbar ist. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre aussagekräftige Bewerbung.

Sie möchten Innovationen vorantreiben und zukunftsweisende IT-Projekte mit tollen Kollegen gestalten? Sie wollen eine offene Arbeitsweise im Team erleben und die Freiheit haben, das Richtige zu tun? Dann starten Sie Ihre Karriere bei Capgemini!

Mehr Infos

Erfahren Sie hier mehr zu unserem Bewerbungsprozess und erhalten Sie Tipps für Ihre Bewerbung. Steigen Sie jetzt bei Capgemini ein und profitieren Sie von unseren zahlreichen Benefits, wie Gesundheitsschutz, Mitarbeiterrabatten und flexiblen Arbeitszeitmodellen.

Mehr Informationen zum IT-Berufsfeld bei Capgemini und unseren Standorten in Deutschland finden Sie auf unserer Karriereseite.

Wir wollen einen klasse Mix. Und freuen uns ganz besonders auf Bewerbungen von Kolleginnen in spe.

Full time, Berlin

Freshworks is looking for an exceptional addition to our Customer Success team in Berlin. Being a customer champion is part of our culture and a guideline for anything we do. Our team plays a central role in this effort and is the primary driver to retain and develop our existing customers.
As a Customer Success Manager (CSM), you will act as a strategic consultant and trusted advisor to our mid-market and enterprise customers. You dedicatedly engage with key partners and help them use the Freshworks platform fully. The foundation for this engagement is a precise understanding of our solution as well as in-depth knowledge of the client's business and industry trends.

Your role and responsibilities:
1. Build deep relationships and drive product adoption
Work along with a pre-defined group of our largest and most important customers. Establish connections to partners ranging from support agents to CxOs.
Engage with customers in a dedicated and regular manner e.g. in quarterly business reviews, roadmap presentations and product trainings
Understand and document customer’s organization, its needs, goals and challenges.
Educate and train customers on the best ways to use our products and its new features. Help them to follow data driven approaches and measure KPIs.
2. Retain customers
Analyze product usage data to actively take necessary actions to improve product adoption and reduce churn
Conduct diagnostics and identify gaps in the customer’s product setup and processes. Evangelize and guide customers to implement improvements.
Develop creative solutions in collaboration with technical experts in case the standard feature set is not sufficient to meet customer needs.
3. Inspire customer growth and advocacy
Work together with the Account Management team to discover opportunities for growth and drive net expansion.
Promote awareness of Freshworks’ latest innovations and motivate customers to become references, participate in events and contribute to case studies.
Find new and creative ways to create “moments of wow” for our customers.
Our perfect match
Experience in a customer facing role. Experience with consulting or account management a big plus
Bachelor's degree. Engineering background is advantageous.
Communicates clearly and with empathy to become a trusted advisor for our clients.
Collaborates effectively with different internal teams (e.g., sales, marketing, product, support).
Enjoys learning about Freshworks’ products and their technical foundation.
Shows business insight to understand client’s needs and keeps a professional attitude.
Combines an analytical mindset with a can-do attitude. Identifies root causes and develops adequate solutions quickly.
Manages multiple projects at ease and can quickly switch context from technical to business topics.
Willingness to travel, as much as 25% of the time will be spent at client’s offices
Fluency in English and German. Fluency in other EU languages is a plus.

These are some benefits you can expect from us in return:
Great opportunity to build the European presence of a fast-paced global growth startup from scratch
Flexible career development path within an international environment
A fun startup work environment in the middle of Berlin
Work closely with inspiring, encouraging and interesting colleagues in an international team within a flat organizational hierarchy
Fully stocked pantry with healthy fruits, snacks, coffee, and breakfast options
Weekly family lunch and quarterly team building events
Weekly yoga class and gym membership contribution
Educational reimbursement of 65% including learning a new language
Team gatherings and company parties!

About Freshworks:
Freshworks provides innovative customer engagement software for businesses of all sizes, making it easy for teams to acquire, close, and keep their customers for life. Freshworks Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) products provide a 360-degree view of the customer, are ready to go, easy to use, and offer quick return on investment. Headquartered in San Mateo, USA, Freshworks 2,000+ team members work in offices throughout the world. Freshworks has global offices in India, Singapore, Australia, UK, Netherlands, France and Germany. The company counts over 220,000 businesses in its customer-for-life community around the world including Honda, Bridgestone, Hugo Boss, University of Pennsylvania, Toshiba, Sling TV, Sotheby’s and Cisco.

Freshworks’ suite of products that transform the way world class organizations collaborate with customers and co-workers, include Freshdesk (Omni-channel customer support), Freshservice (IT Service Desk), Freshsales (Intuitive fully-integrated CRM), Freshmarketer (Marketing Automation Suite), Freshteam (HR Management System for growing teams), Freshchat (Modern messaging software) and Freshcaller (Cloud PBX system).

Freshworks has received numerous accolades from analysts and media including making it to Forbes’ Cloud 100 list, Economic Times Startup of the Year, 2019 LinkedIn Top 25 Companies to work for in India and a listing on the Magic Quadrant for CRM Customer Engagement & IT Service Management. While Freshworks has had incredible organic growth over the last few years, the company also has made targeted acquisitions that add critical capabilities to the portfolio including Natural Language Processing, Chatbots, Machine Learning, Social and Messaging Transformation. Freshworks has raised over $250 million in capital and is funded by Accel, CapitalG, Sequoia Capital and Tiger Global Management. More information is available at: www.Freshworks.com.

job_title: Team Lead Real Time Manager Customer Care
full_text:
Responsible for Real Time Management across 15 sites and 17 markets with several service providers and Inhouse teams in a multicultural environment. You drive and implement meaningful initiatives and together with other internal teams you will optimize the current process and increase our productivity.

------------------------------
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
------------------------------


Lead a team of 10 Real-Time Analysts and act like an owner by optimizing the business and improving channel handling
Monitor operational business in real-time and detect possible deviations in forecast, productivity and staffing levels to deliver the expected SLA. Enable quick decision making and incorporate findings into future learnings
Team up closely with our Operations Management, Vendor Management and other internal and external key stakeholders
Ensure that Intraday strategies are aligned within the whole Workforce Management Department (Forecasting and Scheduling)

----------------------------
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
----------------------------


Min. 3 years of experience in Real Time Management, in a senior or leadership role, with proven experience in a multi channel environment (Chat, Call, Mail, Social Media) and advanced steering technical set up
Great leadership skills with the passion to build and strengthen your team by developing and coaching them in their careers
Strong strategic and customer focus with a clear understanding of the wider issues impacting the relevant markets
An ability to break down complex problems and prioritize them effectively, backing up with solid data.Keep an eye on the required resources, you give confident instructions and keep several plates spinning at the same time to ensure deadlines are met
Great communication skills in a professional and intercultural environment, fluency in English and German. Other languages are highly desired

-------------
PERKS AT WORK
-------------


A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings

-------------

Zalando is Europe's leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
