job_title: Global Supply Chain Analyst (Business Systems Developer)

full_text:
Full time, Berlin

Are you ready to boost your career working for one of the coolest SaaS companies in the market?

In this role, you will have the unique opportunity to help reshape the Customer Engagement market. As a Product Marketing Manager for Freshworks, you will help build a multi-billion company by planning and developing cutting edge strategies. And you will be part of a super creative, fun and multicultural team, you will also work closely with our top-notch teams in Chennai, India.

Your role and responsibilities:
Develop product positioning that differentiates Freshdesk by understanding customer needs, product roadmap, market trends, and competitive forces
Plan and execute product/feature launches across cross-functional teams (spanning Product, Marketing, Support, Service, Sales) and related sales enablement
Work with Product Management to establish a continuous feedback loop (encompassing market trends, customer needs, and competitive factors) to influence the product development roadmap and mitigate product gaps
Build a profile of the Freshdesk buyer across various industries, verticals, and business roles
Collaborate with Sales to understand & support ongoing enablement, and maximize the impact of messaging for the mid-market and enterprise audience
Content, Campaigns:
Partner with Product Management and Sales to develop a new narrative for Freshdesk Customer Experience and a comprehensive strategy for bringing this solution to market
Drive the production and aggregation of high fidelity Customer Experience related content (marketing, thought-leadership, product demos, webinars, datasheets, solution guides, etc.) for all funnel stages by partnering with the industry's leading creative team
Identify, enable, and champion our community of Customers for Life in customer stories, videos, and events
Go-To-Market & Sales Enablement:
Enable Freshworks' global sales and solution engineering teams to ensure that they are able to identify opportunities, position our solution, and drive deals to close
Create compelling and useful enablement assets such as playbooks, deal wins, training decks, FAQs, and videos
Partner with Solution Engineering to build killer demo assets and stories that wow customers
Partner with Sales Strategy to create pricing, packaging, and sales incentives that make Freshdesk Customer Experience easy for AEs to sell and easy for customers to purchase
Stakeholder Management:
Build consensus, alignment and engagement across Campaigns, Creative, Product Marketing, Product Management, Sales, Pricing Strategy, and Customer Success

Our perfect match:
Experience in product marketing
Strong understanding of the cloud enterprise application space such as Customer Service software or CRM software
Enthusiasm and empathy for genuinely improving how businesses serve and engage people
Can quickly synthesize disparate data into a ‘position’ and craft messaging that connects with both internal stakeholders and customers
Outstanding storytelling capabilities: crafting a written or visual story in a simple straightforward way
Strong analytical skills and passion for analyzing products, competitors, and market dynamics
Creative thinker that can generate innovative marketing ideas, work collaboratively, and lead a cross-functional team of stakeholders to drive execution
Proven ability to work well cross-functionally and with customers

These are some benefits you can expect from us in return:
Excellent chance to define the European presence of a dynamic global growth startup from scratch
Flexible career development path within an international environment
A fun startup work environment in the middle of Berlin
Work closely with inspiring, encouraging and interesting colleagues in an international team within a flat organizational hierarchy
Fully stocked pantry with healthy fruits, snacks, gourmet coffee, and breakfast options
Weekly family lunch and quarterly team building events
Partial financial assistance for German language courses
Weekly yoga class and gym membership contribution
Educational reimbursement of up to 65%
Team gatherings and company parties!

Sounds interesting?
Then please apply here via our website and share your salary expectations as well as the earliest date you can join us. Feel free to visit our website to find out about other job postings.

About Freshworks
Freshworks provides innovative customer engagement software for businesses of all sizes, making it easy for teams to acquire, close, and keep their customers for life. Freshworks Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) products provide a 360-degree view of the customer, are ready to go, easy to use, and offer quick return on investment. Headquartered in San Mateo, USA, Freshworks 2,000+ team members work in offices throughout the world. Freshworks has global offices in India, Singapore, Australia, UK, Netherlands, France and Germany. The company counts over 220,000 businesses in its customer-for-life community around the world including Honda, Bridgestone, Hugo Boss, University of Pennsylvania, Toshiba, Sling TV, Sotheby’s and Cisco.

Freshworks’ suite of products that transform the way world class organizations collaborate with customers and co-workers, include Freshdesk (Omni-channel customer support), Freshservice (IT Service Desk), Freshsales (Intuitive fully-integrated CRM), Freshmarketer (Marketing Automation Suite), Freshteam (HR Management System for growing teams), Freshchat (Modern messaging software) and Freshcaller (Cloud PBX system).

Freshworks has received numerous accolades from analysts and media including making it to Forbes’ Cloud 100 list, Economic Times Startup of the Year, 2019 LinkedIn Top 25 Companies to work for in India and a listing on the Magic Quadrant for CRM Customer Engagement & IT Service Management. While Freshworks has had incredible organic growth over the last few years, the company also has made targeted acquisitions that add critical capabilities to the portfolio including Natural Language Processing, Chatbots, Machine Learning, Social and Messaging Transformation. Freshworks has raised over $250 million in capital and is funded by Accel, CapitalG, Sequoia Capital and Tiger Global Management. More information is available at: www.Freshworks.com.

The Markets team is responsible for managing AMBOSS’ regions and their performance across all business-relevant metrics.
We’re looking for an insights-driven and commercial-savvy Market Analyst to proactively and continuously support our growth efforts in our key markets.
As Market Analyst, you will be responsible for business analysis and insights holistically across user-, financial-, and qualitative data. You will be the data and analytics sparring partner to the Market Lead and work daily to uncover business insights that will help guide market success in our key markets and drive strategic decision-making. Above all, you will be at the nexus of data science and business at one of the most innovative healthcare companies in the world.
In addition to possessing a strong technical background, you are a natural communicator who is able to explain complex statistical frameworks to non-technical stakeholders. You’re curious with a good business understanding and comfortable translating data into actionable insights.
What you’ll do
Own the process, framework, output of market analysis and business reviews, and growth initiatives as part of the market business plan
Proactively identify and analyze new business and growth opportunities for the expansion of our business (B2C and/or B2B) in one of our key markets
Support the market leadership with research on key business initiatives and challenges as well as strategic deep dives
Develop a robust body of knowledge around key audiences and markets to proactively address business questions and drive market strategy
Help drive quant and qual actionable insights to the commercial teams (Performance Marketing, CRM, Field Marketing, Influencer Marketing, B2B, etc.) and senior management in one of our key markets
Produce day-to-day analytics and insights for the respective market
Track the periodic performance of market-important business metrics
Maintain strong working relationships across teams, adding business insights value where appropriate
Who you are
Strong SQL experience required, experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Tableau, Metabase), ideally experience with Python or R
Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or another quantitative field
3+ years of experience working with analytics, preferably experience from start-ups
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
You have strong Excel / Google Sheets skills and are comfortable with making compelling visualization and presentations in PowerPoint / Google Slides
Comfortable with operating independently in a fast-paced work environment
You are an inherently curious, organized person who loves using data to inform decisions
You are a self-starter with excellent time-management skills, the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks, and who takes pride in their final product

THE AMBOSS PRESCRIPTION
Set your own biological clock: choose flextime and home office options.
Keep the hemoglobin flowing: enjoy our fitness and wellness program with a sponsored gym membership.
Need more serotonin? Join our monthly team events, game nights, and weekly language lunches.
Keeps those synapses firing: profit from ongoing learning opportunities with our educational seminars, “crosstalks”, and development programs.
No risk of high cholesterol here! At our office, you will find freshly cooked lunches, healthy snacks, and an amazing Italian espresso machine.
Your doctor recommends time-off your feet? We got you! Enjoy our employee mobility perks, such as a yearly public transportation card. Or, if you want a little exercise, there is a sponsored bike waiting for you.
Reduce the childcare-associated build-up of cortisol! Have your child join our AMBOSS Daycare when your Kita is closed or bridge a gap until you have found a daycare spot.
We believe it is impossible to put every type of diversity into words. We always have and always will live with the intention that every person, from every background and demographic is welcome. Whoever you are, and wherever you come from, we believe you have something to add to our mission.

Does this sound like the place you have been looking for? Get in touch! We are looking forward to receiving your application.

We are looking for the right people to join our well-funded, growing open source startup and to help us to continue to build exciting technology that make our users happy. Right now, we are looking for a full-time Java developer to join our team in Berlin.*
Who are you?
You graduated in computer science or have comparable experience and have already worked on one or more larger software projects for some time. Java is your favorite language and when writing software you’re not looking for the quickest solution but always have the “bigger picture” and performance in your mind. You also enjoy thinking about reusability and design patterns. If you are happy every time you find a problem while writing test cases for your code then you’ll get along great with our QA team. You’d be a good candidate for our Big Data Development Team if Spark doesn’t just mean lighting a fire and you’re already familiar with the framework and have used it. Other nice-to-haves are experience with additional frameworks such as SQL databases as well as Cloud environments. Last but not least you’re fluent in English, which is our working language. Being fluent in German is a plus, but not required.
What’s the job?
You will be part of an agile team that integrates various Big Data frameworks into our product. You will scale out the execution of jobs by KNIME Server to many machines and in the cloud. You will be helping non-expert users to seamlessly use the computation power of the integrated frameworks. Our Data Scientists will come to you as the technical expert to help them to provide solutions for our users. You will also be involved in the decision which framework should be integrated next. As part of your role, you’ll be able to work with a broad spectrum of frameworks such as big data frameworks, databases, Cloud Frameworks and apply a wide range of technologies. Not an expert on all of these? No problem, as learning is also part of the job!
Who are we?
We are a rapidly growing, young company developing analytics software for performing advanced data science. We are a highly interactive team and very enthusiastic about developing solutions for our users. Our open source KNIME Analytics Platform, developed together with the community, is transforming the data science landscape. It is popular among its very active user community as well as among IT analysts, who regularly place us in their "leaders" category - next to some still surprised industry dinosaurs. Our commercial KNIME Server enables enterprises to responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.
How to apply?
If you think you would be a great fit and would like to learn together with us, apply by sending your application. On top of your usual dossier, please tell us about an earlier project you are particularly proud of, e.g., by providing a short summary or a link to a GitHub repository you have contributed to.

Though we are happy to have applicants from further away, we’re not offering relocation benefits for this position

Be part of the next big thing in travel and join Zizoo, the world's leading boat holiday platform. Named one of Forbes' top 'Travel Tech Startups Taking Europe by Storm', Zizoo is bringing boat holidays to the mass market, offering over 30,000 boat products across 500+ destinations worldwide. Zizoo's unique business model and tech suite sets it apart from the competition by monopolising supply and demand while offering a seamless booking experience to the end customer. Backed by Europe's leading tech investors, Zizoo's team is growing fast as we continue to transform the travel industry.

------------------
Your Mission
------------------


Optimize data visualization
Maintain and build ETL pipelines
Create analysis based on specifications from stakeholders
Stakeholder management and consultation in any data related questions
Analyse data trends and elaboration of an understanding for development
Identify metrics, KPIs and any data needs to support various business units
Collaborate with data colleagues and product owners

--------------
Qualifications
--------------


At least 5-years in a Data Analyst position or similar
Expert with writing SQLs including query optimization
Building pipelines for new data sources and model them to the DWH
Strong Tableau experience
Has data modeling knowledge,processing and storing large and (un)structured data for analytical purposes
Experience with analytical databases like Redshift
Experience in marketing analytics such as Google Ads, Bing etc
Strong analytical and statistical analysis skills in order to extract insights and recommendations
Experience in Xplenty ,Snowplow and Python is a plus
Fluent in English with strong communication skills (both written and verbal)

-------------
What We Offer
-------------


A transparent data-driven environment where good ideas flourish. Got a good idea? We'll test it!
The possibility to experiment with new technology
Cross-company personal development and training budget
An opportunity to work in one of Europe's trending startups
Team building events and a sailing holiday for the whole team
And, of course, boat holiday discounts!

To apply please email your CV to jobs@zizooboats.com with the Subject Line "ZIZOO Senior DevOps Engineer"

Fit Analytics ( http://www.fitanalytics.com/ ) — the world's leading sizing solution for apparel & footwear — is seeking a highly motivated and driven Head of Account Management based in Berlin. You will take ownership of the entire account management cycle at Fit Analytics. If you're ready to use your skills to help shape the future of the online fashion industry, we want to hear from you!

Who We Are

Based in Berlin and Chicago, we're a team of data scientists, fashionistas, physicists, business analysts, designers, and hackers, working together to tackle a single problem: making it easy for online shoppers to find clothes and footwear that fit. We help some of the world's largest clothing brands solve sizing issues, boost conversions and slash returns.

What We Do

The Fit Analytics' platform combines the world's largest database of garment and fit information with hundreds of billions of purchase records and consumer preferences. By applying the power of machine learning to this unique data set, we've created a range of innovative solutions to help drive improvements throughout the apparel lifecycle from manufacturing to marketing. Our products Fit Finder, Fit Connect, Fit Intelligence and Fit Source help apparel and footwear companies to deliver a perfect fit for customers. Leading apparel brands and retailers across six continents trust our platform to solve sizing at scale and deliver meaningful bottom-line impact. Our clients include the likes of Asos, JD Sports, Bershka, The North Face, Tommy Hilfiger, Uniqlo, Calvin Klein and many more!

What the Role Involves


Leading, mentoring, and growing the Account Management team (Integration + Client Success team)
Providing clear objectives for your team, monitoring and making sure that these are being met
Ensuring a high level of customer retention rate with a clear focus on increasing revenue through up-selling of new products and services
Overseeing the smooth on-boarding of all new clients in collaboration with the Integration team
Leading the business's strategic account planning processes per client including renewals and upsells as well as performance objectives and ROI demonstration in collaboration with the Client Success team
Forecasting and tracking key account metrics such as integration time, churn and revenue retention & growth
Taking ownership of cross-departmental projects and processes
Sharing important customer data and insights with the Product and the R&D team with the goal of influencing internal strategy and securing client success
Defining data and data collection requirements for optimizing our products together with the product and R&D teams
Educating our clients concerning information and data needs to maximize the impact on their business success

What We're Looking for in You


University degree in Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Business or a related field
10+ years experience in account management, ideally in a SaaS or Software company
Previous experience in building and managing a team and experience with b2b accounts
Structured, highly-organized, thorough and persistent, with a "can do" attitude
Extraordinary analytical skills
Ability to handle high-pressure phases with many simultaneous client requests and to prioritize those requests
Curiosity and drive in order to improve current processes

What We Offer You


Hands-on experience building a product that is revolutionizing the apparel & footwear market
The opportunity to become a key part of Fit Analytics' growth story
A competitive salary
A spot in our smart, creative, and highly motivated international team
Daily breakfast and lunch plus regular team events

Why We're Different

We're not sitting around wondering what the product is and burning other people's money while expecting everyone to work ridiculous hours for little reward. We're profitable, organized, and already providing a unique solution that delivers huge value to our partners while helping millions of people shop better online.

If you're excellent at what you do and want to apply those skills to solving a genuinely hard problem together with a great bunch of people, you've come to the right place. To take the next step, send us your CV and a brief message explaining why you're the perfect fit!

At HelloFresh, our mission is to change the way people eat - forever. From our 2011 founding in Europe's vibrant tech hub Berlin, we've become the global market leader in the meal kit sector and inspire millions of energised home cooks across the globe every week.

We offer our meal kit boxes full of exciting recipes and thoughtfully sourced, fresh ingredients in more than 12 countries, operating from offices in Berlin, New York City, Sydney, Toronto, London, Amsterdam and Copenhagen and shipped out more than 250 Million meals in 2019. Our more than 5,000 employees are the heart and soul of our highly international, fast-paced, and dynamic environment where innovation and smart, fast action is encouraged.

We want you to join us and help take HelloFresh to the next level - as a company in its growth phase this is a great time to join. Career and development opportunities are endless. We will encourage you to make an immediate impact in your area of work as well as empower you to grow your career with us.

Develop custom reporting capabilities as well as dashboard analytics to better service our customers and provide insight for internal stakeholders. Examples are: Forecasting of ARR, Recognised Revenue, Cash, etc by Product, Region
Own and drive projects to completion in agreement with relevant stakeholders in Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Legal and Finance.

Certified SalesForce Application Architect with proven record of collecting and implementing requirements of multi-stakeholder Salesforce implementation across sales and service cloud

Our culture is integral to our success and is built on trust, collaboration and a sense of ownership
Join a cohesive environment that lets you learn, grow and encourages you to challenge
Make no mistake we work hard but with perks ranging from 4 day working weeks in summer to team getaways and the obligatory snacks, we take care to enjoy life too
And of course we offer competitive compensation and benefits structure


Das ist eine Stellenanzeige von ITbbb.de. Mit 'Jetzt bewerben' werden Sie zur Originalanzeige weitergeleitet und können sich dort direkt bewerben. Der Link zur Stellenanzeige: https://www.itbbb.de/jobs/127991/salesforce-architect-f-strich-m-strich-x-in-berlin

We are looking for an
IT Architect (m/f/d) Products & Growth
full-time in Berlin

You will be responsible for:
Full ownership for prototypes / MVP’s from scratch and until handover into operational organization
Designing, developing and running respective IT setups and solutions (prototypes / MVP’s / MMP’s)
Connection between business, IT and providers (internal and external)
Coordinating decisions, preparation of recommendations and options for management
Coordinating a development team and IT operations resources (external, potentially internal)
Providing technical project planning and execution
Presenting your results and status reports regularly to your team

Your skills:
Degree in computer science, business informatics, information engineering or a similar education
Professional experience in a similar or related role in the financial services industry
You have experience in designing, establishing and running IT architectures in high performing and high availability environments
You have built high performance IT environments in payments, risk or related areas
You have experience coordinating a development team
You have the ability to build starting points for development teams
You have experience with enterprise applications and ideally, you have some experience in software development
You have a real passion for new technologies and the innovations of the digital industry
You have a positive attitude towards products and solutions in the financial industry
You have a good understanding of requirements and the ability to instinctively recognize when something is wrong
You have a structured way of working, ability to prioritize and escalate meaningfully
You make decisions and make things possible
You have effective communication skills on and with all levels

We offer you:
High flexibility: To make sure your private life is not overlooked, we support you with flexible working time models - full or part time flexitime.
Attractive additional benefits: In addition to the fixed salary, employees enjoy a contribution to the success of the Group and company as well as an allowance for capital formation benefits.
Fancy parties: We hold after-work parties, team events, and summer & Christmas parties.
Basic provisions: We offer free fruit baskets and water dispensers for your daily supply at work.
Diverse opportunities for development: We offer a wide range of internal training offers, as well as personal e-learning options - including at home.
Strong sports options: We offer discounts for local fitness studios and hold company runs, in which we participate as a team.
Healthcare: With the help of our in-house social services and our own company physician, we look after your health.
New opportunities: Even as career and lateral entrants, you will get the opportunity to be inducted in a wide range of tasks.
Open corporate structure: We support diversity in the company - in every regard. For example, we promote an open working environment for all employees with our LGBTIQ network ‘be.queer’.
Great prospects: In a dynamic and at the same time future-proof working environment with prospects for promotion, you will get a limited employment contract with the possibility of permanent employment.
Who we are:
Let's be honest, finance is complicated. So we at Arvato Financial Solutions are proud to be guiding international as well as renowned local companies through the complex world of cash flows. Whether our customers sell shoes in e-commerce or offer telecommunications services, our services ensure efficient credit management for the best possible financial performance. Our approximately 7,500 employees solve new challenges in payments and complex data riddles every day, and do so cleverly, analytically and with an eye for every little detail as that is our DNA. We are seeking colleagues who want to take an active part in this - whether they are young professional, IT specialists, data analysts, advisers, managers or lateral entrants. And thanks to our presence in around 20 countries with a focus on Europe and America, there will usually be the right job available nearby. Innovate Yourself.

We keep what we promise:
More information at www.innovateyourself.de. Are you already convinced? Then we look forward to your online application with salary expectations and the earliest possible start date.

As a principal product manager within the recommendations team you will be working on highly visible and high impact customer facing features that directly affect the customer experience of 29 million Zalando customers across app and web. You will drive Zalando's vision "to become the starting point for Fashion".

This is a unique opportunity to work in one of the most advanced recommendations teams in Europe and improve how more than 29 million Zalando customers in 17 countries engage with fashion online.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED


You will scope and prioritize the most important customer problems with respect to fashion recommendation and create an actionable strategy and roadmap to solve those
You have the ability to author all important product documents including a product roadmap, working backwards press releases, definition of business requirements, as well as functional specifications.
You lead: you excite all team members and stakeholders for the impact and the incredible opportunity ahead for fashion domain specific recommendations.
You will collaborate strongly with the leaders of the Engineering and Design teams in order to advance the recommendation engine putting the customer first and ensuring that all teams focus on the most customer centric opportunities.
You will be accountable for the customer benefits and the associated business impact. You are expected to present your work to Zalando's Executive team within the Digital Experience Department.
You will coach a team of product managers to grow their skills and capabilities.
You will work with a collaborative and enthusiastic team consisting of software engineers, data scientists, product analysts, and designers.
You will be part of the leadership team of the recommendation program.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


You hold a Masters degree in a STEM or related field.
You have experience in creating great customer experiences through leveraging Artificial Intelligence.
You are familiar with the product development process of working backwards. You always start with a customer experience that is worth creating, and then work backwards to derive how to get there.
You have at least 8 years of product management experience in building complex data-driven products that solve real customer problems. Your experience spans across product discovery, requirements definition, and agile delivery processes.
You can break aspirational targets into validated feature ideas with concrete deliverables.
You have a very strong analytical skills set and knowledge in Machine Learning / AI.
You have the ability to communicate in different settings and audiences, both with documentation and speaking.
You have a true passion for B2C product management.
You demonstrated the ability to handle ambiguity with ease, finding solutions to difficult problems.
You have a proven ability to work in a truly cross-functional setting.

PERKS AT WORK


Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source ( https://opensource.zalando.com/ ) commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs ( https://jobs.zalando.com/tech/blog/ ), product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive on-boarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available only in selected locations)

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO

Zalando is Europe's leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 29 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages ( https://opensource.zalando.com/tech-radar/ ) our teams choose to use.

Within Zalando Digital Experience (DX), you will work with many autonomous teams that live up to the standards of software craftsmanship, ownership and excellence. Along with our guiding set of principles we entrust you and your team to shape the future of Zalando.

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

As a Product Owner at idealo’s Mobile Apps Team, you drive the evolution of our award-winning e-commerce apps and their underlying backend services. We are a fully integrated and autonomous team that balances using proven technologies with cutting edge experimentation, delivering best in class user experiences and impact on idealo’s mission. We own our code and together with designers, analysts and engineers, you drive the direction of our products. This allows you to have a significant contribution to transforming business at idealo.
About your new role
At idealo you are part of a cross-functional team that strives for excellence in product and software development. You work closely with other product owners, user experience designers, data analysts, and an engineering team
We work as an agile team where you will be driving product development from ideation to operating a product at scale. With proper prioritization, you enable a continuous flow of work and business value delivery
You’re routinely working with business and technology stakeholders on various levels of the organization, structuring a wide variety of functional and non-functional requirements from marketing journeys to payment APIs
You have a positive impact on our culture, encourage knowledge sharing and drive product discussions within the team


Skills & Requirements
You have a deep understanding of either e-commerce or mobile Apps ecosystems or related fields
You are meticulous about data and up-to-date with product development, leading a development team, passionate about user satisfaction, operational health, and commercial success
You communicate complex topics and priorities concisely and effectively in product, business, and engineering contexts
You are an open, approachable team player, curious about solving interesting and sometimes complex problems
As a Product Owner, you’re self-sufficient and well organized, and you can expect the same from the team around you
Your benefits at idealo
Training opportunities for your individual career
Adequate compensation, relocation support
Family-friendly and environmental-friendly company policy
International, open-minded working environment with 800 people from 40 countries
The provision of all necessary equipment that you need to deliver top performances
Employees are self-reliant and free to schedule their own workday
Onboarding program including Welcome Day, Trainings and individual incorporation
The chance to work together on our goals, while also working to create something new
A cool office loft in the trendy, international district of Berlin-Kreuzberg
About idealo
idealo is a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Right in the heart of Berlin, over 800 employees from 40 nations are working on the future of online shopping. We focussing on agile and self-reliant work, sustainability and a healthy relationship between work and private life. These values are firmly anchored in our corporate culture and an integral part of our corporate philosophy.
As part of our team, you can look forward to freedom, an international and inspiring working environment. Your ideas are particularly important to us. Not only our product portfolio is diverse, but also the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation or a severely handicapped degree do not play a role.

job_title: Senior Product Manager Public Cloud Managed Services (m/w/d)
full_text:
Ihre Aufgabe
Als "Senior Product Manager Public Cloud Managed Services (m/w/d)" haben Sie folgende interessanten und wichtigen Aufgaben:
Definieren von standardisierten Preismodellen und neuen monetären Ansätzen für Value AddedServices on Top auf Public Cloud Infrastructure
Management des gesamten Produktlebenszyklus angefangen bei der strategischen Planung bis zur taktischen Ausführung, Entwicklung von neuen Ideen und Lösungen
Entwicklung und Ausarbeitung von Wettbewerbsvergleichen, Markteinschätzungen und -bewertungen, Einsatzszenarien, Use Cases, Referenzen und den entsprechend ableitbaren Vertriebsargumenten, entsprechenden Präsentationen, Whitepapers, Argumenten und Benchmarks für das Product Management, den Fachvertrieb und das Management
Tiefes technisches Briefing von Agenturen, Partnern, Redaktionen auf Ebene Funktionen, Spezifikationen und weiteren Entwicklungsroadmaps sowie technische Begleitung und Umsetzung von Pilotprojekten und -szenarien bei Kunden
Sie agieren für Sales Enablement als Content Experte, Trainer und Referent sowie als Train-the-Trainer
Mitgestaltung der Sales Enablement Ziele und Maßnahmen für Managed Cloud Services on Public Cloud Infrastructure sowie Überwachung des Fortschritts und der Ergebnisse
Vorstellung und Positionierung der Lösung, Komponenten, Funktionen und Features vor Analysten, auf Kongressen und Fachkonferenzen und gegenüber der Fachpresse
Zusammenarbeit mit dem Amazon Web Service und allen Konzernteilen der Deutschen Telekom AG
Anbahnen und Umsetzen von Partnerschaften, insbesondere zu Independent Software Vendors, Software as a Service (SaaS) und technischen Communities im Public Cloud Infrastructure Eco System
Entwicklung von fundierten Cross- und Upselling Szenarien
Vorantreiben des Vertriebs durch Unterstützung der Business Development Management und Sales Teams, z.B. durch das Leiten von Gesprächen mit Schlüsselkunden, Entwicklung von Tools um den Erfolg zu unterstützen, Hilfe beim Identifizieren von Opportunitys um den Erfolg zu verbessern
Festlegung von Zielen und Prüfung der Kennzahlen um Opportunitys zu identifizieren und zum Erfolg zu bringen
Ihr Profil
Für diese Position besitzen Sie ein Studium der Fachrichtung Informatik, Ingenieurwissenschaften, Mathematik oder eine vergleichbare Berufsausbildung sowie langjährige Berufserfahrung sowie mindestens 6-8 Jahre Berufserfahrung in ähnlichen Positionen in der IT/TKBranche (z.B. Pre Sales Manager, Sales Engineer, Technischer Sprecher oder Produktmanager).
Des weiteren überzeugen Sie uns mit:
Hervorragende Kenntnis des internationalen Cloud-Computing-Marktes technisch wie auch strategisch (insb. übergreifende Industrietrends, Technologien, Bereitstellungs-, Betriebs-, und Servicemodelle, treibende Trends wie Konsolidierung, Transformation, Digitalisierung)
Nachweislichen Erfahrungen als Technical Consultant, Technology Officer, technischer Sprecher oder technischer Trainer
Umfassende und vertiefte Kenntnisse des Angebots, der Technologien, Komponenten, Services und Funktionen, u.a. AWS, Azure
Amazon Web Services Zertifizierungen sind erforderlich, inkl. praktische Erfahrungen und Trainings zu folgenden AWS Competency Areas: i.e . Migration , Big Data, Security
Expertenwissen in Bezug auf Architekturmodelle, Komponenten, APIs, Administrationsumgebungen Funktionen und Services und deren Zusammenhänge zur erfolgreichen Bereitstellung und Betrieb leistungsstarker public/hybrid Cloud Plattformen und Dienste
Nachweisliche umfassende Kenntnis der technischen und betrieblichen Einsatzszenarien von Cloud-Lösungen vor allem bei Großkunden sowie deren technischen und inhaltlichen Beschränkungen und Einwände
Fähigkeit zur erfolgreichen Diskussion und Argumentation mit Analysten, CIOs, technologischen Entscheidern unserer Kunden, als auch vor versiertem Fachpublikum und der Fachpresse
Hervorragende Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse, schriftlich und mündlich, mit der Fähigkeit die internen und externen Gesprächspartner zu überzeugen (Vordenker)
Sehr gute Kenntnisse im Projektmanagement, insbesondere die Fähigkeit enge Zeitpläne einzuhalten und Arbeitslast zu priorisieren
Bereitschaft zu regelmäßigen nationalen und internationalen Geschäftsreisen
Über uns
Multinationale Konzerne und öffentliche Institutionen sind unsere Kunden. Wir machen Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft startklar für die Gigabit-Gesellschaft. Überall auf der Welt. Mit einer globalen Infrastruktur aus Rechenzentren, Netzen und integrierten Lösungen. Sie haben Lust auf die vernetzte Zukunft? Dann zeigen Sie uns Ihre Innovationskraft. #PUCLOUD#

We are looking for a Trainee/Working Student to join our Development team in Berlin at a well-funded, growing open-source startup to help us to continue to build exciting technology that make our users happy.
Who are we?
We are a rapidly growing, young company developing analytics software for performing advanced data science. We are a highly interactive team and very enthusiastic about developing solutions for our users. Our open-source KNIME Analytics Platform, developed together with the community, is transforming the data science landscape. It is popular among its very active user community as well as among IT analysts, who regularly place us in their "leaders" category - next to some still surprised industry dinosaurs. Our commercial KNIME Server enables enterprises to responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.
What we offer

The chance to become part of an aspiring, fun and young work environment.
The opportunity to grow within a quality driven company.
Working in an agile team.
Opportunity to learn about and make an impact on our Big Data and Cloud products.
Working on our integrations with Spark, Hadoop, Databricks, H2O, as well as services on AWS, Google Cloud and Azure.
Attending training courses on KNIME products.

What we look for

Enrolled student in Computer Science or related fields.
Proficiency in Java development.
Familiarity with Linux/UNIX.
Proficiency in at least one of the relevant Big Data technologies such as Spark or Hadoop is a plus.
Proficiency in Python, Scala or shell scripting is a plus.
Eagerness to learn about new technologies or platforms.
Fluent in English.

You should be available for at least 6 months. The maximum weekly working time is 20hrs/week during semester and 40hrs/week during semester breaks. In general, we offer the opportunity to write a master thesis about hot topics like data analytics, big data and more.

Every time a customer searches for products on Zalando, a bidding request is sent to our system in real-time. The system aggregates relevant data points, evaluates thousands of candidate ads with our machine learning models, and decides what ads to show where - all within 10-30 ms. Every second, we score tens of thousands of ad contents.

As the Lead Engineer of Zalando Marketing Services' Sponsored Products you will manage a high-performing team of engineers who enable one of the fastest growing business area of Zalando by solving large scale, high-load, algorithmic real-time bidding challenges which revolutionize and streamline an even better customer experience than previously possible.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
------------------------------


Design & develop low-latency, high-load, real-time bidding system end-to-end
Optimize stochastic behaviors of the system based on online experiments (through budget pacing strategies, content filtering strategies etc.)
Mentor and grow junior and mid-level members of the team
Collaborate with brilliant Product Managers, Data Scientists, Engineers and Analysts across Zalando to create positive customer impact together
Help define our team's objective. Continuously improve the self-organization of the team.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
----------------------------


3+ years of experience in designing and developing highly available (24x7) high-load distributed systems, preferably in Java
Expertize in concurrent programming (multi-threading), network programming, distributed databases, microservice architecture
Systems programming experience will be highly valued (low-level programming skills, hardware awareness, good knowledge of JVM internals, Java Memory Model etc.)
Experience in high-load technologies like Aerospike, DynamoDB, Cassandra, Redis, Elasticsearch, Hazelcast, Kafka, RabbitMQ, ZeroMQ, Hystrix, Protobuf, gRPC, Netty, Disruptor, Vert.x etc. are a strong plus
Knowledge of container technologies like docker, kubernetes as well as knowledge in cloud computing (AWS, GCP etc.) is a plus
Experience in relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL etc.) and application frameworks (Spring Boot, Dropwizard etc.)

PERKS AT WORK
-------------


Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback,open source ( https://opensource.zalando.com/ ) commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy andblogs ( https://jobs.zalando.com/tech/blog/ ), product demos, parties & events

We are home24, the leading home & living e-commerce platform in continental Europe and Brazil. We are currently active in eight countries and in 2018, we became a publicly listed company in Germany. Over 1,000 Homies work together towards a common goal: to create happy homes for everyone and every budget.

How can we reach this goal? With an assortment of over 100,000 pieces of furniture and accessories from more than 500 suppliers, we offer the perfect addition to any living space combined with the comfort of being able to shop from anywhere.

What makes us proud to be Homies? We are pioneers in our market who seamlessly combine technology and creativity. We utilize data to provide personalized recommendations, tips and inspiration for every home.

At home24, we strive to deliver a superior assortment of products and the best service. To do this, we need fresh ideas, 100% motivation, and dedication to our company mission. We always have a space at our table for service-minded individuals who are passionate about digitization and modern living.
For our headquarter in Berlin Prenzlauer-Berg we are looking to have you on-board as our new
(Senior) Business Intelligence Engineer (m/f/d)

Our Business Intelligence team has the mission of making data available to everybody who needs it and to enable our teams to take data driven decisions. For this purpose, we develop state-of-the-art tools, such as powerful business data warehouse in Redshift and a Tableau instance serving as the central reporting repository of the company.

Your Responsibilities

You will further develop, scale and operate our cloud based BI Data Warehouses using latest technologies (e.g. Redshift, Airflow, RDS)
You will work closely with business stakeholders create data pipelines from the data lake to reporting and modelling tools
You will be the architect of the data warehouse schema / data model to ensure it is up to date with the latest technologies and best practices
You will work with BI analysts, supporting them to derive insights
You review peers' work quality and act as mentor for more junior colleagues
You will provide suggestions on how the team can leverage new technologies and architectures to improve the data platform or new methodologies to improve the team performance

Your Profile
3-5 years of hands on experience building data warehouses and BI solutions
Excellent Knowledge of SQL and Python
A passion for emerging technologies
Experience with AWS services and Tableau is preferable
Exposure to e-commerce is preferable
Willingness to work in an agile team

What we offer you
The chance to make an impact
The opportunity to work alongside a highly motivated team of professionals
An open-minded culture ready to incorporate new and creative ideas
Room for growth and development within your role and within the company
Benefits including employee discounts on our entire assortment, team events, free fruit and drinks, German language classes and more!

Mal ehrlich: Finanzthemen sind kompliziert. Und dank unserer Präsenz in rund 20 Ländern mit Fokus auf Europa und Amerika ist ein passender Job zumeist in der Nähe. Innovate yourself.
Im Geschäftsbereich Accounting und Payment bieten wir konkrete Antworten auf die Herausforderungen unser Kunden, insbesondere wenn es um die Erschließung von Kaufkraft, internationaler Märkte, das Stärken der Kundenbeziehung und die Digitalisierung von Unternehmen geht. Dazu setzen wir auf passgenaue Gesamtpakete, Plattformen sowie den gezielten Einsatz von Robots, künstlicher Intelligenz und Big Data Analytics.

What's next in music is first on SoundCloud. As the world's largest open audio platform, SoundCloud is powered by a connected community of creators and listeners who share, discover and influence what's new, now and next in music and audio. Our Product Design team creates and shapes those experiences that serve hundreds of millions of users. We're now on the lookout for a Product Designer to join our team.

The Role

You will work in close collaboration with Product Managers, Engineers, UX-Researchers, Data Scientists, and other Product Designers on the Insights and Royalties team to meet the needs of SoundCloud listeners and creators on the web, mobile, and beyond. We expect you to take ownership of your experiences from the early strategy and concept phases to the implementation and following iterations. You speak the language of users and will define their journey through a system from start to finish. You will participate in discussions to challenge assumptions, give critical feedback, and create consensus.

Responsibilities


Define user experiences including interactive statistics and data-driven insights and visual content across multiple platforms. You will also be responsible to define where and how these fit in the SoundCloud product
Work directly with product partners and data analysts to find and design meaningful data points for users
Partner with peers on your team to set clear objectives and an execution strategy
Draft and iterate on multiple solution proposals for a problem with storyboards, sketches, wireframes, and prototypes
Collaborate with UX-research, Product Management, Data Science, Engineering, and Marketing to ensure a smooth product development process
Understand and determine the level of fidelity required for our features and ensure we're prioritizing our efforts effectively
Ownership of experiences from the early concept phase to the final implementation
Communicate and align expectations within your team and stakeholders

Requirements/skills


A strong online portfolio that demonstrates your process and ability to turn ideas into a convincing and unique creative vision
A background in designing user experiences and interaction design for digital consumer products and working with cross-functional teams
Experience designing data visualization, information design, and insights products
Ability to provide the rationale and trade-offs for your solution proposals
Communication is a big part of your daily work. You're not only interested in input from users, developers and everybody else, but you're able to ask questions, give feedback and critique your peers' design solutions
A holistic understanding of design. You are eager to understand the underlying problem and able to work out concepts and ideas that are addressing the real issues
You can deliver larger projects reliably, coordinate with other design team members and delegate when needed
You enjoy working on a product from start to end and you won't rest until a solid experience is shipped. At the same time, you are able to align this expectation with an iterative product development process and respective trade-offs
You are a passionate product designer and a great storyteller
In your design process, you consider the entire experience rather than individual views
You have excellent presentation skills and communication abilities

Diversity at SoundCloud:
SoundCloud is for everyone. Diversity and open expression are fundamental to our organization; they help us build a social platform and global community where anyone can create, discover, and share sounds. We acknowledge the challenges in our industry and strive to develop an inclusive culture where everyone can contribute.

colorfy is where design meets engineering. We create products and services that have a meaningful impact on the world and help other businesses launch their ideas in our B2B consultancy. With our interdisciplinary team of hard- & software engineers, industrial-, interaction- and visual designers, analysts, consultants, strategists and project leaders, colorfy can offer even more. We often start with business development, business modeling and digitalization concepts for our customers from scratch. Being data-driven, research and analysis is an integral part of colorfy's work. Guide junior developers and do code reviews with your teammates.

Design software architectures for cloud-based and/or serverless (FaaS) systems.

Write, test, deploy and monitor code.

Define continuous integration processes.

Document your solutions.


YOUR PROFILE

At least 5 years of experience as a backend developer.

You have proficient programming skills in Node.js

Solid experience in creating and maintaining database schemas while bearing business needs in mind.

You have good experience in programming GoLang

You have an extensive understanding of asynchronous programming and scalable, stateless services.

You are interested in and able to learn new technologies and programming languages

You have the ability and eagerness to maintain open, professional communication with clients. You are fluent in English, German is a plus.

You have a hands-on mentality and you love working with new technologies and processes.

Infrastructure as code


OUR TECH STACK

Programming Languages: JavaScript , C, C++, Dart, GoLang, Java

Frameworks: React, React Native, Serverless, Flutter, Dialogflow, AVS

Communication: MQTT, RabbitMQ, PubNub, gRPC, REST, GraphQL
Operations: Docker, Firebase, Grafana, Prometheus, Jenkins,

Cooperation: Jira, Git, Confluence, Slack


BENEFITS

Compelling projects with startups, multinational corporate clients, and everything in between.

You work with a highly motivated and skilled team from all over the world in a very friendly work atmosphere.

5 weeks of paid vacation and Christmas vacation.

Stock options.

Free BVG (public transport) monthly pass.

Yearly professional Edu Budget – supplement your education on us!

Keeping you fuelled with fresh fruits, coffee, and snacks.

Modern office located in the heart of Berlin (Mitte).

Urban Sports Club membership and In-house Yoga.

Monthly external team events.

Quarterly health workshops.

ABOUT ZALANDO LOUNGE

We are looking for a full-time or part-time student intern to join our development team in Berlin at a well-funded, growing open-source startup to help us to continue to build exciting technology that makes our users happy.
Who are we?
We are a rapidly growing, young company developing analytics software for performing advanced data science. We are a highly interactive team and very enthusiastic about developing solutions for our users. Our open source KNIME Analytics Platform, developed together with the community, is transforming the data science landscape. It is popular among its very active user community as well as among IT analysts, who regularly place us in their "leaders" category - next to some still surprised industry dinosaurs. Our commercial KNIME Server enables enterprises to responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.What we offer

The chance to become part of an aspiring, fun, and young work environment
The opportunity to grow within a quality driven company
Work in an agile team
The opportunity to learn about KNIME and its analytics extensions, such as Deep Learning (Keras/Tensorflow), H2O, Python, R, Data Visualization, XGBoost, and to make an impact on the development of these products

What we’re looking for

Student on a computer science degree course or related field
Proficiency in Java development; knowledge in Eclipse IDE is a plus
Eagerness to learn about new technologies or platforms
Python experience is a plus
Proficiency in machine learning techniques is a plus
Fluency in English.

As a part-time student, you should be available for at least 6 months. The maximum weekly working time is 20hrs/week during the semester and 40hrs/week during semester breaks. We also offer positions for 6 month full-time internships.

You are a highly organized professional who puts the customer at the center of everything you do. You can identify a solid opportunity and bring it to fruition, but also know when to walk away. You will be the main contact for your assigned accounts and will work together with the Life Sciences team and other team members to understand client needs, help with evaluations, negotiate contracts, and handoff happy clients to our customer success team. You will identify incoming leads, keep track of renewals, and handle/direct customer questions to the appropriate channels.
Who are we?
We are a rapidly growing, young company developing analytics software for performing advanced data science. We are a highly interactive team and very enthusiastic about developing solutions for our users. Our open source KNIME Analytics Platform, developed together with the community, is transforming the data science landscape. It is popular among its very active user community as well as among IT analysts, who regularly place us in their "leaders" category - next to some still surprised industry dinosaurs. Our commercial KNIME Server enables enterprises to responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.

Uberall empowers some of the world’s biggest brands to deliver a memorable ‘Near Me’ Brand Experience — from online interactions to offline sales. The ‘Near Me’ Brand Experience consists of all the online touchpoints that a consumer has with the local outlets of a brand, from finding, persuading, buying and recommending, to returning as a regular customer.
Uberall’s solutions enable multi-location brands to easily manage search and discovery, engagement and conversion in real-time on all online platforms — mobile, voice and desktop — across websites, mobile apps, store locators, search engines, maps, social platforms and advertising networks.
Uberall is headquartered in Berlin, with additional offices in San Francisco, London, Paris, Amsterdam, and Cape Town. Its clients include Fortune 500 companies and industry leaders from all over the world.
Learn more at www.uberall.com.

About the role:
For our highly motivated and committed Business Information Systems department, we are looking for you as a Salesforce Administrator (f/m/d). The Business Information Systems department’s mission is to establish best in class end-to-end automated business processes in an integrated business information system landscape that enables data-driven decision making. Salesforce is a crucial lever in our system landscape.

Your tasks:

You will configure and maintain custom objects, record types, fields, page layouts, formulas, data validation rules, triggers, custom workflows, approval processes, installed packages, etc. within Salesforce
You are responsible for the maintenance of user roles and profiles, security settings, access settings, etc. (user profiles, role hierarchy, sharing rules and security); user set-up and deactivation
You're going to provide user training and support, develop and implement training paths for end-users, create and maintain training materials and guides for all Salesforce processes levering our knowledge base (Helpjuice) and online learning system (Talent LMS) and will ensure a smooth onboarding and off-boarding of users
You collaboratively manage the integration of Salesforce.com with other applications in our Business Information System landscape to improve operational excellence
You will manage data imports, database deduping and cleanup. Work closely with BIS colleagues and key business users to ensure data governance
Furthermore, you are going to work closely with our Business Intelligence Analysts to manage dashboards and reports to facilitate informed decision making at all levels and full workflow control
You're going to leverage Salesforce to improve our users' operational lives and proactively drive consistent adoption of Salesforce across the organization
You will stay current with Salesforce releases and corresponding documentation, provide new functionalities and solutions as needed. Provide detailed information to the BIS team on how changes will apply to all affected departments/users and work collaboratively to drive ongoing system improvements in our Business Information Landscape


Your profile:

You have solid experience in a Salesforce Administrator role, especially in configuration and maintenance of standard objects, record types, fields, page layouts, formulas, data validation rules, triggers, approval processes, process builder, custom objects and workflows, deduplication tools and data governance etc. - Salesforce Certified Administrator certification is a plus
You show a deep understanding of how Salesforce interacts in and affects businesses and their workflows - You know what good looks like
You own positive interpersonal skills, ability to establish and maintain cooperative, courteous working relationships with others - you work well independently and in a team
You own your deliverables and you manage your time well and you are able to look and think about the complete business information system landscape
You are always looking for the best solution for the business need, not the most technically interesting solution and at least have basic experience in user support & training
In general, you have the deep desire to learn more, ideally, you have a basic understanding of project management, already gained some experience in agile working methodologies and the use of tools like Jira, Pardot, Outreach, Ambition, Aircall or ZoomInfo
You are business-fluent in English

A market-leading and cutting-edge location marketing software (SaaS) scale up with an exciting & international customer base
A very exciting position in close collaboration with a highly professional team in Uberall’s headquarter
International team and regular company & team events
A lively and open company culture with flat hierarchies and short chains of command
Flexible working hours, an attractive budget for professional development and regular feedback sessions to assist you with your career plans
Coming from abroad? - We are offering an extensive relocation package including visa, temporary and permanent accommodation, etc.
Regular language classes, meditation sessions and our own gym
You are a dog person? - There will be room in the office as well
A high degree of responsibility with creative freedom and personal advancement avenues.

IHR PRIMEPEOPLE PROZESS
Schicken Sie uns gerne Ihre Unterlagen oder greifen Sie direkt zum Telefon. Im ersten Schritt ist uns wichtig, dass wir Sie näher kennenlernen und Ihre beruflichen Ziele greifen können. Sie erhalten dazu Online-Zugriff auf Ihr Profil und können uns dabei weitere, Ihnen wichtige Parameter an die Hand geben. Im weiteren Abgleich mit einer konkreten Position bieten wir Ihnen eine kostenlose Persönlichkeitsanalyse an, die wir dann in einem persönlichen Gespräch (oder über Skype) ausführlich mit Ihnen besprechen. Sollten wir danach gemeinsam zum Ergebnis gelangen, dass diese Position gut zu Ihren beruflichen Zielen passt, werden wir Sie bei unserem Mandanten (nach erneutem Einverständnis ihrerseits) vorstellen. Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
