ELEMENT Insurance AG is a product factory for insurance and a leader in insurance digitalisation. We supply our partners from various industries – both from an insurer, as well as a non-insurer background – with in-house underwritten insurance products, which they market under their own brand. Our modular insurance platform enables us to tailor-fit and supply these non-life insurance products in record speed.


Our diverse team with over 25 nationalities combines the expertise of the worlds of insurance and technology. At ELEMENT, we live an agile and empowering company culture to work on ‘the insurance of tomorrow’.


ELEMENT seeks to partner with leaders in the insurance industry. ELEMENT works closely with its industry partners to deliver products and solutions, which lead to enhanced automation and data-driven processes. ELEMENT is looking for a

(Senior) Product Owner - Partner Solutions (m/f/div)


Are you willing to change the way insurance is delivered and to be at the forefront of our revolution? Then we are looking for you!


What will make you succeed?

Work experience as a Product Owner/Project Manager/Business Analyst or similar role for 3+ years
Work experience in insurance or financial company building partner solutions like: partner portal and purchase flows
Work experience with BiPro standard and intergration with MGA's and brokers is big plus
Technical background with knowledge of software development and web technologies
Educational background in Finance, Computer Science or similar relevant field
Familiarity with agile processes and principles
Team spirit and good communication skills
Presentation and leadership skills
Good organizational skills and time management skills
Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills
Creative thinker with a vision
Attention to details
Fluent English & German



What will keep you challenged?

Take lead of scrum teams as the Product Owner
Providing vision and direction to the agile development team and stakeholders throughout the project and create requirements
Define product vision, roadmap and growth opportunities
Analyze and lead the planning and prioritization of feature requests of end users/stakeholders into a product roadmap with stakeholders
Provide backlog management, iteration planning, and elaboration of the user stories
Develop user stories and define acceptance criteria (wireframes, flowcharts)
Work closely with our Product Management to create and maintain a product backlog according to initiatives, business value and/or ROI
Keep up with agile/scrum best practices and new trends
Research and analyze the market, the users and follow our competitors and industry trends


Why ELEMENT?

The opportunity to be part of a driven and diverse team which is creating a measurable impact on the future of insurance
An open and welcoming company culture, empowering you to freely grow and develop
We openly share our knowledge – we are a mix of insurance experts, technology specialists and experienced entrepreneurs
We have a dedicated onboarding process, enabling you to quickly thrive at ELEMENT
A direct influence on our company and our products – we value your ideas and your input
Plenty of perks including a benefits package, choice of computer, drinks and snacks, language classes, company-wide networking events and outings

Every time a customer searches for products on Zalando, a bidding request is sent to our system in real-time. The system aggregates relevant data points, evaluates thousands of candidate ads with our machine learning models, and decides what ads to show where - all within 10-30 ms. Every second, we score tens of thousands of ad contents.

As the Technical Lead of Zalando Marketing Services' Sponsored Products you will manage a high-performing team of engineers who enable one of the fastest growing business area of Zalando by solving large scale, high-load, algorithmic real-time bidding challenges which revolutionize and streamline an even better customer experience than previously possible.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
------------------------------


Design & develop low-latency, high-load, real-time bidding system end-to-end
Optimize stochastic behaviors of the system based on online experiments (through budget pacing strategies, content filtering strategies etc.)
Mentor and grow junior and mid-level members of the team
Collaborate with brilliant Product Managers, Data Scientists, Engineers and Analysts across Zalando to create positive customer impact together
Help define our team's objective. Continuously improve the self-organization of the team.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
----------------------------


3+ years of experience in designing and developing highly available (24x7) high-load distributed systems, preferably in Java
Expertize in concurrent programming (multi-threading), network programming, distributed databases, microservice architecture
Systems programming experience will be highly valued (low-level programming skills, hardware awareness, good knowledge of JVM internals, Java Memory Model etc.)
Experience in high-load technologies like Aerospike, DynamoDB, Cassandra, Redis, Elasticsearch, Hazelcast, Kafka, RabbitMQ, ZeroMQ, Hystrix, Protobuf, gRPC, Netty, Disruptor, Vert.x etc. are a strong plus
Knowledge of container technologies like docker, kubernetes as well as knowledge in cloud computing (AWS, GCP etc.) is a plus
Experience in relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL etc.) and application frameworks (Spring Boot, Dropwizard etc.)

PERKS AT WORK
-------------


Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback,open source ( https://opensource.zalando.com/ ) commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy andblogs ( https://jobs.zalando.com/tech/blog/ ), product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
--------------------------------

At Zalando Marketing Services we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.

Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

GetYourGuide is the place to book the best experiences in destinations across the globe. Currently we are in a strong growth phase and are working on building a world class travel ecommerce product to help us scale and serve millions of customers.

As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will help develop the next generation of our in-house systems in the realm of Search Engine Marketing (SEM). You will work as part of a cross-functional mission team with top-notch developers, analysts, data scientists and product owners as co-workers. Deep dive data, develop innovative solutions, lead architecture decisions and take our marketing systems to new heights!

Marketing Technology Team Mission:
We are part of the Growth department and responsible for the development, maintenance, and technical vision of the core systems behind our Marketing initiatives. We aim to be at the cutting edge of advertising technologies and partner with business stakeholders to develop impactful features to connect customers with the most relevant tours and activities in our inventory. We have touch points across the business and aim to solve problems at scale with big data systems that manage 10s of millions of entries.

Responsibilities:

Immerse yourself in the problem space and our technology stack
Lead architecture discussions and develop next generation systems
Partner with our business and technical teams to deliver innovative solutions
Review ongoing SEM efforts, identify opportunities and explore new areas
Design and develop efficient solutions that can continue to scale
Continuously improve our code base, systems and processes
Mentor other team members and be involved with hiring

Requirements:

Minimum of 5+ years of software development experience
Highly proficient in backend engineering and best practices
Experience with Scala or Java , or otherwise a desire to learn
Experience with the architecture and deployment of complex systems
Ability to turn ideas into fast, reliable and maintainable code
Solid understanding of SQL including complex queries and optimization
Positive, proactive team player who is passionate about their craft
Customer-centric prioritization and data driven decision-making

Nice to have:

Experience with large scale data processing using Apache Spark & Airflow
Experience developing projects in a Docker microservice architecture
Developed using advertising APIs (Google Adwords, Facebook, etc.)
Prior experience in startup environments

We Offer:

A modern infrastructure (AWS, Kubernetes, Istio, Kafka) and a good DevOps mentality (you build it you own it)
Solid engineering principles. Check them out here ( https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1ci12gXY9gIn8w68BK0gtvEQMRjpBLTTCceNygrjLF_M/edit?usp=sharing )
To work on creating memorable travel experiences for millions of travelers. Find out more about our KPIs here ( https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1ShJ6OrGHj8pGW_jPV0b9z5Gafw83ytDn9ZcXoXRa3s0/edit?usp=sharing )
Smart and engaged co-workers - Take a look at our team video ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?reload=9&v=h8i1tP0ARMA )
An English-speaking office with people from 60+ nationalities
Virtual stock options - be part of our success story
Monthly Hackathons and weekly tech talks
Annual external training budget
Weekly social events to bring the company together (pizza & beer Fridays)
GetYourGuide gift cards and free German lessons
Relocation Assistance ( https://recruiting.getyourguide.com/berlin-relocation-moving-to-berlin )
You can also take a look at our Tech Radar ( https://techradar.getyourguide.com/ ) for an insight into our stack.

It is our commitment that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

You can get in touch with us via jobs@getyourguide.com, and make sure you check out life at GetYourGuide on our blog ( https://inside.getyourguide.com/ ).

--------------
ABOUT THE TEAM
--------------

Department: Zalando Lounge

Reports to: Head of Marketing Performance

Team Size: 20

Recruiter Name, E-mail: Anja ( anja.spierling )

At the Zalando Lounge it is our vision to open doors to exciting fashion moments for everyone. As Customer Activation Expert for the Zalando Lounge, you are owning the performance of our customer retention efforts. In our demand side matrix organisation your lever are our marketing channels and analytics teams which want to reach the customer retention targets with you.

------------------------------
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
------------------------------


As customer retention expert and owner of the respective customer lifecycle step you align and utilize our Paid Marketing and CRM channels to execute a best in class customer retention strategy.
Supported by our Marketing Intelligence allocate and optimize channel budgets to maximize the return on investment.
Work closely with our Demand Analytics team to continuously improve the performance of our customer retention measures and be a hands-on analyst to pursue your targets.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


Expert knowledge in performance marketing, CRM and deep understanding of customer lifecycle concepts.
Advanced quantitative and analytical skills
Experience in managing budgets
Experience with data visualization tools (ideally Tableau)
A minimum of 7 years experience in digital marketing, B2C CRM experience is a must.

-------------
PERKS AT WORK
-------------


Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source ( https://opensource.zalando.com/ ) commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs ( https://jobs.zalando.com/tech/blog/ ), product demos, parties & events

--------------------
ABOUT ZALANDO LOUNGE
--------------------

Zalando Lounge is an online shopping club for fashion and lifestyle products in 11 European countries. We offer our members daily, time-limited sale campaigns with discounts of up to 75% off the recommended retail price. However, Zalando Lounge is so much more than discounts. Our strength lies in our focus on fashion: from sought-after labels to niche brands, from famous international names to trendy luxury brands, we make sure to meet the fashion taste of all our customers, who are always on the hunt for the best products at the best prices. Working with our brand partners, we're pioneering innovative supply-chain and production processes and offer them an impactful and smart solution, creating a new way to shop for fashion - and a new way to sell it.

Zalando is Europe's leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages ( https://opensource.zalando.com/tech-radar/ ) our teams choose to use.

Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and creativity, where you are part of the team shaping the future of global commerce?
Want to help millions of people find, buy, sell, connect and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive work environment,
join eBay – a company you can be proud to be a part of.
The eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) Motors team is flexible and fast like a start-up, yet we are part of the global eBay Family. We value the entrepreneurial spirit, the “can-do” attitude and their mutual respect for each other’s talent and contribution.
eCG is an innovative global leader in online classifieds. Our sites help people find whatever they are searching for in their local communities. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.
We have ten brands that span the globe offering online classifieds in more than 1,000 cities.
We are looking for a Technical Product Manager SEO (f/m/d) to join the team in Berlin Friedrichshain!
As the Technical Product Manager responsible for SEO, you will work closely with other Product Managers, Engineers and Analysts to ensure the continuous development of SEO.
You will join necessary standups, planning sessions and ensure that SEO is considered during the development of the product.
You will agree and set targets with the teams, track progress and communicate outcomes to the broader audience and partners across the organization.
Your responsibilities
Leading internal SEO projects in collaboration with colleagues from Product, Technology and Marketing
Monitor SEO performance, find opportunity and develop strategies to address them
Prepare, refine and prioritize JIRA tickets to help us excel at SEO
Estimate the benefits of SEO initiatives and present them to internal partners

We are looking for the right people to join our growing, well-funded, open-source startup and to help us to continue building an exciting technology that makes our users, customers, and partners happy.
Who are you?
You are enthusiastic to get started or have a few years of experience in a partner or customer-facing role at a software/tech company. You are highly organized and energized by enablement, administration, and management being a large part of your work. You are comfortable in communicating with a diverse set of partners and clients. You are driven by a strong desire to maintain and build new relationships. You are tenacious but not pushy, you bring credibility but also empathy.
While you may not have a lot of personal experience with Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, or Machine Learning today, you are willing to learn from our experts. If you do have some exposure to data science and machine learning, that is a huge plus. Excellent English skills - both written and verbal - are required. Additional languages, especially German are a bonus. A healthy sense of humor is also always appreciated.
What’s the job?
In a nutshell, your job is to recruit, enable, and co-sell with partners with a focus on the EMEA region. Ensure that partners are happy and successful and that their customers increase the adoption of KNIME over time. As part of the Partners team, you will be the main contact for a portfolio of partners and will work together with our Data Scientists and Solution Engineers to understand their client’s needs, help with evaluations, negotiate contracts, and hand off happy clients to our customer success team.
Who are we?

We are a rapidly growing, young company developing analytics software for performing advanced data science. We are a highly interactive team and very enthusiastic about developing solutions for our users. Our open source KNIME Analytics Platform, developed together with the community, is transforming the data science landscape. It is popular among its very active user community as well as among IT analysts, who regularly place us in their "leaders" category - next to some still surprised industry dinosaurs. Our commercial KNIME Server enables enterprises to responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.
We’re looking for someone to join us in the Berlin office. Though we are happy to have applicants from further away, we’re not offering relocation benefits for this position. If you think you would be a great fit and would like to learn together with us, apply here, and let us know why you want to join us.

We are looking for the right people to join our well-funded, growing open source startup and to help us build exciting technology that makes our users happy. Right now, we are looking for a full-time Java developer to join our team in Konstanz or Berlin*.
Who are you?
You graduated in computer science or have comparable experience and have already worked on one or more larger software projects for some time. You are experienced in Java and have worked with Eclipse and git before. You are driven by an urge to optimize code and data structures for performance. You are well-versed in design patterns and know when to apply them. When writing software, you are not aiming for the quickest solution, but always have the “bigger picture” in mind. Maintainability, reusability, backward compatibility, and software testing are no strangers to you. Other nice-to-haves include experience with JVM internals (garbage collection, profiling, etc.), distributed systems, streaming, and benchmarking. Last but not least you’re fluent in English, which is our working language. Being fluent in (Swiss-) German is a plus, but not required.
What’s the job?
You will be part of an enthusiastic team of Java developers that maintains, extends, and optimizes the core of KNIME Analytics Platform. Together with our core dev team, you will work on efficient data handling and the design of APIs central to all KNIME products. Other projects you could be a part of include optimizing the performance of various components in terms of memory footprint and execution duration and upgrading our data streaming operators. Besides these projects, our flexible organizational structure makes it easy to branch out into other topics.
Who are we?
We are a rapidly growing, young company developing analytics software for performing advanced data science. We are a highly interactive team and very enthusiastic about developing solutions for our users. Our open source KNIME Analytics Platform, developed together with the community, is transforming the data science landscape. It is popular among its very active user community as well as among IT analysts, who regularly place us in their "leaders" category - next to some still surprised industry dinosaurs. Our commercial KNIME Server enables enterprises to responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.
How to apply?
If you think you would be a great fit and would like to learn and grow together with us, apply here by sending your application to us. On top of your usual dossier, please tell us about an earlier project you are particularly proud of, e.g., by providing a short summary or a link to a GitHub repository you have contributed to.

Though we are happy to have applicants from further away, we’re not offering relocation benefits for this position.

We are looking for an experienced Team Lead who can lead, coach and manage our Back Office Product Owners and Product Analysts in Berlin. You are outcome-driven, have a focus on a clear and practical product roadmap, and you understand the value of KPIs.
In Berlin we have multiple Back Office product teams, each consisting of a Product Owner, Product Analyst, UX/UI designer, developers, QA, and a Scrum Master. The Product Owners and Product Analysts will report directly to you, and together you're all responsible for the development and support of various internal products. Motivating your team comes naturally to you and you enable them to create clear and elevating objectives each quarter, including fitting and achievable product initiatives.
Your job

You and your product teams are based at the tech office in Berlin and you will report to the Product Lead of Back Office in Amsterdam. You have a passion for and a deep understanding of modern product management, product performance, and you have the leadership skills and responsibilities of a manager. You mentor your team to tackle new and interesting challenges. You enable them to deliver high quality work within a challenging time frame, and you are able to adapt quickly in a fast moving environment.
Your tasks
You represent the Product Owners towards the rest of the organisation
You act as the first point of contact for your Product Lead, located in Amsterdam
You actively work on implementing and improving product management practices within all your product teams
You mentor your team towards continuous growth and personal development
You fully support your team and the daily tasks that come with this
You collaborate on the vision and direction of your Product Owners and make sure these and related initiatives are in alignment with the Product Lead and overall Product strategy
You ensure your product teams deliver value according to their OKRs continuously
Your profile
Academic degree and preferably a technical affinity with backend systems and processes
At least 4 years of Product Owner/Product Manager experience in an e-commerce environment
At least 2 years of management experience
Fluent in spoken and written English, German is a plus
Deep understanding of and experience with UX and UI
Passion for leadership and mentoring
Strong in logical and analytical thinking
You enjoy keeping up with developments in the product management community
You are a team player and motivator; you value the input from each person in your team
Experience within a hyper growth e-commerce environment is a plus
You are data-driven, experienced working with KPIs, and focused on outcomes
Our offer
Work in a young, dynamic and international eCommerce company with flat hierarchies
Amazing multinational product and development teams
Short decision-making processes and room for initiative
Company contribution toward your pension saving
Awesome (global) team events like the summer party, skiing trip and more!
Table football, billiard and Playstation in the kitchen
Contribution to your travel cost with the amount of the BVG monthly subscription
An attractive location with roof terrace close to Potsdamer Platz
Workshops, conferences and training seminars to support our growing team
Inhouse German language courses

job_title: Senior Information Security Program Manager - Payments
full_text:
As a Senior Information Security Program Manager, with security know-how and leadership qualities, you will be leading security program to maintain trust with customers, stakeholders, and employees, and ensure that the systems and processes relating to the security is world class.

------------------------------
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
------------------------------


You understand the security concepts and know how to develop and enhance Information Security Management System (ISMS).
You ensure that business needs are translated into technology requirements and drive execution of cross-department security projects from ideation through launch, working with engineering and other stakeholders.
You can adjust your approach for each individual initiative and can play many roles, from in-house consultant to business analyst to hands-on product owner.
You identify metrics that quantify success. You build dashboards and other reports to manage the security program and key initiatives.
You manage relationships with third parties (vendors, suppliers, contractors, partners, and critical infrastructure owners/operators). You seek and own opportunities for automation at all levels of activity.

----------------------------
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
----------------------------


You have 5+ years related work experience (security program or project management preferred).
You should know how to prioritize, communicate clearly and compellingly, and understand how to measure and drive improvement.
You should have a strong knowledge of security program requirements coming from data security and privacy regulations and standards such as GDPR, ISO 27001, PCI DSS.
Together with other team members, you continuously improve current practices. You are able to put new tools and concepts into practice in a diverse, living and ever-growing organization and regularly reflect on your own work and share feedback in a constructive way.
CISSP, CISA, CISM or other security certifications are preferred.

-------------
PERKS AT WORK
-------------


Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source ( https://opensource.zalando.com/ ) commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs ( https://jobs.zalando.com/tech/blog/ ), product demos, parties & events.
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings.
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts .
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations).

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

-------------
ABOUT ZALANDO
-------------

Zalando is Europe's leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages ( https://opensource.zalando.com/tech-radar/ ) our teams choose to use.

IT Security & IT Compliance is a team within Zalando Payments that covers all aspects of information security and IT compliance, with a mission to assist the development and technical teams on their projects to achieve Security by Design and keep payments services secure.

As a Product Specialist in Personalized Marketing, you will participate in the development of new features for our advertising products, which drive the growth of our business. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large datasets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results of our performance marketing activities.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, economists and data scientists who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for Facebook marketing and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
BigQuery / SQL
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined


PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Als Teil unseres Teams kannst Du Dich auf Freiheit, ein internationales und inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld freuen. Deine Ideen sind uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nicht nur unser Produktportfolio ist vielfältig, sondern auch die Menschen, die daran arbeiten. Wir wollen dich so, wie du bist! Dabei spielen Herkunft, Religion, Geschlecht, sexuelle Orientierung oder ein Schwerbehinderungsgrad keine Rolle.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Teil unseres Teams übernimmst Du die Verantwortung für das gesamte Customer Experience Reporting und die BI Roadmap. Um diese Themen zu übernehmen, arbeitest Du mit diversen Teams (z.B. Merchant Performance, Customer Trust, Customer Care und Payments) an strategisch relevanten Themen zusammen und treibst diese voran
Auf Basis relevanter Datensätze stellst Du die Optimierung unseres positiven Kauferlebnisses sicher und leitest ggf. Handlungsempfehlungen ab, um dieses zu verbessern
Die Optimierung des ganzheitlichen Kauferlebnisses unserer Kund*innen durch die Analyse relevanter Datensätze und die Ableitung / Empfehlung geeigneter Maßnahmen liegen in Deiner Hand
Du baust ein Data Analysis Framework und eine Customer - Centric Datenbank auf, mit der unsere Teams täglich arbeiten können und relevante KPI's für das operative Geschäft ablesen können
Außerdem kümmerst Du Dich um die Erstellung und Visualisierung neuer Reports, um Ausreißer schneller erkennen zu können und Maßnahmen effizienter abzuleiten
Du bist für den Aufbau einer Kund*innen CRM Logik / Systematik verantwortlich, die es uns ermöglichen soll , gezielter auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kund*innen einzugehen und, insbesondere bei konkreten Problemfällen, schneller helfen zu können
Stellenanforderungen
Das bringst Du mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachgebiet sowie mehrjährige Erfahrungen in Customer Centric Attribution und -Analytics
Du verstehst die Stärken und Schwächen diverser Messansätze und mathematischer Modelle im Kern und kannst diese entsprechend als Entscheidungsgrundlage berücksichtigen
Sehr starke Zahlenaffinität, hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten sowie ein guter Überblick über aktuelle Entwicklungen in den Bereichen Data Management und Data Science gehören zu Deinem Repertoire
Datenkonsistenz, (statistisch) valide Testaufbauten und Messansätze, die bereits in der Kampagnengestaltung berücksichtigt werden, sind Dir äußerst wichtig
Du bist Spezialist*in in SQL, Tableau und MS Excel - auch neue Technologien reizen Dich
Idealerweise kennst Du den E-Commerce Markt und kennst die Bedürfnisse von Shops
Bei idealo erwartet Dich
Die Möglichkeit der Weiterbildung für Deine individuelle Karriere
Die Bereitstellung der Arbeitsgeräte, die Du benötigst, um Höchstleistungen zu bringen
Der Freiraum, selbst zu bestimmen, wie Dein Tag aussehen soll und viel Eigenverantwortung
Onboarding Programm inklusive Welcome Day, Schulungen und individueller Einarbeitung
Die Chance, gemeinsam an unseren Zielen zu arbeiten und immer wieder Neues zu schaffen
800 motivierte Kolleg*innen, Kitaplätze & ein cooler Büro-Loft Komplex in Berlin-Kreuzberg
Über idealo

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. Im Herzen Berlins arbeiten über 800 Mitarbeiter aus 40 Nationen an der Zukunft des Online-Shopping. Wir konzentrieren uns auf agiles und eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten, Nachhaltigkeit und ein gesundes Verhältnis von Arbeit und Privatleben. Diese Werte sind fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert und tragender Bestandteil unserer Unternehmensphilosophie.

As a Product Analyst, you will be working in one of our product teams (more details below). You will participate in the development of new features used by millions of customers. Doing so, you will gain deep domain knowledge and become an expert.
You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define tracking requirements, analyse large data sets to provide actionable insights, A/B test and dive deep into the results.
In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.
 WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions, even ask to revise decisions that contradict the analytical insights
Give (analytical) evidence why we do certain things - from discovery to roll out.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably BigQuery
R or Python combined to good mathematical and statistics foundations
Strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and relevant technologies
Strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


WHICH PRODUCT TEAMS


Content Composition team: Zalando has a lot of content to offer to the customer and a lot of Models in place to define what content should be shown where based on several factors. As a Product Analyst in the content composition team, you will work with data scientists and engineers, draw insights from the complex interaction of content, customers, and Zalando’s business and help to understand why which content is successful in front of the customer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle , connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

A Pricing Data Analyst in our Pricing & Forecasting team is passionate about creating accurate data solutions and have a proven record of developing trusting relationships with product and commercial leads who will turn your insights into actions.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Build and improve upon the system which measures sales forecasting, price optimisation and customer lifetime value
Act as the point of contact between Analytics and external product, engineering and ops teams to ensure key projects are successful
Build and own periodic reporting - Take advantage of the ever-growing amount of data we have at our fingertips to help stakeholders build best in class forecasting tools
Managing and leading key initiatives in the Analytics team and Pricing & Forecasting
Mentor and guide junior members of the Analytics team
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
3+ years of experience using data to build analytical solutions at industry leading companies in Technology, Retail or e-commerce.
Ability to turn complex findings and results into a compelling narrative and a set of actions
Familiarity with SQL and an objection-oriented programing language (Python, R,Java)
Undergraduate degree in a technical field (Science, Economics, Physics, Maths, Engineering)
Led or contributing to a complex technical project related to analytics, testing or data modeling/Warehousing
Experience mentoring or leading
Passion for analytics as a craft
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
ABOUT ZALANDO
The Pricing & Forecasting Department plays a pivotal role in the organisation by producing algorithmic-based price recommendations, forecasting sales, defining and implementing pricing strategies across 16 countries and 500k articles . The Department is a self-sufficient team of product, engineering, Analytics and operations. As a member of the Pricing Analytics team, you’ll build tools and data products that impacts millions of Zalando shoppers, the top and bottom line of our company and the many internal teams that rely on your analytics solutions.
Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 23 million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

The Insights – Digital Data Analyst role provides data-driven value to both our brand partners as well as internally by being the go-to person for the Analytics team as well as the consultants when it comes to transactional and onsite data analysis.
This is an opportunity to be part of the forefront team to shape a new business venture and to personally grow with it. Insights is a data-driven Zalando offer enabling clients in the fashion industry to gain a holistic understanding of their business and consumers. This offer includes project-based consulting services and self-service web interfaces.
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts

ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES
Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.
For more information check out this link: https://zms.zalando.com/

Visit our Tech Radar and check our open-source projects.
Please note that all applications must be completed in English using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

Your profile:
You are proficient in SQL / ETL, preferably with hands on experience from a business environment.You are proficient in MS Excel: You know how to work with VLOOKUP, SUMIF(S), INDEX, MATCH and other functions, you use Pivot Tables.You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.You have a passion for data and are curious to always dig deep to uncover patterns.You are self-driven and motivated to learn and explore.You don’t mind a bit of chaos. Actually, you embrace it as something that provides all kinds of opportunities.You love solving problems.You are enrolled in a Berlin university for a full-time degree.

Hey – there’s a revolution going on! A revolution in digital entertainment. Every day millions of people around the world choose to be more thoughtfully entertained, informed and educated by listening to fascinating stories and all forms of fictional and non-fictional content on their smartphones and other mobile devices.

Audible, an Amazon company, is the leading provider of premium digital spoken audio information and entertainment on the internet, offering customers a new way to enhance and enrich their lives every day. Titles downloaded from Audible are compatible with hundreds of mobile devices, including the iPhone and Android smartphones.

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for a Working Student (Werkstudent) Business Analytics EU (m/f/x) who will support us in creating insights & build reports that help us to make critical business decisions.

Our team in Berlin works closely with stakeholders in Berlin and around the world. You will work with data and will have the opportunity to analyze customer behavior across different market places. When working on a specific analysis, you will have the opportunity to drive key business decisions with the help of marketing teams and other analysts.

Main Responsibilities:
Extract data from Redshift databases for ad-hoc analysis using SQL.Work with large data sets using various analysis tools
(MS Excel/SQL/Python/Microstrategy/R/Tableau).
Perform data validation, cross checks and plausibility checks.Recognize patterns in the data and dig deep into anomalies.Perform A/B testing on various marketing campaigns.Create customer segments for Email Targeting.

Preferred Qualifications:
Have been enrolled in economic computer science / mathematic / engineering / computer science / business administration / or similar university programs and have at least one year of your studies left.Great communication skills.
Our offer:
This is a student position for 20h/week with a salary of 12€/h.Contribution on the long-run (ideally 1 to 2 years) as a fully-fledged Team Member.Exciting opportunity to participate in the growth of a global digital audiobook provider.International work environment in a beautiful Berlin Mitte location.
Sounds interesting? If you are looking for a new challenge in an innovative company, where you will be surrounded by an engaged and fun team, Audible is your next stop!

We are looking forward to your application with all details together with your cover letter. When it comes to tools, skills etc. we would appreciate if you could not only let us know which tools you know, but also your level of expertise.

As a Data Analyst in our Convenience Proposition Analytics team you will be regularly benchmarking Zalando’s fulfillment proposition, supporting investment decisions. You will enable evidence-based decisions with your data analysis expertise optimizing post-checkout experience at an international scale.
If you enjoy examining large amounts of data to uncover hidden patterns and trends and you surface insights as exciting stories, based on beautiful visualizations, then join us - the opportunities to make a personal impact are limitless!

Collect benchmarking data and lead statistical analyses to help our business make better decisions.

We are looking for the right people to join our well-funded, growing open source startup and to help us to continue to build exciting technology that makes our users happy. Right now, we are looking for a full-time developer with experience in Python and Java to join our team in Austin (TX), Konstanz or Berlin.*

Who are you?
You are an experienced developer who works with both Python and Java and who appreciates that Python code should not look like Java and Java code should not look “Pythonic”. You enjoy switching your approach to code organization and coding style as you go back and forth between Java and Python projects. You can help a team of Java developers communicate effectively with a team of Python developers and coordinate the teams’ work. You’re fluent in English, which is our working language. Being fluent in (Swiss-) German is a plus but not required.
What’s the job?
You will be part of an agile team focused on improving and expanding the integration between Python (CPython) and KNIME Analytics Platform. Initial projects include things like deeper KNIME-Python integration, performance optimizations for Java-CPython communication, and Java/Python dependency packaging. Familiarity with tools such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, scikit-learn, pytorch, tensorflow and others in the scientific Python stack as well as the Anaconda Python distribution is not required but will be helpful for understanding what end users are often doing in their Python code which they integrate into KNIME.
Who are we?
We are a rapidly growing, young company developing analytics software for performing advanced data science. We are a highly interactive team and very enthusiastic about developing solutions for our users. Our open source KNIME Analytics Platform, developed together with the community, is transforming the data science landscape. It is popular among its very active user community as well as among IT analysts, who regularly place us in their "leaders" category - next to some still surprised industry dinosaurs. Our commercial KNIME Server enables enterprises to responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.
How to apply?
If you think you would be a great fit and would like to learn together with us, apply by sending your application to us. On top of your usual dossier, please tell us about an earlier project you are particularly proud of, e.g., by providing a short summary or a link to a GitHub repository you have contributed to.

Though we are happy to have applicants from further away, we’re not offering relocation benefits for this position.

We are looking for the right people to join our well-funded, growing open source startup and to help us to continue to build exciting technology that makes our users happy. Right now, we are looking for a full-time JavaScript developer to join our team in Konstanz or Berlin.*
Who are you?
You are experienced in developing large JavaScript Web Applications with REST/JSON. Vue.js experience is ideal, but if you've worked with React, Angular, or a similar framework, you'll get into it without problems. You have used the flux pattern, Redux, MobX, Vuex, or similar before. Although you’re not a designer, you can identify good UI design when you see it. And you know the basics of accessibility and usability. User Experience design is something you’re familiar with. You’ve written unit tests with Mocha or Jest and high-quality code makes you happy. Tools like git, PostCSS, WebPack and npm are no strangers to you. You’re fluent in English, which is our working language. Being fluent in (Swiss-) German is a plus but not required.
What’s the job?
You will be part of an agile team that not only constantly improves the KNIME Hub (our online platform for sharing resources, workflows, and nodes) and our WebPortal, but also brings KNIME Analytics Platform to the cloud/browser. The primary focus is writing user friendly, high performance, interactive JavaScript apps based on REST services. Occasionally you will contribute to the bigger picture by working on other parts of the stack such as REST API design, continuous integration, monitoring, infrastructure etc. Our lightweight organizational structure approach makes it easy to get involved in cross-team topics.
Who are we?
We are a rapidly growing, young company developing analytics software for performing advanced data science. We are a highly interactive team and very enthusiastic about developing solutions for our users. Our open source KNIME Analytics Platform, developed together with the community, is transforming the data science landscape. It is popular among its very active user community as well as among IT analysts, who regularly place us in their "leaders" category - next to some still surprised industry dinosaurs. Our commercial KNIME Server enables enterprises to responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.
How to apply?
If you think you would be a great fit and would like to learn together with us, apply here by sending your application to us. On top of your usual dossier, please tell us about an earlier project you are particularly proud of, e.g., by providing a short summary or a link to a GitHub repository you have contributed to.

Though we are happy to have applicants from further away, we’re not offering relocation benefits for this position.

We are looking for the right people to join our well-funded, growing open source startup and to help us to continue to build exciting technology that make our users happy. Right now, we are looking for a full-time Java developer to join our team in Austin, Konstanz or Berlin.*

Who are you?
You graduated in computer science or have comparable experience and have already worked on one or more larger software projects for some time. Java is your favorite language and when writing software you’re not looking for the quickest solution but always have the “bigger picture” and performance in your mind. You also enjoy thinking about reusability and design patterns. If you are happy every time you find a problem while writing test cases for your code then you’ll get along great with our QA team. You’d be a good candidate for our KNIME Hub and KNIME Server development teams if REST doesn’t just mean relaxing on the sofa and you’re already familiar with the concepts and have implemented a client and/or service. Other nice-to-haves are experience with SQL databases, Docker, Kubernetes and micro service architectures. Last but not least you’re fluent in English, which is our working language. Being fluent in (Swiss-) German is a plus, but not required.
What’s the job?
You will be part of an agile team that designs and implements new functionality around our distributed and cloud-based products. You will scale out the execution of jobs by KNIME Server to many machines and in the cloud. You will contribute towards re-thinking the architecture of KNIME Server as a composition of fine-grained microservices. You will also be involved in designing and implementing the backend of KNIME Hub, our online platform for sharing, finding and collaborating on workflows, components and extensions. As part of your role, you’ll be able to apply a wide range of technologies, such as Eclipse Microprofile, Open Liberty, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ, and Maven. Not an expert on all of these? No problem, as learning is also part of the job!
Who are we?
We are a rapidly growing, young company developing analytics software for performing advanced data science. We are a highly interactive team and very enthusiastic about developing solutions for our users. Our open source KNIME Analytics Platform, developed together with the community, is transforming the data science landscape. It is popular among its very active user community as well as among IT analysts, who regularly place us in their "leaders" category - next to some still surprised industry dinosaurs. Our commercial KNIME Server enables enterprises to responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.
How to apply?
If you think you would be a great fit and would like to learn together with us, apply by sending your application. On top of your usual dossier, please tell us about an earlier project you are particularly proud of, e.g., by providing a short summary or a link to a GitHub repository you have contributed to.

Though we are happy to have applicants from further away, we’re not offering relocation benefits for this position

Come join a well funded and rapidly growing team at the center of AI, Cloud, and Open Source as we build our German and US partnerships team.
Who are you?
You are a candidate who is detail-oriented and operationally minded, while also having strong communication skills. You have a track record of success in sales, operations, channel partnerships, customer success, or account management at a software or tech company. You know what it means to build a trusted advisor relationship with an account and help them to adopt technology across the organization. You are analytical and use data to make decisions on where to spend time and money.
You should be driven by a strong desire to build and maintain relationships with happy customers and help them solve their problems. An understanding of data science would be really nice, but is not a must-have as we can teach you what you need to know. Excellent English skills - both written and verbal - are an absolute must. Additional languages, such as French, or German are a bonus. A healthy sense of humor is also always appreciated.
What’s the job?
In this role, you will be responsible for building programs and processes that allow us to scale our engagement with partners across all aspects of our interaction. You will also ensure that the customers brought to us by partners are happy and successful, and that their customers increase their adoption of KNIME over time. You will be the main contact for existing customers and will work together with our Data Scientists and Data Engineers to understand client needs, help with evaluations, negotiate contracts, and do reporting and optimization for the existing partnership business.
We’re looking for someone to join us in the Berlin DE or Austin USA offices. Though we are happy to have applicants from further away, we’re not offering relocation benefits for this position.
Who are we?
We are a rapidly growing, young company developing analytics software for performing advanced data science. We are a highly interactive team and very enthusiastic about developing solutions for our users. Our open source KNIME Analytics Platform, developed together with the community, is transforming the data science landscape. It is popular among its very active user community as well as among IT analysts, who regularly place us in their "leaders" category - next to some still surprised industry dinosaurs. Our commercial KNIME Server enables enterprises to responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations.

job_title: Senior React Native Mobile App Developer (f/m/x)
full_text:
colorfy is where design meets engineering. We create products and services that have a meaningful impact on the world and help other businesses launch their ideas in our B2B consultancy. With our interdisciplinary team of hard- & software engineers, industrial-, interaction- and visual designers, analysts, consultants, strategists and project leaders, colorfy can offer even more. We often start with business development, business modeling and digitalization concepts for our customers from scratch. Being data-driven, research and analysis is an integral part of colorfy's work. Our teams thereafter design and engineer the necessary software and hardware, build prototypes and accompany our customers in an iterative approach, until we reach the mass production and, in many cases, even further.

Tasks

YOUR TASKS


As colorfy’s Senior React Native Software Engineer:
You will cooperate with the design and software team in an interdisciplinary product design and development process.
You will be involved in all phases of projects; design and develop software from architecture till release.
You will evaluate new technologies and develop building blocks for later product integration.
You will do code reviews with your teammates.
You will write performance optimized react native apps.
You will lead and guide junior developers on the team.

Requirements

YOUR PROFILE


You have a solid react native or react.js programming skills and strong experience in developing mobile apps.
You have experience in native iOS and/or Android app development.
You have an affinity for good UX and UI design.
You have good technical communication skills with peers and non-technical cohorts.
You are able to create and maintain documentation.
You have the ability to work on different projects in changing technological fields.
You are a flexible, results-oriented problem-solver and could work independently and at the same time being part of the team.

Benefits

BENEFITS


Compelling projects with other startups, multinational corporate clients, and everything in between.
You work with a highly motivated and skilled team from all over the world in a very friendly work atmosphere
5 weeks of paid vacation and christmas vacation.
Stock options
Free BVG (public transport) monthly pass
Yearly professional development budget – supplement your education on us!
Keeping you fuelled with fresh fruits, coffee, and snacks
Modern office located in the heart of Berlin (Mitte)
No boredom! Colorfy offers challenges and development every day
A position that offers you tangible impact on the company’s success with a high level of personal responsibility from day one
You will have an exciting front-row perspective on the development of global new generation IoT solutions with a steep learning curve

In summary, we are looking for someone who is a team player and aspires to high-quality work and strives to learn and share their knowledge with their colleagues. If the above descriptions sound like you, and you want to be a part of our amazing team, let’s chat. Show us your GitHub profile or Apps, if available.

We're looking for a Product Marketing Manager for our growing team in our new office in Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg.
Your Responsibilities
Develop product positioning and messaging that differentiates AIVEN within the Cloud market
Build out a core set of content that helps the Go To Market team to articulate the product vision, capabilities and differentiation.
Become the subject matter expert around how the end user selects solutions and their buying criteria, deeply understand the customer’s needs and problems (by persona and industry)

We are looking for a Trainee/Working Student to join our Development team in Berlin at a well-funded, growing open-source startup to help us to continue to build exciting technology that make our users happy.
Who are we?
We are a rapidly growing, young company developing analytics software for performing advanced data science. We are a highly interactive team and very enthusiastic about developing solutions for our users. Our open-source KNIME Analytics Platform, developed together with the community, is transforming the data science landscape. It is popular among its very active user community as well as among IT analysts, who regularly place us in their "leaders" category - next to some still surprised industry dinosaurs. Our commercial KNIME Server enables enterprises to responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.
What we offer

The chance to become part of an aspiring, fun and young work environment.
The opportunity to grow within a quality driven company.
Working in an agile team.
The opportunity to learn about and make an impact on our products related to data engineering and cloud platforms.
Working on our integrations with storage and database services, as well as services on AWS, Google Cloud and Azure.
Attending training courses on KNIME products.

What we look for

Enrolled student in Computer Science or related fields
Proficiency in Java development
Proficiency in at least one of the big cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) is a plus.
Eagerness to learn about new technologies or platforms.
Fluent in English.

You should be available for at least 6 months. The maximum weekly working time is 20hrs/week during semester and 40hrs/week during semester breaks. In general, we offer the opportunity to write a master thesis about hot topics like data analytics, big data and more.

We are looking for the right people to join our well-funded, growing open source startup and to help us to continue to build exciting technology that make our users happy. Right now, we are looking for a full-time Technical Product Specialist to join our team in Austin, Konstanz, or Berlin.* If you think you would be a great fit and would like to learn together with us, apply here and see at the end of the posting how to make your application even more relevant.
Who are you?
You’re a technical champion who loves software and gets excited when telling the story of a SaaS product. You’re passionate about - and good at! - helping people understand technical use cases as well as demonstrating key customer benefits. Most importantly, you’re a successful product-oriented marketing professional who brings several years of relevant experience and can deliver great technical content and tools for KNIME Software. You bring knowledge and experience in data integration, data analytics, statistics, and data science software. Do we need to emphasize that you have to be capable of turning complex topics into something that less techy people can understand? Furthermore, you’re an independent thinker and can organize projects efficiently whilst becoming a trusted contributor. You hold a bachelor’s degree in marketing, specializing in product management and/or computer science, or engineering and are 100% fluent in English. (Swiss-) German is nice to have but not required. Everybody at KNIME is fluent in English and English is our working language (but if you really want to, there are plenty of people here who can teach you many other languages).
What’s the job?
You’ll join our marketing team to communicate the value of our software to our customers. You’ll work closely with Tilman from Marketing, Christian from Product, and Rosaria from Evangelism to get all the information you need to create product-centric marketing content (i.e. data sheets, presentations, videos, blog posts, and website content). Albert from our customer care team will work closely with you and give you data on which features and materials are the most important for getting customers interested in our software. You’ll be the pivotal person in making sure our product messaging is strong and consistent. You’ll also create and provide training material and software demos, and come up with product naming. As part of the bi-annual software release team, you’ll be responsible for bundling the release messaging and for delivering technical marketing content and competitive analyses.
Who are we?
KNIME Analytics Platform is popular with its large and enthusiastic user community as well as IT analysts, who regularly place us in their “leaders” category – next to some very surprised industry dinosaurs. But we are most proud of the consistently high marks we get for user satisfaction. We are transforming the data science landscape by developing - together with our community - the completely open source KNIME Analytics Platform that lets data scientists mix and match the tools and methods they want. Our commercial KNIME Server helps enterprises responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.
How to apply?
On top of your usual dossier, please tell us which is your favorite KNIME Server feature, and why.

Though we are happy to have applicants from further away, we’re not offering relocation benefits for this position.

We are looking for the right people to join our well funded, growing open source startup and to help us to continue to build exciting technology that makes KNIME users happy. We are a rapidly growing, young company developing analytics software for performing advanced data science. We are a highly interactive team and very enthusiastic about developing solutions for our users. Our open source KNIME Analytics Platform, developed together with the community, is transforming the data science landscape. It is popular among its very active user community as well as among IT analysts, who regularly place us in their "leaders" category - next to some still surprised industry dinosaurs. Our commercial KNIME Server enables enterprises to responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.
Who are you?
You graduated in computer science or have comparable experience and have already worked on one or more larger software projects for some time. You are experienced with both application and infrastructure code, and use your knowledge to build highly available, elastic applications and services to fit any number of domains and problems. You are proficient in Java and have advanced knowledge of cloud providers and technologies including AWS and Kubernetes. You are continually learning and adapting to new technologies based on thoroughly analyzing their strengths, capabilities, presence and application to your domain of expertise.
What’s the job?

We’re currently designing, building and launching our first generation of products and services in the cloud, and are looking for someone eager to be a part of that process. This includes adapting our industry leading data science and analytics platform into a managed platform capable of serving thousands of users. The ability to handle both application development and infrastructure development is crucial as we strive to match our quality and functionality with innovative solutions that can address growth, cost and durability concerns. You will work in both back-end development and DevOps roles, building APIs, services, and infrastructure while interfacing with multiple teams to drive complex projects forward.
Ideally you have experience in one or more of the specialties that are outlined below.

Strong Java experience
Experience with dynamic/scripting languages including Python
Strong cloud experience including advanced knowledge of AWS and many of their services (Cloud experience with Azure, Google Cloud Platform or other technologies is also of interest)
Container technologies including Docker and Kubernetes
Experience designing, building, deploying and maintaining distributed systems and microservices
Experience working in Agile development environments
Git and GitHub/BitBucket
Knowledge of best practices around service telemetry, including metrics aggregation, distributed logging and tracing in large, distributed systems
Knowledge of build systems and continuous integration/deployment tools and strategies including Jenkins
Linux and shell scripting
Ability to work both independently and in a team setting; with clear communication across an organization that is geographically and culturally dispersed
Desire to learn, advocate and adopt new technologies and patterns

What we are offering:

The chance to work with a wealth of different technologies
The opportunity to be a driving force and cloud advocate as we design and build our next generation of service offerings
An open and dynamic environment, where you will continuously be learning something new
The possibility to grow together with KNIME.

BigQuery / SQL

idealo ist eine Erfolgsgeschichte aus Berlin: Im Jahr 2000 sind wir mit der Mission gestartet, unseren Nutzer*innen zu helfen, richtige Kaufentscheidungen zu treffen. You will work on consulting projects by scoping, extracting, analyzing and interpreting transactional and onsite data to derive relevant insights together with our consultants.
You will develop new analytical products through e.g. predictive modeling and build minimum viable products (MVPs) in order to test them with our clients so that they can eventually be integrated into our self-service web interfaces or evolve into a standalone product.
You will analyze the success of our self-service web interfaces in terms of usage and user preferences and derive recommendations for improvement.
You will be responsible for monitoring and improving our data quality by analyzing data from various sources, coordinating with internal teams and reviewing calculation methods.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You are an expert in SQL and comfortable to work with large volumes of both transactional and onsite consumer data.
You enjoy working in a commercial context and have experience defining, modeling, testing and evolving analytical models with direct impact on business realities. Special focus on models concerning customers (e.g., customer management, segmentation, value, etc.) is a plus.
You possess relevant professional experience in analytics or controlling in industries such as e-business, retail, consultancy or market research are able to communicate precisely with results.
Extensive knowledge of respective tools and methods, preferably SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and Python combined with good mathematical and statistical foundations. Experience in forecasting and predictive models would be a plus.
You are comfortable working with combining and cleaning massive datasets and have advanced skills in data visualization
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
